Once upon a time, there was a man that received a magic wand from a mysterious woman.
Whenever he used the wand, its magic came at a cost. When he used it to fix some broke plates, it made his wife unable to see him.
Later, he was drinking at the tavern and wanted to impress his friend with the wand. But the same thing happened—his longtime friend could not see him at all.

Realizing that the wand exacted a toll, the man grew desperate and tried casting a spell in a busy plaza.\nWhen the people started walking into him with surprised looks on their faces, he finally understood his new wand's true purpose...

All the boy wanted was his father's approval.\nSince his father was a wizard of the royal palace, he decided to study magic.\nBut just as his efforts were beginning to pay off, his father, seeking power, disappeared into darkness.

With his father gone, the boy lost all purpose. He didn't know what to do. In his desperation, the boy searched through his father's study.\nThere, he found a strange, glowing jewel.\nHe thought he might unlock its power with forbidden magic, but he soon realized he didn't have the aptitude for it.

So instead, he studied hard to master crimson magic.\nAs his abilities grew, he tried to understand where his father had erred. It was then, when he chose the path of light, that he understood the jewel's mutterings.

The country was in flames, and amidst the carnage stood his father. He looked to the sky and cursed his father for being so foolish. The boy surrendered himself to the jewel and defeated the man from which he sprang, but not even torrential downpours could to douse the fire. It burned everything and everyone, destroying the country.
The cursed sword had a relatively modest appetite.\nIt exacted a toll for every two deaths instead of every one. It asked only one thing in return: the user's second most prized possession.
The man felt that everything besides his own life was worthless. He felt no differently about the parents that raised him than he did about random acquaintances.
The only thing that mattered to him was his own life.\nStatus and honor were also of no importance.
"This cursed sword is awfully beautiful,"\nhe said after taking his fourth life.\nIt was then that his life lost its place as his most important possession, though he would not keep it for long.

There once was a man who was obsessively clean.\nHoping to avoid contact with other people, he only set foot outside his home at night. But his efforts were for naught, as others walked the main street no matter how late he went out.
He couldn't stand it.\nTo him, humans were the dirtiest creatures alive.
Before long, he was killing anyone that he came into contact with.\n"This world needs to be purified," he murmured.

In time, people stopped going out at night. And yet, the man still wasn't satisfied. "Right...there's still one left." These were his last words before he killed the only person left that his eyes couldn't see.
Another man disappeared from the village today.\nHow many is that now? There've been a lot of mysterious disappearances in my town lately.\nIsn't the disappearance rate a little high?

At least the only people who have disappeared were unsavory types that wouldn't be missed much anyway.\nStill, the way they disappeared was...unnatural. I felt certain there was some sort of foul play, but there was not enough evidence to prove it.

Normally when somebody disappears, they leave some sort of trace behind. But this time...nothing.\nThat's what made the sudden disappearances so shocking. To just spirit people away like that...\nWhat were we dealing with? Some kind of Pied Piper? The plot thickens...

That is all for the details of this request.\nBecause no bodies have been found, we can safely assume that they are no longer with us. Unless the bodies are dissolved or burned, there is always evidence.

It was an especially hot day.
"I want to see a beautiful snowfall."
It was his terminally ill granddaughter's final wish.
The old man went out into the mid-summer heat in search of snow.

As he searched, the old man came across a magical spear that could make it snow.
He rushed home with the spear raised high above his head.
Since he did not know magic, however, the magical spear did nothing. It might as well have been an ordinary spear.
The old man couldn't fulfill his granddaughter's wish.

His granddaughter's eyes had shut.
The old man desperately raised the spear towards the heavens many times, but to no avail.
With no magic within him, the old man used his life force to fuel the spear's magic.
Snowflakes began to fall.
Though already unable to open her eyes, the girl was conscious of the specks of cold dissolving on her cheeks.

"Thank you," she said quietly.
The old man's grip on the spear weakened as he, too, fell into an eternal slumber.
As if in defiance of the hot summer's sun, the snow came down harder and harder, accumulating around them.
The warmth in their bodies eventually disappeared,
but the warmth in their hearts only grew stronger.

For the longest time, the man felt like something was missing. An accident had created a hole in his memory.\nHe didn't know why he had the flute, but whenever he played it, sheep would follow him. And so, he became a shepherd.

One day, a lamb wandered away from another herd and into his.
Something about the lamb seemed familiar.
Eventually, a shepherdess showed up to claim it.
His flute had led her to him as well.

They were strangers.
But because of the serendipity of their meeting,
they began to herd their sheep in the same area.
One night, the man played a beautifully sad song on his flute.
It brought the shepherdess to tears.

"That song...I wrote it for my husband," she said.
"We were separated by an accident. I can't even remember his face..."
The man wiped the tears from her eyes.
It was a miracle.
They locked eyes under the moonlight and became whole once more.
He was the shabbiest wolf in the pack. As such, he was constantly shunned by the others. His reflexes were poor, and he could barely keep up when on the prowl. What worth is a wolf that can't hunt?
When the wolf reached adulthood, the rest of the wolves decided to expel him from the pack. But before they could, a group of hunters attacked.

The wolves fought for their lives. And as they did, something occurred to the shabby wolf. He realized that the pack was ready to fight to the death. So he made up his mind. A wolf that can't hunt may be worthless, but at least he'd be alive. So he clung to life. It was a very human choice.
The wolf ran through hills and fields until he found himself in a village and could run no further.\nHe came upon a human there and knew right away. He wasn't a wolf at all. He was human.

There once were two men who lived together on the bad side of town.\nThey were very close and made a pact that that they would escape their hopeless situation together. The plan: For one to commit crimes while the second stopped the first, collecting the reward and dividing it between them.

Their first goal was to escape the slums.
It was easy enough.
One of them attacked a noble, and the other pretended to be a passerby and rescued him.
The tricked noble agreed to let his rescuer become one of his vassals.

Their next plan was much more difficult, but they ultimately pulled it off.\nIt's easy to subdue an insurrection if you know what the enemy's planning, after all. The young man who stopped the insurrection was promised a noble title that would solidify his place in the world.

Even at his new station in life, the young man kept his promise.
It would be his downfall. The young man's connection to the enemy didn't stay a secret for long.
He apologized for his mistakes, but it was too late. "You'll be friends again in the afterlife," the noble said as he drew his sword.
From then on, the two men with those strong bonds no longer needed words...
There once was a staff made from the wishes of many. With one swing of the staff, one of its many wishes would materialize.

There once was a poor boy who owned the staff.
He swung it,
and gold coins rained down from the sky.
People rushed to collect them.

The boy had become a slave of the staff.\nHe rode to the mountain so that he could fulfil his desire and waved the staff.\nIt was then that a beautiful woman he had never met before drifted down from the heavens. The boy had an intense impulse to share his feelings with someone.

So he told the woman about the staff's power.
Fascinated, the woman tried swinging the staff herself.
When she did, a giant fissure opened in the ground and swallowed the country whole.
"Who the hell made THAT wish?!"
A voice could be heard screaming in the darkness...
Welcome to the worst world.\nThe first thing you're going to need is a weapon.\nHere. Take this one.

Do you know the name of the dragon sealed inside this weapon?
...
......
Oh wow! You're right!
It's the very dragon that popped into your head!

But existence in this world is different.
In this world, this dragon is no different from us.
A puppet under someone's control.
The same might be said for you as well.
What's that? You want to know who pulls our strings?\nThat's a secret. Secret! SECRET!\nAnyway, I hope you enjoy the worst world.
When did it happen?\nWhen did we start doubting our beauty?\nWhen? When did we start to envy and seek youth?
When?\nWhen did I start believing that I could stay forever young by bathing in the spinal fluid of young women?\nWhen did I no longer hesitate to do it?

When?
When did I succumb to my unrelenting desires?
I breathe white, and the words in my throat dye it black.
I'm not afraid of the me who has learned to accept that.

I soaked my body in red. Her sacrifice maintains my youth.
The agony of the young woman's death colored me.
Forever. Forever. Forever. Forever.
"I want to drown in her agony..."
I suddenly heard singing.\nI was surprised that it was coming from me.\nAnd the song...

I liked that song.
I tried to keep quiet so nobody would hear.
I expressed all my pent up emotions with passion.
I liked that my lord sang that song after everyone went to sleep.

I felt like sharing that secret. I was drunk on my sense of superiority.
But I was unsatisfied.
I tried to keep quiet so nobody would hear.
I practiced singing my lord's song.

I would automatically start singing whenever I heard it.
The secret was out. He showed me a side of him I'd never seen before.
He turned around and smacked me for my insolence.
Then, with a voice that would violate my every nerve, he whispered, "I like your voice."
Ah...now it's clear. I only learned the song to hear him say those words.
My dress was stained with blood.\nHow long had that been there?\nAnd when did I stop worrying about it?
I was named after a symbol of purity... Snow White. As the name implies, I have no impurities.\nI could wash my hands in blood and emerge as pure as my namesake.
Until the moment I am finally defiled, I will guide and correct this world with "Justice." I am not wrong.\nI am right, right, right-right-right...
I had attached my mother's mirror to my hammer. I asked it a question.\n"Mirror, mirror, on my hammer. Who lives in the most just manner?"\nI don't even need its answer. It's me, of course.

Tears. Secretions from my lacrimal glands.
A liquid filled with salt. Why are there so many kinds of tears?
Perhaps it's because they're the most beautiful manifestation of emotion.
To be tearful is to experience the most beautiful feelings in the world.

[Crying]
Is this the word for when tears roll down your cheek?

[Teary]
Is this used when drops of water spill from your eyes over and over again?

[Sobbing]
This word refers to continuous, uncontrollable tears.

[Bawling]
This word refers to tears accompanied by screaming.
What kind of tears do you shed?\nShow me.
It's time. I must hurry.\nI didn't expect the early afternoon weather to lure me to sleep.

I had let my thoughts wander through my dreams.
I wanted to remember the Author's face.
But... I can't.
My thoughts go dark...

FaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFace.
No, that's not it. That's the Mad Hatter's face.
The White Rabbit's... That's Parrah...
That's Noya... The faces vanish as quickly as they appear.
FaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFaceFace.
My forehead was wet with sweat. I couldn't remember his face.\nThe clock hand on my sword showed\na far different time than when I last checked.
I play and I play and I play, but it's never enough.\nI really want them to play with me more.\nThe toys I'm given always break so quickly. I thought I could try making my own.
My author heard me, and I clapped my hands with joy.\nHe taught me how to make sturdier toys. But it was really hard. Making sturdier toys required more hatred.
But I didn't understand it. There are various ways to make someone harbor hatred.\nOne of the easiest is to kill the person most important to them in an extremely cruel manner.

I found a happy couple.
I tore open the woman's swollen belly
and squashed the small thing inside.
But even with the man's hatred,
I failed to make sturdier toys.
That's when I realized...
I really enjoy breaking things.
His music became the only cure for a countrywide epidemic. Amidst the smell of rot and decay, people flocked to him, hoping for his musical aid.

"Stop making all that noise,"
they used to say. Now they didn't want him to stop.
But he was at odds with himself.
He looked to his wife for support, but the tortured look in her eyes seemed to say, "Hey... Is this okay?"

It all started when he acquired a harp that was said to grant wishes. But like with all things, those wishes came at a price.\nAnd so he hesitated.\nWhen he finally settled on a wish, he made it small, wishing for his wife—his only true friend—to say four simple words: "I like your music."

He then wished for a world where his performances would be appreciated.
Before long, the epidemic made his wish a reality.
His wife fell ill and her short life came to an end.
The young man watched her body burn.
He was perfectly in tune with the sound of regret...

There once was a master and apprentice that hunted in the mountains.\nTheir age difference was such that they could be father and son, and they worked together in total harmony to take down their prey.\nIf they had a weakness, it was that they were antisocial and unfriendly.
The two of them received many requests to hunt.\nThis time, their target was a bear that had acquired a taste for human flesh.\nIt was attacking villagers instead of hibernating.

The skilled hunters were only asked to pursue formidable targets. No prey was too much for the pair, and they expected this bear to be no different. But on this hunt, the master's belly was torn open by the beast's teeth, and he died.

His apprentice cried bloody tears. He burned his master's corpse and fashioned the bones into a bow.
He named the bow "Hunter's Spirit" and used it to kill his prey.
Then one day, his prey got the best of him, and he soon succumbed to his wounds.
The bow with the spirits of both the master and apprentice imbued in it remained in the village forever.

Merchant's Notes, April 3rd
People who serve god talk a lot.
I wasn't able to make a sale.
But I know my heart is in the right place and will try again tomorrow. A virtuous heart is one that shows kindness to others.

Merchant's Notes, April 5th
My customer opened up to me today.
He recently lost a son.
I suppose my innermost thoughts don't really matter,
but I'll try to remember to be kind to others and try again tomorrow.

Merchant's Notes, April 6th
He showed interest in the staff.
It seems that the ornament on it resembles a stone that his son liked.
I'll try again tomorrow.
Acting without understanding all of the circumstances is definitely part of having a virtuous heart.

Merchant's Notes, April 7th
I completed the transaction.
Surely, having your heart in the right place is the secret to doing business.
I sold him a staff made out of his son, and only kept that little detail a secret with the purest intentions.

Legend has it that an ancient village once existed\nthat was settled in a volcanic crater plagued with constant eruptions. A traveler, pitying the villagers, went to the crater and stopped the eruptions by striking the magma with his axe, leaving it stuck within the crater.
But after a long period of dormancy, the legend was forgotten. In time, few people knew of the axe's true purpose.

One day, a young man decided to put his courage to the test by
retrieving the legendary axe from the magma. He approached the elders with
his idea, who urged him forward with their blessing. When he dislodged the axe,
terrible volcanic eruptions continued for six days and nights.

The villagers tried to escape the sudden eruptions.\nEventually a youth emerged who was willing to risk his life to strike the magma with the axe once again. He stopped the eruptions, but paid for it with his life. He was honored as a hero. The legend was archived as a warning so that it would never be forgotten again.

Who knew that a renowned wizard giving a lecture at the school of magic could cause such a commotion? The classroom brimmed with students and teachers alike.\nEveryone was captivated...but not because of the lesson.
When the old wizard arrived to give his lecture, the students and teachers were taken aback. Whispers filled the classroom. What the class saw that day perplexed them.
Some in attendance thought the wizard looked like the headmaster. Others thought he looked like one of the legendary wizards from their textbooks. So why did his appearance cause so much confusion?

It was later revealed that the headmaster was simply using magic to make himself look like the wizard of legend. It was a magical test conducted by the school. Teachers who saw through the ruse earned a raise, while students were given extra credit. Students who failed to pierce the veil, however, were penalized.

This eye, that eye, these eyes, and those...
All of the eyes on me scared me.
They all looked at me.
As much as I wanted to escape, I couldn't.
I gouged out my own eyes to escape their gaze.\nI thought that would be enough to quiet my fear.
But it was no use.\nEven if I couldn't see, I could still feel.\nI COULD FEEL THEIR EYES UPON ME.

But why? Why?
This eye, that eye, these eyes, and those...
All of them, all of them, every one...
I gouged them all out!
So who was still watching me?!
Countless eyeballs rolled towards me...
Those who obeyed were brainwashed.\nThose who resisted met reprisal.\nBefore long, the religious sect's teachings had reached every corner of the kingdom.

Brainwashing requires imprinting.\nThe religious sect used tax money to build a gate to heaven.\nThey required their followers to pray there five times a day. Religion ruled every aspect of their lives.

To anyone other than a follower, the gate itself was underwhelming.\nEven so, the sect had gone bankrupt in building it. And despite religious dogma to the contrary, many of its builders killed themselves during its construction. The sect made many excuses to cover up this fact.

The end result was a small gate whose key was given out to the religious sect's members.
All of this, just so their followers would pray.
Seeing their followers flock to the gate,
the sect was more than satisfied with the result.
The scientific community resisted military intervention. They were developing a drug that would release me from the darkness.
I was appointed as director and served the king directly.\n"Sacrifices must be made to protect the many."\nI used that belief to secure the environment I wanted.

Under the pretext of "saving as many people as possible,"\nI started testing new drugs on the populace.\nIn times of peace, it would have been considered inhumane. Given the circumstances, however, I was allowed to do as I pleased.

My efforts were finally rewarded!
I made the world even more chaotic!
Even more free!
Hooray! Hooray! Hooray!

The burden was mine to bare, not hers.\nEven though no words passed between us, I felt closer to this girl than anyone else.\nShe'd saved me more times than I could count. And I protected her in return.

Every time she regained a human emotion,
the burden I bore decreased.
"I want to see her smile."
In time, that became my reason for being.

But all good things must come to an end.
We slept close to one another.
My nightmares worried her enough to keep her up at night.
I had to get free of that spell.
I knew of only one way to do it. So I decided to take action.

I returned to the battlefield with her by my side.
I was more afraid of losing her than anything else.
"Is revenge really that important? What if we went somewhere far from all this darkness?"
But my voice grew weak and faded away...
A blade made with vengeance in mind...\nI thought I heard a voice begging for mercy. It sounded familiar...\nBut I ignored it, cutting away at the darkness.
What was I doing there, anyway?\nSomething inside me urged me on.\nLike the brilliance of a dark void being consumed by light, long forgotten memories resurfaced.

Someone handed me a sword, but I couldn't read their expression.
Someone caressed my head as if they were proud.
Someone squeezed my hand as if they cared...
"Hey. Who are you?"

I shouldn't be crying.
I did what I set out to do.
I'm the one that did the killing.
So why am I crying? Why do I feel so empty?
I want my voice back. Hurry up and give it back. Hurry up and find it. Hurry, hurry, hurry, hurry. This is your fault. This is all your fault.
Why was my heart snatched from my body? I answered every question. I gave her my voice. So why did she...?
I saved you, not her. Give me back my heart my voice my heart my voice my heart my voice my heart my voice.

This sad void isn't just you, it's me as well. The me who wouldn't regret killing you would have a much, much, much, much, much sadder death. I mean... Right?\nYou'd be sad if I were to die, too, wouldn't you?
What happened to my staff?! Ah... You could hardly even call it a staff anymore...
Okay.\nI'll put these clothes on and perform in the plaza.
It's no use. I'm not making any money.\nIf I don't turn this around soon, they'll sell off the old man's treasure.
That much?! Are you sure...? Thank you!\nI'll listen to anything you say!\nYour wish is my command.
Many nightmares had scattered\nin the wake of a giant chunk of tin.\nIts appearance was sudden and devastating.
The nightmares' minds were made up.\nThey were the ones who caused this calamity, and they'd be the ones to stop it.
They were used to dealing with the tin.\nIt was only natural after all,\nas they had been dealing with tin for a long time.

They forged the tin into powerful weapons,
but still failed to obtain the upper hand.
It was then that a wise orc had an idea.
"If wisps have no bodies..."
"It was the tin that took your son. I saw it with my own eyes. It was chomping down on wisps."
The orc's words filled the wisp's parents with rage.
The orc armed them with a tin hammer and spear, and they headed into the forest in search of the tin.

The tin found the parents and came running up to them.
Though it appeared to scream, the parents heard no sound.
They brought the hammer down and smashed the tin with a powerful blow.
Faced with the gory corpse, they were overwhelmed by regret.
Whrrrrr...\nKa-chunk. Click-click-click-click... Ping!
Click-click-click-click-click....\nClick, clock, click... Ping!
Ah. It doesn't float. Even with a spring attached, it cannot swim. All it does is fire from this cannon.\nThe wise orc petted the muzzle with pride.
Red Riding Hood was so excited!\nShe loved playing with her wheel.\nLook at how much fun she's having, throwing that thing around!
Red Riding hood burst out laughing when she saw the wolf running away as fast as he could.
When she finished playing, she amused herself by trying to copy the look on the wolf's face!
She sure played a lot today.\nShe decided she'd come up with more ways to show everyone just how fun her wheel could be.
There was a holy forest where faeries were rumored to reside.\nBows made from the trees of this place were of unrivaled quality,\nhailed for their performance, durability, and beauty.

But very few of these bows existed.\nThe wood alone was hard enough to come by. Finding an artisan skilled enough to shape it was harder still. Furthermore, the local lumberjacks felled few trees in order to preserve the forest.

A hunter, seeking a fabulous bow for himself, cut down a tree without permission. He took the ill-gotten materials and entrusted them to an artisan who crafted the bow...yet he would never see the finished product.

The hunter contracted a fever that night and died soon after.\nThe true reason so few of these bows were available is that they required a pact with the faeries. Only so many trees could be cut down per month, and anyone who exceeded that limit was to be killed with a curse. A pact that the hunter had foolishly broken...

The kingdom was on the verge of collapse.\nOne of the worst harvests on record plunged the land into famine. The government, unable to curb the devastation, began to suffer public ire as tensions rose.

To combat the mounting disquiet, the king formed special units to deal with dissenters.
As the units tempered unrest, the king ordered a blacksmith to develop a new weapon.
He requested that it be so powerful that it would strike fear in the hearts of all who saw it.
In response, the blacksmith developed a giant club.

Revolts broke out across the kingdom, and the special units were sent to deal with them.
They left equipped with the new clubs.
Unbeknownst to them, the blacksmith had been a part of the insurrection from the start.
The battle that ensued was an overwhelming victory for the revolutionaries.

"Why did you betray me?!" the king yelled at the blacksmith on the eve of his beheading.\n"My Liege. Do you have any idea how much bread could have been bought with the money you used to commission this weapon?" The blacksmith muttered dispassionately.\nMoments later, the king's head was caved in by a blow from the costly club.

There once was a girl whose lover was murdered.
They had been happy together, content in each other's arms, but reality cares little for simple pleasures.
Having lost her heart's true match, the girl's life grew empty and hollow.
One day, she finally decided to avenge her loss.

Her lover's murderer had been a powerful lord.
A young girl would be no match for such an adversary.
Thus, she sought help from a wizard she'd met some years prior.
Hearing her story, the wizard produced the one-swing scythe.

This scythe could instantly kill targets with its cursed arc.\nThe price exacted for each kill was the death of another. The wizard told the girl that two must die each time the scythe was used. Though hesitant to take such a weapon, the girl's eyes hardened with resolve. Neither she, nor her lost love, would be denied.

On the fated day, the girl found an opening in her battle with the lord and swung with all her might.
The lord wasn't wounded in the slightest.
Unable to hold back her laughter, the girl cackled as she slit her own throat with the scythe.
The lord only had time for a single astonished cry before the power of the curse cut him in two, the scythe's bloody price paid in full.

There was once an instrument said to bless its musician the more they played it.\nBy chance, a man stumbled upon the mystic item.\nHowever, he had no idea the violin had magic within its polished surface.
He played it once and received a fortune in gold.\nHe played it again and found true love.\nHe played it a third time, and his mother recovered from her deadly illness.

The man celebrated the life the violin had given him.\nYet he still had no idea it was the violin's magic that had so blessed him.\nWhen the man came upon an impoverished girl, he gifted her the instrument.

The blessings it had bestowed vanished in an instant.\nHis status and honor vanished, and his life soon followed.\nWhat does it mean to be blessed? Is a blessed life just what comes before you lose everything? Perhaps the answers rest in the sorrowful wail of a violin.
Merchant's Notes: August 12th\nHypocrisy is rampant among my business rivals.\nMany pretend to be pure-hearted... Ha! They are anything but.

Merchant's Notes: August 14th
I met with an associate today.
He was the very image of a brown-noser.
I doubt even his own mother would mourn his passing.

Merchant's Notes: August 16th
At the meeting, we discussed donations for that same associate's impoverished hometown.
It's said that charity can often invigorate one's business.
Nonsense. Pure hogwash. I refused his cause.
Merchant's Notes: August 17th\nTurns out that the donations were being embezzled by one of the bosses working behind the scenes.\nIf this isn't the very essence of hypocrisy, I don't know what is.
There were once two excellent wizards who decided to wed.\nThey dreamed of developing a unique type of magic together, and along the way discovered other magical arts as well.
In truth, the two of them were after one thing—forbidden magic.\nThey sought unnatural power, the likes of which could resurrect the son they had lost in an accident.
After years of toil, their wish came true.\nOf course, the wife would never get the chance to smile at their success.

Their son's first sound upon resurrection was a scream of anguish.
The boy wanted to die.
Seeing her son in agony was too much for his mother.
A dry snap echoed across the dark laboratory...
O   N   E...\n   T   W   O...\n   T   H   R   E   E...
S   H   A   K   E...\n   S   H   A   K   E...\n   S   H   A   K   E...
Once with a heartfelt vow...\nTwice with a wish to love forever...\nThree times to quell my doubt in your commitment...
P   L   E   A   S   E.\nMake me your one\n   and only love.
He imposed some restrictions on me.\nPerhaps he feared my approaching adulthood?
We made some promises to each other.\nI felt like I'd lose him if I didn't.
Sometimes, things in the distance would catch my eye.\nImpulse would take over,\nand he'd know I'd broken a promise yet again.
Maybe his fears had come true.\nI could neither bear his rules nor believe his words.\nAnd so, I...
He couldn't understand a thing we said,\nbut before long, he was part of our village.\nHowever peculiar he was, there was also something undeniably fascinating about him.

Though the village offered plenty of freedom,
those you could call happy were few and far between.
Yet, the man always seemed to be smiling happily.
It didn't matter how many restrictions we imposed on him.

Gradually, the man learned to understand the language.
Now that we could communicate with him,
we were finally able to ask him why he was so happy.
"I didn't understand the value of freedom," he said. "At least, not until I lived without it."

So we made more rules...
But broke them whenever the happiness of another was at stake.
In time, the village came to resemble his country—
a place with no shortage of rules and unending happiness.

I should have just said it.
"I want to be with you." That would have been the end of it.
We spent time together,
but I silenced my heart. It was my duty as the elder sister.
I don't have much time left.\nMy body has made that very clear.\nHoping to enjoy what remained of my life, I took every moment seriously.

But our approaches differed.
She refused to give up hope on a cure even though she knew it was impossible.
I knew she was fighting for my life.
But all I wanted was for her to stop and stay by my side.
Is that really so much to ask?

Today was another day wasted looking for the cure.
The room was littered with half-finished books.
"All you do is worry."
Knowing what was to come, my body screamed in agony as I took up my cane and headed into the desert.
I just know it.\nMy sister won't succumb to this illness.
I just know it.\nI've become a burden to her.
I'll do my best.\nI want to play with her again.
My sister has done so much for me.\nIt's time to pay her back.\nI love her so much.
There was once someone who would keep pushing forward in the face of any obstacle.\nThere was once someone who would destroy evil with no hope of receiving praise for it.
There was once someone who would abandon relatives to save the innocent.\nThere was once someone who sacrificed their life to save this disgusting world.
There were once people who resorted to accursed means to achieve their beautiful ideal.\nThe possessed sword never turns red\nno matter how much blood it devours.
Those who have held the sword in defiance of this world have come to be called the "Azure Swordsmen."
You can use this gun under one condition.\nEvery time you point it at another and pull the trigger,\nyou would then have to turn it on yourself and do the same.
There is no limit to the number of bullets you could load into the chamber.\nLoading all of the bullets at once makes it the perfect killing machine.
I had an enemy I had to kill even if it cost me my life. The man who took my wife from me... Forgiveness was not an option.

But I found myself conflicted.
She looked so happy with him.
I pondered my course of action, and after deep contemplation,
I slowly pulled the trigger...
"Behold. This newborn baby is divine."\nWhy do you look at me like that?\nWhy? I thought you'd be happy.
If possible, I would like to satisfy this beautiful soul with my own two hands.\nWith that in mind, I walked down the road until I found a pregnant woman and removed the baby from her belly.
Ahh! As beautiful as ever.\nToday was my third time, and the color is never the same.\nI've pressed my cheeks up against all of them.
Those who have gathered try to restrain me.\nStop! That's mine! Give it back!\nOnly those who understand their beauty are allowed to touch them!
Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother. Mother.
God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God. God.
Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody. Somebody.
Anybody. Anybody. Anybody.\nAnybody. Anybody. Anybody.\n...Get me the hell out of here.
Buzz, buzz, flies the fly.\nAround the face, the flower blooms.\nBuzz, buzz, flies the fly.
Buzz, buzz, flies the fly.\nAround my father, it lays the eggs.\nBuzz, buzz, flies the fly.
Buzz, buzz, flies the fly.\nOn my body, the flower blooms.\nBuzz, buzz, flies the fly.
Buzz, buzz, flies the bee.\nBehold! Around the pond, the flowers bloom.\nBuzz, buzz, flies the bee.
All over my body, I get the feeling that I'm being watched.\n"Who are you? Let's talk."\nThe staff calls out to me.
Shut up. You disgust me.\nI throw it away, and the next thing I know, it's right back in my hand.
Whoever made this staff must delight in my anger.\nThat leaves me with only one option—\nI have to answer in a way that bores him.

"Who are you? Let's talk."
"You see me, eh? Well, I see you, too."
"I see YOU. I see YOU. I see YOU."
"I'm always watching ME, and I'm always watching YOU." 
From then on, that's all I would say to the staff...
Access acquired.\nIn accordance with the rules, I will give you some advice.
Read what follows at your own risk.\nWe take no responsibility for your safety.
Your desires have been acknowledged.\nPlease remember, you yearn for that place\nat your own risk.

Camouflage canceled.
Eradicating structures in the volcanic zone.
We await you at the point
where it begins—35.658581, 139.745433.
I hate the customs of this village.\nIt's mandatory that the fertility of the bride be ascertained as soon as she enters into marriage.

The village chief is the one who decides the partner.\nHaving been born and bred in this village, I had no right to refuse.\nEven if my partner turned out to be the bastard who imprisoned my mother on false charges...
So every night from then on, the little tadpoles swam inside of me.\nRound and round, round and round, round and round, round and round, round and round, round and round they went...

Even after the ritual was complete, I couldn't wash away the sensation.
Round and round, round and round, round and round...
I'll never be rid of the feeling of them swimming inside of me for as long as live.
At least, for as long as I live in this village...
Hey, Brother. I just had a bad dream.\nIn it, I was a little older, but I was trapped in a dark and cramped place...
For some reason, you weren't there.\nI was alone and talking to a plate\nthat had a pale glow to it.

Terrifying, right?
My life means nothing without you.
Oh, I know.
You'd never abandon me.
Hey, Brother.\nHold me close, okay?\nJust like you did when you took me in the forest. Remember?

Test Subject #1: Designation #3072 (10 days in)
The meds seem to be working.
I wonder what she's dreaming about right now?
I'm so curious.

Test Subject #12: Designation #3454 (30 days in)
She managed to wake promptly from her dream.
However, she started speaking in a strange tongue,
and I am no longer able to understand her.

Test Subject #12: Designation #3454 (50 days in)\nEver since she woke up, she's become increasingly violent.\nWhat's more, she's grown resistant to the sedatives and is now beyond my ability to control.

Test Subject #24: Designation #3902 (100 days in)\nTen days ago, we saw a stark increase in the number of waking subjects.\nControlling the violent ones among them has become increasing difficult, and we have since requested the appointment of an executioner.

Research Journal: 0504 -Maeda-\nProgress has risen at a remarkable rate since my addition to the team. It was about time they finally wised up. It's only a matter of time before they see me for the genius that I am.

Research Journal: 0604 -Maeda-\nThe results have been absolutely astonishing. Should I sell it to the government at a premium? Or should I deal with a research lab in another country instead?\nThe fate of the world is in my hands.

Research Journal: 0605 -Maeda-\nMy head is killing me... I guess I had a bit too much to drink last night. Still, I want this record to be complete, free of lies.\nI lost critical research results while intoxicated.

Research Journal: 0606 -Maeda-
Well, no matter. All of the critical information is up HERE anyway.
Something is not right with Kuramochi today, but the parameters are still well within the margin of error.
There is no way to escape from OUR network.
Research Journal: 0605 -Kuramochi-\nI've just obtained some amazing information.\nI can't believe Maeda has been keeping this from me...

Research Journal: 0806 -Kuramochi-
The organization has been following me ever since...that day.
And the number of mysterious incidents have only increased.
If that data turns out to be correct, then the world has begun its descent into madness.

Research Journal: 0909 -Kuramochi-
Men with the same face as Maeda appeared before me.
I doubt I'll make it out alive if I cross paths with one of them again.
If only I'd never learned the truth...
"It won't be long now."\nHe escaped into the dark alley, but nothing could prepare him for what he saw next.\nA squirming darkness oozed up from the ground and covered the sky...
Prisoner's Diary ①\nI want out of this fucking hellhole.\nWord among the other inmates is that someone is conducting inhumane experiments somewhere in this prison.

Prisoner's Diary ②
I heard something interesting from the guard.
Apparently, Maeda likes butterflies.
I'll try to catch one when I'm out in the yard tomorrow and give it to him.
Anything to get my sentence reduced.

Prisoner's Diary ③
The place is growing gloomier by the day.
First they took away the TV and newspapers, now we're being denied visitations.
We are completely cut off from the outside world...

Prisoner's Diary ④
I'm done for. The prisoners who have gone crazy are howling in a some strange language while cannibalizing their fellow inmates.
As if that weren't enough, a bunch of brutes known as the Executioners have been patrolling the prison grounds...
Tomorrow. Tomorrow's plan will mean the difference between life and death. I break free, or I die...
It's the beginning. The beginning.\nThe beginning of the end.\nA feast for the mad.

The application spreads.
There's a document hidden in its database.
The network spreads.
The world is a maelstrom of plots and desires.
I don't know what to believe anymore.\nI don't know which side will win.\nAll I can do is put my faith in what I've heard.
This sentence is just one possibility.\nA possibility that can never be written into history.\nIt's a piece of fiction full of countless lies.
I wanted her desperately...\nSo I cut her beautiful black hair.
I had to see her face...\nSo I cut away her hat.
But the my scissors were those meant to severe the threads of fate, and I cut whatever future we had together.
If our fates are no longer joined in this life, I'm sure we'll reunite in the next.\n Cut. Cut. Cut away.\nCut. Cut. Cut away our ties to this world...
Yay!\nTanuki's game is about to begin!
I really like tanu-sleep!\nAnd I hate tanu-wake up!
I really like tanu-sleep!\nAnd all who wake are going tanu-die!
Buuuuuuut I would like to meet you in my dreams!\nYou smell really nice, like the sun!

-Young Orc Cutlet / Organic Tinder -
1. Dress up like a helpless maiden and fall asleep in the forest.
2. Threaten the dumb orcs drawn to the sweet smell.
3. Take some of them as hostages and have them guide you to their horde.

4. Promise to release the hostages if they guide you to a house with a young orc suckling.
5. Squeeze about 100ml of milk out of the orc mother.
6. Smash the orc suckling of choice with a large hammer and carve up its meat.
7. Hang the orc suckling out front until its blood drains out.
*This process is critical if you're to maintain freshness. Complete it as quickly as possible.

8. Soak the orc in its mother's milk to remove the smell.
9. This won't get all of the orc stink out of it, however, so pickle it in herbs and spices afterward.
10. Wash it thoroughly with water, sprinkle a modest amount of flour on it, and soak it in egg yolks.
11. While the meat is still soaking in the yolks, cut the throats of the orcs from step 3 while they sleep.

12. Prepare about one adult orc's worth of oil (obtained in the last step) and heat it up to 160 degrees.
13. Fry it up to a golden brown, and you're done.

Review: The smell was a bit much for my taste, so I threw it in the fire and burned it to ash.
Kill or be killed.\nIt's common sense for anyone who lives in this town.
You can't last a day without taking a life.\nIt's just that common.\nKnowing that, who could blame the bandits before me?
I want to survive at least one more day.\nAnd that reminds me... I get paid tomorrow.\nAll I can think of is a hot bowl of soup...

I hear a quiet "plop."
My head rolls.
Ah... So my dream of soup will remain just that.
My head tumbles on the cold ground, awash in a thick, red broth.
Love me.\nYou'll live a blessed life if you do.
Love me.\nYou'll live a long life if you do.
Love me.\nOf course I loved you. Can't you see?
Love me.\nBecause if you don't, I'm going to kill you.
This is basically a version of the F7 arcane pistol that's been modified to take 10x24mm Jigrane bullets. DWK Inc. staked its survival on the project.

Since it incorporates the same locking mechanism used on the Lucaine semi-arcane rifle, its design is essentially identical for all intents and purposes.\nAdopting this method allows for uniformity of its magic, which has made it one of the world's most popular models.

If there were anything else of note about this weapon, it would be its minimal recoil. It promised an accuracy beyond what any other modern magical guns could claim, and was rewarded with incredible demand once word got out.

On the other hand, its construction was incredibly complicated, which led to higher prices. This meant that it also required advanced technology to repair, and the worldwide panic it caused would eventually lead to its disappearance from the battlefield. When production was halted following DWK's bankruptcy, the gun and its name road off into the sunset of history.
I hear a song.\nIt's the lament of stolen happiness...an accursed cry.
I hear a song.\nIt's the murmur of love...a wooing cry.
I hear a song.\nIt's the chiding of my child...a warning cry.

I hear a song.
The lyrics are the same. The melody is the same.
But it's filled with a myriad of emotion.
Everything but the singing of this song was banned in the village.
And there it echoes to this day.
It's only when you stand at death's precipice that you truly feel alive.
When the fate of the tower rests in your hands...\nWhen you fire explosives at the rogue stronghold...\nThat's when you remember, "Oh, right. I really live here."
But when I came across this cursed staff...\n"Say your own name, and you die." It brought a new warmth to my life.

Nearly letting the syllables of my name tumble free was such a joy. Each time was cathartic, like crossing the rickety bridge of my mortality.\nAlas, all good things must come to an end. Never in my wildest dreams did I think saying the word in my sleep would count.
Hatred. Hope. Demise. Desire. Reality. Saturation. Chaos. Impulse. Lamentation.
Alienation. Infestation. Impatience. Rage. Anger. Blasphemy. Sloth. Debauchery. Circulation. Rebirth.
Slaughter. Weakness. Isolation. Rift. Discord. Conflict. Victory. Ambition. Cycle. Saga.
Fulfillment. Confinement. Incubation. Surges. Monsters. Authors. Parasites. Detachment. Reincarnation.
An imperial humanoid android. Built for both general and military use, the standard model was created to assist in the everyday lives of humans.
When first activated, the Niverno Lab's network was used by the Empire to control them.
They obeyed the commands of their owners and life became richer, but, unbeknownst to their owners, the androids would soon be placed under imperial supervision.
They were ordered to kill anyone that might pose a threat to the Empire. Many citizens disappeared, a testament to their obedience.
"Desire" received.\nRestoring story...
Initiating character resonance.\nBiological homeostasis. No abnormalities detected.
Initiating bookshelf restoration.\nBookmark acquisition complete.
The verse is complete.\n"Welcome to the Worst World."

The city where the religious leader resided was thought to be the closest place to heaven, and so attracted a great many pilgrims.\nDevout as I was, I took up my halberd and stood before the gates of the holy city to watch out for any suspicious wanderers.

I kept a careful watch for anyone who could have been a pagan spy or a dealer of forbidden articles.\nWhen I saw anyone who fit the bill, I approached them to halt their activities...by any means necessary.

Old and accomplished veteran that I was, the younger guards would come running to me whenever I stood in front of the gate and insist that they take my place.\nI wish I could say I can still hold my own, but it's time I acknowledge my age and step aside for the next generation.

I heard something from my family.
An arm injury had forced a former holy knight tasked with defending the holy city into an early retirement.
Seeing himself as a knight of the gods, he was consumed by wild delusions that it was still his job to protect the city.
Well, I suppose he's not doing any harm... May as well let him live whatever life he has left on his own terms.
Collection Site: Abandoned Amusement Park\nSituation: It seems that I took heavy damage in a battle with a large machine. The records show it employed a specialized soundwave attack. ａ.
Collection Site: Forest\nZone: The home of many small animals, now abandoned. These diminutive creatures may have died fighting the larger beasts that inhabited their surroundings. ａ.

Collection Site: Flooded City\nAfter the bunker fell, records say the surviving YoRHa units abandoned their weapons here. It's not known exactly why they chose to do this, but it's quite possible that a bug occurred in their thought processors. ａ.
Collection Site: The Tower\nDetails unknown. Collector unknown. ａ.

One wave of the spear would charm a hundred people, but at the cost of a year of your life. Rumors of a curse arose when the head of a dance troupe died at a young age. He was well-liked and always brandished the eerie spear when he danced.

After he died, use of his beloved spear was forbidden, and it was sealed away. He originally purchased it from a merchant who had traveled from China. After much haggling, the dancer had managed to secure the item for an impressive bargain.

For a weapon said to have come from China, its decorative face felt strangely Japanese. The face was sullied, as if stained by blood. Any servant entrusted with cleaning it would eventually grow too scared to go near it.

Despite the mysterious power of the spear, the merchant couldn't unload it no matter what he did. He eventually went out in search of an eccentric collector. When he received the small pittance he sold it for, a slight grin crept onto his face, and a strange voice spoke from nowhere... "Thanks for the feast."

I've sustained damage in the battle. I'm shutting down all processes to stay in the fight.
Flying blood-blood-blood-oil.
The shrieks and screams of mechanical lifeforms reverberate throughout the giant abandoned factory.
The enemy... They must be defeated.

Some of the machines seemed to have taken on a parental role.
They cry and yell as they plead for their lives.
I'll kill tens of thousands of them.

The machines crowd around me as if they are dancing.
"This cannot continue. This cannot continue. This cannot continue." They chant these words like a prayer.
I brandish my sword and challenge them.

And that's when I always wake up from my dream.

When I wake, I hear the sounds of insects.
I've been taking longer naps recently. Maybe it's some kind of malfunction.
I get the feeling that I just had a really long dream.
I bite down hard on my lip as I watch him sleep.

February 4th
Malfunction reported at a Shinjuku supermarket.
We investigated but were unable to ascertain the problem.
The gas monitor showed all was normal.

February 6th
Malfunction reported at a Shinjuku supermarket.
The same place from two days back.
We investigated but were yet again unable to figure out the problem.
We did, however, replace some of the piping to quell their complaints.

February 8th
Malfunction reported at a Shinjuku supermarket.
I talked to my boss and asked if we could deal with it over the phone.
We decided to have management deal with it first from now on.
March 14th\nMalfunction reported at a Shinjuku supermarket.\nIt was in the "no-go zone," however, so no response was provided.

My first impression of this weapon that came from a faraway land was "rustic." Its handle was rusted, it had a strange mechanism, and the blade was deformed. It had been sold as a spear, but it was too heavy for that. Is this something that was really worth anything...?\n

His Majesty presented us with quite the demand—"I will handsomely reward anyone who brings me the heaviest weapon in three days' time." He wants to use it to nominate heroes, apparently, but frankly? I couldn't care less about his insane requests. That's when the gods blessed me with a heavy spear. It was just lying in a junkyard.

When an enemy nation is conquered, you take their weapons as proof of your victory. I can't imagine the land of vanquished giants this monstrous spear came from. The king was gripping it tightly as he pleaded for his life, kneeling in his own piss. Once would think it'd be worth something, but when I took it in to be appraised, I was told it was absolute trash. So much for that.\n

When the weapon was discovered in the war against the machines, the years had not been kind to it. A lab discovering a previously unknown circuit suddenly brought it back into the spotlight. It was hard to imagine that such sophisticated technology existed in the past, so a number of researchers openly doubted its authenticity. All doubts vanished in the war that followed.

[0806-0002]
Report: Newly operated old world production facility deep beneath a gigantic factory has been confirmed. No machine signals found.
Hypothesis: An automated human relic that is still operational.
Recommendation: Report to headquarters and continue investigation.

[0806-0006]\nReport: I've concluded that the control system that exists deep beneath the factory was created by old world humans.\nRecommendation: Continued investigation and system data backup and analysis.

[0806-0018]\nReport: Investigation of the factory control system has been completed. Human information was detected within the internal data, and I have concluded that it was made using data on human personalities. I have decided to carefully proceed with the investigation. Over and out.

[0806-0021]\nReport: I have concluded that the factory I have been investigating is an ordnance factory created by old world humans. I have also confirmed that the personalities of heads of state and other prominent citizens of the time have been inserted into its control system.\nConsiderations: This production method is a counterintuitive countermeasure for human-based war.
My magnificent medicine is complete!\nWith this, you can go three days and nights\nwithout eating and still have plenty of energy!
So let's test the intake limits!\nWe'll start by giving three liters of medicine\nto a 15kg young hound.

Oops! Looks like a fatal dosage...
Well, let's just skip this step
and try it out on a human subject!
This medicine is pointless if it won't work on humans, after all.

I did it!
And boy, does it work!
My eyes...
I see what looks like a new kind of butterfly appearing before me!
I mustn't let it escape!
I must capture and dissect it!
Congrats on turning ten.\nI'm sure you're growing into a lovely young girl. Nothing fills me with more joy than seeing how kind you are, so fond of songs and birds...just like your mother.
I'm sorry that I never get to play with you.\nI want you to play this violin and remember I'm always with you. Is it selfish of me to ask you that?
If not for clan rules, you could have been born into a normal life, and there is so much I'd want to teach you...\nSo much I'd want to see with you.
If only I could prove you're not dangerous. If I did, I'd put you on a golem's shoulder, and we'd travel the world. I'd more than make up for the ten years that have been wasted thus far.
We are about to go off to battle to rescue you.\nIf we fail, this will be my last message to you.
That's why we'll entrust you to those we can be sure of.\nEven if we can't be there, you won't be alone for your birthday or go without presents.
If only we lived in better times...\nI'm so sorry.\nI made the decision I thought was best for you. Nothing would make me happier than to get you something to bring you joy on your birthday.

We'll tell you how important you are to us in a letter.\nIf you ever find yourself alone without anyone you can trust, don't be sad. We will always be by your side.\nWith all the love in the world... -Mom
Congrats on turning five.\nWe didn't think you'd understand our feelings if we told you in person, so we decided to write them in this letter.
When you finally read this, we hope you'll realize just how much we love you.
Are you happy now that you're five? Or are you still imprisoned in a world of darkness?\nWe're so sorry if you are.

We're so sorry we can't kill you.\nSorry to make you live like this.\nYou're an irreplaceable treasure to us. Even if you're a cursed child prophesized to bring calamity upon us all, we could never bring ourselves to kill you.

"You say I'm wrong? Yeah...I know"

                "All I can do is keep fighting."

"If I can't bring him back...then I'll..."

"Abandon your emotions..."

"This battle is the reason I live."
"It's because of Him I exist."\n\n            "Defeat me, and I will stand again."
The song I use to cheer myself up leads to a resentment that plagues me even further.\nMy heart is sinking into the shadows.\nThe day when the whole of me drowns draws near.

"Go forth, dear child. Be free of your savage soul." —At mass that day, I heard god's revelation.\nWas I hesitant? It matters not.\nI immediately made preparations to depart and left with the church's staff in hand.

As I calmed lost souls at various stops along the way, I came to a realization. The Undead King had been revived and was threatening order in the afterlife. That was the reason for this multitude of strange phenomena.\nI challenged the Undead King to a duel, and after a hard-fought battle, I successfully purged him.\nThe souls trapped inside of him were released and ascended to heaven.

A summons came from His Holiness. He said, "You will be made a saint. Go forth and be a model for both the clergy and faithful alike."\nTo that, I smiled and said, "I cannot accept this honor, for no man is above or below any other." I bowed and took my leave.\nI had to do that which I felt was right.

Men clad in black blocked my path, stole my staff, and dragged me to the ground.\n"You insolent fools! You dare to threaten the authority of the church?! To hell with you, I say!" Despite my rage, the wet crack of the staff crushing my skull would be the last sound I heard in this mortal coil.\nAnd thus, I was freed from the bonds of earthly life.

There was a woman who got engaged to a promising officer after several years in love. While their life together was a blessed one, relations with the neighboring country were on the decline, and her fiancé was to be dispatched to the front lines. "I'll marry you as soon I as I get back," he said. And with that, he was gone.

After several bloody battles, both countries declared a stalemate and withdrew their forces. The woman awaited the return of her fiancé, but after many days and nights, he still hadn't returned home. In time, his superior came to her and told her the grim news—he had died honorably on the battlefield.

Day after day, she mourned the death of her beloved. His superior officer visited her often and eventually asked for her hand in marriage. It was around that time that a friend of her fiancé showed up and told her the truth. It turned out that the superior officer had his eye on her for a while and had sent her fiancé into harm's way to get him out of the picture.

The officer was elated that she had accepted his proposal. After the wedding, on their first night together, the woman brought a bow and shot the vile man with it, killing him. Having taken vengeance for her lost love, she stabbed herself in the neck with the arrowhead and killed herself. The bow she left behind has since been passed down as a symbol of chastity and fidelity.

A fierce-looking man lived with his young wife in a manor.
The man was silent and surly, while his wife was a somewhat shadowy, beautiful woman.

A young man who had come to work at the manor caught a glimpse of an expensive bottle of liquor and couldn't help but try a swig.
At dawn, both of his pinky fingers were smashed with the blunt side of a large sword, and he was promptly expelled from the manor.

There was a "locked room" in the manor that the master forbade his servants to enter.
One of them couldn't contain his curiosity and took but a step inside.

At dawn, both of his pinky fingers and pinky toes were smashed with the blunt side of a large sword, and he was promptly expelled from the manor.

A journalist hoping to write an exposé infiltrated the manor as one of its servants.
The man ruled the manor with an iron fist, and his wife was a victim who feared for her life... At least, that's what he had been planning to write.
In the dead of night, he snuck into the wife's room and tried to get her side of the story.
But just then, the door burst open, and the man appeared before them...

His beautiful wife swung a sword into the journalist's skull, smashing his brain into pulp. The man kneeled before his wife and kissed her feet. "I've crushed the filthy hyena," she said. "Indeed, my queen. Thank you so much." Even a small fist can rule with fear.

When the king said he wanted two brave souls to protect the kingdom, a pair of battle axe-wielding brothers answered his call.\nOn the following day, the neighboring country invaded, and the elder brother went out first to meet them. However, he did not return.\nVowing revenge, the younger brother attacked the enemy with a small force.

The younger brother couldn't believe his eyes.\nThe person standing between him and the enemy camp was none other than his elder brother.\nSeeing his surprise, the elder brother's lips twisted into a sneer. "What? Look at their numbers. I'm just playing the odds."

"On my honor as a knight, I will kill thee, traitor!" With those words, the younger brother brandished his axe.
The brothers were nearly equal in skill, and it was clear that the time for talk had passed.
After a furious battle, the younger brother emerged victorious by severing the tendons in his brother's right arm.
"You've grown," he said shortly before his severed head hit the ground. The younger brother returned home.

The neighboring country abandoned its invasion and withdrew.
That night, the younger brother drank himself into a stupor. It was then that he was attacked and dealt a fatal sword slash to his chest.
Looking over the younger brother as he fell into a pool of his own blood was a knight, one he'd seen before...the elder brother's lover.
The knight tried to make off with both axes, but during his escape, he was attacked by bandits and stripped of his belongings.
The axes would continue to be passed down through generations, forever in pursuit of their next victims.
[1st Black Mass Notice]\nWe'll be holding a black mass.\nInterested parties should congregate at the cemetery on the edge of town at 11:00 p.m. this evening.

[2nd Black Mass Notice]
Unfortunately, the last black mass was cut short when someone fainted at the sight of goat's blood.
Sooo, let's try this again.
Same plan—interested parties should congregate at the cemetery on the edge of town at 11:00 p.m. this event.

[3rd Black Mass Notice]
Alright. So. A candle fell over and started a fire, cutting our mass short yet again.
It's okay, though. This time, we'll get it right for sure!

[End of the World Notice]
The 72 Pillars have returned!
It's been a while, so let's warm up a bit with the destruction of this world.
But before we do that...we'll gorge ourselves on your flesh and blood!

When I was a child, I would cry when my foster mother locked me in a dark room with icicles hanging from the ceiling.\nIt was times like those when my beautiful mother would console me.\nShe's probably the reason I now only love women who are extremely pale.

One day, I made a pass at a bourgeoise madame I'd had my eye on.
You'd be surprised at how many say yes.
I'd take them up to a snowy mountaintop and force them to dig holes in the snow. Then I'd cut their throats with a sickle and kick their bodies into the holes.
Finally, I'd cover them with fresh powder and make my way home with an extra spring in my step.

You guessed it—my beautiful mother was killed by her husband.
I was the first to find her body. I looked into the kitchen and saw that her head had been separated from its body. He had discovered she was cheating and killed her on the spot.
And so was born my fetish.
The only thing that satisfies me is the feeling I get when I cut a woman's throat before anyone else can get to her.

"Now it's your turn," the man said as he swung the sickle.
I flew at him and he pulled away, cursing.
I struck him hard with both hands and knocked him into a hole.
When I peered inside, I saw his neck bent at an impossible angle with his eyes wide open.
The madness of the dark room with icicles died inside that hole.

A young man visited the royal palace, hoping to help a good king who feared a barbarian invasion. The pureness of the man's intentions so moved the king that he knighted the peasant and gave him his own sword. In turn, the knight was humbled by such honor and swore to repay the favor, no matter the cost.

Time and time again, the barbarians attacked the royal palace. Each time, the man would stand at the front of the army and brandish the sword gifted to him. So it was that he drove away the barbarians, and in time he earned fame both at home and abroad.

The young man became known among the people as the "Hero of Salvation," claiming fame and recognition for his acts. The other vassals gradually accepted them as one of their own, and soon he was regarded as second in importance only to the king himself.

One day, the king summoned the young man and handed him a cup of poison. "This country has no need for two leaders. You understand, don't you?" The young man understood immediately. He had become the object of the king's jealousy and hindered his ability to rule. "Yes, Your Majesty," he said. "For the strength of the nation!" He then gulped the poison down and ended his life.
The scene at the reception is seared in my memory.\nI close my eyes and let out an achingly long sigh.\nThe breath that escapes my lips is heavy, sullen.
Craving solitude, I escaped into the woods.\nI leaned against my axe, as if feeling fatigued .\nAnd just then, a shadow drowned out the silence.

In an instant, I turned around and cut the wolf in two.
Its head flew through the air.
Reflecting in its eyes,
was the cold, indignant rage on my face.
There I was, unable to accept what had been done...\nAlmost as if a mirror had reflected my heart instead of my appearance.\n...Who are you? Why do you haunt me?

My obsession with justice...
When did it start?
Could it have been that day?
Or perhaps it was something that gradually
became a part of me as I grew up?
...No. I know when it was.\nIt was definitely that day.\nThe day when I met the prince, and I...

You can go in circles all you want, and the answer will never come.
Indeed, I doubt that had anything to do with it.
I carry out justice, plain and simple.
The reason I do it matters not.
I am my own master.
An escapist answer, no better than running away.\nThen it occurred to me.\nMy justice comes from...
Love had nothing to do with it.\nWe simply married for the good of the country.
But this one is different.\nI can raise her up to be as beautiful as me.\nShe IS mine, after all.

Every parent loves their child.
Or at least, that's what I thought.
Try as I might, I could only hate her.
Is something wrong with me?

If not for this mirror. If not for this mirror.
If not for this mirror. If not for this mirror.
If not for this mirror. IF NOT FOR THIS MIRROR.
...Hmm. When did I get this mirror, anyway?

Today is a momentous day for everyone in the castle.
It's my mother's birthday.
Everybody is busy preparing for the party...
Including the adults who are usually so busy watching me.
I left the castle in search of presents.\nI walked and walked until I found what I was after—\nA lovely hand-mirror, perfect for my mother.
I love my mother more than anything...\nEven if now she always looks at the mirror instead of me.\nBut if that's what makes her happy, that's all that matters, right?
With this mirror, I wonder if she'll let me out of my room.\nI wonder if she'll let me read picture books like she used to.\nIf I'm able to play with Mother, I don't need anything else.
You need to be strong to survive.\nThat's the only reason I took up this sword.
I'm useless without a sword.\nNobody ever bothered to teach me anything else.
This sword is what allows me to live.\nBut the better you get at it, the harder it is to return to an ordinary life.
When I swing my sword, all of my idle thoughts just slip away.\nI no longer belong anywhere else in this world but the battlefield.\nIt's a dull life, but I don't mind.

The heavy rainfall flooded the riverbanks and inflicted massive damage on the fields.\nThe crops that everyone had worked so hard to grow were ruined, and the villagers grieved their loss.\nWith the rain showing no signs of stopping, the villagers feared that their houses would soon be likewise swept away and decided to search for a shaman.

Many shamans offered prayers to the heavens, but the rain did not stop.
Just as the villagers had given up, a spellcaster approached with an offer to "help them."
This wizard's abilities were known far and wide, but so was his greed.
The villagers, left with no other choice, ultimately decided to hire him.

As the spellcaster raised his staff to the sky, the waterfall that fed the river froze.
The rain weakened to a mist, and the village was saved from destruction.
Moments later, the spellcaster was struck in the back of the head and killed.
The villagers shot each other nervous glances, eventually letting out a sigh of relief.
They would never have been able to afford his fee...

The four seasons came and went, but the frozen waterfall refused to thaw.\nThe villagers worshipped the spellcaster's staff, hoping to appease his soul, but to no avail.\nFor a hundred years thereafter, the village's crops were plagued by a bitter frost...
In my village, there are two people who were teased for their stupidity.\nOne was a man, the other a woman.\nThe man was dim but kind, and he loved music.
But because he was ashamed of the way he looked when using his instrument, he never played in public.\nI knew there had to be something I could to do to help.

So I decided to commission a violin only someone his size could use and send it to him.\n"Look. It's just your size, made especially for you. Nothing sounds quite like it. Now, you don't have to be embarrassed about playing for people."
When he began to play, he looked like a changed man.\nHis life finally had meaning, and that meant that my life, as the woman teased for being stupid, also had meaning.
Bet it all on a single shot.\nThis cannon isn't rapid-fire.\nAll that we ask of its users is that they prepare for an honorable death.
To use this cannon, line up in a row on the front line.\nTake your shot, and bask in the praise that follows.\nYou are now the perfect target, a sitting duck in the middle of a bloody battlefield.
Failure is not an option.\nAn incredible weight is on your shoulders.\nYour love for your country, family, and friends will stifle your retreat.

You lived your whole life for this day,\nyears of training culminating in a single pull of the trigger.\nAnd once again, at its end, the bodies of brave men will be gloriously scattered across the battlefield.
