100 years later, weary of the long war, the descendants of the two countries' monarchs agreed to sign a peace treaty.\nThen the king of the northern country had a flash of inspiration.\n"Wouldn't a gift of a staff that emits the chill wind of Ice Mountain be an excellent show of friendship with the south?"

[Dr. Garve, Brainy Mad Scientist]
A man with a sharp intellect and infallible memory, his gifts became apparent in childhood, and he earned his doctorate at the age of ten.
On taking a research post in the ivory tower, he lost interest in the world and immersed himself in research.
Several years later, he kidnapped and killed a healthy young couple and began building artificial people cobbled together from their body parts.

[Ermina, the Thief Who Steals People's Hearts]
As a young girl, she was an ugly wench, to put it mildly, and the boys bullied her mercilessly.
But around fifteen, she had a growth spurt, her features sharpened, and suddenly she was so gorgeous you could hardly recognize her.
Attracted to young women already in romantic relationships, she repeatedly lured them away to gain revenge on the boys who had tormented her.

[Justin, the Boy With Two Faces]
Born to god-fearing parents who worked in a church kitchen, Justin is polite and well-liked by everyone.
But one day, while helping his parents sweep up in the cathedral, he was caught trying to steal a relic.
"God is all my mother and father care about, so all I care about are things I can see with my own eyes. I was wondering what it would be like to steal one of these things they're always staring at," he explained.

[Author's Afterword]
Ask what the greatest mystery in the world is, and I will respond without hesitating, "humanity."
The human race is made up of all sorts of people, including some very unusual ones.
The author has collected their stories and presented some of them here.
Dear reader, if you walk the steps that descend down from my tomb, you will find them there, just as they were in life!

For many years, the village had been a peaceful place, but that ended one day when the ground began to rumble.\nAt almost the same instant, the people heard a beast roaring on the mountaintop.\nThey began to gossip anxiously that there was a fierce monster lurking in the mountains.

There was no more peace and quiet from that day on.
Day and night, the roaring continued.
Certain the beast would come down at some point to attack them, the frightened villagers stood guard round the clock, prepared to be ambushed at any moment.
Then, one day, the roaring suddenly stopped, and was never heard again.

Steeling themselves, the villagers climbed the mountain, and when they reached the top, they saw a lion lying dead.\nThey could see right away that the beast was severely injured. Bloodstained bits of volcanic ash were lying all around, and they heard a low rumble from the ground.

The beast they had dreaded turned out to be an extremely cowardly lion.
A wind had blown up, stirring some bushes, and the frightened lion had roared menacingly.
Blinded by falling ash, the lion had roared continuously to keep the threat at bay.
Of course, the lion's roar had not stopped the ground from rumbling.
No matter how the lion roared, the ground had kept rumbling, and at last the lion had collapsed, its strength exhausted...

In the kingdom of Ichi on the continent,
nymphs were invited to the palace to sign a contract with the emperor.
The nymph of the springs gave the kingdom rain, the nymph of the flowers brought nectar, and the nymph of the earth brought the fruit of plants.
The nymphs were servants of the spirits, one for each generation. When an emperor took the throne, a new nymph would appear,
and when he passed away, the nymph would mysteriously disappear.

The nymph of the reign of Emperor Isao was the nymph of trees.
She was a gorgeous woman with smooth skin like white wood,
but Emperor Isao hated legends, fables, witchcraft, and magic.
So he refused to have anything to do with her, and chased her from the palace without paying her a penny.

Later on, there was a landslide in the kingdom of Ichi, and many homes and people were swept away.
Fresh green shoots spouted from the ruins, and in the blink of an eye, a forest of giant trees loomed. 
The forest began to devour the kingdom.
It spread unstoppably, at incredible speed,
so that before long an ocean of trees had submerged the kingdom of Ichi.

Much later, pioneers came to the continent and blazed trails through the ocean-like forest.
They cut down the giant trees, building houses and furniture and making bows and arrows to hunt with.
The arrows of the young leader were made from stunning white wood.
A woman appeared to him, claiming to be the servant of the spirits.
Thus, the kingdom of Ni was founded, and survived for many illustrious days.

If you despair of the boundless desert,
unfurl this scroll.
A cactus will grow
and quench your thirst.

If you despair of the filthy, suffocating sky,
unfurl this scroll.
A sturdy tree will sprout
and purify the fouled land.

If you despair of the short lifespan you have left,
unfurl this scroll.
The flowers of spring will bloom madly
and grant your wish.

If you do not yet know despair,
unfurl this scroll.
An ordinary flower
with no spiritual power will show you reality.

Deep in the forest stands a small building covered in ivy,
the ruins of an abandoned church.
The ivy even covers the inside. In one corner, the ivy is colored all year round with autumn oranges and reds.
A staff sprouting red buds lies within.

Once a pastor preached passionately to his flock from the pulpit of the church.
Devotees, most of them elderly,
would gather from all around.
Their children hated this remote place, preferring to live in far-off towns and cities.
The devotees were left to live out their final days in solitude.

The preacher sympathized deeply with their plight.
All he could do was watch over them and see that they died peacefully.
So, as the devotees neared death, the preacher would slash their throats with the tip of the staff,
and stand to the side watching and weeping until they took their last breaths.

Finally the preacher was hauled away by the higher-ups in the church, but the staff stayed behind.
When the devotees realized they were near death, they would slash their throats with the staff.
Rather than dying alone at home, it was better to give their lives to this staff
that had already absorbed the lives of countless others—at least that way they would have some company.
Even now the staff's buds glisten with fresh blood.
Prevented forever from voyaging, the sailboat's frustration\ntransforms into ice and drowns enemies.
Every day, the sailboat\nmisses the raging sea\nand thinks of journeys yet to begin.

The sailboat will never again embark on
another voyage.
Envisioning the grand voyage to come,
the sailboat has sunk.

And so...
This sailboat prevented forever from voyaging
will keep channeling every ounce of its frustration
into sinking enemies.
This instrument leads people to rapture.
The people are entranced by a joy nearing ecstasy.
In a trance, they lose themselves.
Then they lose consciousness.\nThey settle into a final sleep before bidding the world goodbye forever.
Things were tough when I was a kid.\nI didn't know how to deal with these impulses that kept grabbing hold of me.
My childhood was amazing.\nI would walk along at night with no goal in mind, and beasts would jump out from all sides to greet me violently.
I got a little older and learned more about the world.\nI started to understand that the same sex didn't appreciate it when I acted out my impulses.
So I learned to live the way I do now.\nThese days, in the information age, I can pretty much fulfill my needs online.\nI've realized how easy it is to find anything on the internet.
"Soon there will be nothing left of this village.\nA disease from another kingdom has infected this place, turning people into beasts, devouring everything."

The last words of the woman in the black cloak were, "Get out of this village as soon as you can, before the sickness devours you." Then she ran away as fast as her legs would carry her. I took a close look at the village, and noticed there were three types of people.

Pathetic village people who knew nothing. People who understood everything, in search of a way to coexist with their one-time brethren who had changed completely. People searching for a new, peaceful place before the disease could destroy them... Maybe none of the three were right.

There was an answer.
Before the disease could spread any further, everyone had to be killed.
"What a terrible, sad story..."
My murmured voice had a desolate ring, as if soaked by cold rain.
There is something strange about the village this Halloween.\nTake a walk through the village, and you won't see any children anywhere.
Well, you may see some, but there are shockingly few.\nAnd there are almost no old people either.\nA village with only young adults...there seems to be something else going on.
All the people are the same height.\nThere are only a few different hairstyles.\nThe leaders of the village must rule the place with an iron fist.

Normally the village leader would take charge.\nPeople who rule others with such authority usually make themselves conspicuous. That's what I thought, but—is it true?\nI'm not sure, but what I do know is, there's something fishy going on.
What do you want with me?\nHoho, you want revenge. Not a bad answer.\nI sense destiny has brought us together. After all, you could have chosen anyone.
To my bearer, I grant inhuman strength.\nWith my aid, you will easily obtain the blood-soaked revenge you seek.
But as payment, your soul will be mine for all eternity.\nWhen you perish, you will not be admitted into God's kingdom.\nYou will dwell in the inferno as the devil's slave. Is this what you desire?

Oh, what's that? You say I would gain more by letting you keep your soul and claiming those of the men you kill?
Hahaha, few dare negotiate with me. I admire your gall.
As you wish. Let the greedful pact be sealed!
Swing me, and let me savor the sweet taste of human souls!

Magical Familiar Contract\nArticle 1\nThe Magical Familiar Contract shall be carried out with both parties' consent. Forced servitude may be resisted through any means. Signer is responsible for all harm resulting thereon.

Article 2\n Following the execution of the Contract, compensation shall be paid upon each instance of servitude. Compensation shall consist of granting whatever the Familiar desires. Payments through magic shall be increased by twenty percent.

Article 3\nIn the event that Familiar dies due to negligence or mishandling by Attendant, Attendant shall expend the magical power/vitality necessary to revive Familiar. Rights to material benefits resulting from Familiar's powers revert to Signer.

Article 4\nIn the event of a contractual violation by Signer, Familiar may devour Signer's soul and/or body. In the event of a contractual violation by Familiar, Signer obtains Familiar's power and soul. Subsequent rebellion by said soul does not constitute a contractual violation.

"Hmm. Due to a family situation, Tomoki
has transferred schools."
It was a lie.
Even I knew that.
There was definitely something strange about him.\nSo of course I was happy.\nIf it was obvious enough that even I could see it, it had to be really bad.

From the first time we talked, there was something strange about him.
"Hey, show me your $%^{."
"I'm too embarrassed."
"It's okay. I won't laugh. So show me."
When ordered to do something, I never disobeyed.\nThat's the way my mother raised me. From the beginning, Tomoki knew that.\nSo he took advantage of my weakness...
"You look just like her."\n"Like who?"\n"My daughter."
Three days earlier, the nurse had listened patronizingly\nto the patient who had just been admitted to the nurse's office.

"I want to see my daughter again..."
"I'm sure you'll be able to see her soon,"
said the nurse, flashing a polite smile
while injecting the arm of the patient who lay in the bed.
The nurse knew all about the patient's daughter.\nAfter all, just days earlier, the nurse had injected her with the same medicine.

The people say it is a type of ghost.
Most of the sightings occur on the night of the new moon,
but the reason for this is not known.
The most convincing explanation so far is that the "ghost"
is actually the light of far-off lanterns.

It emerges from the darkness and just stands there in front of you.
It doesn't do anything but stand there,
and stare at you with its vacant eyes. 
Dawn breaks, and the sun sets again,
and still it stands there silently.

You even see it standing there in your dreams.
There is only one way to break free from it:
death.
By suicide, by accident, by any other way.
How you die doesn't matter. Death is the only way out.

And when you die, it quietly goes away.
Then, on the next new moon, it appears before someone else.
And it only appears to people who know the story.

Now that you know, you may be next.
A strange place filled up with all sorts of objects.\nA girl who looks just like me stands there, smiling.
Has some emptiness that can never be filled warped the girl beyond repair? She has turned to a husk of a person who desires only pain.
"You're the strange one, if you ask me..." says the girl mournfully, talking to nobody.
With a sense that something was terribly wrong, as if a red beast were rampaging around inside me, I watched as the girl rotted away...
The craftsman saw the two women laying on the floor of the house and gave a small, satisfied smile. Now there was proof that his masterpiece had made an impact on the world.

When the intruder stepped through the door, she stood at the threshold with a long sword in her hand.\nShe swung the sword, striking down the intruder, who had murdered her lover. But at the same time, the intruder struck her down, too.
The intruder had been a woman too.\nAnd, like her, that other woman was armed with a long sword.

She too had been told to wait there until the woman who had murdered her lover arrived, then extract vengeance with the halberd given for that purpose...\nfrom her lover's true killer, the smith who had forged the blade.

The man ate like a pig. Everyone said so, and he didn't deny it.
Except when he was sleeping or brushing his teeth,
he was constantly eating.
He loved to eat so much that he even regretted wasting time sleeping
when he could have been eating instead.

As you can imagine, the man eventually
grew so obese he could barely walk.
The doctor strictly monitored his meals, and ordered him to fast several times.
Each time, the man would wail that if he couldn't eat,
he would rather die.

To comfort him, the man's wife made a strange flute.
When you played it, it made dinner sounds:
a fork scraping a plate, wine pouring into a glass, the sound of chewing...
It might lift his spirits if he played it while he was fasting, the man's wife thought.
But when he blew on the flute, he realized something.

What he loved so much was not actually eating,
but all the sounds eating made.
The man lost all interest in eating and became obsessed with the flute.
He grew thin and healthy, but he would blow the flute day and night, filling the home with the sound of eating.
Driven insane by the racket, his wife committed suicide.
Special Edition!!\nThe ultimate diet drink, known only to a select few--until now!\nWhat's really in this "Meltdown Juice?"

According to information received by this magazine, this diet drink
is well-known to advanced dieters, who have kept it a closely guarded secret.
One sip, and you'll slim right down.
Our investigative team obtained it through sources that cannot be named.
Below is our report.

"The writer of the special edition died, didn't he?
I heard he was right in the middle of the article when he dropped dead."
"Yeah, apparently he drank nuclear fuel. His body was half-melted."
"Oh, he drank that fake Meltdown Juice.
What a dummy. Everybody knows you can't drink nuclear fuel."

:Meltdown Juice:→Search
A term referring to a diet fad popular among young people.
They cut out their tongues to stop themselves from eating.
The term comes from the huge amount of blood that spurts out when the tongue is severed.
It is an extremely effective diet, but be careful not to die of shock.
Daphne petals scatter in the breeze.\nThe garden lantern lights the dark.
The vanquished build their nests in back.\nDripping wet, eternity beckons.
The fangs of the cornered rat have not broken.\nCicadas sing in the red empty sky.
Well, let's cut your finger.\nBefore the dream goes up in smoke.

Fierce beasts with jet black fangs and fur lurked in the Forest of Shinra.\nThe young beasts were gentle, but as they grew, and began searching for mates, they became so violent no one dared go near them.\nThe people feared these guardians of the forest, calling them "beasts of legend."

The woodsmen knew the black fangs of the beasts of legend were what made them legendary.\nThe woodsmen would steal into the forest, capture a young beast, bring it back to the village and pull out its fangs.\nWhen the beasts grew old, their fur turned silver. For generations, the woodsmen had praised these gentle old "divine beasts."

A man who deeply loved the beasts stopped in the village and stayed for a while.
A village girl fell in love with the man, and revealed to him the secrets of the divine beasts and the beasts of legend.
Filled with righteous indignation, the men bellowed at the village elder, "This cruel custom of kidnapping young beasts must be stopped immediately!"
The elder ordered his guards to cut the man down where he stood.

The girl deeply resented this, and one night, when everyone was sleeping silently, she doused the houses in kerosene and set the village ablaze.\nThe flames quickly devoured everything—the village, the people in it, and their terrible timeworn customs.\nToday, a few beasts' fangs still circulate in the markets. The people whisper about a rare "Blackfang Sword" crafted by a smith enchanted by the beasts' fangs.
Get a load of this!\nSo I fessed up to this girl I had a crush on, and she agreed right away to marry me!
I'm so friggin' happy!\nI'm jumping for joy. I feel like dancing the waltz!
Know what, this would be a great time for a little violin accompaniment!\nC'mon everybody, let's dance!\nIt's a wonderful life!

I stopped fiddling and took the violin down from my cheek.
Severely wounded in the battle, my good friend lay dying.
My playing seemed to ease his suffering, and a smile covered his face.
May you rest in peace, my friend.

The temple maiden strolled the battleground, healing staff in hand, tending to the injured men's wounds.\nThe people gossiped about her, saying she would spend the night with anyone who approached her.\nOne day, to see if the rumors were true, a man went over to her place.

The next day, he returned home with a satisfied grin, telling all who would listen what a wall-quaking, earth-shaking night it had been.\nSo an endless string of men went to see the sorceress, and she slept with all of them.

The rumors spread at an incredible speed.\nThe archbishop accused the temple maiden of being a witch, sending an inquisitor to interrogate her.\nBut the inquisitor too fell into the maiden's clutches, sleeping with her like all the other men.

The archbishop dispatched the holy order of knights, and they took the maiden captive.\nBut even the archbishop ended up sleeping with her.\nAnguished at having broken his vow of celibacy, he said to her, "I want to heal and help people. So let's get down and dirty till we don't feel guilty anymore!"

The general, an outstanding military strategist, commanded the great army units as if they were his own limbs, crushing every enemy.\nYet he was a humble man deeply trusted by the king, who granted him the authority to command the entire army without asking for the monarch's permission.

A rebellion broke out, and the general quickly dispatched the army.\nAt last, the rebel forces laid down their weapons and declared defeat, but the general would not accept the surrender, and slaughtered the enemy to the last man.

A neighboring state mobilized its army and breached the kingdom's border.\nIn the blink of an eye, the general dispatched his troops and crushed the enemy, yet again refusing to let them surrender, slaughtering them to the last man.

Each time, the general would return from battle and report expressionlessly, "I have annihilated the enemy." This began to trouble the king.\nOne day, the general was murdered in his sleep by an unknown assassin. There were many opinions about who the culprit might have been, but no one knew for sure.\nIn later generations, historians would say, "He was a faithful servant, taking hatred for his master onto himself."

An anthropologist visited a village where the people prayed to bees. They welcomed the anthropologist by treating him to a performance with dancers in bee masks. But in his heart, the anthropologist was suspicious of their "traditions."

The bee masks and beekeeping tools were brand new. The anthropologist was sure it was all a big hoax. To attract people to the bland, boring village, they had made up the tradition of praying to bees. "Tomorrow, when I leave this village, I will write a report revealing the hoax." Gloating to himself, the anthropologist drifted off to sleep.

When he woke, he was on an altar. The men carrying him had insects' eyes and antennae. A woman descended the steps of the altar. Like everyone else, she had a bee's face, but her body was many times bigger than those of the men who had captured him.

The bees were a rare species, parasites that fed on people's brains. When the infected hosts died, they turned to giant bees. To camouflage themselves and lure prey from the outside, the bee people had started the tradition of praying to bees. The worker bees presented the anthropologist to the queen, who hacked him to bits with a giant sickle. From then on, the only sound was that of the bees slurping up his organs like sweet nectar.

It was a record of secret knowledge from a lost ancient kingdom,
wisdom gained from communicating with the spirits of the dead.
Only the oddballs and outcasts of the kingdom could communicate with the spirits,
for they were closer to them, and able to hear and understand their words.

Based on this communication with the spirits, a compact with the dead was drawn up.\nTo enter into the compact was to rule over another dimension that was beyond the human world, yet influenced everything in it.\nAnd so no end of people sought to join it...

Throughout history, the legendary tome has repeatedly appeared only to vanish again. The hated volume has been burned countless times, but translations into other languages have remain passed down. Never have the attempts to destroy it succeeded completely. Its cover is made of human flesh, the flesh of a human face, complete with eyes.

Whenever the book is used, disaster strikes the world.\nThe book is a portal, letting the user travel between dimensions.\nDrawn by promises of strange visions, people look into the book, only to find the book looking back at them...

The black magician, an evil man with a warped nature, was in search of a magical staff to put a deadly curse on his master.\nA fortuneteller advised him, "Go to the dark forest and break off a branch filled with mana."
The black magician traveled far and wide in search of the dark forest.\nOn one of these journeys, when he had nearly spent up all his traveling funds, he used his black magical powers to steal money.
In the dark forest, the black magician found a branch filled with sinister energy, and wrenched it off the tree.\nJust then, the branch sprouted a long thorn that pierced him through the heart.

The thorn sapped the black magician's magic power and sent it to the branch.\nThe fortuneteller appeared and kicked the lifeless corpse.\n"Well, this will make for a nice magical staff," said the fortuneteller, smiling with satisfaction as he picked up the branch.
That mask is super awesome.\nA few days ago, I saw a guy go into the mansion across the way wearing a mask.\nWhat a cool dude.

A man in a mask has been coming to my house too,
 once Mom and Dad are sound asleep.
He comes all the time.
Awesome, right?

The man in the mask used to only talk to Mom and Dad,
but since I got pimples on my face,
he's been talking to me too.
But he won't let me touch the mask.
I want that mask so bad.

When my hands turned black,
the man made me a little mask to wear.
The man in the mask is so cool, and so nice.
When I grow up, I want to be just like him.

The people told tales of a sea demon that sang a beautiful song. Hearing the tales of the most beautiful song in the world, a middle-aged man set off on an ocean voyage, determined to hear it for himself. \nThe song was indeed beautiful, but it was said that those who listened for too long would end up casting themselves into the sea. The man handed out earplugs to all the deckhands and had himself tied up so that he couldn't toss himself into the sea.

A demon rose from the sea and started to sing. At the first snatches of the melody, the man was struck by the urge to toss himself into the sea.
But since the deckhands had tied him up, just as he'd asked, he couldn't.
Still, the man thought to himself, "To die like this, listening to this beautiful song, would be the greatest joy a man could ever ask for."

Swept away by this powerful impulse, the man tore off the ropes, tossed himself into the sea, and died in rapture, just as he had wished.\nBut the curious deckhands who had pulled out their earplugs just cocked their heads to the side when they heard the song. The man had gone on and on about how beautiful the song was, but to them it didn't seem like anything special.

It was an enchanted song that could sound many times more beautiful depending on the listener's past experiences and memories.\nEveryone heard something different when they listened to the song, and it was the man's own perceptions that made the song so beautiful he was willing to toss his life away.
Loving words. A gaze that lingers. Batting eyelashes. A pulsing heart.
The girl nudges him, and the boy lies down, bending to her will.\nHis heart pounds madly as he anticipates tasting the forbidden fruit.
A smile. A throaty moan. A pale hand caressing a slender neck, then grabbing tightly and throttling to the very brink of death.
Lust, scorpions, bursting bubbles, dreams, slipping down, surging impulses, death.\nThe hand squeezes until the last drop of life is wrung out...
[Excerpt from Preface to Indictment]\nThe man stood before the reliquary in the cathedral and hacked a wad of phlegm and saliva onto the holy burial shroud.\nThen he shouted out a blasphemous curse.

[Judgment]
The man is sentenced to the death penalty.
In addition to committing foul acts in the house of god, he used extremely foul language before the court.
The condemned must be shown no mercy. The execution will be carried out in ten days.

[From the executioner's diary]
The condemned man continued to hurl vile curses after he was dragged to the guillotine, and not only that, he tried to run away.
I immediately picked up a bow gun and shot him in the back.
Did I hesitate? Not for a second.

Stirred by a vague pulsing sensation, I started to open my eyes. \nI was in hell, and the devil stood before me, grinning.\n"I have to hand it to you, you've got a backbone. From now on, you will be my right hand man, commanding hell's army."

Lusting to expand his territory, the ambitious king exterminated the tribe who praised the gods of old.
He seized a large number of slaves, all the gold and silver, and the ax displayed on the altar, and returned in triumph.
At the victory banquet, the king turned his drink-bleary eyes to the ax.
A pair of sinister eyes stared back.

From that night on, the king seemed to become a different person.\nHe was cruel to his retainers, drastically increased taxes, and encouraged the people to betray one another.\nUnable to let this pass, the nursery attendant who had watched over the king in his youth spoke up, but the king split his skull with the ax.

A sorcerer returned from a pilgrimage to the magical western kingdom to find the king had become a tyrant.\nThe sorcerer saw the truth—the king was enthralled by the cursed ax—and told the senior vassals.

In a flash, the sorcerer realized that the senior vassals were also under the spell of the cursed ax.
But it was too late—the king split his skull with the ax, too.
A few days later, at the dinner table, a concubine stabbed the king to death with a table knife.
The corpse was dragged to the public square, where an angry mob tore it to pieces.

There once was a giant, very clever bird that could understand human language.\nThe people of remote villages worshiped the bird like a god. Once a year, they would bring it a sacrifice and plead for its mercy.\nThe giant bird meant no harm to anyone, but still accepted the sacrifices.

One day, an innocent young girl lost her way in the forest where the giant bird made its home.\nMistaking her for a sacrifice, the giant bird swooped down.\nEyes full of tears, the girl pleaded with the bird, "Please don't eat me. As thanks, I will mend your feathers and make you beautiful."

The giant bird allowed the girl to mend its feathers.
The bird and the girl were both lonely, and soon became friends.
The girl moved into in the forest to live with the bird, and half a year went by.
One morning, the girl was out gathering berries when a man from the village wandered by.
"You were supposed to be a sacrifice! How dare you run?" roared the man, and beat the girl to death.

The giant bird swooped down, saw the girl's battered corpse, and fell into a stupor.
Then, the bird went on a rampage, biting off the head of the man who had killed the girl and laying waste to village after village.
Before long, an order of knights rushed to put a stop to the destruction, slaying the giant bird and tossing its corpse onto a bonfire.
The only thing left of the bird were a few feathers floating on the wind.

The sensuous king was a lover of women, constantly taking new concubines into his harem.\nOne day, the king anointed a squire. While young, he was a promising man who was both well-educated and skilled in military arts.

The sensuous king realized he was thinking constantly of the young squire.\nThough the squire was a man, his face was as beautiful as a girl's, sending chills down the king's spine.\nOne night, the drunken king invited the squire to his chambers, and realized his true passion was for men.

The sensuous king became obsessed with squire, thinking of him constantly. One day, seduced by the queen, the squire went to visit her in her chambers. She too fell head over heels for the squire, and the two started an affair.\nThe squire was now the ruler of the kingdom in all but name.

The squire was far from the queen's only lover.
One evening, a jealous lover came to her chambers and murdered both her and the squire.
Ashamed of the queen's folly, the king changed his ways and became a benevolent ruler.
The squire, on the other hand, was remembered as "the most infamous traitor in history."
The flowers that bloomed on the ice plains stayed beautiful forever, because they were frozen.
Their scarlet blossoms bloomed all across the land.\nIn one patch of beautiful flowers lay a young girl's corpse, looking like part of the scenery.
There was once a struggle between the people of the north and invaders from a foreign land over who would rule the ice plains.\nBlood stained the ice, and flowers sprouted from the scarlet splotches.

The plains and the flowers were well-known by young women as a place for committing suicide. Once the first girl took her life there, many others followed. They all wanted the same thing:\nto be beautiful forever, like the flowers that blossomed on the ice plains...

The magical book could bring out the melody in anyone's heart without the long, hard years of musician's training. The man who owned it would let people he met on his travels try it out. The melodies were sometimes happy and bright, and sometimes sad. They were plain, ordinary melodies that told the truth about whatever these common people were feeling.

One evening, the man passed around the book at a tavern, listening to the different melodies of all the customers. Then, just for fun, he passed the book to a maid who was tidying up the inn. But the melody that emerged when she touched the book immediately caught his attention. It was a ghastly, bloodcurdling melody, very different from what he would expect of a plain human of normal upbringing.

The man was sure: this woman was responsible for killing the prostitutes that people had been finding dead around town. He tipped off the authorities, and the maid was arrested. She fiercely denied any wrongdoing, but after a thorough investigation by the guards, she was found guilty and sentenced to death.

The woman was not the true culprit. The imaginary world she had built in her mind to make it through her days of drudgery cleaning up the inn had expanded until she couldn't tell reality from fantasy, and she became convinced she was the killer...

[Executioner's statement, part 3]
God is enraged at the vile, blasphemous acts you sinners have committed.
Therefore, I, the Executioner, will bring down a rain of fire on the streets of the Golden City.
That will make for three towns I have reduced to ashes. Sons of men, fear God!

[Notebook of Dukas, the clever detective]
I have come up with a personality profile of the Executioner.
Not only is he stupid, he has bad people skills, easily getting emotional and picking fights.
No doubt, he is an ugly, pitiful man who has no self-confidence.

[Inspector Simon, immediately after the suspect's arrest]
The enraged suspect tried to attack Dukas, and we subdued him.
Who would have thought the office coffee boy would be involved in this awful crime?
Well, at least this way we don't have to evacuate everyone from the town.
What's that? Dukas already ordered them all to evacuate?

[Chief Lightning of the Chateuse Police Force]
The coffee boy you bunglers arrested was just the man's underling!
He cleaned out the safe of the Golden City and ran away!
What's that, Simon? You still don't get it?
That man who claimed to be a detective was the Executioner. He really took you for a ride!
After twilight, things in the village get interesting.\nOnce night falls, we'll paint the town red.
For our first night together, tie your sash in front.\nThat way it'll be easier to take off.
For tonight, I'll be your bride.\nHope you like me.
You don't have to pay me anything.\nIf you're man enough to satisfy my needs.

An axe was displayed on the wall of the cathedral.\nAfter the day's lessons, the ascetic knights grabbed hold of the new recruits and told them sternly,\n"There's a story behind that axe. There was once a knight in training who couldn't take the heat, and he was possessed by a demon. He went on a killing spree with that axe, and finally chopped his own head off."

The new recruits turned pale, trembling with fear, and the knights doubled over laughing.\n"No need to get all worked up. It's just a story! But the part about the training being tough, that's not made up. So brace yourselves."\nAt this, the new recruits heaved sighs of relief, but thinking of the trying days of training to come, gloomy looks came over their faces.

The next morning, a trainee was found dead. He had been beheaded in his sleep, but the head was nowhere to be found.\nSeeing the new recruits trembling, one of the knights spoke up.\n"We told you guys it was just a story, but actually, it's true. So be careful not to get possessed."

Later, the new recruits learned that the murdered knight had been disliked because he had liked to picked fights, but the other knights, well-bred men of peaceful temperament, had not fought back.
Had his one-time comrades finally gotten fed up and banded together to commit the murder? It seemed like a strong possibility, but they couldn't prove it.
That night, there was a knock at the door. Eyes still bleary with sleep, the new recruits opened the door to find a headless knight standing there,
holding an axe in one hand. In the other, he held his severed head...

Spying a blue bird flying in the sky, the queen declared, "I want that bird so badly."\nShe immediately ordered the bird captured.\nSeveral minutes later, a royal retainer returned triumphantly with the blue bird.

The blue bird was put into a cage.
The queen's servant girl cared for the bird.
The servant girl pitied the caged bird, treating it with loving care.
But the bird hated the servant girl from the bottom of its tiny heart,
because of her lowly social standing.

The blue bird was more beautiful and noble than any other, all the more so now that it had gained the queen's favor.
(Take your servant's eyes off me, you lowly creature.)
(Only the royals may stroke my feathers, wench.)
The bird's twittering sounded like sweet song to people's ears, but actually it was uttering foul curses.

Before long, the servant girl fell ill and died, and the queen said, "This bird was always twittering to the servant girl. Put it in the coffin with her."
Inside the coffin, the blue bird squawked with all its might, but what came out still sounded like sweet song.
"Somewhere in this world, is there a bird who sings only for me?" wondered the queen.
Never again did she give another thought to the blue bird.
Since boyhood, people had been saying the singer was gifted with a marvelous voice. Based on the success he gained, he decided that when he grew up, he would be a singer.

But the young man made no success in his chosen trade.
Those who heard him singing would say, "Your art is technically perfect. But you're not singing *about* anything.
There's no heart behind your voice."
The young man knew it was true.
No matter how he practiced, he couldn't muster up any passion.
The young man began dabbling in magic.

He got his hands on a grimoire, and following its instructions, he sang his heart out, a fervent song that burned like flame, stirring passion in all those who heard it.\nThe song moved the people to tears. The man gained the success he had always sought.

But when he sang this song, the passion burned his heart to a charred husk.\nHaving burned up his heart, he turned to a barren husk, unable to feel anything at all. And that is how he remains today...
Shlepp, shlepp.\nI heard a sound like two slimy bodies rubbing together.
Huh? That's funny. I'm awake, but I can't move.\nThrough blurry eyes, I saw a girl with the same face as me, seeming to be having an awful lot of fun toying with my body...
Oh, I'm just dreaming. But I never thought I'd have such amazing abilities in a dream. Now that I can do anything, I want to see into the abyss at the end of the world.

At last, the girl woke from a light slumber, her memories grainy at best. In fact, she couldn't remember anything at all.\n"Well, at least I got a good start!"\nThe girl set off with a spring on her step, and a black feather fluttered down from her shoulder and landed on the ground.

Hahaha, it's a shocking story, isn't it?\nThis is the most powerful sword in the world, born out of long years of anthropological research.\nArmed with this sword, I stand at the very pinnacle of humankind!

I brandish this sword, and people instinctively throw themselves at my feet, begging to do my will!
Pretty awesome, don'cha think?
W-wait a minute, one more step and I'll pull out the sword!
What's that, go ahead and pull it out, unless I'm just blowing smoke?

Okay, look, I can't pull it out. If I did, you'd end up a sniveling mess of sliced-up pieces wiggling on the floor, and we wouldn't want that.\nWhat's that? You've never heard such a load of crap in your life?\nWell, okay! But remember, you asked for it!

I subjugated all of humanity with the Anthropology Sword, and reigned over a new world order.
But challengers came, brandishing the Long Anthropology Sword, the Short Anthropology Sword, and the Anthropology Bamboo Spear, and declared my downfall.
As history teaches, those with power are brought down by those with greater power.
I sigh endlessly at my stupidity... did I learn anything at all from my anthropological studies?

This book was inspired by bees.
Worker bees gather nectar.
The queen eats the nectar and gives birth to the babies.
This book also uses worker bees to gather information.

This book's queen bee gathers information.
She writes the information down in the book, organizing it like a beehive.
This is the book's purpose.
The ancient magicians made the bees do all the work for them.

Bees' honey is very sweet.
The book's honey is sweet, too.
To those who thirst for knowledge, it is the sweetest nectar.
Knowledge of every type increases on its own.
The book's owner obtains wisdom, but does not remain free. You are a worker bee.\nYou put all the knowledge inside your head into the book.\nThe book is based on honeybees and parasitic wasps.
The cosmos was preparing to welcome another cruel being into its midst.
It appeared in the dreams of highly sensitive infants, and the infants who glimpsed it went mad before reason could take root inside their minds.
What sort of catastrophe, what sort of confusion would be born into the world this time? When would the destruction and disorder end?
All those who hated the world, all those wretched ones, those lacking the ability to do things for themselves, sensed its arrival far in advance, longing for the day of its birth...
―　Celtic　－\nThe three beings that do not breathe are paid for only by the beings that breathe. These three are referred together as the Irish Three.
(Steiner/1975#212)\nThe fat pig is a heavenly creature. While obese, it is a cosmic being.
(Steiner/1978#278)\nThe pig of so full of lust for life that the gods are said to have enjoyed transforming into pigs.
(James/1998・100)\nFat, juicy pigs were cooked whole and placed in the burial chambers along with the emaciated corpses.
He deliberately challenged enemies who were bigger.
The bigger, the better.
Hearing of a giant ravaging a distant kingdom, he set off to challenge the fearsome foe.\nThe giant was the biggest enemy he had ever challenged.

The giant stomped around smashing buildings, sending bits of brick raining down on him.\nFinally, the giant picked him up between his finger and thumb and ate him.\nThe moment the giant bit into him, the unconscious sexual urge that had made him constantly challenge these giant enemies, was finally fulfilled.

Two aristocratic families vied for power, constantly fighting like cats and dogs.\nThe son and heir of one of the families snuck into a masquerade, and fell in love with a masked reveler. As it turned out, she was a member of the other family.

The boy and girl talked things over, and decided to tell their parents they wanted to get married.\nWhile putting on a show of reluctance, both sides agreed to the wedding.\nThe truth was they were weary of the constant, futile fighting.

Overjoyed to hear the families had agreed to a truce, the king who ruled over both families offered to serve as the go-between at the wedding.\nHearing this, the head of the merchants' guild that had supplied arms and mercenaries to the families grumbled, "Their cursed truce will put us out of business. We have to do something."

When the soldiers of the two families lined up to greet the king, a disguised assassin crept in among them and beheaded the king with the sickle that was to be his welcome gift.\nThe princes besieged the families' estates, believing them responsible for the crime, and a bloody war began.\nIt is said that the war enriched the merchants beyond their wildest dreams.

In the forest there lived a strong and handsome buck.
The buck was so beautiful that all who laid eyes on it would gasp.
Wherever the buck went, a wind blew, stirring the grasses as it leisurely strolled.
The buck is the guardian deity of the forest, people would whisper.

I was an orphan, abandoned in the forest as a baby.
I slept in a hollow of a giant tree, nourishing myself on wild berries and flowers' nectar.
The buck never seemed to notice me.
But one bitterly cold winter night, I felt a gentle breeze blowing.
The buck is watching over me, I thought.

Hunters were after the buck.\nI eavesdropped on them, and learned the ruler of the kingdom wanted the buck's handsome head as a trophy.\nOne night, the forest was set ablaze, but suddenly the direction of the wind changed—maybe the buck was behind it—and the fierce flames burned the hunters to ashes.

When the flames went out, the buck looked exhausted.
I crept up to the sleeping buck and cut its head off.
I went to the capital and claimed a handsome bounty for the buck's head.
The buck's beauty and grace made me a wealthy man.
The buck was watching over me after all. I am sure the buck would be happy with the way things turned out.

In my line of work, I have met all kinds of people: well-known actors, schemers that move nations, corporate fat cats. All of them aimed for the peak in their fields, their ambitions and desires growing day by day.
What was it that kept them going? It's a question that eventually the little people like me start wondering about. The answer is plain and simple.
None of them had reached their goals, and this is what gave them the drive to keep going.\nIt's the same with me. I'm only halfway up the mountain.

It's a long story. Long, and incredibly boring. There's nothing worse than a shallow person like him. He was the leader of some organized crime organization, I think. So anyway, tonight, a group of young men will kill him, minor players in someone else's plot. Like all of us are, when it comes down to it.
[Dear Santa]\nThe present you gave me last year didn't last very long. This year, I want a present I can play with much longer.
I want a present I can keep playing with, even when I put it in a bag, toss it down the chimney, and burn it.
Ooh, I've got an idea.\nThis year, I want you for x-mas, Santa!\nWe're gonna have sooo much fun!
Sounds like a plan / Sounds like a plan\nPlease circle one of the above.
[To Parrah and Noya]\nSomeone is going around telling kids you're the ones who really bring the presents.
We need to seal the source of the enemy's power as soon as possible. On my justice, I swear to protect your secret.
That's not our only problem. No one's writing letters. How are we supposed to know what they want?
I was finally able to negotiate with Cinderella. This year's x-mas will be a peaceful one...perhaps.

"You really look like a girl, don't you?"
My father-in-law, reeking of alcohol, drew near my face, all while patting me on the butt.
He was a total tyrant. Unable to resist, I gave myself up to his violations of my body.
After the deed was done, he spoke.
"Be wary of the dark when entering the forest. No one who has heard the sound of wings flapping has returned. How about it? Feel a little wiser now?"

Some days later, I went into the forest with my father-in-law to fell some trees.
Around noon, he sat on a stump and began eating his lunch.
Excusing myself to take care of some business, I took my leave and began running with all my might deeper into the forest.
I had driven all trivial details from my mind. I couldn't stand to be with such a vulgar man any longer.

As I loitered around, it gradually began to grow dark.
My father-in-law's words of caution—"Be wary of the dark when entering the forest"—came to mind, causing a shiver to go down my spine.
"Hey! I'm not gonna let you get away!"
Hearing an angry voice calling out to me, I quickly turned around. With a look of a demon about him, my father-in-law had come chasing after me.
Just then, the sound of flapping wings drew near...

Huh? What happened after that you ask?
I gave up my feeble body and mind to the overwhelming darkness.
My father-in-law? Hmph, who knows.
All living things are nothing more than tiny specs of mold growing on the surface of the planet, after all.
Since I have become one with mother darkness, I don't want to trouble my mind with such trivial matters. I have, for the first time in my life, found peace.
An eye for an eye.\nA tooth for a tooth.\nCrimes must be met with punishment.

The one who perpetrates the crime
is the one who must be punished.
You say you're innocent?
Have you ever heard of collective responsibility?

If you find a bunch of ants eating up a house,
it's logical to destroy their nest, wouldn't you say?
Considering that the innocent eggs and larva
will cause trouble once they become adults,
it's more efficient to destroy them in their entirety.

This world...
It's full of irrationality, inequality,
and misfortune.
So, someone, somewhere has purported a crime.
Because of that, you're going to be punished.

Father, please hear out my confession.
But, before that… There's no fear that what I say here will leak to the outside, is there?
Oh, good. I'll take reassurance that my secret won't get out, then.
Actually… Actually, I killed my brother with my very own hands!

Why did I kill him, you ask?\nWell, that's because his fiancee was my private tutor. I had loved her for far longer than him.\nI had him take sleeping pills. I then closed him up in his room, and set fire to some charcoal set on a plate. I made my brother's murder look like a suicide.

After my brother died, that woman spent her days in tears.
I stayed by her side, consoling her with all my might, making her heart mine.
We were finally married, but were completely unable to have a child, leaving our relationship to grow more and more sour by the day…
Perhaps it was my brother's curse…

As I was preparing the Mass, a nun spoke.
She said the man who had come to repent yesterday had been shot dead.
And then I remembered. Yesterday, I could feel someone's presence outside the window of the confessional booth.
The wife had eavesdropped on the husband, and had resolved to kill him, leading her to commit this crime…!
I'm the only one who knows this secret, so I'll be the next one killed. I need to escape quickly…!
H-hey, y-you're…! W-wait! Hear me ou–
The two snipers, set up in the ruins of two buildings facing each other, continued with their confrontation.

There were innumerable dead bodies rolling around in the space between them. They were the remains of those who tried to force their way to the snipers' position, only to find themselves between their sights.

For a split second, the enemy sniper was reflected in the sights of the other gunner. His carelessness was due to a scuffle with an assassin who had approached from behind.\nWithout a moment's hesitation, he pulled the trigger. The assassin, just about to stab the other sniper, fell to the bullet.

The boorish obstacle was taken care of. Furthermore, the enemy sniper had disappeared from the gunman's sights again.\nNow they could continue. A true match between the two, to see who could kill who, without any outside hindrance.

In that large country, whose rulers descended from a horse-riding tribe that had controlled the entire continent, there was a female general known by the nickname "Black Rose."\nBlessed with strength and bravery while boasting of ingenuity and beauty, she was a famous commander well known for both her appearance and her substance.\nAnyone who would face the wrath of her warhammer had no chance of escape, making her feared among the soldiers on the battlefield.

Many young nobles would gather around the Black Rose, but they held absolutely no sway on her.\nOne day, a single knight came to serve under her. Not a particularly handsome man, his merits were his quietness and his honesty.\nAs the Black Rose developed feelings for this man, she set her sights on him.

On that night, an assassin raided the Black Rose's bedchamber. The knight, who was on the night's watch, risked his life to protect her.
Once the assassin had flown, the Black Rose questioned the knight. "Sir. Do you love your Lady?"
Looking her straight in the eye, he gave her a hardy nod.
Thus, servant and master became lovers.

Afterwards, the Black Rose's country found itself cornered by an enemy nation.
The Black Rose asked her knight, "Are you hiding something from your lady?" To which he replied, "Nothing."
"I see" she said nodding, as she swung her hammer, smashing in her lover's face and killing him.
"I knew you were in contact with the enemy. Had you confessed everything and swore your love for me, I would have searched for another solution…"
Her faint mutterings could no longer reach her lover's ears.

In a certain back country, there was a village where people lived in relative abundance and peace.\nOne day, a beast with an uncontrollably wild temperament appeared out of nowhere, making its dwelling near the village.

Every time the beast would go wild, it would damage the beautiful scenery, causing the villagers to be troubled.\nA bard, hearing of their troubles, appeared in the village, saying "Leave it to me. I'll tame the beast."

The villagers sent him on his way. The bard, heading towards the beast's location, began blowing on his fife.\nThe beast, who until that point had been full of rage on the brink of boiling over, grew ever calmer at the sound of the fife.

The bard, taking the beast along with him, returned to the village.
Seeing the smiling faces of the villagers who had come out to greet him, he began to laugh.
"The beast will do as I say. In other words, whether you all live or die is up to me…"
Thus, the bard took control of the village, and allowed himself to indulge in selfish debauchery.

With "life is a journey" as his motto, the adventurer had spent most of his life traveling, from the time he was born until past the age of 20.\nHis dream was to visit the "Golden City" said to exist somewhere in this world.

In the depths of a certain woodland, there lived a great sage who knew everything there was to know.\nThe adventurer made his way through the vast woodland, where he met the great sage. He asked of him the location of this "Golden City."

The great sage warned him, "I will not speak ill, but give up your quest to visit the "Golden City."\nYet, the adventurer replied "I have no plans of giving up."\nLetting out a sigh, the great sage handed him a compass, saying "Follow this. But know you were warned."

Following the compass, the adventurer finally arrived at the "Golden City."
Every person there spent gold as though it were water. They partook in the best food and drink, had intercourse no matter the location, and thoroughly indulged in the glorious paradise.
Entering that circle, the adventurer became a complete fool.
Yes… The "Golden City" was a prison that never let its prey escape. There, the adventurer became a prisoner.

The old lady, lying sick on the floor, spoke to the young, popular playwright, who had been brought there through an intermediary. She told him of her past memories, making sure that he listen.\nThe playwright was a self-styled up-and-coming author who was determined to shake up his country's theater scene.

The old lady had once had a lover. But their marriage was opposed by their two families, who had feuded for many years. There, she decided to make use of a plan devised by a monk acquaintance.\nShe had planned to take a certain drug that would allow her to feign death. By doing so, those around her would think her dead, and she and her lover would run off together.

However, she had not explained the plan well to her lover. Seeing her fainted, he thought her truly dead, and took his own life in his grief.\nAwakening, she learned of her lover's death, and in her sadness took her life as well.

Then, several decades after that tragedy occurred, in a small house in a nearby village, a woman named Juliet learned from a doctor that she would soon die from an illness. Saying that until now she had lived under a different name, the woman told the story of her tragic love to the playwright…

That man, who was employed under the kingdom's intelligence bureau, set off towards a neighboring country on official business.\nHiding his true identity, the man set about his service, becoming a commanding officer of that country's military, passing off military secrets to his home country.

That neighboring country's counterintelligence organization caught wind of their secrets leaking, eventually finding their way to the source of the leak.\nThe man underwent harsh questioning, but unshaken he feigned total ignorance.

When the spy returned to his residence, he found a single merchant waiting for him in the parlor. It was a communications operative in the employ of his own country.\n"I was nearly found out during that questioning session, but I managed to fool them," he laughed as he gave his report.

The next morning, the commanding officer was found dead by hanging.
His will read thus: "That my faith was in question was a failure of my own virtue. I choose death."
In actuality, the communications operative had killed him, covering it up to look like a suicide.
More eyes would be on him after the questioning, and the man himself had felt no sense of danger. There was no other way to deal with the situation.
It was a sudden, gloomy darkness that fell then. Even knowing it to be a dream, having lost my way, I was powerfully attracted to that place…
The old woman with blue hair leaned weakly on the tree, looking up at the moon. She looked as though the very flame of her life would be snuffed out then and there.
In the end, the old woman muttered "In this land, there are so many things left unknown… I wish I would have never known," as she slowly closed her eyelids.
Those words were surely not for me. Yet, their reverberations were somehow familiar, filling my chest with a pleasant feeling.

A revolutionary and an officer planned the assassination of a certain tyrant, and had tragically failed.
During their escape, they had asked to be protected in the house of a wealthy man who had been kind to them for some time.
Tired to the bone, the revolutionary and the officer skipped dinner and fell asleep.
Then, that night, hearing a sound like something being crushed, the two awoke.

They heard arguing voices: "Let's smash its hands and feet so it can't move about." "No, it'd be faster to just smash its head in."\nThe revolutionary, exclaiming angrily that they'd been sold out, leapt out of the room without heading the officer's calls for restraint. He killed the wealthy man and his entire family.\nThe officer cried, "What have we done!" as his face grew pale. In the garden, a pot was boiling over. They realized that the family was preparing a cow to treat the two to dinner.

…The next morning, the revolutionary decided to escape alone.\nProceeding as though stepping on thin ice, the man escaped to the safety zone and met up with his subordinates.\nThey asked, "What happened to the officer you were with?" To which he let out a bitter laugh, telling them that the officer had abandoned him.

Before long, the revolutionary overthrew the tyrant to become supreme ruler. But, unable to control his subordinates, he found himself surrounded by a mutinous army.
The revolutionary let out a sigh.
"Back then, the officer offered me his consolations, suggesting we just forget the whole disastrous misunderstanding.
I doubted him, thinking he'd make the deed public. So I smashed in his face with the hammer that had been lying there.
If he were still here, I wouldn't be caught up in this whole insurrection…"

"Lately, my shooting skills aren't improving."
"When the time comes, I'm worried if I'll be able to hit the enemy's vitals."
Say goodbye to those kinds of troubles!
Today, I have something for all of those who love marksmanship!
Let me introduce this one-of-a-kind commodity, just for you!

Take a look at this, the "Lovely Silvered Locks"!!
So sleek and beautiful!
Look, look! Such a cool gun, isn't it?!
A design graced with delicate craftsmanship, it's light enough for even a child to hold!
Getting one for yourself is oh-so easy!

And, within this gun… That's right!
Celebrated as the god of marksmanship, that certain someone's hair is embedded in this gun!
Amazing, yes?! Absolutely amazing, isn't it?!
If you use this gun, with the god of marksmanship's hair resting inside it, 
you'll soon become a legendary sharpshooter yourself! That's for sure!

We've prepared a limited run of only 20 "Lovely Silvered Locks" guns!
That's because the god of marksmanship
had only 20 hairs left on his head when he died. It's super rare!
We'll be accepting applications after this commercial ends!
First come, first served! We're waiting for your calls!

The tones produced by that fife are a thing of beauty. Play it, and those that hear its tune begin singing and dancing, buildings light up with vivid colors, flowers bloom, and all goes into disarray. Its owner must be the happiest in all the world.
Huh? There's no way a fife could exist like that? ...Give it a try. Just once. You'll see the world change before you.

If something unpleasant happens, you have but to let go of the fife. The beautiful tones and beautiful spectacles produced by that fife are after all, quite addicting to say the least. If you can stop playing it, in the end...

Those singing and dancing to its tune will yelp in agony, buildings will fall into decrepitude and collapse. And flowers will wilt and die... Back to their original state. Ah, I forgot to tell you one important thing. Playing that fife will cause the surrounding scenery to seem warped... That is the extent of its power.
"Dear Santa"\nI'm sorry. When someone suddenly tells me to pick out a present, I'm not sure how to. So, I don't worry about me. I don't need a present.
That, or whatever my staff wants, I'll have that since I'm indebted to it. Just ask it.
Or, I'd like your clothes, Santa.
Oh, but everyone's going to have to wear swimsuits again next year. Maybe I can give them warm clothes so they don't catch a cold. Sorry, I guess I'm no good at deciding after all.

After an invasion from a remote region's barbarian tribe, that country's knights were defeated, and its capital fell.\nA hero from some back country grew dissatisfied with the tribe's control, and so he rousted a volunteer army.\nFollowing victory after victory, he was able to drive them out.

The king lauded praise upon the patriotic hero, raising him to the position of commander-in-chief.\nHowever, the hero was totally disinterested in political power, and was dissatisfied with the treatment, causing him to get into a heated debate with the king. In the end, he gave up his position.\nHe returned to the countryside, where he kept to himself.

Marrying his daughter to the king, the prime minister gained real political control of the country, beginning his tyrannical rule.\nFearing the unifying power of the hero, the prime minister levied suspicions of rebellion in order to capture him.\nThe hero, dissatisfied with the suspicions levied against him took soldier after soldier in heated battle.

Afterwards, at the king's request, the hero drove the prime minister and his entire faction from the country.\nHanging his head low in front of the hero, he told him "I am not fit for ruling this country. I want you to become king in my stead."\nThe hero, who detested any kind of restraints, was dissatisfied with the request and refused him outright. Disappearing without a word, the hero was never to be seen in that country again.

"Ta-dah!!"

"The results of the 2023 character fortune telling
cafe sales are out!"

"Out now!"

"Congratulations!"

"Looks like Snow performed excellently, as expected!"

"All the merchandise sold
exceptionally well!"

"Congratulations! And thank you!"

"However..."

"It seems you were negligent!"

"In the file category and stand category you were..."

"2nd place! Even we were surprised!"

"1st place went to Gretel!"

"So you need to improve from here on out."

"From 2023, you'll have to drum up some
new appeal to compete."

"Well then, let's make a big leap this year!"

"Aladdin..."

"Allow me to speak frankly..."

"I'm not sure how to deal with you."

"Honestly speaking, there's no demand for male characters.
Or at least, that's what I thought..."

"Your Grimoire sales aren't bad..."

"I'm at a total loss..."

"For how much merchandise to buy!"

"If stock overflows, the storehouse will be put under pressure."

"Get out there and show them your charm!"

"To put things bluntly, it's your fate to determine
how we deal with the gender ratio
from here on out!"

"If any more troublesome girl characters show up,
our worries will never end..."

"So, please do your best!"

"Still, all of our characters...

Regardless of their gender,
are all a bunch of weirdos..."

"It's about time we were put in a position
to be treated nicely!"

"Hey Mr. Producer!"

"Can you hear me?"

"Ta-dah!!"

"The results of the 2023 character fortune telling
cafe sales are out!"

"Out now!"

"Congratulations!"

"Kaguya, you're actually...

First at the wrong end for clear files!"

"And second from the bottom for acrylic stands!"

"Oh well..."

"It's no time to be pessimistic."

"It was a very tight margin."

"Just sell a hundred or so more and you'll enter the standing!"

"Next year, focus on something other than
just showing skin, and aim for the top!"

"But if you can't sell five times as much as this time,
there's no way you're entering the top ranks."

"..."
"..."

"It'll be fine!"

"You can pull if off...right, Kaguya?"

She's a painter.
She takes in orphans, and
uses them as material
to paint pictures.

Her canvas is their skin.
The paint is their blood.
Their hair, the brush.
She wrings the fat from their organs and uses them to light her studio.
Every one of her paintings fetches quite a high price.
But she had no good use for the bones.\nSince a painter's fingers are dextrous,\nshe decided to use the bones to make violins.

The finished violins
sing with the voices of the children they were made from.
Hey, grandpa, how do you like this violin made from my bones?
If you like, buy a painting made from me, too.
It must be a beautiful picture, I think.
Entering that religious organization's hideout, I bore witness to the remains of a heroic battle between zealous soldiers.\nNot a single one still had breath in their bodies.
That year, the leader of the organization died without leaving a successor, causing a war of succession to break out.

The believers lamented as no end to the scandalous disputes could be seen.\nThey wanted the conflict to end.\nNot a moment after expressing their grief, the believers found a cache of weapons stored away just in case the country ever wanted to oppress the religious organization.
All opposition faded away.\nThe founder of their sect had responded to the believers' lamentations.

The king was wise, and excelled at military strategy and politics.\nBecause of his sternness, he came to be known as "Thunderous Fury."\nHe would constantly be at odds with his retainers, as hints of a thunderous fury would peak through his features.

Once, one of his generals retreated in the face of the opposing army, invoking Thunderous Fury's wrath.\nThe resentment the general felt resonated among the entire army, leading the general to take a segment of troops to invade the Thunderous Fury's bedchamber.

Thunderous Fury, knowing he had no chance of escape, committed suicide.\nThus, the general took control of the kingdom's capital, and gained the power to control the realm…\nBut soon after that, Thunderous Fury's messenger, who was delayed by the pursuit of the enemy country, finally arrived at the general's location.

"You are the hand of the king. I would rouse you, if you would but forgive my severity. I am in need of your assistance in the coming days…"\nReading the Thunderous Fury's letter, the general was grief-stricken.\nHe decided to give himself up entirely to the crown prince's punitive force, extinguishing his life blood with the Thunderous Fury's beloved sickle.

\nThis little girl is my partner? And she's spewing some bullshit about hearing the voice of god, and being this nation's savior. I've been caught by a megalomaniacal girl here. Shit out of luck. I told her to stay out of my way, but she just ignores me with a little smirk on her face.\n

It's been five years since I was picked up by the little girl. Time flies. Her swordsmanship was pretty haphazard in the beginning, but it's gotten a lot better. And what's more, before you know it she's leading this big group of knights, winning battle after battle in this war. I know she's busy being the messenger of god, but she could at least be careful not to get injured. She's getting older, after all.

The enemy has caught me and the little girl.
I yelled at her to run, but she didn't even try to listen. All she can hear is the voice of god. But this time, it looks like even god is silent.
If my body could move, I would run to her side right this very instant.
Because of some nonsense trial, her punishment is to be burned at the stake.
I… I was forced to watch her body burn from the front row…
She believed in god till her last moments, but god did not respond.

"The Undrawable Sword"
In a plaza, where a young girl who was the self-styled savior of the nation had been executed, a single sword stood. A few days after her death, her ashes suddenly rose up to pierce the sword into the ground.
No one knew the perpetrator, and rumors that the sword moved of its own accord eventually reached the authorities.
No matter how strong the man that tried, the sword could not be drawn from that place.
For eternity, since that girl's death, the sword has remained.
A skilled assassin snuck into the enemy force's camp, stealing an amulet from a mighty general's bosom.\nChanging into the enemy force's gear, he ran to their capital city.

At the gate of the enemy's castle, a gatekeeper challenged the assassin, who responded "I am a subordinate of the lord general. A few days ago he fell to an assassin's dagger. I have come to bring this information, and a memento of the general's to our king!"

The assassin was granted an audience with the king. Drawing close to the king with the pretense of showing him the general's memento, he successively assassinated the king as well.\nAs the palace fell into chaos, the assassin slipped out of the castle, yelling "I did it!" with a big smile on his face.

As he drove his horse on, the assassin heard a strange groaning at his ear.\nHis fingers, searching frantically through his pockets, came into contact with the general's memento.\nIn the next instant, his horse reared, and the assassin fell off, breaking his neck. That was the end of his life.
I don't know. I told you I don't know…this feeling.\nHey. What should I do? My staff…
A red dream, smeared in the blood of a wolf. I don't really want to do this, but I don't have much of a choice. I can't control my impulse to destroy.
Destroying complete strangers one after the next… Even if I tear an old friend limb from limb, I won't stop. I can't stop. Before I knew it, the staff covered in blood had split cleanly in two.
Now you're not here to order me this way and that.\nWhen I realized this, a trickle of tears ran down my face…

In a certain country, a certain game was popular among the nobles.
The game entailed placing an apple on one's wife's head, and shooting it with an arrow.
Inevitably, accidents did happen.
Any man who tried to pull an arrow from their wife's head would be severed from the group.

The nobles who had killed their own wives fell into a deep depression. They even went so far as to demand being let into prison.\nHowever, the justices deemed them innocent, as there was no intention to kill.\nSooner or later, the heartbroken nobles would find new wives, and would soothe their sadness by burying their faces in the bosoms of the young maidens.

As the rate of death for wives rose, the country's government moved to ban that game.\nOne noble who had amused himself with that game closed himself up in his room in an exaggerated display of grief. There he shouted his true intentions.\n"Damn! That was the only legal way to kill a wife!"

The lecherous nobles wanted young women. Their country, however, prohibited divorce, and infidelity was punishable by death.\nYet, if a wife's death came about during the course of a game, no one could complain.\nThis was the best way to take care of an old, annoying wife.

The young lady had been alone for a long time. Since soon after her birth, she had been attached to that staff. On some lonesome night she sat crying, and the staff played a soothing lullaby for her. Yet, the young lady had no intention of forgiving her enemies.\nOne day, the young lady fell in love with a young man. After a few meetings, the youth said to her:\n"I want you to be with me from now on."

But, in the very next moment a stream of blood sprung from the nape of the youth's neck. It was the staff's power at work.\n"You should burn that dangerous staff before it hurts more people."\nThe girl hesitated, but listening to his advice, she set fire to the staff. The staff let out a sound like a shriek, as it burned into a black char, and finally into ash…

The youth invited the young lady inside his own house, treating her to a feast.\nThe girl, having enjoyed the feast, suddenly found herself sleepy.\nWhen she awoke, she couldn't move. She had been tied to a chair. The chair sat in front of the table which she had just eaten from. Upon closer inspection, the table had been made from human skin stitched together.

Just then, the youth entered.
"Please, stay with me forever. Just like…the others here."
The youth drew out his cutlery. Yet, before his blade could touch the young lady, the staff had pierced the boy. When the boy had died, the staff became ashes in front of the young lady.
Just before that, the young lady heard that soothing lullaby again…
A man died at a cheap hotel in some border town.\nNo one knows about what happened to the man on the verge of death. No one knows what his facial expression was upon death.
The man, in the middle of a trip, dedicated his life to pursuing music he'd only heard rumors of.\nHe found the answer in his last moments.
That music was a complete fabrication. It was music that didn't exist.\nA performance that didn't exist. An audience that didn't exist.
The man had spent his life pursuing something that didn't exist.\nAnd, he learned of this just on the verge of death, only to die moments later.\nIn some remote border town no one had ever heard of…

So why↑ are their↓
eyes so↓ far apart?!↑

♪Bears are↑ so strange↓
Bears are↑ so strange↓
