BANG BANG BANG BA-BA-BA-BANG!!
HaHA! This is better than sex! Might just shoot off my other gun, if I'm not careful!

[Scholar Gedino's Thesis]\nAn observational study. Subjects were given a gun with unlimited ammunition and observed to determine on which day they would go completely f#$&*ng postal. Onset of crazed rampage varied, but no subject went more than two weeks on average before flipping out and popping multiple caps in one or more asses. (See figure 3a.)\nThis scholar theorizes that the gun merely represents opportunity, and that the desire to just go buck wild is universal to humanity.

Once there was a dragon who quite nearly brought about the destruction of the world. Called the Ravening Wyrm by humankind, it would devour living things of all kinds, and before its rampage was halted, had succeeded in consuming 80% of all life on the earth.

As the world was already perilously contaminated by pollution, the appearance of this dread wyrm which consumed out of sheer gluttony, far beyond its survival needs, could not help but speed the approach of the end.

In the end the remnants of humanity banded together in a desperate last battle. The fighting raged for three whole days and nights before at last the beast was defeated. Only eight people remained, to mark their victory.

The author paused for a moment, before touching pen to the page once more and continuing, "And, as the dread wyrm fell in defeat, its body returned to the book from whence it came."\n\nIn the devastation that followed in the wake of the battle, humankind was determined to preserve life. They wove a great working of magic to preserve as much genetic information as they could. To see the world come so near its destruction was one last blow of despair to a sorrowful people.
The Hersonian Museum exhibits a wide variety of souls, ancient and modern. They range from humans, demi-humans, monsters, and insects.
During the middle of the night, the souls fly about as they please, carrying on their with meaningless cries. At night, the museum becomes pandemonium.

One day, a god's soul was displayed at the museum. Witnessing the deplorable pandemonium that came as night fell, he cautioned each and every one of the rampaging souls in an attempt to restore order. However, none of them paid any heed.

Finally the god snapped and caused a great flood that resulted in every soul in the museum to be washed down the drain. But unbeknownst to the god, the doors were locked from the outside preventing any escape. And so they too were caught up in the current and down the drain they went.

Whoever hits the one holding that club would be stricken back twofold. And if they were to be killed, then death would be brought onto their murderer. Therefore, the man deceivingly convinced someone nearby to hold it for him.

The man's enemies and the one who held the club fell to their deaths. The man—and sole survivor—soon became famous throughout the lands as the brave warrior who vanquished numerous beasts and soldiers.

Having no more need to deliberately make enemies and fight, he relished in his newfound fame and fortune. No one had a clue that it wasn't actually him who was risking their life in battle. He spent the rest of his life indulging in pleasures until he finally died a peaceful and tranquil death.

The man's eyes opened once more. Standing before him...was the first person he had hold the club. That very next moment, the man was struck hard with club. Pained from the contact, he swung his arm out and punched his opponent dead. Sprawled out in agony, the man died again. ...But when he opened his eyes for a second time, he was met with the second person he had made hold the club.

With a crooked spine and hideous face, I was considered a nuisance wherever I went. While earning a living as a pickpocket, I learned to run faster thana horse and to creep around without making the smallest sound. But one day, after a failed thieving, I was sent to be executed. But for whatever reason, my now master stepped up and untied me.

Despite everyone's hatred towards me, my master took me into his home. Under his command, I became known as the "Dark Raven," a secret agent who brought him success by stealing enemy secrets across the land. When my lord's greatest adversary, an enemy general, attacked, I risked infiltrating the enemy camp.

However, I could not outwit the experienced soldiers and after a grueling battle, I barely escaped with my life. When I returned, I overheard these words my master said to his concubine:\n"I sent that raven to his death. He knew too much. But he was a good find. A few nice words was all it took to have him risk it all for me."

Heartbroken, I left my master and became a peasant in the countryside. Some time later, after a devastating defeat, my mater escaped to my neighborhood.\n"Which route is the safest?" he asked me.\nThe handkerchief wrapped around me prevented him from recognizing my identity. I pointed out and said, "That way." His horse then galloped away...towards the bottomless swamp.
Honey! Listen! I was making dinner when all of a sudden a bullet shot through my house from outside! See the cracked window and hole in the wall? Oh, what am I to do?! I'm too scared to sleep!
Dear, oh, help me, please! I've been targeted again! I was working in the archives when a gunshot was fired from outside! I have the bullet as evidence! Please, you have to do something, and fast!

Honey! Are you listening to me?! I was sweeping up the front porch and once again someone tried to shoot me! Now the porch is splintered and blacken from the bullets grazing it. I'm terribly frightened for my life! You will do something, won't you?!

Yes, I'm the one who killed my husband. He kept ignoring my pleas for help, so I retaliated by blowing his brains out. Oh, and that fake act I did about someone after my life? What's your point? The real matter at hand is that unfaithful husband of mine! I just gave him what he deserved! So hurry up and have me acquitted!
Phoenixes born into this world, while alive engage with humans.
The world of a person chosen by a phoenix has a vastly different life than that of one who's never had contact with one.
A person who encounters a phoenix is destined to be a pawn in changing the world as we know it. Their destiny may at times derail from its intended path, and may ultimately face a sorrowful death.

The phoenix that had engaged with many people rises to the alter where it burns to death in the flames it creates. From its ashes, a new phoenix is born, and once again it soars from the alter into the world...

The boy was known to be a bit eccentric. For as long as he can remember, he had always feared the sky. He feared the clouds, sun, and the stars, terrified that one day they'd all crash down to the earth, so he stayed hidden in his basement.

He was born into a military family with very strict parents. His parents, however, were fed up with his ways and declared, "You are no longer part of this family!" before pulling up the ladder connected to the basement.

Because the basement was well stocked with food and water, he lived comfortably underground for a few years. There were some moments when he became curious of the outside world, but fear would always win out. Then it occurred to him. If he could identify the signs of a calamity, he would be able to avoid danger. For the next year or so, he would further his knowledge by reading scholarly books in the basement library.

"Now I get it. There was no calamity to begin with! Thanks to gravity, the sky will never come crashing down!" Just as he shot up with excitement, a loud roar echoed from above. Just then, the entire ceiling collapsed and crushed the boy. It turned out that the parents distraught over their son's behavior decided to blow up their house in a spectacular act of suicide.

This is the story of a healer. He was a poor man who lived by eating the grass in mountains and fields. Perhaps because of this, he acquired knowledge of many types of medicinal herbs. In a world obsessed with greed, through his knowledge he continued to save people with a pure heart.

The gods, pleased with the man's good deeds, called him to have a feast with them. The man was brought to tears by their invite and promised to continue offering his help to serve the world even more. In turn, the man ask for and received the an item used during the feast.

What the man got was a samovar. However, since he was a mere bottom-feeder with no link to tea culture, he used the pot to boil tea water to concoct a potion. Since the divine tea cup possessed magical powers, the effects of the man's potion multiplied.

Noticing the great effect his potions now had, he tried to create a cure for a deadly fever. A medicine that would eradicate it and destroy all germs. He administered his new drug in large doses, but its side effect was...an extraordinary massacre. The sacred artifact was then sealed away as an item of the Demon Lord.\n\n　　　　　　　　Recommended Basic Science, published by the Association for the Advancement of Science

It was a machine that could record sounds from its surroundings. However, since it was still in its experimental stage, it lacked the technology to hear the recorded sound since it had yet to be developed. Despite this, the machine would occasionally emit sounds that should have been impossible to hear.
It was said to be the sound of a world where those who left this world no longer alive.
Those who heard the sound were subjected to terror inducing nightmares of what was to come following their own deaths.
Just as the machine beeped in reality, so did it in their nightmares. Then, the room and the world was consumed by nightmares of the afterlife...
The queen who had an unsightly face, had married the king through an arranged marriage and was sent to live in a tower full of his mistresses. Day after day, tears would fall from her hideous face.

What did give her some form of hope in that lonely tower was the violin she brought from her hometown. Although the only songs she plays are full of melancholy, it produces such a beautiful tone that could never suit her face.

Then one day it was gone. While the queen had gone out, someone had stolen her beloved violin. From another remote tower, she could hear the sound of a violin playing. Along with it, was cackling from the king and his mistresses.

Some night later, a maid screamed out in horror. There in the remote tower, she found the dead bodies of the king and his mistresses. Standing before her was the queen, splattered in blood, and stabbed herself with the violin. It is said that at that moment, her ugly face appeared to have found peace.

The woman was the daughter of an aristocrat, but during the revolution she was captured by the people and beheaded along with her family. When the people began looting the homes of aristocrats, her beloved violin was one of the items taken. Years passed and the violin found a new home at an antique shop. The shop owner warned his customer that it once belonged to an "abominable woman," but believing superstitions were nothing but nonsense, he went ahead and purchased it.

The man played the violin. That night, he woke up feeling the presence of someone in his home. But after searching every corner, there was no one to be found. Ready to return to his bed, he turned around and was met face to face with the alleged abominable woman. The corners of the woman's mouth opened wide.
Aaauuuuuhhhh...
The sound came from deep inside the woman's throat. It was jet-black darkness that seemed to plunge into the depts of hell. Just then that abominable sound—

The chancellor, a man of great political and military talent, assisted his lord in expanding his domain several times over in just a few years. His skill was so outstanding that it was rumored he had 10,000 wisemen living in his brain.

The chancellor had established a free school where children of the poor could get an education. One day he paid them a visit and taught them how to study. Noticing a boy with a limp, he offered him a cane. Impressed by his kindness, the boy then vowed, "I'm going to grow up just like you, Mr. Chancellor."

Ever since their fateful meeting, the boy studied diligently, but compared to his friends, he wasn't making any prominent strides. While his studies showed a lack of growth, the opposite could be said for his stature. However, due to his crippled leg, he was unable to hold a post in the military. "What the hell is so different between me and the chancellor?!" he grieved.

One day, a gruesome scene was discovered at the chancellor's home. A dead body with their brain gouged out. The corpse belonged to none other than the chancellor.\n"The brain... Replace my brain with the chancellor's," the young criminal muttered. He would repeat these words until just before his execution.

Production Report 001\nObtained information on the production of the Fool's Golden Staff, which has been kept secret by the Empire. Due to a multi-layered encryption process, first-class ceremonial magic was used. Destruction of the arcanum mechanism was a success.

Production Report 005\nOf the materials required for production, the most crucial of them, true gold, was nowhere to be found. An alternative material, fool's gold, is listed in the production data. Production will resume using this material.

Production Report 0254\nThe prototype machine has been completed. Executed start-up test also a success and achieved 70% of original output.\nNote: One researcher has voiced doubt this will work. Since true gold is a biological material, theoretically, using fool's gold as a replacement should result in failure.

Production Report 0323\nThe fool's gold automatically takes and fuses its missing or biological elements from its surrounding. 90% of the organisms in our institute have vanished. It is possible the Empire planned this all along...

The achievement of your dearest dream rests atop a hundred million victims.
What would you yell in a world where you were only one of two left?
Would you finally smile?
Would you lament when you learn the truth about justice?
We have come here again and again, hoping to see you wail in sadness in your final moments.
.........
.........
.........

Case 1:

He raises his fist, only to bring it crashing down towards me. There's nothing I can do to stop it. He teases me, as I drip blood onto the ground. There's naught else I can do...

There's no place to run. I can only hope for a brief respite.

"It's... actually not so bad..."
With that one whispered phrase, those beautiful eyes slid closed, face lit by the light of the moon.

Case 2:

"I...should have figured things would end up like this, again..."

Thinking back, every time my life's fallen to pieces the moon's been there, full and bright and red as blood. It's fine though. As long as I know that. Next time, I'll...

Case 3:

"I've been waiting for you. Come."

The moon princess raises a graceful hand to beckon the assembled group of black-robed figures.

"You've kept me waiting an awfully long time, though. I hope you'll make up for it a bit with some...entertainment."

The light in her eyes sparks a feeling in me as powerful as the one I get facing up against a formidable opponent in battle. Just as powerful, but not the same... There's something of a prayer in it, somehow.

Your wish will be fulfilled
over thousands of corpses.
What do you want in this lonely world of two?
Are you smiling?
Are you filled with sorrow, thinking it all a waste?
So many times, we have seen that at the final moment,
you have the urge to scream.
………………
…………
……

Case 1:

"A world where only the strong get any recognition...? I can't think of anything more boring!"

The crimson mantle flutters with his motion, looking like nothing more than a roiling sea of blood. The dull glint of the hammer's dark metal winks as he whips the maul around to attack, silver eyes dancing with a sharp glint.

"I'd lose a lot of friends if we lived in a world like that. A lot. Doesn't sound like my idea of fun, you know? Don't think... Don't think I'm going let down all the people who've taught me so many important things!!"

The roar of a great and towering beast was swallowed up into the crimson moonlight as the world itself came apart at the seams, even as my own memories started to dissolve, running together.
It was the world I'd dreamed of, the world I'd yearned for. It was a different way to be, a world where life had an entirely different meaning.
A whole other world quickening, hear at the destruction of this one.
...A piercing whistle that rang through every particle of creation, announcing the end.

Case 2:
Success. A wish granted. Eternal play, forever after. And there, in the middle of that dream come to life, the sight that awaited was...

Red, everything stained red...all the way to the core, all the way...

"Mr. Wolf! I'm...I'm right here! So come find me quick...I...don't want to be alone, anymore."
Even when I close my eyes and cover my ears, I can still hear that voice.
The voice of my failure, that day, chasing after me...
Sorry, I know I was bad.\nI'll do it better next time. I'll make sure I do as I'm told!
So please...\nPlease don't make me feel like this anymore...\nPlease?
It was a time when all seats were filled.
Against all reason a false star gleams,
and from the void a monster is born.
Awe-stricken by the sight, the people called it "xxx."

After making a name for himself in his studies, the young man was offered work at the palace. His good looks, gentle nature, and kindness to those he met drew the attention of many female admirers. When a daughter of nobility confessed her love for him, he shot her down saying, "I swore to devote my life to my country and do not seek not a family."

The was the upright, pure and fortitude youth were rising in rank. During a New Years celebration, he went off into the garden reeking of booze and something soft clinging onto him. In front of him stood the noble daughter who had once attempted to woo him. At first she playfully giggled at him, but whatever hopes she had were quickly dismissed when he pushed her away.

Heartbroken, the girl took her leave. As she did, the young man noticed a letter fall to the ground. Reading it over, he was taken aback of what it entailed. It was a message from the minister stating that he had blackmailed the young girl into a physical relationship with him and was summoning her again tonight.\n"That filthy bastard! I have to do something!" Driven by righteous indignation, he rushed to the room indicated in the letter.

"You son of a—!" His words were cut short when he realized where he was. The room he had barged into was none other than the Queen's dressing room, and what's worse, she was in the middle of changing. The guards patted him down and found a dagger in his pocket, though he had no memory of ever carrying one. He understood now. That noble daughter pretended to cling onto him so she could slip the dagger into his pocket and dropped the letter knowingly...all so she could get her revenge. In an instant, his honor had been lost, and so he left the country in misery.

Her bedroom was filled to the ceiling with expensive gifts from all her suitors. At this point, she became town gossip, and rumors spread like wildfire. They claimed that her heavenly beauty had gone to her head and had become nothing but arrogant.

The girl, however, never lost her pure heart. Her mailbox was flooded with letters from gratitude from poor children she donated her gifts to. The act of exploiting suitors to save underprivileged children has since been called an "angel's arrogance."

As if something took over him, the eldest son became obsessed and devoted himself to blacksmithing. Eventually his family acknowledged his devotion and taught him the secrets of blacksmithing. He worked hard and waited patiently for the day he would be able to teach the hero the way of his sword and become a player in world peace.

...Even if his face is disfigured by fish, I am still his parent. There's no chance I wouldn't recognize my own son's face. I can't believe he drowned himself consuming alcohol on a boat in the middle of the day. Where did I go wrong in raising him? Let him be reborn again after reflecting on his past where he can draw his sword for someone else's sake.
Dammit...! What's the meaning of this?! I thought I killed Tempest Pistol! Who could possibly be attacking the mansion?! Master! Please, take this secret passage and escape with your life!

Once freed from confinement... What are you people doing?! My husband died ages ago! Tempest Pistol was just pretending to be him! An attack on the mansion? That's impossible! It must have been a staged using timed explosives! What?! They've robbed our safe! They took everything!
"Are you my bride?" he inquired. "I originally came here with the intent to throw myself over the falls to my death, but I don't care for egotistic women."

The woman stopped singing and lashed back at him. "A low-life like you shouldn't be complaining!"\nThe man threw himself over ledge happily, for he was a bit of a masochist. And so he lived happily ever after.

Thinking he had been tricked, in a fit of anger, the man took the poison himself. Nothing happened and he felt foolish for paying a hearty price for it. It would be two years later the man suddenly died, and his friends and family would be left perplexed over the cause.

It was a poison that worked on nobles who ate a nutritious diet. It also worked on men who were not wealthy, but who cared about their health and diet. However, the person it was given to drank cheap liquor and meat, a habit that ultimately saved his life. It was the low-quality oil and alcohol used in his diet that acted on the poison and neutralized it.

The young man removed the earplugs he was instructed to use. He listened to the string of the lyre plucked by the band. Then all of a sudden he saw his crush there on the battlefield. Before it could strike him as odd for her to be there, he rushed out slaying all his enemies until he was eventually pierced and died at the hand of an enemy sword.

However, he wasn't the only naive one. Others around him continued their assault, hoping to gain whatever nonexistent reward produced from the melody of the lyre. The mercenary captain won another great victory, and his fame grew even stronger.

[Alfonso's Wife: Mia]\nEvery time I go to visit that person, the jailer seems more and more polite to me. You know what he told me? Ever since he killed the psychic, he's been able to talk to the dead. He said he could communicate with my dead mother, too. He even said things only my mother and I knew.

[Aspiring Psychic Apprentice: Rani]\nUm, are you the psychic Alfonoso? I want to read prophecies from the underworld, too! I beg of you! Please make me your apprentice! Huh? I should find the sacred tree instead? I'm being serious here! Please don't tease!

Enraged at the axe-fighter's actions, the Emperor set up a public execution. He doused the slave in oil and ignited it with a lit torch.\n"Freedom for the slaves!" the axe warrior hollered as he burned to death. The crowd watched motionlessly as the flames consumed his body.

Some time after, a debate arose among the people. Some spoke out and advocated the abolition of slavery, and word spread across the land. It wouldn't be until five years later when the Emperor realized his lack of sense and judgement finally decided to abolish slavery. This miracle which began with a single axe warrior, would later be known as the Axe of the Phoenix.
Men who are as kind as a prince are special to me. One found me, as filthy as I was, and shined me up.
He picked me up, like a muddy stone that no one would look twice at, and ever so gently made me shine.
That's why I want to repay his kindness.\nI want be someone whom he can boast that he was the one who found her.
I will return the favor you've given me twice over!
He was a master piker, with none in all the land who could compare to his skill.\nThe king said of him, that the country was unshakeable, as long as it had such a peerless hero.
He loved his fellows, and went about saving the weak and crushing the powerful.\nHis friend said of him, that the spirit of righteousness will never die, so long as such loyalty exists.

However, within his own household he was a terrible miser, spending all his money on causes that he believed in.\nHis wife said of him, in quite the spiteful tone, that because of his penny-pinching, she couldn't even keep them in respectable clothes.

Finally, he was apparently quite the deviant who rired quite outlandish acts, in order to sate his desires.\nSeveral courtesans of every strip said of him, staring hollowly into the distance, that they'd really rather not relive those memories, thank you.\nScholars have theorized that these wildly different reports, as varied as the shifting colors of an opal, are the origin of his moniker.
Q: Why is the sky blue?\nA: Sunlight is composed of many different colors, and they scatter upon hitting the atmosphere. Blue is scattered more than other colors, and so reaches human eyes.

Q: What is the meaning of life?\nA: In the nature of each organism on earth, there is something akin to the survival instincts of animals or the flourishing of seeds, all connected to that creature's essence. We humans are the only ones who try to attach meaning to any of it. Which is to say, there really is no one particular meaning to life, but myriad answers to that question.

Q: What is love?\nA: Love is a set of sensations and emotions triggered by dopamine, noradrenaline, and serotonin, in order to encourage us to form bonds and pass on our genes. It can refer to a large number of very intense feelings.

Q: What is happiness?\nA: How should I know! I thought I'd be happy if I studied hard and worked towards a bright future but my crush just told me I'm "creepy" when I tried to make conversation so I'm not really feeling it right now, okay? Just, UGH leave me alone you smarmy bastard.
The day I met that lion was the day I began to realize that human hearts are fickle things.

The people who had saved me at first now betrayed me. They took their swords in hand and denounced me. What brought about this turn? The answer is clear. This was the unavoidable result of my own hubris.
"You didn't bring more people? Seriously? ...Man, you guys really do not know who you're dealing with right now."\nI wasted no time taking up my sword to put down these betrayers.

That impusle...the desire to be saved...it's really a beautifully arrogant emotion, wouldn't you say?\nI savor it, letting myself drift in that feeling that burns in my breast as my steps trace through a field of blood.

One beautiful young noblewoman had a rose garden, cared for by a gardener of surpassing skill. One day, her father offered her up to an emperor, to slake his own hunger for political advancement. She accepted it gracefully, saying that it was her cross to bear.\n\nShe set out for the imperial palace, gardener in tow.

Now, the emperor owned terrifying beasts, and the palace contained over a hundred concubines. One day the most beloved of the emperor's concubines died under strange circumstances. On the heels of this tragedy, more began dying, in order of how cherished they were by the emperor.

The rose-loving concubine took this opportunity to get closer to the grieving emperor, an conceived a son. The emperor rejoiced and the son born to them became the imperial heir. Then, the unthinkable happened. Although relations with her imperial husband had grown distant and strained, the empress nevertheless gave birth to another son.

Her gardener was immediately arrested on charges of entering the imperial gardens, and planting the poison that had claimed the other concubines. It seemed he had plans to kill his mistress and her youngest son, as well, but before a confession could be extracted the silent man swallowed the poison hidden in a back tooth and stepped freely into hell.

The country was under threat. An armed populace had risen up, intending to overthrow the current monarch's government. Worse yet, they were aided by a regiment of the army that had defected to their cause.

The Queen played her clarinet, a mystical instrument which could summon a guardian depending on the melody. The entirety of the rebel forces were struck with awe as it was brought forth, larger even than the castle itself.

A mage in the rebel forces played her clarinet, and a clay figure grew to titanic proportions and stepped forward to act as the rebels' own guardian. The titans clashed, but the rebels' guardian was no match for the Queen's. It crumbled into shards of pottery, and hope of revolution crumbled along with it.

The monarchy's retaliation against the people was ruthless and total, spilling rivers of blood and tears as it sought to punish the people for their impudence. The carnage continued until one day, the silent royal guardian began to move once more. However, instead of attacking the remnants of the rebel forces, it turned its might against the monarchy, decimating the royal army. The guardian stood watch as the remaining rebel forces poured into the breached castle, before slowly lying down, never to move again.

The world has been choked with coal-black mist since before I was born. I don't know what it's like to breath clean air, free of this clinging miasma. Humanity lives reliant on beacons, now. Their brilliance drives back the cloying mist. It's said that if you allow yourself to be swallowed too deeply in the fog, you'll never find your way home again...but no one knows what happens to those lost.

My grandfather told me something before he died. He told me about a world without the Blackmist, a world with clear blue skies. His stories made me want to know where it came from, and why. They made me want to see the blue of the sky with my own eyes. With those dreams burning in my heart, and the beacon burning atop my staff, I set forth into the swirling mists.

I explored the blackmist depths, mapping the way as I went, returning over and over, only to return to my explorations... It was the work of years, but I eventually discovered an abandoned laboratory. The building was silent, equipment long since plundered, but alone on a dusty desk I found an old journal. I learned that its author had been engaged in research she believed to be vital, the search for a way to bring peace to a world utterly depleted by successive wars.

On the final page of the journal she'd written of discovering a 'unique solution,' which she meant to implement. My mind leapt with what I knew was the wildest of speculation. Knew, but did not care. I had always thought the Blackmist seemed to have a will of its own, a malice. What if this long lost scientist really did find a way to render down the human unconscious? To distill out the malice, the hostility, the violence. What would become of these, now free of human minds? I was immediately seized with a passion to learn more, to know as much as I could.\n\nTo lay bare the truth of the world.
I'm not crazy. I'm fine. Totally fine. I eat when I'm hungry, just like anyone else. Nothing weird about that.
I wipe the last of the red stains from my mouth as I finish explaining this fact. My companion, a tiger, laughs and tells me, "An appetite is rather much like a heart seeking love."

I nodded. That made sense. Even more proof I'm not crazy. I remember what love is like. My love left me with so many memories. If I'm hungry, I'm hungry. It's because my stomach is empty, nothing more. Nothing more than that.

And you know, even if I was crazy, which I'm not. But, even if I was, I don't think being crazy would be so bad. Going crazy's probably the worst thing. Especially if you didn't know it was happening. That's why I'm fine, though. I mean, I know I'm not crazy, after all.

Once there was a Dwarven Kingdom, surpassingly skilled in the mining and smelting of iron. One day, a tribe of savage giants from beyond the mountains appeared, launching a sudden attack. The dwarve's chief, knowing they must fight back, decided that they would work to produce giantslaying weapons.

For the giants' skin was unyielding as stone, and could not be harmed by normal weapons. Therefore a great bow was constructed, so powerful it might with justice have rather been called a siege engine. Designed to pierce solid rock, it was made of good steel and the weaponsmiths confidently declared that it couldn't fail to secure their victory against the giants as they readied themselves to test it.

Though it took a few hundred of the dwarves to draw the bowstring, the test was a wild success, as the bow demonstrated enough raw power to blow away mountaintops. No giant would be walking away unscathed from a weapon like this, and surely their victory would be assured with a few hundred such weapons. They set immediately to work, throwing the weight of all their skill and industry behind the enterprise.

However as the day of the decisive battle dawned, the dwarves found themselves overrun and crushed in the time it took them to draw and load the cumbersome weapons. As the giants advanced, the seized the bows, marvelling at their perfect size and excellent construction. The dwarven kingdom was swiftly defeated, and thereafter the dwarves were obliged to continue producing their most excellent bows for the new imperial government.

An ominous rumbling in the earth resolves into deafening booms, drawing every eye towards the sound. The sight that greeted them was no less than a figure of majestic stature, a giant lumbering across the land. The impressive vista was somewhat undermined by the voice that emanated from the metal monster, somehow shrill and thin for all that it echoed around them. "Listen up," the voice shrieked, cracking a little, "this country is now under the control of I, Griff, the Great and Powerful Magician!" Everyone only stared in confusion for a moment, before realizing that the speaker was, in fact, the little old man perched on one of the giant's palms.

"You may now cry out your adoration," Griff's voice was slightly nasal, and the amplification wasn't really doing him any favors, either. The people exchanged glances, and an old man stepped forward and shouted, "Ah, you're that black mage idiot Griff that just got a bounty put on his head, right?" The town guard surged forward in attack, but soon found to their consternation that they had about as much chance of piercing the automaton as a mosquito. Cackling maniacally, Griff ordered his mechanical avatar to attack, and its ponderous iron fist crushed several in the crowd, somewhat lessening the humor of the situation for those remaining.

When word of the somewhat unorthodox situation unfolding in the town reached the King, he quickly assembled a battalion and sent them to defeat the giant. Unfortunately, they barely lasted an hour after the attack commenced, solidifying the townspeople's determination that this was actually not the least bit funny at all. While this was happening, one of the townsfolk scaled a nearby tower and loosed an arrow, aiming not for the automaton, but for the heart of the old man still standing on its palm. Seeing this, one of the King's men let out an exasperated chuckle and exclaimed, "Why didn't we think of that?"

The mage's body toppled from its perch, plummeting towards the ground. As it struck the earth, the automaton began to run wild. This put a damper on the celebratory mood that had been emerging, and eventually resulted in hundreds of deaths and the loss of the King's own castle. The reign of terror and destruction continued until the gods finally grew bored with the drama of the situation and sent a divine warrior to dispatch the construct.

Among all things in this world, there was once a kingdom, its capital city and those who resided there ruled over by the very strictest of discipline and control. Two young people yearning to escape their city's strictures and love each other freely, thereby determined that they would elope. The gate guard took pity on them and allowed them to pass, so moved by their love that she took up her violin and began to play in their honor as they fled.\n\nHowever, and dear reader, this is stating things in the kindest terms possible, her music made one feel as if their soul had been rent from their flesh and cursed to the third generation.

When the pair were discovered missing, the gate guard was dragged before the court and made to tell the entire story.

"...so, you know, I played them a song," she finished, and shrugged before playing a short sample melody for the court.

"I think those two have been punished enough," said the Judge, who had collapsed in a fit, foaming at the mouth after only a few minutes of the guardswoman's music. The other court attendees had fared no better, and murmured in agreement. Thus, the lovers were left alone and the guardswoman was sent back to her post with a stern warning about municipal noise ordinances.

Some time later a merchant arrived from the country to which the two lovers had eloped, telling tales of sudden war and massacre.\nThose present the day of the guard's trial scarcely fared better, dying one after another in strange circumstances. It didn't take long for rumors to spread like wildfire across the city, telling of the terrible power of the guardswoman's song. Citizens began to look on her in fear as they passed in the street.

The city reacted, promulgating an official notice. No longer would citizens be confined. Anyone was free to go as they pleased, they only need ask a certain guardswoman to let them through her gate and listen to a single song. This proclamation did the guardswoman no favors, as she became the unwilling target of even more virulent rumors, but on the bright side, she also became the most effective guard in the history of the city.
For a sword of great beauty, it brought nothing but misfortune to its wielder.
The sword would be his ruin.\nFriends were lost and eventually so was a part of himself.\nDespite his misery, he refused to part with it.
He put his life on the line for the sword.\nHe chose it over his own family.\nAnd he sacrificed he parents and children for it.

When it came to that sword, there was no being in the entire world that could compete for his love.\nAfter all, the sword was himself—his anima—and having found no greater love than himself was his inevitable tragedy.

I'm in the business of showing women wonderful dreams, and it only makes sense that a service like that comes at a cost. And yet they slander me! They say I'm committing fraud and bigamy! Can you believe that?! \n\nThat's not even the worst of it! After I was convicted the judge just looked at all three of my lives and said my punishment was up to them! Locked me up in a room with them! I'm afraid for my life here, okay?!

Come on, guys, let's just talk this out like rational adults! If you kill me and take my stuff you'll have to split it three ways, and that won't be very much at all, will it? You get it right? You're reasonable people! I'm quite the egalitarian, I have you know, and I think I know just the compromise we need for everyone to walk away happy!

So get this: we just divide each day up into thirds, and you can each have an equal amount of my time! Great idea, eh? Oh, but then, I suppose you'd all end up fighting over who had me at night, huh? No worries though, I'm an egalitarian, like I said so...

Now...wait just a minute! Hold on! Where did you even get those spears from?! Fine then! I didn't want to marry any of you anyway! You're all ugly! A-And fat!

Huh? "Since I'm such an egalitarian I must be happy to be so equally despised"?!
Aaaaaugh!! Help! HELP! Someone! They're gonna—
It was a book of unspeakable matter.
Depictions of an ungodly being littered its pages.
A blaspheme to the pious and devout.
Despite no great god would create something so accursed, the very possibility that such atrocious things could exist was enough to make any rational person lose their sanity.
Laying dead in the man's arms was the corpse of a cat with a coat of fur of unusual color. He had indeed killed this cat—the Feline King.
It was said that the king possessed nine lives.\nAnd it was that treasure that the man sought.

If one could obtain the Feline King's treasure, they would have the ability to bring humans back to life through those nine lives—so it is said.\nSo when the man had murdered the king, he thought he had finally acquired that very treasure.
The man prayed and prayed to the Feline King's treasure, and at long last, the figure of his deceased family had returned. However, the spirit inside was not that of his loved one...

Member:\n"About that thing I just borrowed a minute ago, but...er, why are their candles coming out of a harp? How am I supposed to play this thing without dripping hot wax onto my own arms? And they're covering the entire thing! Just...why?!"

Member:\n"I mean I guess MAYBE if it was back in the days before electricity and someone was so passionate that they needed to practice into the night, but...EVEN THEN! I mean, why put the candles ON the harp itself?!"

Receptionist:\n"Why, you've got it all wrong. You see, that harp was once the possession of a rather unique performer with a decided masochistic streak. He did indeed enjoy practicing into the night, with spines on that harp cutting his arms. Unfortunately, he was careless one night and knocked over one of the candles on the floor, which caused the fire that resulted in his death."

Receptionist:\n"When his wife was going through his possessions, she mistook the harp for a candlestick holder and stuck all the remaining candles onto its spikes. Well, and as you can see it's a rather curious sight, isn't it? We just couldn't help but buy it for our music club. But I see you've had a very good idea about the hot wax, Mistress. Would you be interested in dripping it onto a man kneeling at your feet, perhaps?"

A pair of siblings—brother and sister—had lost their parents at a young age.
"We were supposed to be together forever."
"Yeah... But it's not so bad."
Atop a staff, a memento of their parents was a decorative gem portraying a sea of stars.
Their parents had become stars watching over the pair.

Their eyes glossed over the staff's starry sea.
"Is this star Papa?"
"Maybe this one is Mama."
Failing to agree on any particular star, they sought out the ones that belonged to their parents.

One day, a boy from the neighborhood approached them.
"That star isn't real!" he exclaimed.
He claimed that the starry gem was just a rock with holes, and that something shinny from inside the staff was emitting light to make it look like stars.
However, the siblings refused to believe him.

"It's not nice to to lie. Can I hit him?"
"Go ahead. You did the same to Mama and Papa."
The brother grabbed the staff and proceeded to bash it against the boy until he was no longer moving. Just then, a small hole appeared in the sea of stars.
"Look, another star."
"See, people do become stars when they die."

Hey, did you know I was the Blade of Systole before you took me up? I should probably tell you then. Those who wield me, well, they get a pretty hefty boost to their lifestuff. Yeah, that's a technical term. I'm talking all the functions that keep you alive, dialed up to 11. You'll be able to access great power, but it'll put equally great stress on your body.\nYou're fine with that, huh? Well, as long as you know the risks.

Hmph, so that was the dark emperor who's been terrorizing the world?

He was nothing special, at least, not as long as you've got me. You've got the strength to take on armies! Look at you, tossing aside his evil knights to take the guy's head, and all before breakfast!
Now, let's finish this!

Heh, now that you've made yourself king, how's the family life treating you? Heard you're gonna have another kid. How many is that by now? Well, it's no wonder, I did say ALL your life functions'd get boosted. What are you gonna do next? Storm heaven and become a god? Nah, sounds like a reasonable plan, we just--\n\nH-Hey! What's wrong? What're you doing falling over all of a sudden?

Geez, just like that, huh? A peerless champion goes to his grave. Tragic. I mean, I did warn you about the stress wielding me'd put on your body. Looks like a stroke.\nWell, rest in piece. You didn't stick around long but you got a lot done, my man.

Welcome. You've passed beyond the veil into the other world. I'm God. Nice to meet you, and congrats on living out your life. Now, we should probably get on with it. Time waits for no one, not even me. Hah! Anyway, I'm going to whack you into you with this maul. Hold still. \n\nHmm... seems you missed out on marrying and died a virgin. Geez, that's rough. Don't worry, though, you can make it up in the next life. Now, I can give you two options, just let me know which you like best.

[Option 1]
You'll be drop dead gorgeous and immediately bag yourself someone rich to marry. Rich, not faithful, unfortunately. After cheating on you with dozens of people regardless of gender, the marriage'll sour a little bit.

So you get a divorce and a pretty hefty settlement, enough to live comfortably, which will work great for a while, but then one of your lovers gets obsessed and starts stalking you and begging you to marry constantly. You refuse to marry someone who's clearly insane and in revenge, your jilted lover hires people to kill you. They kill you. You die.

[Option 2]\nYou'll be pretty good looking still, but end up falling for and marrying some talentless artisan. You'll have come from money but you were so sheltered you end up mismanaging your money and your family falls into poverty. Then, your spouse gets a great idea for an invention and the two of you start selling it. It's a hit and you begin to recover financially, but what can I say, you're REALLY bad with money, so you bankrupt the household all over again. Alas.

What do you mean you're still deciding? Maybe if you could make up your mind quicker, you wouldn't have died a virgin, ever think of that? How about I use the Soul Moving Maul to whack you into a life just like the one you just lived, then you can come back here and tell me about regrets? What? Not fair? Who ever told you life was going to be fair?!
In a cheap, dingy inn, a man aims a bow at a woman. He's drunk. She's bound, and terrified, but he keeps explaining that it's fine, he's an expert, everything's going to be fine, before he fires.

His bow was a whimsical bit of weaponry known as the Butter Dragon Flybow. Sometimes arrows shot from it would fly true, but on other occasions they were known to dart about playfully. No one, not even the wielder knew which it would be until the arrow was loosed. He'd received the bow after the death of his wife.

As he looked down at the dead woman bound to the chair, he thought again of his wife. That night, he'd been entertaining her with some target practice, only to accidentally kill his beloved wife. Despite that loss, he gained something that night, as well.
Ever since, he'd entertained himself by shooting his capricious bow at a long string of victims.\nStill a step ahead of the authorities, he slips out of the inn early an vanishes into the night.
The crystal on the haft of the spear is said to show its bearer the Spear's victim, past and future. The warrior stood aghast, as his own face looked back from its depths.

He journeyed far, scaling a towering mountain and entering a thick, dark forest before digging a hole and burying the spear within. He intended to put as much distance between it and himself as he could, but the spear managed somehow to return to him.

When it did he set out again, travelling all over, hoping to accomplish his goal. Then, finally, he found it, in a far off town...just what he'd been searching for. He crept up on the man from behind and drove the spear into him, watching the shock on his face as he fell. A face that looked just like his own. The warrior relaxed, feeling more at ease, and unaware that he was being watched.

When dawn came, the townspeople discovered two bodies. The two men looked incredibly similar. Within the gathering, curious crowd there was a man apart from the rest, eyes set deep into his hood, shadowed features quite strikingly similar to those of the two dead men. Picking up his new spear, he turned to leave, only to see his own face peering back at him from the crystal.

The flute was enchanted, gifted with a magic that drew out talent in others. When you played it, inexperienced soldiers would find their marital ability blooming, and put up an admirable fight.\n\nThe flute's owners were a pair of travelling companions, a musician and a swordsmaster. They wandered from inn to inn, earning their daily bread at gambling.

That day however, they had decided to challenge someone to a fight. A rather muscular young man stepped up to take the challenge. The musician took one look at him and suggested they be cautious, and take this seriously, lest the swordsmaster be killed. However the swordsmaster only replied, "I know your music will carry me through, my friend."
The match began.\nThe swordsmaster, it is true, struggled more than usual, but eventually triumphed when the young challenger's hand became to injured to fight.

Returning to the table, the swordsmaster saw that the musician was distraught.

"What's wrong?"
"The flute is broken, I couldn't get it to play."
"Wh-but, the fight's over..."

Deep in concentration, the swordsmaster had not noticed the absence of the flute's melody, but even so faith in a friend carried the day.
I am a proper young lady, brought up in a proper family. My hobbies are needlecraft and music appreciation, although I will admit I also fancy myself a bit of a poetess. Oh ho ho ho!

Now, obviously, as I am lady of such manifest sophistication, the hoi polloi simply cannot take their eyes off of me. It can't be helped, really. For those dedicated to cultivating their beauty, to be endlessly bathed in the discerning gaze of the public is but a cross that must be borne.

When I go out, I carry a parasol with me at all times to stave off the burning light of the overbright sun, but it does nothing to turn aside the eyes of each person who stop in their tracks to take a second look at me, a beauty's beauty!

[Psychology Department, Dr. Muse, Patient Notes]\nPatient has spent most of her time in her house, sleeping, for the past several months. In addition, she has not been eating well or bathing regularly and looks quite thin and unkempt. It appears she may be the one responsible for the murders of her parents and the household staff. The property where she was found was filled with garbage, as well as the decomposing bodies of the murdered individuals. I fear we may never be able to rescue her from her delusion. Her mind seems to have created a powerful illusion of positivity to cope with reality.

Once, in a certain land there was a girl known as the Priestess of Salvation. She made it her work to heal people's wounds and cure them of their sickness. The king desired to have her abilities all for himself and had her imprisoned. She was gravely wounded, and refused all food until her body withered horribly. In the midst of this suffering, one young man showed her kindness.

He would visit her in her prison and tell her stories, take his meals together with her in hopes of encouraging her to eat. In time she began to recover, and eventually agreed to obey the king's commands. However, one day one of the kingdom's prophets made a truly shocking pronouncement. He said that the Priestess' power came from her heart, and suggested the King simply rip it out and mount it on a staff. And so, the king ordered her execution.

In her final moments, she called out the name of the young man who had shown her such kindness. The greedy king, not sated once he had the Priestess' power for his own, invaded the neighboring kingdom. However, the Priestess' powers were for one thing only, to save people. They did nothing to improve the martial prowess of the king's forces. The king lost his foolish war and as a result his people were put to the sword. Only one was saved. That kind young man.

From that moment onward, the young man never suffered injury or anguish. He found the staff with the Priestess' heart in the ruins of their country.

"Finally..."

The young man, the former prophet of the fallen kingdom took up the staff and set off, becoming a hero renowned the world over for saving thousands of lives.
Once you find security in your everyday life, you'll find yourself looking with envy upon your fellows.
If we were to be praised upon slaying 100 of our brethren, we'd next not be satisfied unless we slew 101.\nOf course we become twisted, living in such a world.
Encounter a raven, however, and you will know the true depths of greed.\nYou will realize, too, unavoidably and irrevocably, how far its darkness has spread within yourself.
It will all be far too late.\nYou'll find yourself consumed by an endless, all encompassing greed.

"Your life is mine."
Not a moment had passed from the time those words left my lips before the general's severed head hit the ground.
With the blood on my blade still fresh, I looked up to clouds parted by a howling wind. While no man witnessed the death I rent, the ever-watchful eye of the moon sees all.
Look all you want. I don't care.
I live by the sword, and I will someday die by it.

That wasn't the only job I took that day. I was ordered to kill another samurai, and that's exactly what I did. A quick stab to the neck and the blood in his throat took care of the rest. All in a days work. Or so I thought. His little brat came running and saw his old man dead on the ground. Dunno why, maybe I just felt bad for the kid, but I decided to take him along with me.

From then on I decided to put down the sword for good, and devote my life to teaching the boy. Wasn't a year past till an old friend stopped by.

"You gotta understand, you're the only one that can get the job done!"

Not my problem. I threw him out like yesterday's trash.

Didn't think anything of it, until the next day when I got back from the market. The boy was missing, and a message was posted on the door.

"Do the job, and you'll get the boy back."

I decided to pay my friend a little visit first. I knew he'd have his goons around, but I didn't care. He had this smug look on his face, the kind the dead ones make when they think they're invincible. "So you'll do it?" Yeah, I'll do it.

The old feelings came back as I killed every piece of crap in the room. Until a pain rushed across my spine. The bastards finally got me. Can't say I'm surprised it ended this way. But it is what it is.

Don't waste your tears on garbage like me...kid...

There was a scruffy man with threadbare clothes and the plainest, poorest food in his pantry, but who could heal a person's wounds with just a wave of his hand. He preached the virtues of gratitude for all one had, and the benefits of living in harmony with nature. In time, he came to be regarded as a saint.

The Pope at this time lived in a luxurious palace, wore sumptuous clothes and ate the most decadent food available. He was petty and jealous, and never hesitated to wield his considerable power. When he heard tales of the poor saint, he immediately had the man arrested and condemned to die, saying that he should have no trouble saving his own life if he were the real thing.

Even as the saint's ashes cooled on his pyre, his teachings did not fade, for they had taken root in the hearts of the people. They kept to his teachings on gratitude, and continued his legacy of respect for nature. The Pope himself was suspected of heresy, as several cardinals leveled charges of murder for his execution of the saint.

In the end, through a unanimous decree, he was put to death on the same pyre he'd sentenced the saint to face.\n\nAs he was overwhelmed by pain from the consuming flames, at the last he saw that it was fitting. The saint had been the real thing, and thus his teachings and faith had outlasted his death. Appropriate, then, that one such as himself who preached falsely should face these same flames.

The Tome of the Burning Eye, also known as the Tome of Vows.\nThe name is appropriate, for if the wielder of the tome lays eyes on an oathbreaker, the poor wretch will be utterly consumed by fire, even as the magic stains the wielder's eyes crimson.

There was once a young man who inherited the tome from his grandfather, who cautioned him in the strictest of terms to never risk breaking a promise so long as he should possess the book. Ever since, the young man heeded those words and adhered to every promise he made, though this resulted in many an unfair and bitterly frustrating experiences, as the city in which he plied his trade was full to the brim with corruption and vice.

He carried on for many years in this way, but ultimately the many unscrupulous people surrounding him took their toll. The young man tired of being tricked into unfair agreements, of so-called friends who only thought to use promises as shields, and eventually broke his word.\n\nBrought low by his sorrows and intent on suicide, the young man opened the tome his grandfather had so strenuously warned him against, and in the very moment its pages parted, the workplace all around him was engulfed in roaring flame.

For you see, what met his eyes were the stacks upon stacks of unjust contracts and agreements that littered the magistrates office where he was employed. And though all of it burned to cinder as the crimson stole across his eyes, the young man himself was not consumed, for his eyes were ever after blind to the sight of himself. He stumbled from the ruins of the office, wandering in vain for a mirror that could show him his own reflection, until every inch of the town had burned to ash in his wake.

Duty is a chain that binds with the power of one’s thoughts.\nIn the beginning, it was a symbol created to use people’s emotions.\nA symbol to fulfill the thoughts of the oppressed, the thoughts of the powerless.
The symbol represents a rebel who wields his power against the malice of those with power.\nThe masked man, Zero, who came to symbolize an ally of Justice.

Eventually, the emotions of the desperate become too powerful. They cling to such symbols, entangling them, leaving them bound.\nThis is the cursed fate of all symbols which outlive their usefulness.\nNo matter the personal desires of the one beneath the mask, the curse drives them mercilessly to save the powerless.
They cannot be allowed to break the curse.\nThey must become a legend.

You know, despite appearances, I was quite the dilettante, when I was a kid.
But under the occupation, my father, who’d always gone on about how much he hated injustice, was thrown into prison. He took his own life there.
After that, the rest of the family was left behind to face suspicion.
My mother disappeared, and I was taken into my uncle’s house.

Treated like a nuisance by my aunt and uncle, I avoided the house and spent my time wandering the backstreets, picking fights with the punks I found there.
One day, after beating one of them to within an inch of his life, I drew my blade decided to take his eye.
I figured he’d never make anything of himself anyway, so why not have a little fun? Only...
I glanced to the side, only to see a beautiful girl standing only a short distance away, staring back at me.

Fighting always made the a fire rage inside me and time after time I lost control of my own brutality, until I decided to take that man’s eye.\nThe whole time I was doing it, I just let myself drink in that delicious thrill.\nBut you know what? I couldn’t do it. I couldn’t do it, because that girl was there, staring at me, every thought in her head clearly visible her gaze.

Sometime after, a friend of my father came back from a trip overseas. When he heard what had happened, he invited me to come live with him.\nI tossed aside my blade, filled with a determination to turn my life around under his watchful eyes.\nWith that, I left the back streets behind me, and never managed to find that beautiful girl again.
You mustn’t let yourself be consumed by hate.\nCalm your mind, empty your thoughts, and simply observe yourself from above.\nWell? Do you think you can do it?
You mustn’t pursue selfish desire.\nTo lose oneself in power and act only on impulse is the way of a mere beast.\n...Huh. So, you’re going to try to control yourself, then?
You mustn’t be driven by pity.\nSuch underlying feelings are unnecessary. Maintain perspective and be prepared to even eliminate women and children, if need be.\nHm? You say you’ll try to do it?

I see... I think I have a good idea of your resolve.\nIf you truly possess such determination, I’ll take you on.\nI’ll break you free of the shell binding you, and grant you great power. We’ll eliminate all life, and usher in a world of solitude!
I eat only just as much as I want to eat, and sleep only just as much as I want to sleep.\nEveryone says such things aren't possible, but the tiger that visits me in my dreams praised me.
The tiger went on to show me a dream, and in it I saw a country where people eat until they're stuffed, and still discard mountains of food.

The tiger showed me dreams of clouds that floated by in the air, shaped like all sorts of food, and I ate them. The tiger showed me dreams of such exquisite deliciousness that even asleep, my stomach rumbled in craving.

And when at last I awakened from these dreams, unable to bear the craving any longer, the tiger whispered softly to me. It's alright, it said, it's okay to indulge. You don't need to hold back, anymore.

What do you think the most powerful weapon in existence is?
Is it a sword that can cut anything?
A war hammer swathed in lightning? A flaming axe?
No. Hell, no, in fact. This is the wisdom brought to us by the weaponsmith who crafted this.

Then, I hear you ask, what weapon IS the strongest?\nHe had an answer for that, too.\nAxes and swords, war hammers and bows...each one of them relies far too much upon the skill of its wielder. That is why they could never be the strongest weapon. For that, his choice is the gun.

Now, what is the most powerful attack?
Many seem to have settled upon the providence of the most powerful creatures in this world...dragonbreath.
So, what if...
What if one could reproduce such an attack? Why, they would have made the most powerful gun in existence. The weapon smith did just that, personally capturing a dragon for his crafting and creating a gun that could produce dragonbreath.

Only...well.
The gun was successfully completed, it's true, but it was far from the most powerful weapon. Although it produced dragonbreath, it had none of the power and force a true dragon could command. It seems that dragonbreath, like axes, swords, and bows, relies significantly on skill and talent.
Regrettable.
I suppose this is another dead-end theory. Good on paper, but...alas.
And at any rate, the weaponsmith defeated the dragon itself with a hammer, so they can't be all that bad...
He dreamed. He saw the same dream many times over.

In the dream, he walked the roads. Over and over, mile after mile, he walked. As he walked the roads changed in imperceptible ways, always different, hauntingly familiar. He was following something, and, even as he realized it, he knew he was also being pursued. As he walked, he ate.
The roads he plied in his waking dream eventually all drew together into one, thread running to a single spool.

In the center, where all roads lead, he found an axe. He found it, and eventually he killed with it in the waking world. In the moment of the kill he took flight, in that instant he was utterly free, mind and body.

There was once a land blessed with good governance, in which the citizens enjoyed a bountiful and happy life.\nThe king took for his council only the most purehearted of his people, all to create the best possible life for the most possible number of his subjects.
One day, a new minister arrived to serve at court. She was lovely, wise, well educated, and a such a virtuoso on the harp that no others could possibly have been her equal.
She managed to capture the hearts of many, and ultimately the Chancellor proposed, and upon her acceptance announced her to be his new wife.

Mere days after they were wed, however, the chancellor was dismissed and ousted from court entirely. The king took the minister to be his own wife, and in revenge for the harm wreaked upon her beloved, the new queen conspired with her true love to bring about the corruption and downfall of the monarchy, from within.
What is "life"?\nWhat is the meaning of human life? There were those who tried to live to spend time with their loved ones, to achieve their dreams, to make the world a better place.
But my hands are stained with the blood of such people.\nWhile searching for a place to die, I'm taking the lives of those who want to live.

Why?
Why am I still alive?
There were people who told me they liked me like this.
So there was someone who told me to like myself.
But she's gone.\nSo why am I still alive?\nIf life is such a hard road, why am I still alive?

What is "friendship?"
...I wonder if it is a bond that was once, indeed, there. A connection of the heart.
But now it has changed its meaning drastically.
Bonds are there. There is also a connection of the heart.
But it is no longer shaped by favoritism alone.\nI have mourned so much I thought I would regret it.
But it doesn't make sense.\nThis form is due to the result of an action that I chose.\nIt is the result of an action taken with determination.

Then I can't allow myself to regret it or regret it.
If I do that, I'll really be trampling on my feelings.
That's why I have to move on.
Because I can't go back to the two of us on that day anymore.
I believe that "education" is a ray of light to help us move forward in this malevolent world.
I was once an ignorant child who knew nothing.\nI was hurt because of my ignorance, I was proud because of my ignorance, I was cursed with eternal damnation because of my ignorance.

However, the prison called eternity was also a place of learning that granted me knowledge.
So much knowledge, it became a light that illuminated my path to life.
But there are some things that even that light cannot illuminate.
Our feelings.

As I spend more time and gain more knowledge, I lose my emotions.
I feel like I'm becoming less and less myself.
Someone, please notice...
I still want to be just another human being...
Who am I to decide what's wrong or right?\nEven if I'm wrong, I wield "power". If I don't have the power, I will be robbed. I will be tortured. I will be trampled upon.
I've seen many things happen to those without power.\nThose who are stripped to the bone are thrown away like dust and lose even the fact that they were alive.\nI don't want that.
I raise my voice in disgust.\nIf you try to take it from me, if you try to torture me, if you try to trample me, I will wield my power.
Even if it means getting my hands dirty, I'll wield my power.\nBecause I don't want to be taken away again.\nBecause there are still important things left in my hands.

Interview with POW Mack, Part 1
The damn alliance! Those lying backstabbers!
Our main force was still heading for the front lines, and we had to get back and warn everyone!
But whaddya know, the only way we can follow is if we ford this huge river!

Interview with POW Mack, Part 2
It's not like we were known for being strong swimmers or anything. My lungs were on fire, it felt like my skull was going to burst...
Damnit! We knew our country'd be done for if we didn't get the news back...!
Everything went dark for me in the river, and the next thing I remember is someone leaning over me, surrounded by fuzzy light.
Statement Addressed to His Excellency\n

[Death of a Con Artist]
Couldn't have gone better for me if I planned it. Vodyanoy? I'm just some deserter who fell in a river running for his life. Some fisherman saved me!
I'm like, the all-time master of self-preservation!
Hm? What's that splashing? Who's there? Some...fish person? Wait...that can't be...don't tell me that's a Vodyanoy?!
S-Stop it! What are you doing? Don't...!

There was once a man who loved the wild ocean with all his heart.
If he could have, he would gladly have wished himself a fish, to live amongst the waves.
Some days he'd be consumed with regret that he was born human.
It was his fondest desire that at the end of his days, his body might be sunk at sea, to feed the beds of kelp.
That's why, one night, the man threw himself into the surf.

As he slipped into dark waves, he prayed to die, right there in that moment.\nHowever, as it happened, he failed to sink. Time slipped by, until even the sound of the waves had ceased. The sea and the sky both an even field of darkness.\nSo he dove, cutting downwards through the water until he came to a cozy house nestled on the seabed.

An old man came out to greet him, intoning, "It's your time, now."
The old man handed over a fine staff, and immediately burst into seafoam, dissipating in the current.
With the staff in his hand, the man at last understood everything.
This staff was the symbol of the Ocean Administrator, he felt all the seas of the world at his fingertips and knew he was nigh unto a god.

When he touched the staff, he could summon hurricanes to swallow ships on faraway seas, or send towering tsunami to sweep the coastline clear of villages.\nThe man realized that every temperamental squall, every violent wave that broke in the seas...all of them where the work of the Ocean Administrator. In other words, all of it was the deliberate act of that old man.\nRealize the truth, he was absorbed with grief as if having just lost the love of his life. Consumed by it, he let go of the staff...and burst into seafoam.

Unable to live up to the standards of their stepmother, the boy and his sister fled their home.\nThey wandered without aim, stumbling upon a market.\nIts stalls overflowed with rare and ancient items, plucked from all over.

The two siblings stood captivated by the wares, until a nearby stall owner beckoned them over. "See anything you like?"\nThe brother replied that they were only looking, as they had no money to spare.\nWith a wry smile, the merchant rejoined, "Oh, we don't take money here. You pay with your lives."

Curious, the boy inquired what his whole life might buy, in this strange market.\nMulling it over, the merchant responded, "How about the mistmoon, that shines on the darkest of nights?\n"I like that," said the boy, eyes shining as he nodded excitedly.

The girl's eyes flew open, and she shot to her feet, on the edge of town.
Her brother, who had never left her side, was nowhere to be seen.
In the years that followed the girl would be raised in an orphanage before entering a happy marriage with a wealthy man.
She always believed that her brother had become the moon, and that he watched over her still.

He sat alone on a fine chair in a fine palace.\nHe had everything he could ever want, and for anything else, they only need ask?\nIt was only...he never got to leave the palace, or talk to any other people. You see, those were the conditions written upon the Palace Document.

There were others who had been given the Palace Document, and he was able to watch them through crystal balls. Sometimes the crystal ball showed him women, as well. He particularly enjoyed watching one such, and the crystal began to show her more and more often.

The crystals made sure he knew roughly what happened outside the walls of the Palace. Enough so that he was sure the woman he'd begun to care for lived nearby. Close enough to walk, in fact, if he had the mind to. But he could never meet her without leaving the palace.

In the end he never did, only lived out his life within the palace walls.\nThere were many in that country like him, gifted with palace documents, who lived their whole lives within those walls.\nIn the coming years, the country was conquered by its neighbor, the authors of the palace documents. There was no significant resistance.

The crazed murderer appeared night after night, attacking people. In one hand, he carried a hammer that glowed at every object reflected in his mask. Whenever his shadowy form was sighted stalking the streets of the town, it was certain a corpse would be discovered come morning, although only ever a single one. No one knew why he did what he did, and although the madman's visits haunted the night, during the day the town was lively and cheerful.

The townsfolk threw lavish day parties each day, and the town's lawns and parlors rang with laughter. The laughter had a desperate edge to it, as if they sought to blot out the memories of the night's brutality.\n\nOne day, one of the townswomen found herself outside after dark. She'd heard that a notorious bully had invited another woman out that night, and hoped to intercept her before any harm could be done.

As she hurried towards their meeting place, she stumbled suddenly across the bully, a mangled corpse in a mask lying at the feet of the very woman she had hoped to save. It seemed the bully had been the murderer, and her would-be victim had dealt her her just desserts. Before she could speak, the young woman knelt and took the mask from the corpse, donning it before melting into the night.\n\nRemembering it the next day, she couldn't keep from shuddering.

The cycle repeated. Each person righteously defending themselves with lethal force, all unaware that their assailant had merely done the exact same only one night before.\n\nEach person taking up the mask in their turn, adding a link to the chain of blood, acting out their grudges at night and covering them over in the day with the thinnest veneer of cosmetic.
[Diary of Miriel]\nAugh, I'm so stupid, stupid, stupid! I hate myself, I'm so ugly, how could anyone ever love me?! Is...is he serious? Does he really like me? Does he...love me?

[Diary of Miriel]\nThere must be something wrong with him, if he actually likes someone like me. I've started trying to put aside a little extra money for him. It's not that much of a hardship, when you think about it...

[From the files of Head Psychologist, Darma]\nI've read Miriel's journal, it seems she's fixated on me somehow, believing I harbor affection for her and simultaneously believing our counseling sessions to be meetings to arrange a loan. She is suspicious of the tests. I confess myself to be at a loss as for how best to help her, though I dearly hope I'll be able to.

[Logbook of Head Nurse Marital]\nMiriel and Dr. Darma have become dangerously emotionally dependent on each other. Miriel hasn't realized, but to my surprise and disappointment, neither has the doctor. Watching the awkward way they act with each other, Reluctant Sincerity seems to be the best description...
The lyre's melody appears and fades again in mere moments.
Appearing and fading, like foam on the crest of a wave.
As the melody fades, so do your worst memories, fade into nothing. As do your best memories, fading...
All that remains is a pure and spotless mind...

The day before she was to be married, her mother gifted her a bottle of poison. The representatives of her family were seated all around, she being a daughter of a well to do family, and the family of her intended being even more so.

She kept that bottle of poison, and found it quite useful, for their lofty families had many detractors, and her husband had his business rivals. She never once thought of drinking the bottle's contents herself, restraining herself even when things were hard.\n\nAt last, the day arrived for her own daughter to marry. On the day before her daughter was to be married, she took the bottle of poison from hits hiding place and presented it to her.

"This is medicine," she said, "for I know you've always had a weak constitution. You must drink only a very little bit of it every day. You should see the best effect after three days."\n\nFour days later, her daughter died of unknown causes in the home she shared with her new husband.

After handing the poison to her daughter, she left her husband a letter professing her deep love for her daughter, and left the house never to be seen again. Thus, she cut short the cycle of torment, refusing to pass it onwards to her daughter.

Preface\nThis book aims to deepen scholarship surrounding magical laws and curses. In order to use it, the reader must provide a drop of their blood. Simply prick your finger and press it against the jewel on the cover. A disembodied voice will echo through your mind, informing you that registration has been completed.

Acknowledgements\nI'd like to thank everyone who helped me in creating this book, for all that it is still a work in progress. It was designed that way, that each reader could continue to add to its store of knowledge in perpetuity. I hope that one day it will comprehensively cover knowledge both ancient and modern.

Overview\nI've enchanted this book so that merely reading its contents one time will engrave the information indelibly into your mind. Of course, the magical power to infuse any incantations or hexes must be supplied by the reader.

Coda\nI created this book with the primary goal of advancing scholarship. Thus, it has been spelled so that each reader must add as many spells as they have learned. Failure to do so will result in your lifeforce being absorbed as compensation. I apologize for the inconvenience, and ask for your understanding in this matter.

Listen well, my disciple! I've mastered the necromantic arts necessary to revive the dead languishing in purgatory! What the hell am I talking about? Why, I'm glad you asked! Certainly you can't have forgotten how I struck you a lethal blow this very morning, can you? And yet we stand here, conversing quite amiably. Miraculous, is it not!

Alright, a good job, I'd say! I've been able to have some intelligent conversations with my foolish disciple and understand what his feelings are.\n\nNecromancy is truly a deep and profound art. For my next goal, I want to raise awareness of necromancy and its many benefits amongst the people!

Hmm...I'll admit, I it's beyond my wildest hopes that so many people have been so accepting of necromancy! It brings tears to my eyes to see the gratitude in the faces of those who get to see someone they thought they'd never speak of again...\n\nI must build on this success! I'll gather like minded people together, research more deeply into the art of necromancy.

Now that necromancy has been fully mainstreamed, it's a skill that anyone can easily learn and use. No one cares that much about trivial things like whether someone's dead or alive, anymore!\n\nThis world, where the dead stride openly and unremarked through the living is where humanity has been headed all along! Our utopia! Purgatory!!
"Love" comes in many forms.\nMy love is not to take away the future. My love is not to take away your future or your freedom.
People can easily take away the future, even themselves, and take away our freedom.\nSo I hope.
I want people to like me. I want you to like a lot of people.\nThen there will be no fighting, no taking away your future, no taking away your freedom.
For this purpose, I will use my own life for this love.\nThat...I vowed.
