"Pinocchio! How's it going? I thought you might be a little tired by now, so I'll take the Corrective Measures off for a bit, okay?"\n\n"Th...Thank you...I thought I was going to die if I had to stay like that any longer...!"
Five minutes later.\n"Alright! I think that's enough of a break! You've only got 99 sets left, so let's get back to it!"
Heroes who once ruled the battlefield. The princess accused of being the wench of the castle. The filthy beggar who perished on the streets. Or the newborn baby who's death came too soon...
In death we are the same. Gone is our soul the reaper claims and likewise our flesh to the earth whence it came. For only in death is there true equality.
So take heart, forsaken survivors. Do not grieve for the dead. Blessed is the serenity bestowed to them. Rejoice in their tranquil slumber for they are at peace.

He who mourned at the funeral as we laid their body to rest... The deadman's soul looked on with pity. For the afterlife is but the next phase in our existence—a world of boundless inequality that lasts forevermore. And be it known, they too had knew...it would be a very harsh place for liars.
Long ago, a single firebird lived on a mountain. It was quite the rare sort of bird, and indeed, the only one of its kind on the mountain, without any fellows to call its own.

This solitary firebird loved to sing. It would soar to the mountain's highest point, and serenade all the creatures who called the mountain home. Its voice was so wonderfully beautiful, that all who heard it felt a profound peace in their hearts. One day, in its search for a companion, the firebird flew as far afield as the mountain's foothills, where humans were known to dwell.

The people of the foothills welcomed the firebird, with its beautiful voice. However, its presence soon lead to conflict as they fought among themselves to posses the rare bird. This saddened the firebird greatly, and a young man approached it, promising to craft a flute that would make such sweet melodies people would cease to covet the firebird so fiercely.

The young man did as he said, creating a beautifully melodious harp, and the human's passion towards the firebird did indeed wane. Sadly, however, he was killed by those who'd grown covetous of the flute. The firebird mourned him, singing a sorrowful requiem as it returned to the mountain's peak.\n\nThe firebird lived there alone until the end of its days, having lost the only friend it ever made.

He'd killed five brothers, and their lord father, boiled away his gold like it was water in a teapot as he secured the allegiance of nobility across the board. At long last, the time had finally come to place the crown he'd coveted so long upon his own head. It was then that he finally realized the feeling that had plagued him so long, the yearning he'd suffered with, was gone.

The view from the throne was boring as hell. The only thing the heavy crown was for was giving him upper back pain, and honestly he wanted to chuck the damn thing across the room half the time. He didn't know what he'd been thinking, back when he'd wanted to be king, so sure that the view from the throne would be dazzling. Equally sure that the beautiful crown could never truly be his. It was just too improbable.

The moment he'd gotten his hands on his goal, his world had turned to gray dust and ashes. There was nothing to interest him in any of it, not the beautiful princess betrothed to him, not the vast country under his control.\n\nHe understood his own nature, now. The struggle itself, that was what had given his life meaning. The dream, now that it had been achieved, was worth less than a pebble on the roadside.

That very day, he quit the castle, never to return. He was determined to search for a new dream, even more unattainable than his first. He kept searching, determined to find a dream big enough to stake his life. He grew old and withered and even then searched on, unaware that his quest for a new dream had become the struggle that gave his life meaning.
In Another World Entry 1\nThe slave trader reminded me that there's no refunds if slaves run away.\nI've never seen a world so infested with scum.

In Another World Entry 2
It was my first time having a meal with the girl.
If I'd to guess, she didn't think she was allowed to eat.
What did they put this poor girl through?

In Another World Entry 3
She won't do anything unless ordered. I get that she's been brought up like that, but in no way is that right.
But there's no other way to get through to her.
I hate this.

In Another World Entry 4
Mili arrived to this world way before me.
But what I'm really worried about is this girl.
What if she really is Rem? And she came here much, much, much earlier than the two of us?
It scares me to think that's a possibility.
I've never felt this way before.
The kingdom had become frozen.\nAnd it was done by one single man.
What he desired was an eternal pause.
It was the only way to save his wife. She was sure to die if the disease continued to progress.
His wish was granted. And for his wife's sake, he and the entire kingdom slowly froze to ice.
11/25 10:00\nOn this day, a young investigator came to my home. Without saying a word, he pulled from his bag a black folder with an A4-sized report inside. Then he handed it to me.

<Dosage> <Location> <# Found> <# of Deaths>
1mg - Shoulder - 0/30
1mg - Ear - 0/30
5mg - Skin - 1/10 - 10/10
100mg - Oral - 1/2 - 2/2
250mg - Oral - 30/30 - 29/30

Note: Disposed of by the executioner post-insanity.

The report was littered with unsettling words like death and execution. The man went on to say it bore all the hallmarks of human experimentation. In the basement of the facility, people called "test subjects" were captured and forced to "dream." After seeing this dream over and over, subjects would lose all sense of reason and attack people.

The truth of Iwama's death finally dawned on me. He was most likely murdered because he tried to uncover the truth about the human experiments at the laboratory. The moment I realized this, a chill ran down my spine.
11/27 14:30\n"He desperately tried to get the test subject to recall he was a human being. I couldn't help but snicker at my colleague's stupidity."
"After a while, he started to irresponsibly favor one subject over the other. It was a woman. At this point, I knew exactly where this was going..."
"He took off with our test subject. What happened next should be obvious. No one escapes the executioner. All that remains now are two corpses and a tragic but ridiculous love story..."

I stopped the recorder. The old man's forehead was beaded with sweat. It was thanks to the investigator's connections that I could meet him, but I knew I couldn't press any further. The former scientist from the facility finished his now lukewarm coffee, and rushed out of the cafe as if trying to escape.

11/28 07:41\nI heard my phone ringing in the morning. Still drowsy from my slumber, I lazily answered, only to find it was that female investigator. In an anxious voice, she urged me to turn on the TV.

[News Broadcast]\nThe body of a man was found in front of Shinjuku Central earlier today. The victim was identified as Nobuhiko Tachibana, age 52. He was unemployed at the time. His body bears injuries similar to those of a journalist slain seven days prior. Police believe the incidents are connected, and consider them to have been committed by the same perpetrator.

The photo of the victim that flashed on screen next left me frozen. It was the former scientist that I interviewed just yesterday. When I searched for his name online, details of the crime, including the words, "found dead with his brain extracted" immediately appeared. It was exactly the same as Iwama's death.

I wasn't sure if my interview yesterday was the direct cause of the scientist's death, but I was certain that both my life and the life of the investigator would be in jeopardy if we pressed further. Perhaps sensing my apprehension, the woman on the line said, "Should I hang up?" Iwama's face flashed before me. "Journalism is a dangerous job," I replied, in an attempt to shake away my fears.

12/3 14:41\nWith the investigator's help, I wrote up an expose on the facility and took it to a publisher I had a good relationship with. After reading what I had written, they left the room and returned a half hour later. His expression appeared much bleaker than before. Extending the papers back to me he said, "I couldn't get the green light to publish it. I'm sorry."

12/03 15:41\nNow my only option was to take it to a different publisher. So I left the building and walked towards the station. However, on my way there I suddenly got the feeling I was being followed. I turned around and saw a thuggish man weaking a mask. In his hand was what looked like a blade, its tip pointed right at me. He lunged at me, but I dodged the attack and ran straight into the crowd.

12/03 23:01\nAs soon as I got back to my room, I dialed up the female investigator. When she heard what happened, she guessed it was because I took my findings to get published. A few hours later, she was here with me, lying on my bed. I was completely worn out. The fear of not knowing who I was fighting against had drained me. When I reached out to her for comfort, she did not reject me.

12/04 08:24\nThe next morning, I walked the woman home. The river was lined with pink cherry blossoms. Thanking her for spending the night, I removed a petal that fluttered down on her shoulder. When we parted ways, she said in the softest voice, "Don't hesitate to call again whenever you're feeling worried."

12/11 18:00\nI was looking through a pile of documents I had gathered. They were lists of employees from various companies in Japan, both giant corporations and small businesses. I noticed that the name "Maeda" appeared on every list.
Over the past week, I've asked several detective agencies to look into this Maeda. As it turned out, he was indeed working for dozens upon dozens of companies.

He held an array of titles, such as director of a large company, head of the Metropolitan Police Department, editor-in-chief for a mid-sized publisher, and president of a small business. According to the agencies' investigations, he was accused of harassing a subordinate to the point of suicide, but at another company, it was said he had to take medication at work just to cope with the daily berating from his boss.

It's not just that his name is on all these lists, but he also worked for all these firms for a decent period of time. It would be impossible for a person to undertake this many roles at once. I'm still not sure how this Maeda is involved, but something fishy is going on. As the investigation progressed, the mystery of who he was only deepened.
I wanna see something! I wanna know if a person can live all by themselves. No crying allowed! I already fed all your friends to wolves, okay?
Man, I'm sooo jealous of you! I mean, you've got another little person growing inside you so you're not really alone, now, are you? It's really lonely being all by yourself with no one to play with.
You know, I heard something pretty cool! You're supposed to judge people on what's inside, not on how they look! And it's totally true, too! I mean, even awful people have nice and neat insides!

Awww, now I'm seriously jealous! I wanna have a baby to hold like that, too! And when it got bigger we could play together! Whaddaya think, friend Snake? I really want to have a nice baby just like she does...

The torch bearing the holy flame from the holy dragon has been carried off in a raid. Placing this torch on the Kingdom's alter is enough to guarantee a year of protection...but if the flame is snuffed out before the time has elapsed, the kingdom will fall prey to dire calamity. We must reclaim the torch, come what may.

Running through the town with the torch in one hand, I'm assailed all at once by a chill wind, and a shadow begins to fall over the sun. When I look up, I see clouds gathering. Rain starts, quickly building to a downpour. I have to hurry!

The icy wind grates against my cheeks, whipping the flame of the torch until it wavers. No good, no good...I've got to get out of this! I cast around, eyes settling on a small mill. I shove open the door in a panic, coming face to face with the shocked eyes of the couple who live there. It seems I've interrupted their date night.

I quickly draw my blade with my empty hand, killing them both before breathing a sigh of relief. As I exhale, my breath sends the cloud of flour swirling. The...cloud of flour that got kicked up in the struggle. The cloud of flour that ignites upon hitting the open flame of the torch blowing the tiny mill house sky high.

In a certain little chapel, there sat a magnificent, if antique organ. It was said to have been passed down from a master of his craft, and the records at the time said the melodies it produced were so sublime that they never failed to catch the attention of Heaven. Unfortunately, the organ had sat silent for a great many years now. No matter how skilled a performer brought their fingers to its keys, that silence remained unbroken.

It didn't seem to be broken, an none who examined it could determine the reason the sound refused to play. Because of this, although the organ certainly had value as a historical artifact, it was set aside in the chapel as a silly curio with no practical use.\n\n...However, in recent years, an individual has come forward who possesses the ability to play this organ: A young girl who happened by chance to touch the organ, one day.

When her fingertip brushed the keys by chance, the organ immediately produced a lovely note which hung in the air and charmed everyone present in the chapel. Things weren't meant to be, however. The girl was terminally ill, and before long she took her own life. The very day she passed from the world, the organ sank into a silence as deep as an arctic night.

"it seemed the organ had loved that girl, and now that she was separated from it by death, it grieved, closing its heart away. I believe, however, that one day its heart will heal, and when that happens, be it a decade or a century from now, the chapel will once more resound with music so beautiful the Heavens will stop to listen."\n...As the Priest finished speaking, the organ made a soft, sorrowful sound, almost as if in response.
Once, a certain man's family was killed in the course of a robbery, and the successful robber became quite rich off of the endeavor.

Time passed, and the course of events was changed by this random crime. As a result, things that were not meant to happen began to take place, and the man and those around him found their fates altered.
Good people are not necessarily rewarded, and nor are the evil necessarily punished. There's no sense to it, and people have called this proof that no deity orders the way of things in this world.

Yet...such a deity did exist. She was prone to following her whims and loved mischief, traits which occasionally lead her to do things that were really quite cruel, just to see what would happen. She really didn't care a whit, and fittingly, none of her mortal subjects really cared much about her either, as a result.

Ruling over the continent was a great king of a powerful nation, famous for his amorous nature. Because of this, he was often visited by undercover female assassins. On more than one occasion, he would share his bed with another woman who would ultimately flash a knife at him. The strangest of them all was a woman whose skin contained poison. Anyone who laid their hands on her were doomed to die in agony.

However, before the woman could come near the king, her cover was blown and was immediately executed—but fear of a second poisoned women made the minister uneasy. As a countermeasure, he produced a silver knife that the king would keep on him at all times. If he were to ever encounter an unknown woman, he would use it to confirm her skin was safe.

Gradually, the king's paranoia grew more and more severe. For all he knew, the woman's fingernails, teeth, the blood in her veins, or even her organ could be infected with poison. It wasn't until he finally pierced, gouged, and XXed every inch of the woman's body that he felt relieved.

The king had gone completely mad with fear he would die without a heir. Although his fear had spread amongst his subjects, the minster remained unconcerned. If he does not have a son, the throne would be succeeded by the royal prince, securing the nation's future. But as the minister grinned, the bloodthirsty king raised his silver knife from behind.

I was never that close to my father to begin with. What do I care if my stepmother takes the inheritance all for herself? My wife is all I need in this world. She my one and only jewel. As long as I can make enough money to feed the two of us, I'm fine with that.

How could I ever me a good father if I wasn't a very good son to my own? Due to the doctor's misdiagnosis, my wife had a miscarriage that would prevent her from ever bearing another child. But it's okay. I still have my wife beside me.

Being a ghost writer, I don't have to stand to work. Isn't that great? Besides, even if the right side of my body became paralyzed from a drunken carriage accident, I still have my wife. That's all I need.

You want me to leave my wife? That's ridiculous. What do you mean my stepmother, the doctor, and the driver are all dead? My wife isn't some demon. She wouldn't slaughter them all on behalf of me. Oh, honey. We have a visitor. Can you bring some tea? Eh? Why do you have a scythe?

I don't think I've seen you around these parts before. You must be a newcomer. Every one of us is scarred one way or another, so we don't dig around each other's pasts. That's the law in this den, newbie.
I saw that new guy smokin' a pricy cigar. I bet he's got treasure hidden somewhere. What'dya say we get him to talk? It might make a fortune from it!

...You're really getting on my nerves. You could have saved yourself from suffering if you'd hurry up and spit it out already! What's that? We'll be in some deep shit for this? Gahaha! You should be worrying about yerself! Too-da-loo, buddy boy.
H-hold on a sec! How was I supposed to know the new guy was the head honcho of the underground?! No! Don't cut my hands and feet! I don't want to be fed to wolves! Aghh! Stop! Please! NOOOOO!!!
It was that mycelium-shaped house that attracted people like a magnet.
Enchanted by its warm invitation, a man approached the house and when he stepped inside, he immediately began to hallucinate.
But what he saw was far from pleasant. Sometimes he saw things in 2D; other times the images were so extreme it frightened him.
Despite that, he continued to immerse himself in the world of what he was certain to be a hallucination for he had felt bored of his daily life. And so, he never stepped foot from it again.

By the gods! O Stone Guardian, why should extend my life be a sign of my loyalty to you?! For without me, the high priesthood will cease to exist and havoc will run loose! Please, accept my son as a replacement!

My heavens! O Stone Guardian, what brings you to doubt my loyalty once more?! I cannot die now. Who else will gather believers? It would merely delay the establishment of an earthly paradise by ten more years! Please, may we swallow our tears and accept my daughter as a sacrifice!

For the love of god! O Stone Guardian, why do you desire my life so much?! Ngh... You leave me no choice but to offer my wife as a sacrifice! Please, I beg you not to question my sincerity any longer!

Now, O Stone Guadian, I bring to you the high priest. Boil him, roast him, may you do as you please! Who am I? Why, I am this man's lover. I am certain he plans to use me as his next sacrifice, so I'm taking the initiative.

This is the story of a woman who had lost her husband. Although she loved the ocean, it took her only beloved child away from her. Since then, she has not been able to go near the sea, spending her remaining days in agony. Until one day when she meets a man.

The man had been clutching a staff with a conch attached to it. Apparently, when he dropped his staff in the water, the thing was glued to it. At first, she was wary of this man who reminded her of the dreadful sea. But since he seemed kind, she eventually found it in her heart to forgive him.

She would smile listening to his tales about the ocean. One day, he encouraged her to lean her ear against the conch on his staff. However, what she heard was not the crashing of waves—but the mournful cries of her departed child.\n"That man killed me!"

Enraged, she bludgeoned the man to death with his own staff. Then, wrapping her arms as if holding her own child, she thrusted the staff into her own chest. Both bodies were swallowed up by the tides. Somewhere along the shore, the staff washed up to an unexpecting man. He raised the conch to his ear.\n"That man killed me!"

You can cut them, cut them! ♪
Crush 'em small and you can cut them! ♪
You can cut them, cut them! ♪
Cut those calories, down, down, down! ♪

You can offset, offset! ♪
Chew and chew and you can offset! ♪
You can offset, offset! ♪
Crush until there's only bits! ♪

You can slim down, slim down! ♪
I mean, probably you can slim down! ♪
You can, right? Slim down? ♪
Please say it's possible! I believe I'll slim down!♪

I knew it, I knew it! ♪
I really knew it all along...! ♪

...I can't believe I used to be so dumb...! ♪

■ Journal Entry 1
-One month has passed since arriving to this world.
-I've been receiving an influx of requests to exterminate beasts in the city. But it pleases me that I'm needed by these people.
-I'm worried about everyone in the Mathers domain.
■ Journal Entry 2\n-It's been two months now in this world.\n-Rumors have been circulating that whoever kills Wolgarm will be rewarded by me.
■ Journal Entry 3\n-I listened to this month's reports. However, it doesn't appear anyone else from the mansion came to this world.\n-We're beginning preparations to take down Wolgarm.
■ Memo\nIt is lonely being on my own.\nSo much time has passed without a sign of a single person from my original world... Perhaps I'll never see anyone ever again.
I've been having reoccurring dreams lately. Not the same, but very similar.\nAnd in each of them Barusu dies. They're such horrifying dreams.
Speaking of which, I believe I had another similar one three months ago. But in that one, I saw Emilia crying all alone.
I can't remember what it was about anymore, but I had a similar incident when I was younger. Regardless, it was a very sorrowful dream...
If I could see myself in a dream, I'd want it to be me dashing to Roswaal's rescue! Sadly it's only wishful thinking.
Remorseful Diary 1\nI'm sorry I was incapable of performing what you ordered me. I promise it won't happen again.\nI'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

Remorseful Diary 2
I messed up again today.
Ow... It hurts...
I'm sorry...
I'll do it right next time.
I'll do exactly as you say.

Remorseful Diary 3
It's dark and cold outside.
There's a dog here next to me.
We both have matching collars.
It's a little less lonely with him here.

Remorseful Diary 4
I had a dream today.
I was living in a large mansion.
I was eating my favorite sweet potatoes.
I had a very kind older sister.
I hope I'll get to live a life of happiness like that one day.
Tale of Sword Saint in Another World 5-1\n"It appears I'm a wanted man in this world."\nConfronting the red-haired boy stood a bewitching woman by the name of Kaguya.

Tale of Sword Saint in Another World 5-2
"It would be wrong for me to be rough with a woman..."
"Oh, but I must insist.
It's not every day I encounter such a strong gentleman."

Tale of Sword Saint in Another World 5-3
The clash of steel echoes in the alleyway.
It was enough to determine their opponent's strength.
"No choice. You've forced me to raise my hand."
"That's it! Torment me to your heart's content!"

Tale of Sword Saint in Another World 5-4
"That makes five monsters in this world since my arrival.
I just wish those weird puppets would leave me alone already..."
Reinhard had little time to relax, for another assassin was closing up behind him.

These seeds here, you plant them.
Plant one of them in the heart of the person you love.
I highly recommend red flowers.
They grow through flesh and blood, so it's absolutely beautiful when they fully bloom.
It gushes with love and affection because it shares a part of them.

My mother went first. She was a good mother to me.
I didn't have a father, so to me she was like a goddess.
So when she died, it left me devastated...
That's when the idea hit me. I'd plant one of roses she used to grow inside of her.

Corpses release a strange smell when they begin to rot.
But what I learned is that the smell isn't so bad anymore when you plant flowers in them.
Like, even the soil smells different. Fresh and full of nutrients.
The problem is when the flesh gets soft. When that happens I use the bathtub as a planter...
You can tell I worked hard to grow it.

If there's someone out there who you think would bloom a beautiful flower... That's love.
That's how I knew I was in love. I could see already see the flower to be from her.
There's no turning back.
...I'm going to plant it while she's still alive.
I was in the forest chasing a pretty butterfly when a beautiful lady came and played with me.\nShe knew a lot about flowers and taught me the names of all sorts of 'em.
The lady from the forest came stopped by my porch and played with me again.\nThis time she gave me yummy flower honey.\nIt was fun talking to her as we ate it.

I really like the lady.
She smells like flowers and is nice to me.
If only I wasn't such a kid...
But I've decided to confess to her tomorrow.
I didn't see the lady today.\nI did finally catch that butterfly from the forest the other day.\nI'll keep it as a specimen.

I was awoken by the cry of someone's death in the distance.
As my mind and vision focused, I realized I had become a small child.
So I guess this is reincarnation.
I have clear memories of my previous life.
In that time, I lived the life of a murderous bandit.

I guess I'm just a bad guy to my very core.
For whatever reason, I became a thief in this life as well.
But for some reason, when I went to steal from a castle, I noticed the archer I killed in my past life guarding it.
Everything's repeating itself. Everything's beginning to play out just as it did back then.

On his last breath, the archer fired his final shot at me. It missed me completely.
And again I watched him die. In exactly the same fashion as my old life.
It was too late. Just as I remembered that was the moment my memory cut off, I felt a shock at my throat.
The last thing I saw was my own blood running coating the arrowhead that had impaled me.

"Take that! That's the same arrow I shot in my previous life...!"
The arrow the archer shot before his death in that life had somehow traveled through time to kill me in the present.
I let out a painful scream, the last that would escape from my mouth.
The next thing I knew, I was awoken by the cry of someone's death in the distance.

Diplomatic negotiations were unsuccessful, and the enemy had invaded the kingdom. The difference in military strength was overwhelming. The kingdom's soldiers fought back, but in the end were outnumbered.
The musician of the kingdom strummed his lyre.\nIt was a magical instrument said to be used in times of trouble.
When the enemy heard his performance, they suddenly grew angry. Unable to keep their composure, they fell for every trick in the book.\nThe winds shifted in the kingdom's favor.

However, the lyre was originally the kingdom's beloved treasure. But their mild disposition resulted in their overthrow by the current kingdom. The people of this kingdom were hot-headed already. As the melody continued, so did their rage.\nIn the end, both armies suffered a great many casualties and the victor left undecided...
I want to be liked by a plethora of men. But there's only one of me, so there'll always be a limit to how many I can meet.
Maybe I can play a song—one that will increase their desire to befriend me despite being strangers.
The curtains open. All eyes are focused on my dazzling outfit. I sing with all of my heart, hoping to meet the audiences expectations and fulfill my own desires.
My plan worked! But I forgot one important thing. The ugly jealousy that encumbers women. So...next time I'll just have to get rid of them all.

Have you heard of the master performer who was knighted by the King? Well, it is I! But due to an unfortunate event, I've quit the acting business. During a rehearsal, I accidentally severed a tendon with a dagger. My days on the stage are over. My dear wife who's also an actress, organized a grand party and many people came to cheer me up. After all that, I changed my career and am now a screenwriter.

I wrote a manuscript and pitched it to various theater groups through my agent, but I got no takers. I had my wife read over my work. To my dismay she commented, "You were an okay actor, but this reads like it's written by a third-rate playwright."\nI was furious. I tried to swing at her from the bed, but I was clumsy and tumbled to the floor.

Since then, my relationship with my wife quickly became frigid. "All you have to do is stay home and wait for me," she said. "I can make enough money for the two of us to survive."\nI despised the way she had pitied me. Cursing I hurled all sorts of objects at her. Having had enough, she packed her bags and left. Days later, I received a letter of divorce from her and news that she was remarrying my agent.

Some time later, one of my students came to visit me. He told me that the day I severed my tendon, he saw my agent creeping out of the dressing room. Could it have been my agent who slipped the dagger into my costume and caused my injury? Was it an attempt to kill me just so he could steal my wife? It was impossible to prove. Be that as it may, that dagger ruined everything.

A man reached the end of an expedition, and found for himself the Unicorn Spire. It was the tool he needed to defeat the Administrator, who sat astride the world banishing chaos and filling everything with unbearably tedious order.\n\nThe Administrator called down cataclysms, seeking to drown the man, but with the power of the Unicorn Spire, the man resisted.
Changing tacks, the Administrator caused honey to drip from the sky. Overcome with the impulse to taste it, the man could not resist.

He opened his mouth to the honey. It was the most exquisite sweetness in the world, and more than enough to make him forget his mission. Forsaking his cause for pleasure, the man tumbled into the abyss.
The Unicorn Spire watched as the honey it had proffered led the man to his death, making sure its job was done. Then, mission complete, it moved on to the another plane seeking its next bearer...

I was, as they say, born with the a heart like that of tigers or wolves. I've sullied my hands with any number of foul acts, and never scrupled to starve another to feed myself. So, don't waste your words, Father. I'm not gonna repent, I don't want your redemption, and Hell sounds like a pretty fun place, actually. Now, it's time for you to go.

You're a bit late, aren't you, Father?\n...Oh, your son has a fever? I used to have a kid, you know? The brat was dumb as a brick, always picking fights over stupid shit. Went and got himself killed in one of those fights, just like that. Hm? What's with the waterworks, Father? You're sorry for my loss? Tch, what loss? I'm much better off!

What?! That old priest died of a broken heart after he lost his son to illness...? That's... Tch, why's a good guy like that gotta kick it but a total bastard like me gets to keep breathing? Hey...can I go to the funeral? Just lemme out of here for a day, I've gotta give him a piece of my mind, before they put him in the ground!

Ahaha, I heard that ruthless criminal broke down crying when they told him I died. I really got him with that story I made up about having a kid. God, this is priceless. Anyway, I think it's pretty clear I won the bet so I'll be taking this...!\n\nHm? What's with that expression? ...Standing right behind me? Who is?
Something was odd about the dream the Serpent showed me. I did exactly as it told me and yet afterwards it still had no trouble finding any number of reasons to scold me.
Today is no different. One of the seniors pushed all the unpleasant work onto me and went home early. I have no choice but to do my best. I have my orders, after all.
At first everyone had the grace to at least keep their comments out of my earshot. Now, they badmouth me right to my face. Lately just being there fills my chest with a horrible buzz of anxiety.

I'm so jealous...I just want to be like everyone else, to cheerfully join in a normal conversation. But...something like that really is out of my reach. Isn't there anyone in the world who would accommodate me?

The sea roars, waves crashing into the creaking hull now viciously swaying side to side. I feel a pain in my stomach as if my insides were being squeezed tight.\nMy fate was sealed this evening. There was no escaping this great storm. It'll take me under.

Looking back, I wouldn't say I've lived a cursed life. While not everything I experienced was good, it wasn't all that bad either.\nBut since I'll soon disappear into these treacherous waters, there is one confession I'd like to make.

I...took part in a massacre.\nIt was orders from His Majesty. "There's a wretched stench coming from the slums. I don't want any of those ants escaping. Burn it and everything inside to the ground. Make it look like an accident." Thousands upon thousands of innocent lives were taken...\nI'll never forget those flames and the excruciating wails of the people they devoured...even if I'm sent to Hell.

[Memorandum of Gwynn, Military Physician]\nIn accordance to His Majesty's request, we've completed a truth serum. Whoever drinks it will be put under the illusion that they are on the verge of death, and will confess all their secrets.\nHowever, His Majesty is an evil man. One day the people will revolt against him, and when they do, so will I!
The staff sings an eulogy.
A song for the dead, it extends out a hand to appease and comfort their souls.
As the song echoes across the land, so spreads its prayer.
Tonight may you rest in peace. For there is nothing more you can offer the living...

My conscious was suddenly snapped awake. I was in the middle of taking notes in the judge's chamber when I suddenly dozed off. I shook my left and right in an attempt to shake off my drowsiness. How inappropriate it was for me to fall asleep while taking on the important role of judge. I need to have better self-discipline. Just then, there came a knock on the door.

The door opened and in walked my assistant. Keeping my eyes on my work, I took the cup of tea he offered and brought it to my lips. The warm liquid slid down my throat. Immediately after, I felt the back of my tongue go numb, then my limbs. I looked back at my assistant and gasped. How did I not notice? This was the same thug who was convicted for assaulting children.

My eyes scanned the rest of the room. Over in the corner was an arsonist chuckling to himself, another was a serial killer giving an arrogant grin, and then the last one was a kidnapper sneering at me. They were all criminals I sentenced to death in my court room. Wh-what the hell is all this?!

I straining my neck to view the documents on my desk. It was my entire personal record. In there it stated that I was condemning myself to death for judging others while in the body of a human being. At the bottom was my signature and seal.\n...I see now. I knew I would never be forgiven if I were to continue living the rest of my days in luxury. So I hung myself. This must be what's known as the brink of death.

There were a group of pioneers who set sail in search of a new continent. However, when the crew got caught up in a raging storm, only a small number survived. Those who did drifted to land where they were picked up by locals holding stone axes. While the communication barrier and difference in culture had the locals skeptical, the surviving crew members eventually won their trust and were provided land, homes, and the means to support themselves.

However, the one thing the crew members could not adjust to was the new continent's staple food: rice. Longing for the taste of bread, they gathered tools and materials to build stone ovens. The crew members shared their freshly baked bread with the inquisitive locals, and their faces broke into wide smiles.

Rumors of the bread spread across the continent, and soon many people had learned how to build ovens and bake it. Though the pioneers were pleased they could trade their creation for a good price, there were those who opposed them. One day, they were attacked by a group who claimed they were spreading the devil's food. The group destroyed all the ovens and slew most of the pioneers.

The group, however, was no match for those who praised the discovery of bread. Enraged by their barbaric acts, the people stood divided, triggering a civil war. Conflict over food is a terrifying thing.

A steed of such beauty, there's no doubt it's worthy of the name Pegaus. That is the steed you'll get to ride today. And where will you go...? Shall you go to work? Will you take Pegasus for a spin down to that craft beer place you like? No, you're going to try to pick up girls on Pegasus, aren't you. Don't lie.

Well, eventually one of those girls is going to start thinking about how to get you to stay. It's that steed. Pegasus. Why not turn it into an instrument, she'll think. As one does. Surely such a beautiful steed would make beautiful music, too?

So, now Pegasus is grounded, and so are your joyrides to pick up girls. As for me, I'm trying to play my new instrument. Sounds uncannily like a horse whinnying and causes things in the surrounding environment to spontaneously combust. Huh. It seems I've caught fire as well.

The flames known as Pegasus Cry are an expression of rage. I finally understand. You loved that horse more than anything else, all along. Doesn't really change anything, though. It still took you away from me. Better the three of us all burn, together.
I'm so sad.\nOur new information-based society is structured in such a way that it leaves behind the indolent and the traditionalists.
I have a dream, a dream that I might one day create a completed tragedy. But the only one who believes in me is you, Bear.

As you mocked me for blaming my own sloth on others, Bear, your expression was brighter and more alive than I've ever seen it...that was the first time I understood that my dream would never come true.

Talent + Education + Practice. That's the formula that decides ability. I've understood that much, at least, for ages. Still, I refused to acknowledge my own lack of ability. Tell me, how did I look to you? ...Dreaming of a tragedy, the final act decided before it even began.

[Guest]\nAre you the death row inmate who's been crying all this time? Well, after all the sins you committed, I guess that's to be expected. Although your death is inevitable, I believe there's a way to alleviate your grief. Just listen to what I have to say.

[Inmate]\nI did as they instructed. I closed my eyes and envisioned a flicker of light in the darkness that I could manipulate. Thanks to that, I'm seeing the kind of dreams I always wanted. Living in reality is hard, but in my dreams I can be happy. If I think of those dreams as reality, then I don't have to drown in tears till my death.

[Guard]\nI don't know what happened. The inmate that was sentenced to death row was crying not to long ago, but now they've cheered up. It was depressing to hear at first, but now he looks to have no remorse... It's pissing me off!

[Victim's Family]\nThe blade failed to make a clean cut each time it dropped, so it must have been a slow and excruciating death. Well worth the bribe we paid to have the guillotine blade dulled.\nI heard he went from crying all the time to laughing around the clock. That's why you have to make them suffer to the point they crave death before they're killed.

One day, a hero hailed for their many achievements had been murdered. Beside him laid his most beloved spear. But the question on the people's mind was what person could have succeeded in killing such a hero who also mastered in martial arts?
From the moment he was born into the world, the hero was briming of joy. He loved the world and was even more delighted he could be a part of it.

His mere existence would bring change to the world. He was certain of this. He believed that he was different than the superficial and omnipotence of youth. But this belief would not last forever. One day, feelings about his existence slightly began to waver inside himself.

He thought about his current willpower, the possible expeditions he could make, and based off his past experiences, took a gander at what he'd be able to accomplish. But he concluded that he'd never make it. He'd fail to reach the greatness he had envisioned for himself—deeds that would be talked about for thousands of years to come. And so, he made the decision to take his own life...

An endless sea without land in sight. A vast deep blue in every direction.
Inhabiting these waters is a large fish with magnificent fins.
Rising to the surface, it opened its massive jaw and drifted at sea collecting other small organisms as its meal.
Day in and day out it swam, until one day, it was pierced by a harpoon.

The harpoon pierced straight through its gills.\nHowever, the big fish paid no mind, for the strength of the fisherman was miniscule in comparison.\nThe big fish continued to swim, and the man released his grip on the harpoon.

The large fish continued its swim with the harpoon still intact.\nEven when a white cloth wrapped itself around the long pole, eventually staining black, the fish did not stop.\nAt the same time, the harpoon began to tear at the fish's giant body.

Eventually, the harpoon had decapitated the fish... But even that would not stop the fish from swimming.
How could the fish know when it's been swimming in the same backdrop, the same scenery?
The harpoon, acting as an anchor, sunk down to the ocean floor, dragging with it the fishes body.
Eventually, the big fish's body, harpoon, and shells would fossilize together to be fabricated into a staff by men.
Despite this, the head of the large fish would continue to swim and feed throughout the vast and unchanging sea.

[Master]\nWhat do you think you're doing slacking off?! Kids nowadays are nothing but lazy. They don't want to put effort into anything! Always trying to find the easy way out! I'm the King of Blacksmithing! You should know better if you expect to be my apprentice!

[Master]\nNow you bring a woman into my shop?! Are you mad?! To strike iron is to strike one's heart. This is the vow we tell the inner god within us! And yet here you are engaging in an affair of all things in this sacred place!
[Master]\nUntie me now! Don't play me like a goose, apprentice! What? You've had enough of my criticism, so you're going to have me disappear in the night? Wh-Why you ungrateful bastard!

[Apprentice]\nSee for yourself, Master. Thanks to you, I've made it big and have a shop for myself. It's a good thing you passed away and possessed this hammer, huh? All that scolding did some good. Huh? Can't you see I'm working? You're doing just fine chastising me.
We can keep on living because there is hope. No matter how poor or hungry we may be, because we have hope, there will always be a reason to survive.
We can keep on living because there is freedom. No matter how poor or hungry we may be, because we have the freedom to make our own choices, there will always be a reason to survive.
Our hope. Our only freedom. We each received a small pistol from the country we're supposed to love.

A beacon of hope that we may pass away comfortably at any time. The freedom to decide for ourselves our final moments, no matter how painful and excruciating they may be. As long as we have this, there is happiness.
After being subjected to never-ending torture, they eventually gave up resisting.
They put up no fight, and died at the hands of their enemies.
Many thought them cowards and described the act as just a means to escape.
But despite what the people said, they had already died. No more would they have to suffer in this life...

[Surviving Wander]\nI honestly didn't think we'd make it. After all that happened, I could have sworn we'd be goners by now. Now that the war's over and the mercenary force has been disbanded, there's no need for us. Say, you've got a wife and kids back home, don'tcha? Take care of 'em. As for me, I'm a loner. I'll find somewhere to go.

[Wander & Dark Magician]\nPoor guy didn't have a chance. We come in for a celebratory drink, he gets drunk, then whatd'ya know, he kicks the bucket. ...Err? Who are you? Dark magician? You don't say... What? I can take the dead guy's place if I want? Well, I don't have anyone waitin' for me, so why the hell not? Gah, what's with this strange light around me?

[Wander's Regret]\nI replaced that guy and got myself a loving wife n' kids, didn't I? So why the hell am I so unhappy? Ah! You're that black magician again! Ah, um... Thanks for doin' the switch-a-roo thing for me, but I'm a wander at heart. I ain't cut for this whole stayin' in one place thing. Any chance you can turn me back?

[Wander Arrested]\nToday, a reputed family man has been arrested on suspicion of beating a traveler to death. Showing no signs of remorse, the man gave a cryptic response as his motive. He stated, "It was the only way I could get my life back. Since I couldn't return to my original body, I chose another man who appeared to live on his own to replace."\nOfficers speculate that the harsh experiences during his mercenary days had caused the man to snap.

O God! For it is me, the king of the human realm and an admirer of song! If you continue to cry, you'll destroy my home with frequent tornadoes, storms, and earthquakes! Oh, heaven no! I'm not blaming you for it, but please hold back your tears! If it will help, I'll punish the clan who worships the disobedient god!

O God! For it is me, the king of the human realm and an admirer of song! I had punished that unruly clan and dried your tears, but why do you cry again? Thanks to you, volcanos have erupted, floods are swallowing the earth, and I am tormented by extreme weather conditions... I beg of you! Please don't cry! If it will help, I'll execute those who conduct research that threatens bioethics!

O God! For it is me, the king of the human realm and an admirer of song! After killing all the scientists, you grew calm and content. But now why do you cry? Thanks to you, there are wildfires, terrible harvests, and heavy rains... Um, don't you find it pointless to cry? I have crushed all those who threaten you. What more do you want of me?

O God! For it is me, the king of the human realm and an admirer of song! Now that all your adversaries are ridden, it seems for I have become your only enemy. If I come out victorious, all the better. But if I am to fail and perish, at least the world will regain peace again, even if only for a short time. Now then, I await for you on the battlefield.

My people look towards a great temple as the symbol of our nation, and the priestess who presides over it is revered as a saint. By praying to the temple god, she performs miracles that often help the royal family, support the nation, and giving alms to the people. Each generation of saints are obliged to love everyone equally.

However, each saint has one person whom they make an exception to. If a saint singles out someone in the country, they are separated from his or her family from that day and taken to an underground room below the temple where they will spend the rest of their life.

A long time ago, a saint had claimed that even they are human beings, and so, they could never love everyone equally. Because she insisted on this, the one-exception system was established. In other words, a saint is allowed to treat only one person unequally in the basement in exchange for the love she gives the rest of the nation.

Some saints brought in handsome men who they loved day in and night, others brought in young children to raise as their own, while others singled out beautiful women which they then tortured. So far this system balances out, because the saints have continued to love the people equally which being consumed with their basement counterparts. Now that you understand how it works, we'll bring you inside.
I'll plant the seeds.\nIf I do, my dream will come true.
I'll water the soil.\nIf I do, my dream will come true.
Now, it's time to harvest.\nIt's time for my dream to become a reality!
Those feelings...I cultivated them, grew them myself.\nI refuse to allow any further unsolicited commentary on my behavior! It ends now!

The overlord of the Red Peoples, with his endless bravery and daring, forced the Blue Peoples to submit and brought them under his rule. In the midst of this turmoil a single soldier of the Blue Peoples journeyed to an ancient shrine to pray that he may be given power.\n\nThe god of the shrine deigned to manifest, calling out to the soldier, "This is the Ravenous Axe. In return for granting absolute power, it consumes the life of its wielder. Will you take it up?"

The soldier considered this, and upon accepting the weapon, presented it to the Red Peoples' overlord as tribute, explaining the god's warning. With a sly smile the soldier went on to wonder if the overlord would be able to make use of the axe, knowing the man loved nothing better than a challenge.

With the Ravenous Axe in hand, the overlord was reputed to be nothing short of invincible, and other peoples were felled like wheat in the face of his battle prowess. He exalted in his victories, declaring to all and sundry that he was not so weak as to be consumed by a weapon. Before he could even finish forming the sentence, however, the man crumpled to the ground, unresponsive. Victim to a sudden cerebral haemorrhage, there was never any hope of saving him.

Even as the overlord's seven year old heir ascended the throne, the soldier who had so neatly disposed of the overlord began to foment rebellion. However, one of his subordinates, who disdained him for the cowardly and deceitful assassination of the overlord, revealed his location to the enemy and he was shortly put to death.\n\nThus did the Ravenous Axe bring ruin upon those who would wield it, whether directly or through subtler means.
The melody that would rebuild everything resounded.
It was the Hour of Destruction. All that had been built was now crumbling to their foundations.
There is no escaping this enteral fire.
Once all became nothing, a piece of existence doomed to vanish once more found a new place to call home...

At the end of the world is a castle enclosed by snow and ice. The rulers of winter, the king and queen, live inside its wall together with their twin daughters. The sisters are said to be the most beautiful people the world has ever seen with skin as white as snow, glimmering silver hair, and eyes as cold and blue as ice.

The sisters, however, desired a groom—a man to call their own. But the girls were all alone. The world was much too cold and harsh for anyone to live, and their own parents were too busy with work to put time aside for idle chit-chat. Leaving the castle was not an option, for the twins would surely die in a warm environment. Despite the sisters' beauty, no suiter would offer to live in the castle with them.

"That is why we summon you."
"We've been waiting so long for someone to pick up this book."
"Since you've flipped through its pages, it's a sign that it has chosen you."
"Unfortunately, there was no one who could live with us in our world."
"But perhaps you from another world can."

Suddenly, you find yourself inside an extremely cold castle, greeted by two stunning girls. "Welcome, dear hus—" they began to say, but the words cut out as your body froze solid. The twins heaved a heavy sigh and abandoned you on the spot. Who will their next prospective husband be? It's only a matter of time before this room will filled with many other frozen individuals.
Where do you want to go for Christmas this year?\n--Wherever's fine.
What do you want to do for Christmas this year?\n--Eh, I don't really have any strong feelings about it.
Who are you going to spend Christmas with, this year?\n--Honestly? That's what I want to know.
If only you were here...\nI know I could die without regrets.

Christmas Eve.\nA wonderful night! More than any other night the whole year, on Christmas Eve you go to sleep excited about what the next morning brings. It always feels like Christmas morning is so far away...it's always hard to sleep, and happy all the same.
Even so, some people don't like Christmas Eve at all. They know themselves better than anyone else, and hate the way the morning brings the same thing.
It's really sad, but even people like that sometimes grow up to meet someone who can make Christmas special for them. I don't know how often such a wonderful happy ending happens, though.
That's why it's okay. The present isn't everything. Even if you don't care for it now, you'll have a wonderful Christmas someday.\nThough...I can't guarantee that.
If I had someone who truly understood me, I'd want to get them a present that they'd absolutely love.
If I had someone who truly understood me, I'd want the gift I received to show they understood how powerful my feelings are.
With Christmas finally here...\nWell, even if the present I picked out isn't exactly what you wanted...do try not to let that show on your face.
I'll try my best to do the same for you.\nI'll...well, I'll do as much as I can, anyway. I mean...I'll try.

Another white Christmas, this year. Snow falling all around me, my namesake. I really do love winter. A day like this, more than any other, brings out people's kindness towards each other. It's a holiday I treasure.
Let's make a meal that will warm us, body and soul. The aroma of roasting turkey and fresh bread... Just for today, let's set aside the killing. Let's have a truce.

The table piled high with an improbable feast, the holiday revellers who just as improbably polish off each and every dish. The rush to prepare a few more dishes for the table, smiling offers to help with the meal. The rest of us, killing time together with stories and games. We're all different, but each of us wears the same warm smile.
...I wish our story had been like that.
I've acquired a bow crafted of carved ice. Everything struck with an arrow loosed from this bow bursts with spiralling blooms of ice crystal.
I shot my father. The arrow trailed glittering snowflakes as it flew. My aim was true and it stuck fast into his chest, before a lovely bloom of blue and white ice burst from within it.

It was beautiful. To see my father, a malicious tyrant who had abused his family more than he had our livestock, become the canvas upon which such beautiful art would bloom...\nNothing else I've seen has moved me quite so much as that.

Yes, it is fitting that all the tainted things of this world should be covered over with the pure and the lovely.
Things such as you.
Such as me.
Such as the world itself.
Yes, far better for all of it to be covered in a meadow of pure, glittering white.

Another day trapped in a prison of darkness. 
It's my fault I'm here, I know that. I never wanted this to happen.
I'm still here, it seems...
Can you believe it? I'm really truly, still here. Little as I want to be.

You look like you might even believe me, but I'd understand if you had doubts. It's hard to decide, isn't it? All of those days, and all the endless, sleepless nights...I don't even know how long it's been, any more.\nI thought maybe I really would be better off dying. At least I wouldn't have to think about this anymore, if I was dead...probably. I thought about that a lot. I thought about it so much that I ended up drinking. I thought and drank until one of those nights, I ended up jumping.

Unfortunately for me, that uneasiness I'd felt all along, that sense that my mind might truly be somewhere else, some unknown place, sometimes... That turned out to be true.\nI never found out why. Maybe I did it to myself, pondering that question in circles night after night.

And now, trapped in this endless eternity, with truly nothing else to do but think, I've finally arrived at the conclusion that eluded me all that time before. I had my answers, but I no longer cared about them at all. It's not like they'd do me any good, now.\nIt seems as if this must be my punishment. I, who could never reach any answers in life has found them all in my death, and they're all I'll ever have, trapped as I am with no end to this imprisonment in sight.

It's cold. It's truly, seriously cold.
Feels like the cold is all there is, with the world sealed up under all this white.
...But, suddenly, I can still feel my heart beat, still feel the blood rush in my veins.
Someone asks me if I'm alright, and I open my eyes.
A man with a beard stares down at me, brows knit in concern.

He helped me, gave me aid and succor, until I was recovered enough to walk normally on my own.\n"My men found you locked in a small box, adrift in the ice floes in the Sea of Frozen Blades. I had them save you."\nThe bearded man...the king of this land I'd now learned, told me the story of my rescue.

He asked my how I came to be trapped in that frozen sleep, and I answered. I told him of the undersea village of merpeople beneath the Sea of Frozen Blades, of how I had snuck into their lands, intent on taking some of their blood for myself, and of how magic gone awry in the battle that ensued had seen me locked in a frozen tomb.

As I spoke of the treachery of merfolk, I could see the King more than inclined to believe me. He ordered his men in retaliation to fetch the Hammer of Confining Ice, known to release explosive power at a certain amount of water pressure, and to sink it into the sea above their village.\nI thanked him, stifling my smile. In truth, I'd been justly sentenced to life imprisoned in the ice after terrorizing the merfolk with a series of murders. This landward kingdom seems like a good enough place to pick up where I left off.

A lovely young lady, with a reputation for playing lovely songs on her harp. She played and sang, waiting for a certain man's return. The man she loved.\nShe played clad in white, in the arcing halls of a grand cathedral, and the lovely sound gathered in that space and rang out for even those outside to hear. In this way, she waited.

Someone had told her to do so once, that if she stood in the great church in her white garb and played, that her song would truly call her fated love forth to her. It was a lovely proposal, and she flushed to remember it, even as she continued her serenade.

The harp itself was special, made just for this day, a spider-shaped instrument strung with a spider's silk. It was a joke between them, and she laughed to think of it, how she'd teased him about being entangled in her web.

At long last, the door of the church swung open, and a man appeared there, lit from behind by the brightness of the day. It wasn't her love, but he smiled as if he was, approaching.\n"I asked my best friend to invite you here," he said, smiling shyly. "I've loved you for so long, and I had hoped we might be married..."\nShe stared, unable to overcome the betrayed rage rising within her as she hurled the harp to the ground, more fearsome in that moment than the venomous spider that was its likeness.
9 AM\nI checked the stock prices after finishing a good workout at my own personal gym. Nothing out of the ordinary. Another good start to the day.
11:30 AM\nThe social game giants are crashing. Not to say I didn't anticipate this. Everyone knows to pay attention to what talent companies are losing. That's just the basics.
1 PM\nThe Vtuber company I invested in just plummeted. But how? They had so much promise! They do have a good music game coming up in a year, right? That should get them on their feet again.

1 Year Later\n3 PM\nThe music game was an utter failure. I should have assumed there wouldn't be a director, and I... I'm even more disappointed in myself for falling for it. I guess I paid the price for the new leak that day. Never did I imagine a session with the chairman would result in such a huge scandal...

The lord is ruthless.

The damage from the harsh winter is a sure omen of a poor harvest, but he won't lower our taxes at all. We'll starve!

What? A riot? Now, don't be hasty! Anyway, look, we just need him to see how we're suffering! We'll have plenty of time to riot afterwards, if it doesn't work!
Thank goodness, the lord is surprisingly reasonable.\n\nWe're saved! ...Hm? What's... The village is on fire?! H-Hey, everyone why are you so injured? What's going on here?!

So, you're that necromancer, right?

Can you whip me up an army of the dead? I need to kill the lord!
What? I'll regret it? Shut up, I'm not gonna regret a thing! Please, just help me! You're my last hope!

Looks like the lord's whole realm is in turmoil thanks to the guns of the zombie hoard!
Of course, what with the dead army running around, His Holiness sent the Holy Knights to take care of it.

And now, that got me in a panic, I won't lie. My son is one of the Holy Knights! I screamed for them to stop. I knew I could make them see reason, but the dead just looked at me blankly and raised their guns.

I sighed in satisfaction. The ritual was over, and I was now counted among the ranks of the glorious Papal Knights.\nBut...I hadn't expected Her Holiness to be such a marvelous woman!\nDuring the ceremony, she took my hand and smiled beatifically, telling me she expected great things. I...I'm not ashamed to admit that my traitorous heart developed expectations of its own.

The Papal Knights set out on a holy expedition, battling against the enemies of God. Upon our return, I was summoned before the Papal throne, and Her Holiness laughed warmly, congratulating me on living up to her hopes.\nIt is...difficult to describe the soaring fulfilment that blossomed in me at the sight of her smiling eyes fixed on my face. Such a smile, for one so lowly as I!

Time passed, and I continued in my holy mission to cut down the enemies of God which ran rampant across the land. The more foes I slay, the more deeds of arms I gathered to myself, until one day Her Holiness summoned me to her presence once more.\nUshered into her bedchamber, she favored me with that smile again, saying she believed I must be touched by God, offering me her favor, and I...I could scarcely credit I had heard her properly. She couldn't possibly mean...could she?

Alright, next...!\nI guess we just pack all the severed limbs into crates? Geez...How many people is the new Pope gonna have to kill before she's happy? Talk about bloodlust.\nI'd seriously love to know what kind of hold she's got on people that all those virtuous young people who join her knights are willing to go along with this mess...

It came to pass one day that the man realized his wife hardly ever showed her feelings anymore. It was as if his warm, loving wife had suddenly been replaced by an emotionless automaton. Deeply concerned by the change in his wife, the man resolved to investigate, and followed her as she left for her errands, trailing her to a house on the outskirts of town.

He knew this house to be the residence of a peddler of used tools who had moved to the town sometime earlier. The man tried for a time to glimpse the interior of the house from the outside, but failing in this he turned to go. As he did so, he nearly yelped in surprise to find the peddler standing behind him on the path. He was clutching a book of some sort, murmuring to himself as his eyes travelled over the page, and before the man could so much as say a word, he felt the darkness rise up to claim him.

Opening his eyes, the man found himself sealed inside a box of ice, inside a room lined with many such frozen coffins. Although unable to move, he looked through the milky surface of the ice and could tell that each of the other coffins held another soul.\nAll were as motionless as he.

It was a day like any other, in this small town. The townsfolk walked the street, just as they did every day. They walked with perfect, regulated cadence, just as they did everyday. Their faces held no expressions.\nJust as it is everyday.

Go ahead and feast your eyes on this, the Icewood Spear!\nTotally looks like it's actually made out of ice, huh? It's cool to the touch, but it's got none of the brittleness of actual ice. Don't be afraid of melting it, either! This amazing little beauty will sparkle more than ever if you just wash it with cold water.\nSeems like it'd be just the thing for colder climes, eh?

I'll bet it'd be at its strongest in the lands of the farthermost north, inside industrial-strength refrigerators located upon the ships that ply the northern seas. Seems like the kind of thing I should put to the test...Definitely something I should test, since I'm the one who's got the spear.\nOnwards, northwards!

Ah, check out this winter wonderland, just the stuff you'd expect from the countries of the north! Though, gotta admit, these snowdrifts are making it pretty hard to walk. This looks like a job for my awesome Icewood Spear! I'll channel its true power to strengthen myself!\nOoookay, just gonna rest in this little cabin for a bit. Hm? Oh, someone's coming.

I can't believe this is happening! How was I to know this fully furnished cabin would actually belong to anyone? Let alone anyone so much bigger than me.\nNooo, give me back my spear! Wait, not like that!\nAugh...the lovely clear Icewood is stained red now, with my own blood...I see. I get it. The spear, its...its true power can only be unlocked...by a heart of ice.

Whatever they were, they had the appearance of a white mist. 
They were terrible, ravenous things that consumed anything organic unfortunate enough to be in its path.
No physical attacks were capable of harming them, for they would reflect back whatever they'd been targeted with, and they became known as the Mirrorkind.
The entire planet had been pushed to the brink of crisis, ever since their sudden appearance ten years prior.

Humanity's finest military minds collaborated to create a weapon that could fight back against them, devising a gun that absorbed the wielder's own spiritual energy, concentrating it into a potent projectile. As the new weapons became widespread, civilization pushed back the white mist predators and began to hope once more for the day they could live in peace.

Unfortunately, not every person possessed the same amount of raw spiritual power, and weaker people fell one after another, debilitated by firing the weapon just once.\nIt came to pass, in the midst of this, that the researchers charged with developing the weapon were set upon by the creatures. In desperation, they hastily injected themselves with a substance they had been researching, moments before being consumed by the creatures.

The creatures stopped, realizing something was amiss. There was an anomaly.\nThe substance the researchers had injected was one that amplified the emotion of terror. The creatures recoiled, and as the researchers had hoped, destroyed themselves as they mirrored and amplified the self-directed terror.\nTheir fear was so strong that it echoed throughout their collective mind, as far as 10 years into the past, stirring the creatures of the past to suddenly go mad and attack humanity, the source of that overpowering terror.

The adventurer who found his way to that small village immediately fell in love with its beautiful flowers. Every house in the village was decorated with them, and the adventurer soon built his own house on the outskirts, delighted when his new neighbors came bearing beautiful floral wreathes of welcome.

The adventurer returned one day from wiping out some demons that had been lurking near the village, to be rewarded with another wreath of flowers. He was told it was a celebration of his victory.\nHappy days passed in the village, until one day, the adventurer began to develop a cough.

A short time later, the adventurer was wounded during a quest and fell more seriously ill. The villagers gifted him with more flowers, said to drive off demons, or to encourage greater health.\nThe adventurer's sickness worsened.

The adventurer never again emerged from his house, and when the villagers came to look, they found him dead.\nSoon afterwards, the villagers gathered all together and covered the adventurer's house in colorful wreaths of flowers.

You really are an idiot if you think I'm the kind of person who's gonna forgive and forget, after you only got close to me in the first place because you wanted to use me. Still, I suppose I might be an even bigger idiot, 'cause I'm actually starting to think I might not wanna hurt you.

It's like, when you learn about someone's past, there's a connection there. Everyone's experienced that kind of thing, right? And who'd ever think for a second that their new "friend" was making it all up? No one, that's who.

There's this knight who's always shouting how you can't change someone's heart with violence. Just goes on and one about it, and a bunch of people just eat that stuff up, think it's so deep and noble. ...Well, I'll bet none of them realize that guy's just making it up to. Probably has someone write that shit for him.

That's what the tiger showed me. The dirty tactics of underhanded people who do nothing but devour others. God, they're pathetic. Has-beens, all of them, it's hilarious! ...And you know, I think I kind of get it a little bit now, in a weird kinda way. 'Figure that must be what everyone else sees, when they look at me.

"Oh, so this is the shrine dedicated to the mountain god? What a perfect place to keep our meeting under wraps. Okay, let's cut to the chase. I'll head into town and spread rumors about some dangerous virus on the loose. You can play the role of a clueless traveler, and when I start talking, pretend to have a seizure to freak everyone out.

I'll say, "Here, take this vial of antibiotics!" Then you pretend to calm down after drinking it. That way we can convince everyone to buy one to be safe from the life-threatening virus we made up. We'll sell overpriced water to those gullible fools. What do you say?
Whoa! What was that? An earthquake? Is the mountain god mad at us? Please stop! I swear I won't go through with it. You have to believe me! HELP!!!

Why are those people making such a racket inside the shrine? What earthquake are they talking about? There wasn't even the slightest tremor. Well, I guess spring attracts all kinds of kooks. Can't say I'm surprised.

The general was a superior strategist well versed in ancient and modern warfare. Wherever he led his troops into battle, he would always emerge victorious. Since the king was a man of mediocre talent, his subjects looked to the general as the pillar of the kingdom, and worshipped him.

The general waged war after war, but this gradually took a toll on the people and their lands. The once revered pillar of the kingdom fell into disrepute, and began to be called "war demon" behind his back.

But the people didn't know the general was hiding a secret. Struck with pulmonary tuberculosis, his time was limited. And so, consumed with the fear that his death would lead to the destruction of the kingdom, his last wish was to unify the continent before he passed.

His intentions remained hidden, and drew no sympathy from the masses. One day when the general was out scouting by himself, he was struck by the poisonous spear of a peasant driven to avenge his son who had died in battle.
To grasp the path life follows, to hold its destination. To have life and death both in the palm of one's hand. Could there ever be anything more delightful than that?
Everyone I meet, without exception, trusts me implicitly. They take the substances I give them, which they know nothing of, and willingly introduce them into their own bodies.\n\nThe fools.

Even when I mix in a little bit of poison every month, the only thing that comes back to me is grateful words and generous remuneration. Well done, you idiots. Letting me lead you down the garden path to a slow, painful death.

Still, straight up poisoning people is terribly gauche, you know. The cutting edge of such things is getting a doctor to add your compounds to their medicines and IVs, that sort of thing. For a pharmacist to be anything close to a poisoner is such a throwback, it's laughable! I admit, upon hearing that I let my temper get the best of me and beat the offending doctor.\n\nI guess I must be getting senile, letting myself use such a crude method of murder.
A cowardly man summons up the courage to stand up against a menace for the sake of his friends. Ah, what a beautiful ending.
A man joins in a reckless battle to escape his lover. Ah, what a beautiful ending.
Aware of the provocation, he flaunts his masculinity in an attempt to prove his friend wrong. Ah, what a beautiful ending.
The thread that bonds people together shines much more brilliantly when we're forced into a tight spot. So the moment that thread is severed...I feel a fleeting beauty.

A dauntless and brave king was out falconing when he was bitten by a yellow fever mosquito and fell ill with a high fever. The emperor saw this as a prime opportunity, and immediately mobilized his troops to invade. The dauntless king was unable to lead his own forces, and by necessity surrendered, swearing allegiance to the empire. Shedding bitter tears of blood, the king summoned a powerful magician and ordered him to remove the spirit of rage from within his chest.

The emperor visited the king at his castle, sitting for a grand feast. Deep in his cups, he tossed his goblet at the king, mocking him viciously, claiming he was a a coward without the spine to put the castle out of its misery. The king, known for his temper, became so furious he began to bleed, and his retainers feared what would happen. But the king only laughed, and prostrated himself before the emperor.

Now, the emperor had always held the king in contempt, but at this, even the ministers who had journeyed with him began to despise the king. \n\nYears later, the emperor was thrown from his horse on a long ride and immediately knocked senseless. The king, who had so long had his fangs blunted, went immediately to the treasure carriage and opened a certain box. That day, he reclaimed the Spirit of Lupine Fury that had been taken out of him all those years before.

The ministers gathered before the king, rejoicing that the day had finally come and beseeching their king to destroy the empire. Before they could even finish speaking, the king stove in the magician's skull, and then set about dispatching the rest of the ministers one after another before letting loose a powerful howl. The moment he had reclaimed the spirit, that wrath had burst out of him, focused inexorably on all who had done nothing all those years, as he was forced to endure such humiliation.

There was one instrument that a reputed luthier favored—a harp with bright red strings that he often cared for by one of his customers. Never before had he seen strings of that color and he was convinced that it was the secret to it's wonderous tone.

He had a dream of one day attending a nobleman's banquet. Every evening, a famous nobleman and owner of the bright-stringed harp would hold a sumptuous banquet at his mansion where he would play his harp. Several times the luthier asked for an invitation, only to be turned down each time. But his day had finally come.

The nobleman had requested that the luthier complete work on his harp at the banquet. He traveled to the man's mansion and directed through large doors into the banquet hall dyed in the same bright-red as the harp's strings. But what he saw horrified him. Vampires. Blood-sucking vampires and their victims. The noblemen stood motionless as the other attending artisans tried to flee.

The owner of the mansion swung his harp down, piercing the luthier's chest with the sharp ends of it. Then, as if it were a vampire itself, the harp began to suck the blood out of his body. The harp's string's turned darker in color. As the luthier laid dying on the floor, the nobleman plucked the strings and grinned at the lovely tone it made.\n"You certainly have a way with instruments," he smirked.

Take heed, recipient of this book! We of the Extinction Research Armory have discovered a way to eliminated the entire human population within a century. The origination is conspiring to eliminate every single one of us, including myself tomorrow, so here are the specifics.

Now that the Steam civilization has fully-matured, wars and revolutions are no longer a threat to the human species. However, if external factors cannot eliminate them, it is possible to stir up internal factors. Remember this: humans have a deep-seated need for approval.

It can be a notebook operated via magic, or a device with the state-of-the-art steam engine installed. Spread it from being to being through unprecedented and extraordinary means. Share a hyperspace with the entire human race and encourage interaction there.

Create a void in this hyperspace where one can disguise and avoid identification of oneself. Then soon, after a decade of living in this hyperspace, people will value it more than reality itself. Give it another ten years, and their heads will undeniably seek for approval in this space. And in no less than a hundred years, humans will have begun their slow demise!

"I guess we're like, really together, now, huh? Together, together."
"I caught myself thinking of you, even when we were apart."
"Actually, I was thinking of trying to go into business again, so I'm raising the money for that right now."
"Think of it, if we succeed at this together, then we can really be together..."

"The two of us will be together always. We're one. We even bathe together. Things were so wonderful when we were children."\n"But after we grew up, people started to reject our relationship..."\n"That's why we've decided to find a world for just the two of us."

"If there is beauty in this world that refuses to belong to only me, then I'll ever so gently take it by the throat, and leave it with the loveliest of scars. Then at least, the scars, if nothing else, will be mine and mine alone."

The many dreams the scorpion showed me, and the countless feelings it let bloom in my mind seemed to melt together in a single moment. In that instant, I was certain I could feel that person's warmth. That's how I know...how I'm certain I'll be happier never waking from this dream.

I am the "Guardian of the Deep Green". I see you've come to this world as I did long ago. ...Yes, I remember now. I believe it was 30 years ago. I walked deep into the forest and stubbled upon what I could only describe as a paradise. Men and women lived in youth, gathering nuts and flowers for food, and enjoying the simple pleasures of life.
