You could sleep wherever you wanted. Eat whatever you wanted to eat. Sleep with anyone and anywhere. At that time, I was but an innocent friar and found myself disgusted with the place. So I tried to escape. But alas, there was no exit from this paradise. Forced to stay in this place, I took it upon myself to preach the teachings of God.

I expressed the importance of of monogamy, but they all stared at me puzzled. "It's the teaching of the Lord," I explained, but I couldn't get through to them. In fact, the entire concept of God was foreign to them.

Over and over I preached to the inhabitants, but to no avail. Dispirited by my failure, I began to question my own beliefs. What's so wrong with polygamy anyway? Why should I have to bind myself to something so irrational and inefficient? What about you? Come with me, and we'll get romantic in the bushes to deepen our friendship!

I love the sea. I love watching the sun rise over the waves, and I love to watch the golden sunset stain the waters. There's only one thing I don't really like: the sea on a summer night.\n\nWhen I see the night ablaze with the light from the fishing boats, it seems almost like I'm looking into a dream world. One night, while I watched those lights, I found a spear, dragged in by the tide, and took it home with me.

After that, my little harbor town changed overnight. Perhaps you could even say it was the world that changed, that the way of things was ever after slightly different than it had been before.\n\nMonsters began to attack us from beyond the sea, and the town filled with soldiers from the kingdom's army and navy, clashing over and over with our new enemies in fierce battles.

We were forbidden to venture out to the shore, but after a while, I missed my beloved ocean so dearly I couldn't help but sneak down to the water. As I did, the sea seemed to split, and the creatures came pouring out of it towards me. I clutched the spear I'd brought for protection, brandishing it.\n\nAnd, do you know what happened? They stared at me for just a moment, and vanished back into the sea without attacking.

The next morning I woke to find one of the creatures staring down at me, and nearly leapt from my bed in shock. Imagine how much more shocked I was, then, when the creature immediately knelt and offered me its unending loyalty. I still don't entirely understand, but it seems as if that spear is granted only to their monarchs.\n\n...And so, on my orders, the invasion of the land was called off. This peace owes everything, to the guiding pull of those fishing lights...
The melody resonating from the instrument flowed eternally. The man's performance should have long finished by now, but the sound continued to follow him.
No matter where he went or what he did, it was there in his ears.

Not even sleep could save him as it followed him into his dreams. Eventually the ceaseless ringing had drove him so mad, he was ready to die to make it all stop. Following the man's death, the instrument was passed onto its next owner.
Whether the melody continues to resonate beyond death remains unknown, and those who do have the answer are not in a position to speak...

It wasn't the first time the soldier had heard rumors about the club. Others on the battlefield described it as clunky and strange. You'd never guess its purpose, and no mighty hero would go out of their way to acquire it. But it proved an effective weapon in the hands of an ordinary soldier.

When the soldier found the club resting beside an enemy corpse, the rumors flooded his mind. It was ugly to say the least, but he felt strangely compelled to hang onto it and test it for himself. He went on to slay many men across many battles, until the day he was struck down, and it passed into the hands of another nameless soldier.

There was a spirit with awareness of all things, and perfect knowledge of cause and effect. Though it had no feelings, it was assured of its own omniscience. If two events of great consequence existed simultaneously, the spirit knew the full outcome of each before they unfolded.

It never doubted its omniscience, but the world was complex, with unpredictable outcomes and an endless series of past and future events occurring in every corner. All of this was understood. The spirit crafted a divine weapon—a club. Each time the club was wielded, it changed the trajectory of world events. Over time this confused the spirit, and its omnipotence crumbled. Then, the unthinkable happened. It ceased to be. The spirit was known to people as both a demon and a god.

All he wanted was to put an end to the war. As if it were his calling, he became a reporter and continued to cover war zones. One day, he heard a rumor of a certain war veteran—a famous general. Once a military hero, he had all of a sudden turned a coward.

Curious, the reporter visited said veteran's home. According to his neighbors, he spends most of his days tending to his garden living in solitude. Apparently the men whom he fought alongside with had all died in battle, and it took a toll on him.

The reporter read off his list of questions, but the only attention the veteran gave to were his plants.\n"The plants talk to me," he said. "They told me to create a paradise were my wish for peace will be fulfilled."\nThe reporter took the veteran's hand and smiled. "That's wonderful. I'll assist you."

"Oh will you now?" The veteran smirked and swung his shovel at the reporter's head, killing him. After covering the body with dirt and soil, the reporter had become a nursery for the plants. As it turned out, the veteran's wish for peace was to spend the rest of his days in harmony with his beloved men. Waiting for the day they break free from the earth, and rise from the dead.

[At front door of friend's house]\nIt really sucks that she passed away. She was my best friend, you know? *sniff sniff* No one got me like she did, and I doubt I'll meet anyone else like her... *sniff sniff*

[In hallway of friend's house]\nHow could this have happened? She was kind, cheerful, and upbeat as far as I could tell. So what could have drove her to suicide? I feel so guilty. I wish she would have came to me first...

[In guest room of friend's house]\nThank you for having me today, Ms. And for the tea. I'll be on my way now. Um, I hope I don't come off as rude, but the house smells. It's giving me a headache. And I feel sleepy...

[In basement of friend's house]\n...What am I doing in a coffin besides that girl?! Hey, Ms.! What's going on here?! What? She knew that I was bitching behind her back and slept with her boyfriend? So she wrote how much she hated me with her own blood in her diary? And now you want me to apologize to her in the afterlife?! No, wait! Stop! Someone get me outta here!

Uh-huh... So ya want a magical sword that can slay dragons? Are you sure you wanna be a dragon slayer? Talk about dragons doesn't come up much nowadays. Hate to break it to ya, but we don't have anything like that at this store. Why not? How should I put it...

During my younger years, I made a several swords that could have wreaked all sorts of havoc. But no one's interested in those enchanted ones. Since those types cost a fortune, I resorted to only selling the mundane type.

Even passions eventually die out. When it comes to your livelihood, you do what you gotta do to get by. So I gave up on making strange swords. Now ya know why I hate dealing with nobles. Scram, would ya? There's nothing here but regular swords and a tired old man.

That old man had a bad attitude. So I killed him, threw his body into the fire, and had his son smith me my own sword. The thing is too big and heavy to wield though, so I guess it'll serve as decoration. Oh, the fire is still going. I'll have him make me a meal before it goes out.

[War Maiden]\nYou have proven yourself to be a valiant warrior. You are determined to see each battle to its very end and scatter your opponent's hopes and dreams heroically. Your lionhearted courage and gallantry make you worthy of a place in Valhalla. Join me.

[War Maiden]\nCome, Lionheart. Fight at my side and take down that abominable Serpent Emperor to protect the Garden of the Brave. ...What? You hate snakes? What are you saying? As a warrior of Valhalla, you have no right to refuse! Hey! Where are you going?!

[King]\nOho, you're back! Your heart stopped there for a second! Lionheart, please continue to lend me your strength! ...What? Snakes under the command of the Serpent Emperor are slithering this way? Nonsense, they're just barbarians. Now my face looks like a giant snake, you say?!

[Executioner]\nTo think that the renowned Lionheart could commit the crime of fleeing before the enemy... The morale of the army has plummeted, and the reputation of the Order has fallen. What? Every face you see suddenly resembles that of a snake? I see. Then may this scythe free you from your delusion.

Last night I dreamed that I drank a ball of light. What do you think it meant? Probably nothing at all. Just another day of continuing out my duty as a bellman. "Hear all about it! The minister is taking bribes from a purported merchant!" The following day, the minister was dismissed.

What was that yesterday? I have no explanation, so there's no use dwelling on it. I'll just keep up my duties as usual and pass on the words of the grateful nobleman. "Hear all about it! The Queen is having an affair with the king's guard!" The following day, the king's guard was executed, and the queen was banished.

"The General is leaking military secrets to the public!" "The Prime Minister is addicted to illegal drugs!" "The King has an XXX fetish!" The more unholy secrets I uncovered, the more I was convinced that the ball of light I drank in my dreams was the wisdom of God. "I will drive out all the impure and make a proud world of only the good and righteous," I vowed.

The next thing I knew, the people had begun to distance themselves from me. Perhaps they were worried they'd be exposed for their own vices. One day as I was headed home, I was stopped by someone calling out from behind. But when I turned, a blade gouged me in the stomach. "You went too far, wise man," the assassin muttered, and left me for dead.
The shimmering light in my hands is the pinnacle of all reason. Its tyranny scorches all, and nothing escapes its fury!
Nothing can defend against its lustrous luminosity. It is I who rules the world! Now, burn!
My power surpasses even that of the gods, and can quell even nature's calamities! With this radiance in my hand, I am a supreme being! Fools! Kneel before me and pledge your eternal allegiance!

Hey, did you hear about that greenhouse accident? A child got heatstroke and burned to death from the sunlight through the plastic. Apparently, the kid was always running around roasting insects with a magnifying glass. Sounds a lot like karma.
Such an enchanting tone. The sound seemed to melt his brain.
He put his life at risk in exchange for that pleasure. But he couldn't care less.
You could tell him his country was in ruin or that his friends and family were in danger, and he still wouldn't bat an eye.
The only meaning in life for this king of an entire nation, was the sweet, intoxicating happiness that melody granted him...
It was the end of summer. I was on my way to the beach to watch the calm evening sea.
A full blue moon sat high in the sky, shining faintly amidst the placid waves.
*puff puff* *sway* Countless jellyfish lit up the sea. Almost as if many moons were drifting with the current. They looked so lively and happy.

The disease had spread like wildfire over the summer. Everyone on the island died except me. There's nothing but corpses on land and poisonous jellyfish in the water. Looking at my spotted arm I wonder, which would be the better way to go out?
Damn, I totally missed. I'll aim higher next time.
Did you see that? I won! It's so much fun playing with everyone!
Dorothy, that was incredible! That's 100 points! Look how she's holding her stomach laughing! She's enjoying this, too!
15 minutes later\n"Yoo-hoo, Aladdin! Come play "target practice" with me!
Court is now in session. Standing before you is the defendant whose guilt or innocence will be determined.
The tip of the scythe swings towards the defendant, grazing their body. It slashes forward again, but the defendant dodges it time after time. Could they be innocent this time?
But as soon as that doubt seeped in, the scythe gouged into the defendant's torso. Staggered from the impact, their movements slowed. It took one last sweep of the blade to make the final judgement.
The defendant lay collapsed in a dark alley, soaking in a pool of their own blood. Justice prevails again...

Why am I so fat?
I want to be more beautiful. I want to be perfect.
But I can't control my urges.
...I hate myself.
I received a magic drug. When taken with water, all the food you've eaten will exit your body instantly. I can eat as much as I want with this! I don't have to dread looking in the mirror anymore!

I checked the mirror several times a day, and I did in fact notice small changes.\nI do feel a bit guilty for my actions.\nBut if I stopped taking it now, I would just revert back to my old self. I can't stop...

The number of pills kept increasing, and now I've downed an entire bottle. My body began to hurt and I passed out from the pain. My stomach has been aching for days since.\nBut I'm glad. This pain only proves I am losing weight.
And so they lived happily ever after... How many years ago was it when a man and woman united as one?
She was a wife without a single flaw. Kind and devoted, she showed her man kindness and love when the rest of the world disrespected him.
One day, the man was pushed over the edge and acted on a thought he had long harbored. Despite that, the very next day, his wife was still by his side treating him with affection.

How many years has it been since a man and woman united as one? Hundreds?

"As so they lived happily ever after."

And so they were happy, ignoring the stench of decay that escaped the wife's cracked skull.

Hmmm....this is grilling up nicely. Alright, time to cut. ...Here, this is your portion. I've got some wine I've been saving special, just for tonight. Don't worry about anything, just dig in and enjoy!

Well? Is it good? ...Really? I'm so glad to hear you say that. Hm? Which one? I can grill up some more right now, so eat as much as you like! Well, what are you waiting for? Don't just sit there, I said eat up!

Now, now, there's no need to be crude. You've gotten vomit all over the dishware!\nI think I told you to eat, didn't I?!\nWe've got plenty of meat left and I've got to make sure you finish off every bit of it, now don't I?

Diary of Vigilante Vice-Squad-Leader Atlas:\nI continued to force him to eat that which was most precious to him. He only ever became close to like-minded people, after all. It seems yesterday he lost an auction, trying to get his hands on some famous delicacies. I wonder what he'd think if he knew who outbid him? We livestock certainly know how to hold a grudge, if nothing else.

You mustn't go near that violinist. He bewitches people with that beautiful memory, searching for someone with the lovely hair he favors among his victims. If those crazed eyes light upon you...you're finished. He'd chase you and your hair to the ends of the earth.

And do you know what that violinist would do, then? Well, he'd invite you back to his mansion, to being with. Probably, you'd even have a great time at first. After all, he'd feed you wonderful food, and provide sweet scented oils and lovely ornaments, all of it to make your hair even more beautiful than before.

Unfortunately, you wouldn't be able to see that for yourself, not with every single mirror in the place broken. You see, the violinist, well...let's just say he really loves hair. That's why he can't stand to look at his own hideous head of it. Instead, he'd cultivate your own beautiful locks, he'd adore them.

So you see, that's why I have to have your hair. It's more beautiful than any head of hair I've seen before. Sorry to say, I don't really need the rest of you though, so I'll be burning it with the rest of the rubbish. I've even made a little bauble of your hair, to adorn my violin, so I can admire its beauty every day. I think I'll be able to make even sweeter music, with this.\n\nThanks for that.
For Professor Lona Sandas, who researched the cause of obesity in college: a piece of calorie free chocolate.
For the oil baron concerned about having oily skin: dark chocolate, with no added vegetable oil.
For Kenty, who was so worried about his body hair he stopped talking to girls altogether: chocolate said to have a depilatory effect.

For all present here today, I know you've created a variety of beautiful illusions to aid you in escaping your painful pasts. You no loner need to worry about such things. Eat these delicious treats, and your awful pasts will melt away as surely as the chocolate itself.
If we are to dole out to these sinners their just desserts, then we ought equally to mete out such condign chocolate to the poor but hardworking youth.
Even so...If we have a duty to distribute chocolate, how far does such a duty extend? Of course, we would be obligated to gift it to those who care for us in our daily lives...

It's only that...we really must do something with this towering spiral of stacked cacao. Just so! If we were to designate a particular day as a special day of gifting, the chocolate would have it's own value on that day.
Certainly, I do seem to remember that we made chocolates, long ago...back then, we never had the chance to give them to anyone, but this year? This year will be different...
How strange. The stuff was so bitter, but Snow managed to transform it into such adorably sweet confections...
I have questions! All of those people who were terrified of us before, how is it that they've become such fast friends with Rapunzel, now?
Snow told me that spices are necessary to draw out the flavor of the ingredients. Rapunzel told me further, that you should look for what it is the other person wants...

I spent a long time considering these questions, trying to think of how I, myself, could devise a way to make the others happy, and I succeeded!\n"Alright, everyone! Come join me, and work until we've finished these chocolates!"

To think I'd fall for a fellow hunter! Now that I have thought, I'll stay with you for life! Forever! Even should I outlive you somehow, I can't imagine ever loving another! I swear it, on this magnificent hunting rifle you've gifted me.

I can't believe this happened...how could you go where I can't follow?! Having lost you, the one I loved the most in the world, I truly can't imagine ever loving again. I'll live a quiet life, from now on, standing vigil over your grave.

Who would ever believe the day would come when I could feel the stirring of new love? Even after all my prayers and lamentations, I know you're never coming back to me, my lost love. I must move on, move forward and embrace new love. Oh, to have found such happiness again!

It's truly astonishing, to think that there would ever be a day when I had such a happy home and family of my own. Watching my cheerful wife as we dine together, our child growing within her. I should go out and see if I can hunt something new for tonight's supper. I'll just get my rif...huh? I can't pull my hand away from the stock...Wait! Wh...why is the gun moving of its own accord?! No! Not my wife! Is..Is this you doing this? Please...please, don't....!
Look, I get it, I get it! Love is a fickle thing, isn't it? Quick to cool. I should know, I've had quite the roster of boyfriends. People can break up over the tiniest things.

My first boyfriend cheated on me.
The second guy lied about his debt.
The third one was an addict.
The fourth guy actually killed someone.
And it's like, all of that is just a totally mood killer, you know?

But still! I feel like if it'd been TRUE love then it wouldn't have gone cold so easy. No matter what happened, you know? That's why I've been super careful choosing Boyfriend #5, but there really are just no decent candidates.\n\n...So I started looking at things from the total opposite perspective.

Instead of finding someone who won't do any of that stuff, I need to find someone who'll stick with me even if I cheat on him, lie about my debt, become an addict and kill a guy!\n\nIf they can love me after that, I'll know we have something that'll really last, you know?
Brother, my eyes still recall the sight of you.\nThe bruise on your skin when we'd play together...\nThe stories you created for the sister only you knew.

That was the day I'd realized it. Subtle admiration, nurtured until it bloomed into love. It was the day I left childhood behind. Still, you didn't notice  the change in me, Brother. I stood straighter, knowing I needed to be even more grown.

And I knew, I knew that love would grow until I couldn't bear it, knew if that was what I had to look forward to, then I'd best snuff it out at once. And I've been reliving that day, that moment of decision, ever since.

Tell me, Mr. Bear. Was I wrong, that day? Did Brother want us to live together, after all? It's just that now, I...I can't seem to find an answer. Brother, please, tell me. Was I too weak? Am I still a child, after all?

A fearless warrior of unparalleled strength with axe in hand. He slew the dragon of the sacred mountain, was granted immortality, and has been untouchable ever since. As a result, even emperor and pope bent the knee to him.

A young man who was concerned at the power the warrior wielded over his country visited a secluded region in search of a wise man. After explaining the issue, the wise man offered him an axe, saying, "Replace the warrior's weapon with this BoomerAxe."

Through flattery and service, the man earned a role as the warrior's attendant. When the time was right, he took the warrior's axe from his bed and swapped it with the BoomerAxe. The very next morning, the warrior had regressed into a baby.

With its iron-fisted ruler now a mere infant, fierce men rose to seize power, and the country was divided. The young man felt helpless and overcome with despair. He had not considered that his actions would cause society to regress as well.

The girl was born in the midst of filth, a thief by the age of five, and not long sure to die for her thieving. She didn't die, however. An assassin came, and took her away, took her in. Why her? She asked, and the assassin said simply, "Anyone would have been fine. It just happened to be you."

The girl was trained in the ways of the assassin, and at length, became his trusted lieutenant. She wasn't at all grateful, though. To her, they were merely business partner, and he felt the same. It's why he didn't stop her when she told him one day she meant to strike out on her own.

Working independently, the more jobs she completed, the more she remembered her mentor. She only understood now, now that they were separated. He was a genius in the art of killing. And she...? She admired him more than she had ever realized when he was still training her. It was then, she was contacted by a client who wanted her to kill her mentor.

Why? She asked the question, staring blankly at the blood that now pooled at his feet. He said he'd just forgotten to bring any bullets. How silly of him. And then, he handed her his gun and made one final request.

The client who had orchestrated this was a fellow assassin with a grudge, eager to enjoy a scene of tragedy at his rival's expense. He was certainly nearby, even now, watching.
She took the gun, and loaded it. She had inherited his legacy, and would not fail.
Our classmates are envious of us. It's nice to have jobs, money, fame, and a secure future ahead of us.
But you know, we actually envy your life more. You have loving parents who just care that you're living healthy lives.
The child stars that we co-hosted with are jealous of us. It's tough being triplets in the entertainment industry. That which is scarce is valued all the more.
But if you only knew how much more envious we are of you. Each one of you have your unique charm and talent, while the only thing we have to offer is appearing as a trio.
The snake disguised itself as a drugseller, peddling its wares and declaiming to potential customers that a certain tincture would let the user seduce any one they desired.

I'm not a fool. I could tell I was probably being taken for a ride, but even so, the image of a certain beautiful knight enthralled by me was too tantalizing to give up. I couldn't stop myself from smiling and smiling at only the thought.

"Cost me an arm and a leg, but I guess it was worth it, huh? If it let me charm such a lovely knight this easily" I murmured to myself, later, reaching down to brush several loose strands from a peacefully sleeping face, reveling in the excitement each expression it made had stoked in me.

The true satisfaction though, was in the fact that I hadn't used the tincture at all, though I'd said so. I smiled once more at the lips that had shaped such lovely excuses, blaming that blush, the heat in those eyes all on the drug I'd supposedly used.
This is an ordinary scythe used to crush or break off human blood vessels, cause blood to splatter, or scrape out fat.
When the tip of the scythe is thrust at a person, it easily penetrates under the skin with fascinating ease.
When the serrated blade is pulled against the skin, it makes a delightful gurgling sound as it cuts the human body.

Although I wield this weapon, I am an executioner hired by the government. Yet it shocks me that people call me all sorts of names, such as the devil, manhunter, murderer, and so on. In fact, I am the devil. I love hunting people and even in my previous life I was once a murderer. So how people know so much about me has me quite intrigued.

My fiancé is a true hero, incredibly kind, brave, and absolutely amazing! Though it does get lonely when he goes off on adventures to defeat the Shadowlord, it's all for the sake of justice and the greater good, right? I just hope you come back to me soon, my dearest.

After being away for so long, my fiancé has finally returned. It's obvious that his adventure was full of challenges, as he's completely drained. I'm dying to spend some quality time with him, but I have to be patient! Being a hero's wife is no small feat.

He's been my best friend since childhood, and has always been so gentle... But with each adventure, he changes more and more. He doesn't smile as often, and we seem to have less in common. Even so, he said himself that I'm his number one. He just wants to complete his quest as soon as possible and live a peaceful life.

He wants to quit his life as a hero? Not on my watch. I had to take his sword and pierce him with it. You see, the world requires a hero to fight for justice, and I'm determined to be the hero's fiancé. Now I have to select a new sword and seek out another hero to take on the mantle.
Thank you boys for following the sound of my flute!\nAt last, welcome to "Paradise"!\nNo need to hesitate, please step inside! This utopia is all yours!

Money doesn't exist in "Paradise".\nFor it holds no value.\nSickness and disease is practically non-existent. Every morning, you'll get nutrients from the picking seeds from the flower beds. Eat those and you'll always be healthy.

Just like you boys, you'll find many other children living in the same conditions.\nLook how happy they all are. See their smiles?\nCongratulations, my boys! You've been freed from all your sufferings!

What? Everyone's eyes are empty, you say? That's a very good observation. That's because everyone's always hungry.
Those seeds don't last very long. If you don't eat enough, you'll go the day starving, but at least you won't get sick.
They're too hungry to escape and the seeds rot too fast to sell.
My, what a wonderous "paradise" indeed!
I've been forgetting more and more as the days go by. Even the words that saved me that day have faded from my memory. I can only vaguely recall what they were now.
It's becoming harder for me to remember your face. It may be a matter of time before the fog veils your beautiful features completely.
I dread the day all my memories disappear. The me you knew then isn't the me now. Will I forget the words you liked to hear and the habits and gestures I'd use to hide my thoughts?
"If that happens, start from hello again." I was awoken from my long dream by a voice that sounded like the chime of a bell. And then, I could no longer recall her scent.

"Charge!"\nKicking my heels into my horse's side, I dashed forward towards the enemy general. Our blades clashed over and over, until I cut off his head with a swift swing. This victory turned the tables. I sent my men to crush the routed enemy and inflict even greater pain.

Having weathered the storm of the invading horde, I was granted an audience with my Lord. "You were three days late to arrive! Do you have any idea what my men suffered waiting for you?!"\nMy response was quiet. It was impossible for me to arrive any sooner considering I rushed there right after suppressing a rebellion.

After assuaging my Lord's blustering fury, I left the castle and noticed some townspeople lashing out at the castle guards.\n"You can't expect us to keep paying when you raise the tax rate each time there's war!"\nI asked them to endure a while longer, seeing as we were in the midst of a national crisis.

Upon quelling this angry squall, I returned to my home.\n"How dare you fool around with other women on the battlefield! Two of them came here demanding I leave you!"\nI sighed. Now I must soothe my wife's tempestuous jealousy. I am certain my role in this life is to reign over all storms.
The call of a lost child is an echo in the wilderness.
A voice that longs for guidance.
But beyond that voice there ceases existence.
The voice that has lost its audience continues to call out. But no matter how long it cries, no one hears its echoes in this forlorn land...

I bore the sin of my profligate son. Should I be put to death tomorrow, at least he shall live on. Death is my due punishment for having brought such a bastard into this world to begin with. Surely by sparing his life, my death is not entirely in vain...

...Or so I tell myself. But that is mere wishful thinking, for I am certain the event will roll off his back and he will once more be a burden to others. In a word, my sacrifice has no meaning whatsoever.

"Confessor, please, tell me I'm mistaken."

"What's this? What I said was the truth, and as such, is undeniable?"

"I suppose you're right. What was I expecting?"

"Huh? Now that I've acknowledged the truth, I deserve to be pardoned?"

"What's with that staff?"

The next moment, I was swallowed up in a swirl of clouds. It was as if my very life force was being torn away, bit by bit.\n\nThey were right. This world is meaningless—utter chaos, no different than this vortex of clouds. From chaos I was born, and unto chaos I return.

The girl screamed, tears pouring down her face.\n\n"I showed you everything! I showed you my weaknesses, and my shame, and don't you think that means something?! Don't you think I'm more worthy of trust then one who would only show you the best of them?!"

Furious and bitter at a confession that had come too late, the other woman crumpled, her own eyes filling with tears.\n\n"You're the one who left! You left ME, and...why?! Tell me why! If I'm the one you wanted, why is HE the one you married?!"

And the young man himself, resentful over the lies, bit back his own tears and shouted,\n\n"I trusted you! I trusted you and you...you lied to me! Liar, liar, liar!!! You let me love you...let me lover you this much, and you never felt the same...never COULD have felt the same! Was that not important enough to mention, before now?!"

The wolf, with its sea-blue pelt, showed me a dream, and the dream was a story, and the story spoke of wrath and fury, all of it stained with the hues of the misery and sorry I so favored.\n\nAnd, when I touched that dream...the story filled me with such a yearning to hear more of it that I starved for it, and felt as if I'd become naught but a ravening beast.

"How in the world did he grow up to be this?"
"We taught him better than this."
"Now he's just a disappointment and an utter fool."
"A real pain in the ass."
The priest told me Mama is an avid churchgoer and devout believer. Yet, I always catch her whispering to the neighbors talking about me behind my back. It hurt my feelings each time I passed them by.

If she was a devout believer, then it would be a sin to talk bad about their own family. The only explanation to this must be she's been possessed by the devil. So I took things into my own hands to save her from such evil. BANG, BANG, BANG! Three shots into her head.

I took my new item and added it to the collection in my room. Animal bones just don't give off the same beauty that human bones do. They don't satisfy me anymore. It's not my fault I am who I am now. If Mama would have just loved me, I wouldn't have made this dazzling new discovery.
Welcome to the Angelheart restaurant. Here by yourself? Let me take your bag and jacket. This way, please. Have a seat.

How was your meal? Hahaha. It's as if your body and mind have been revitalized? That's awfully kind of you to say, after going to the trouble of coming to our little out-of-the-way restaurant. We're just happy to see a smile on your face.

You wish to know why we only take a single booking each day? Well, it's our policy to customize meals to the hearts and desires of each patron. We are also very particular about the procurement of ingredients, so we must be selective with the reservations we accept.

You're feeling drowsy? Well, I prepared a fitting dish for one with a heart as pure as an angel. By consuming you, our guests with unclean hearts will be reborn through your genomes, and take on your angelic nature. There now. Rest in peace...

That girl was always taking a nap at the base of that big tree. She loved it, and it loved her. Hard to tell which one of them had the idea, the girl or the tree, but one day she snapped off a branch to make herself a staff.

That staff and the tree were of one heart and the staff remembered everything the girl had ever said to the tree as she sat among its roots.\nThe staff remembered that the girl had been bullied by the chief's daughter, that she wished that awful girl would just go away forever. The staff knew what it needed to do, and cursed the chief's daughter so that she broke every bone in her body.

The girl kept the staff with her always, and the staff came to know of everything she did. The staff knew she was jealous of her talented older sister, and the staff grew resentful of the sister as well, cursing her with heartbreak.

One day the girl grew depressed. She'd been blamed for the tragedies that befell the chief's daughter and her sister, and was so miserable she wanted to die. She hung herself from the branch of her beloved tree, and the staff cursed the branch that it would never break, and the girl would stay with them forever.
Why are there so many words to express emotions?\nSurely it was to share one's joyful feeling with another. Or even to know one's sadness.
Don't look at your work. I'm over here.\nIs what I really wanted to say, but held back the urge. Instead I whispered to your back, "...Hey, pay attention."
"Never mind. It's nothing."\nI've become a natural at smiling to hide just how anxious I get around you. By keeping this up, I'm sure you won't care how often I might say this.

I don't want you to hate me, but each time I conceal my feelings for you, my desire grows.\nThat feeling is only stimulated more by the raven who visits my dreams.\nThe longer this goes on, I'm sure to become the women you hate.
In the dark he wandered.
Uncertain of what was ahead, uncertain where it would end.
Sound is his only guidance. Somewhere in the distance, he could hear the melody of stringed instruments.
They reverberated in the darkness. He walked on. Towards the source, wherever and whenever that may be...
[Greasy Merchant]\nHey, mister. Let me show you want I've dug up here. This girl—you can do anything and she won't talk or fight back. See where I'm getting at?
[Bald Customer]\nWoo, sir. That gal you picked up knows what she's doing. I'll pay ya, so let me have another go with her. I'll be back again.

[Bow-legged Customer]\nHey, mister. This one's popular for a reason. Pretty good, wasn't she? But don't you find her a tad creepy? I mean, you saw those eyes, yeah? It's like she's praying for something in her silence...

[Tobacconist]\nYou're asking about the man of that house? Ah, his carriage fell into a lake and drowned. He probably tried to escape the carriage as his arms and legs were covered in scars. By the time his body was recovered, it has swollen up so much it you'd have thought he'd been cursed.

I'm always in my room. I can't leave or take a step out. My only friend and confident is my pet blue bird. The curtains are always closed, and I have no view of the sky. I have a terrible illness that confines me to this life.

Since I'm sick, I can't venture outside or see the bright blue sky like in the picture books. It'll be the first thing I do once I get better. But I've been feeling very unwell since this morning... Am I going to die?

I wanted to see the big, blue sky at least once in my life. Huh? There's blue right in front of me... So much blue and these white fluffy things... This is amazing. It's the sky. Wait. It's just a bunch of feathers fluttering around the room.

Oh, I...shredded the bird apart again. This disease is frightening. Now they'll never let me leave this room. I'm sorry I used my axe on you, little blue bird. Please know your sky-like feathers will be cherished forever.

I see. So you've gotten yourself into trouble due to your obsession with collecting all things related to whales. Don't worry, I'll dispose of your goods in the case an emergency arises. Here, I'll even write you a note. We'll get rid of your addiction bit by bit. ...Next patient, please.

Oh? You believe you're the reincarnation of a whale and that explains your need to consume enormous quantities? No wonder you've gained so much weight. Indeed, that is tough. Are you willing to undergo group counseling?

I set up a man with an obsession with whales with another who believes they are the reincarnation of one in hopes it would break both their addictions. Never did I think they would turn and kill each other... I hope their wandering souls have found peace. It was...the result of a legitimate medical procedure! I am not at fault!

Ah, my next patient. It's good to see you again. How have you been? The hospital's cleaner since your last visit? Yes, we had some extra income and took the liberty to renovate it. You'd be surprised how much whale goods go for on the market. I took it as payment for the counseling fees so I wouldn't have to face my guilt. ...Ah, forget I said that.

There were twin mermaids who were sold to separate owners. The elder sister was bought by a noble lord as his pet, while the younger sister was sold as a slave to the owner of a freak show. Vowing to reunite one day, they kept each other in their hearts.

The noble took a liking to his pet and showed her kindness. The younger sibling, however, was despised by her owner and endured endless torment. Whenever he'd hurt her, she'd dance elegantly inside her aquarium. Though separated, the siblings shared a bond that let them sense each others feelings and concerns.

The noble was concerned for the elder sister. Though he took good care of her, she was constantly injured. The owner of the freak show, however, was delighted at how quick his slave healed. That's when the elder sister pleaded for the noble lord's help.

One day, the younger sister was served up as live cuisine. In hellish agony, the elder sister took her life to end the twin's suffering. When the lord returned home, he was greatly saddened to find he'd missed the chance to savor two live mer-meals that day.
It followed him in the darkness of night.
It followed him everywhere constantly. When he stopped, it was nowhere to be seen. However, when he tried to eat or rest, it would interfere again.
So he prayed. Prayed for the end of night and the rise of day. Eventually, he found himself pondering what it was that had been following him. A few things came to mind. He kept thinking.
But along with the light, his answer never came...
When I went to retrieve the violin that had been locked in the shed for many years, I found a beehive.
The hive was empty. The bees seemed to have left in search of a new home, save one that had been left behind. I watched the lonely bee struggle, caught between the strings.
Without moving the bee, I began plucking the cords on a whim. The low, roaring hum of the bee's wings combined with the old, unbending tone of the violin made for an unexpectedly harmonious melody.

Since that day, I've made a habit of catching a variety of bees and strapping them onto my violin as I play. The bees die by the end of each song, but at least they have something sweet to hear on their way out! Those little buggers should be grateful!
He who dares cross this gate, did you dream last night? Ah, a dream of women and booze, you say? Let me ask a different question. How are you sure you're not viewing someone else's dream?

Dreamer. Dreamer dreaming the dreamer dreaming. Dreamer dreaming the dreamer dreaming the dreamer. ...Yes, it's all connected like a serpent biting its tail. Dreamer dreaming the dreamer dreaming. Dreamer dreaming the dreamer dreaming the dreamer. What happens when one of these bonds is broken? It all disappears into nothingness.

I carry the core in my sleep, so you must not wake me, she said. I gave her my word that I wouldn't, and after I was given this Guardian's Promise staff. Hey! I said to stay out of here! What do you mean you're taking her away for yourself?! S-Stop! You'll awaken her!

...Phew. That was a close one. Lying about that "dreamer dreaming" quote meaning "me in this place" somehow turned things around. I have no pity for those who would wake her blindly following their lust. They deserve to disappear into thin air. Now, to continue keeping my oath, serving as her faithful guardian.
He was forged by fire within the womb of a cow.

The timbre of the flute seared into his mind the image of him set ablaze. He continued to burn until he could take no more, then finally broke through the wall that had trapped him inside this sizzling prison of suffering.
He leapt up and went on the rampage, mowing down everything that stood in his way.
This filled him with unbridled joy. Frenzied, mad pleasure...
I'm not being suggestive. I just have a bad habit of speaking whatever is on my mind.
Don't call me cunning. This is how I've been all my life. I don't know how to live any other way.
I don't need practical advice. Just listen to me. Tell me more how pretty I am and pamper me like I deserve it.
But don't tie me down. I want to be free just as I am. Forgive me. In this moment, I am yours and yours alone. But when tomorrow comes, I'll be me again...

The young noblewoman found me in an old-fashioned antique shop and pronounced me a very fine weapon indeed. Me, the one who's severed countless heads from their owners' bodies! One look, and I knew she was the one for me.

She hung me up on the wall of her mansion, and I learned what her hobbies were, for I was hardly the only tool of execution in evidence. She loved me more than anyone else ever has, and I was so proud to belong to her.\n\nThose days are my greatest treasure...

Unfortunately, the honeymoon came to a sudden end.\n\nOne day a group of workers arrived and set up a guillotine on her terrace. Ever since then, I lost my place as her favorite. She barely spared me a glance, lavishing the guillotine with all her attention.

In the middle of the night, there was an earthquake, and I took my chance to strike down that accursed guillotine and reclaim my rightful place. In the tremors, I stumbled and fell clattering across the floor to land in the hearth, knocking aside the burning firewood. The carpet caught, and then the curtains, until the whole mansion was swallowed in flames.\n\nThis isn't what I wanted...but I'm glad she'll be mine forever now, even so.
There is a saying, "Dumplings before flowers," Brother. Did you know that? I think I like you more than either, though, Brother. Hehe...
As long as you're by my side, even the darkest most frightening graveyard or the roughest, loudest tavern would feel like paradise.
It's only...\nIt wouldn't be that bad, to sit beneath a cherry blossom tree heavy with bloom and watch the petals fall. Actually, I think it would be quite wonderful.
So, just stand under that tree over there. I want to remember this scene forever. I'll remember it again and again, and again. My brother...my si—
Cherry blossoms are like lives, in a way. Always such a fuss, but once the bloom is off no one will spare a glance.
Once that happens, the petals coloring the ground we walk on are nothing but trash to be swept away.
People aren't fair. When they're beautiful, when they shine, people make such a fuss, but the moment the illusion starts to fade they're nothing.
Now that I know that, thought. Now that I understand the truth of human nature, I can live proudly.
The blossoms are beautiful as they fall. And the wind which carries those full grown blooms from their boughs is enough to bring tears to my eyes.
Promises exchanged beneath those blooms. Fragility and beauty mingling with that sweet-sharp scent filling my lungs.
The seasons change, and spring will come again once more. However, no spring is quite the same as the one before.
Cherry blossoms are strange things, in a way. They've got the same sort of unwavering beauty, wherever you see them, but they always seem to raise a strange wistfulness at the same time.

You pitiful thing who's never known love. Why would you be reading the Handbook of Love, otherwise? You would already know all you needed, had you ever been loved yourself, for being loved is the essence of loving.

You must come to know what love is. You must feel it. You simply cannot do without the understanding that love is simply...love. Realize that you've misunderstood everything and that love is not something to be sought ut something to be bestowed.

Thus, before you think of being loved you must love. By loving you will be loved, and beginning to love gives you the keys to being loved yourself. If you're unsure about the one you love, why not start by loving me?

Yes, through the act of giving love you will come to possess it. If you desire love you must give it freely. As proof of love, I have a request to make. Please, buy my new book, the Handbook of Love II: Handbook of Loving, on sale now.

In terms of beauty, power, wisdom...I'm worth ten men. Pity any of those unfortunate enough to share a generation with me!\n\nSuch were the thoughts of the talenteless knight I spoke to. I said I was from a neighboring country and asked for information on military dispositions, saying that my country had a poor army indeed and would need to rely on the aid of his fellows if ever caught in a war.

His face practically lit up, so happy to see that, rather than criticism for his country, I came to ask its assistance. Incredible he couldn't see I only wished to steal away their secrets, and steal them I did. It was the kind of information I never would have gotten a hold of on my own.

Before, he'd been just about to resign, but now he was full of fire. He threw himself into his work, even earning a promotion. A promotion that put him in possession of even better information to pass along with me. In doing so, he was so unfailingly sincere and friendly towards me that I began to feel conflicted about what I was doing.

Yes, though the king took the blame, this knight was the true fool in the incident of leaks which became known as the Pulsating Blade. For indeed, he gave away his country's secrets and did not even gain money in return. The only lesson being a method for motivating the more simpleminded of knights. That is all there is to the story, although most do not know that in truth the knight in question fell into a black depression and died shortly afterwards of alcohol poisoning.
Usually, everyone's really happy to play with me at first.\n\nIt's only afterwards...they start to hate me. To hate the way I smell, to hate the sound of my voice...
They all start avoiding me, just because I'm different. But I can't be the same as them. It's impossible, because I'm me...

So, if you want to tell me that there must be someone out there who'll want to play with me, someone out there across all those worlds who'll want to be my friend...then show me! Where are they, then?!
Right now...it's just like I'm all alone in the world. Like I'm the only one there is. No one...no one understands me, at all.

A prince eloped with the princess of an enemy kingdom. They fled towards the horizon on horseback, the princess holding tight to her love. As they arrived a t a crossroads, the young prince straightened in the saddle and declared firmly, "To the right, soldiers wait to capture us. Towards the center, bandits lay an ambush. Let us go left!"

As they proceeded down the leftward path, they came upon some rocks and a spring welling up between them.
"Do you suppose it's good to drink?" the princess asked warily, to which the prince answered in the same firm tone of voice, "I should think not! Those stones are certainly drawing up toxins from the ground!"

The princess stared at him incredulously, but this was but the beginning of the prince's declarations, and their journey was continuously interrupted by shouts of "There's a poisonous snake in the grass!" "Deadly mushrooms!" "The cliff here is unstable!"

A curious, sweet fragrance hung in the air a while later as the princess finally ventured, "You seem quite confident, but how can you know such things?\n"Oh." The prince blanched, opening his mouth to voice a reply "Well..."\nAlas, before he could form the words the two found themselves entrapped by the vines of carnivorous plants, their struggling bodies dissolved by acid as they were consumed.

A prince eloped with the princess of an enemy kingdom. They fled towards the horizon on horseback, the princess holding tight to her love.\n\nIndeed, as the prince completed the rite of banishment, trapping them both in an endless hell repeating a wandering elopement and grisly death, he leant close and mused, "Do you suppose our scattered bones will form a ring to mark our wanderings?"

[Oath of Cain the Brave at post]\nYe who are afar, hear me and tremble! Ye who are near, behold and wonder! My lord tasked me with guarding the border, in recognition of my strength and valor! As the sword and shield of this land, I will strike down any and all barbarians who dare impose!
[Diary of Cain the Brave years later]\nThe barbarians have yet to attack our borders. My arrival must have intimidated them. The cowards fear me! The great hero and guardian of this land!

[Diary of Cain the Brave years later]\nHow many years have past since I came to this place? There have been no invasions, my advisor has since left, and I haven't heard a word from my lord. My old friends are grown and married. No one bothers to send me a letter...

[Sand Kingdom Storyteller]\nWhat became of Cain the Brave after that? Well, since no barbarians invaded, he died without ever having the chance to display his bravery. The greatest tragedy in life is having accomplished nothing in the very end. That is the moral of this story.
I grew up in a small town by the sea. To me, the ocean was like a mountain, or perhaps the sky. Basically, I didn't know anything. The ocean was just there.
I loved tales of deep blue sea. Stuff like hunters encountering mermaids, adventurers swallowed by a storm, myths of giant sea monsters, and or pirates and their rum.

I've spent my money on expensive imported goods and seen maps covering every corner of the world. The many stories I heard from sailors were not enough to satisfy my curiosity, and so I finally decided to set sail on my own. Whatever awaited out there for would now become my story to tell.

Things are going well. I've had no issues come up traveling along the path leading to the neighboring country. No seasickness, no storms. I thought the ocean was supposed to be some big mystery, but there was nothing out here. To distract me from my boredom, I began writing. It would be a tale of adventure out in the riveting sea.
Now that I think back, she used to ask me whether I'd had lungs or gills, before. She was always fascinated by the idea.
None of that is any excuse for trapping my legs in this thing and leaving me on dry land, completely unable to use my lungs. She didn't even ask first...!
And the minute she sates her curiosity, she instantly loses interest. I shouldn't be surprised, this is just like her...and now I'm trapped in this living hell.

"It's excruciating...the pain where the device pierces my legs burns horribly...please, someone, anyone...help me..."\n"Oh! Sorry about that! Give me just a sec, I'll make it better. Oh dear, you're unconscious. Well, no need to worry, once I give you this new and improved breathing device..."
We are mermaids, creatures of both beauty and terror, capable of luring and drowning those who dare listen to our bewitching melodies. Our presence used to instill fear in the hearts of humans.

But once they discovered that our songs could be safely enjoyed on land, the capture of our kind became more rampant. To evade the threat of extinction, we started raiding naval and pirate vessels, seizing their arms and armor.

Of all the human weapons, we take most delight in guns. Instead of using them to fire bullets, we load them with giant water balls, perfect for blasting gaping holes into the bodies of unsuspecting sailors and marines.
We revel in displaying the dismembered limbs and guts to the weeping and terrified humans. For us, there's nothing quite as thrilling as gnawing on bloody flesh while their faces contort with horror.
A man screamed inside the pages of a spell book he had been cursed inside.

Once humans become aware their surroundings following their birth, and sooner or later they find themselves competing with others to prove their worth. However, since only few of them are uniquely superior in their universally recognized abilities, they eventually become consumed over trivial matters until the end of their days.
Most of them pretend to adapt to daily routines, smiling amiably so as to never bee too conspicuous and out of place from the group. But in reality, most are still screaming inside.

Indeed, this world is purgatory. Since the day the man was sealed away inside this book, he's been subjected to the angst and dread screaming inside the hearts of the human realm. It is the source of his horrifying cries. Forever more...

I've waited a long time to hear that beautiful melody from that flute. The bones of the woman the fishing village sacrificed to be had long lost their flavor through the year. I poked my head from the waves and gazed up at the village. Just then, someone started swimming towards me.

It was a young girl. At first glance, she appeared to be startled by my appearance, but then decided to swim straight in my direction. She said that she was offering herself to me. However, she was not the sacrifice.

The real sacrifice was instead her sister, who's place she wanted to take. I turned her away, for she was not what I had desired. And so I waited in silence. The day of the sacrifice is near. And when it comes, so will the beautiful melody I long to hear.

I was overcome with surprise and delight. The girl had brought a glass flute. The sacrifice? It wasn't my priority. What I truly desired was that glass flute the villagers play to pray for good fishing! I snatched the flute from the girl and quickly swam away. Years later, storms and terrible catches would wipe out the entire fishing village. But I still have my flute.

The sky was all I ever wanted, to be as the great eagles, freelly soaring into that pure, clear blue. I'd wanted to be a pilot, but I didn't come from a rich house, and I wasn't clever enough to get a scholarship.

Before I realized what had happened I found myself a common soldier, fighting with my life for the kingdom at a command. It's a living. I've got a decent income and a decent amount of renown, but not so much of a dram of fulfillment.
I went home on break, and stood atop a hill to watch the proud eagles lance across the sky, flapping my arms as I did. I smiled, and gravity released me from its shackles.

Stan's Notes on Unusual Occurrences.

He disappeared, leaving only his clothes and his sword behind. Running away from the soldier's life he found so difficult, he was attacked by a wild beast...or so some theories go. Why then, were his sword and his clothes left behind intact?
As the writer pondered the mystery, a single eagle flew overhead.

Should one hold grudges? My child withered to nothing but skin and bones, slowly starved to death, and all the while no one stepped forward to help. I hardly fared better in the face of starvation. In the end, to my shame I was driven to the unforgivable crime of cannibalism, sustaining myself on my poor fallen child.\n\nWhat have I done?

Grudges, vendettas, feuds...they only lead to more of the same.\nThe world grows thick with the lingering spirits of those who died with nothing but bitter regret, and I am one of their number.\nThat's right, the body is nothing but a flimsy wall holding in the spirit. Our consciousness sustains our identity, eventually becoming the only thing that remains of us.

...Still, I never would have thought so many ghosts would gather. This tainted garden of souls expand day by day, with no end in sight.\n\nGrudges, hatred, malice, evil, wrath, resentment, bitterness, and enmity...the list grows day by day.

Yet no matter how far this corruption spreads, we will never know satisfaction. Nothing but desolation awaits.

At last, I came to realize...
I'd only wanted someone to show me a little mercy. A few kind words, if nothing else. Now, though, the rot has nearly overtaken the world. Ironic, isn't it? That I should only seek love, at my vendetta's end.

The good, benevolent king, who loved peace as much as he loved his people saw a brilliantly colorful brimstone butterfly while training with his knights with his battleaxe. Its beauty captured his eye with one glance, but his face twisted when he remembered a line from a folktale. \n\nThese butterflies were ill omens, heralding disaster befalling the kingdom. The king shook his head, banishing the creeping feeling from his mind.

Yet in no time at all the land was assailed by tornadoes and tsunami, and the king lived up to his benevolent name and rallied the soldiers to provide relief to the citizens. As he rode out to see his people however, his horse suddenly bucked wildly, throwing the king to the ground where he died on impact.

As the tragedies piled up, and the king himself was killed, the entire country broke out into chaos. Neighboring countries took this as their chance and rallied invasion forces to breach its borders. Soon, the unfortunate country found itself in a war with seven separate enemies.

The scrum worked in the kingdom's favor as none of the seven were willing to see the others claim too much of a prize, and so after an exhausted stalemate was reached, the kingdom was able to sign a tolerable peace treaty.\n\nThe citizens rejoiced as the king's younger brother stepped up and was coronated, taking in hand the battleaxe that was the crown's symbol, his eyes catching on the fluttering of a single brimstone butterfly and the fresh horrors it foretold.

Honey, I hope you're doing well in the afterlife. It's been ten years since you left me...the time seems to race faster with each passing year. After you died, I had such a hard time living on my own...
But now, that's all in the past. Our children are all grown and married now. Our daughter is expecting her first child this winter. Heheh, our first grandchild...I wish you could be here.

After you died, I struggled to get by for quite some time before I got the jewel company back on its feet. And now that things are quite, now that I've had time to think without all the worries...I'm realizing more and more what an amazing husband you were.

Well, I suppose you're only a good husband now, because you're a dead husband. You put us through nothing but hell when you were alive, with your drinking and gambling and philandering...

Fitting that you'd die at the hands of the family you put through so much. Don't hold it against your son, too much. You were the one who left the gun where he could get it.

Anyway, I hope you're burning in hell. Cheers!
Hehe, do you know what this is? Well, this is a charmed flower pot. Just bury a little bit of someone you love...and ta-da! Watch it bloom!

How did I get this, you ask? Well, I bested an old guy who worked at an antique shop until he bowed before me and then I told him it still wasn't enough! I said he had to give me a little some thing more, and what do you know, he did! Hehe...
And do you know what I think? Well, no matter what you do I think I'll find myself perfectly satisfied.\nYou can't really say the same, can you? I didn't think so.

No, no, it's best if you don't move. The wire I tied you with was coated in poison, you wouldn't want to cut yourself. Honestly you brought this on yourself. If you'd just been faithful....alas! You're just about worthless, but, well... certain parts of you DO have their uses. Good thing I'll be able to grow a copy for myself, once I gut it off and plant it in this pot!
Revenge begets revenge, setting in motion an endless spiral of blood. So wouldn't a chain of good deeds cause a whirlpool of purity to flow?
I want to urge reckless avengers to escape this bloody cycle and seek pure waters! How exhilarating it would be to make a heroic speech that could patch up old wounds.

I'm doing my best to set this Purewater Whirlpool in motion, but no luck... It's not easy finding an avenger these days. But I haven't given up. There's got to be a way. I must act, instead of biding my time!

I finally did it! I found a girl thirsting to avenge her slain family, and my words touched a nerve. Then a moment later my blade bit into her belly... I guess my words were hollow, coming from the one she sought vengeance against.
[Blank-faced Sentry]\nThat guy's an idiot to slack off on the job. Not an hour later the Spear of the King came over and took him away. Anyway, I'd better get back to work.

[Sullen Bartender]\nI told him to stop at one drink. I guess he wanted to drown his sorrows, but he ended up getting violent. And after that? I'm sure you can guess. The Spear of the King had him in shackles in no time.

[Curious Scholar]\nWe live in a world where even minor misbehavior is punished. I wanted to know the secrets of this system, so I went to the plaza earlier and scrawled on the walls. The Spear of the King should be here soon to get me. I wonder where I'll be taken and what they'll do.

[Spear of the King]\nA thousand years have passed since I came to this world. Now I rule over it. Absurdly, the callow masses seem to think I sustain myself by devouring the brains and organs of reckless souls. It cannot be helped. They have no concept of a being so much more advanced than them.
I want to be oppressed, laid low, utterly conquered.\n\nLet me feel a pitying caress against my flushed cheek, the sweet sting of teeth against my neck.
I want to be taken, and broken, and utterly bound.\n\nI want to feel the thrill of that humiliation eat away at the core of me, deeper and deeper...
I want to be rejected, shunned, utterly despised.\n\nI want to be toyed with, as if no one has ever truly cared.
Such simple things to wish for, my desires...yet so impossible to achieve, it seems.\n\nAgain, and again, I've nothing to do but find myself in these trifling little stories.

All who lay eyes on me have nothing but words of admiration and flowery prose. When was that? A well-spoken man asked. He said I have the appearance of a lady. I was impressed by his perceptiveness. Because he was right. I was born a lady.

The instrument maker who conceived me was married to an unfaithful wife. But in his dreams, he had a different woman in mind. How he wished to have a wife who was chaste, pure, modest, beautiful, sincere, and graceful. He put all those emotions and ideals into me. That's why I have a talent for fascinating so many—especially men.

All who see me dream of hearing my voice. They wonder if my tone is as beautiful as my form. But I never make a sound. I am a lady, born to be the chaste wife of an instrument maker. Only when my craftsman touches me do I succumb to song.

Eventually my maker gave me away. Still my heart would not be moved. Though we may have parted, I can only give my love to one man for the rest of my life. I will not say a word when the king curses me defective, and I will endure the pain of beheading at my beloved's hand. Because I am a forever chaste lady.
One day, my parents took me to visit XX, but when we got there, they left without us. Since it was just the two of us, XX showed me the rose garden, hugged me from behind, then bit my earlobe.
Eventually, XX reached their hand in front of me. I twisted around in surprise, but XX continued to move their fingers further with an ominous smile...
After that day, XX would make up excuses just to be alone and spend more time with me. Then one day, that connection was severed. XX died in an accident.

Since then, I've moved house a number of times. But wherever I end up, I'd notice roses blooming in my garden. No matter how many times I cut them or douse them with weed killer, the roses keep coming back. Not to mention, I often have dreams of a woman with a bewitching smile having her way with me...

[Frightened Man]\nSoon I will meet my end at the guillotine. The punishment fits the crime. I admit to the murder, and I know what I did was wrong. But if I hadn't done it, I'd have been killed instead!

[Frightened Man]\nThe man who lived below me was highly strung. Whenever I saw him he would babble nonsense, accusing me of dropping things on the floor on purpose, or causing his insomnia. If I made even the slightest noise, he'd bang his cane up at the ceiling.

[Frightened Man]\nEvery day I was being harassed! I was scared he'd come butcher me if I didn't do something! So...I killed him instead. What? I just felt something poke me from below! His evil spirit has come back to haunt me! GYAAAAHH!!!

[Sneering Woman]\nThat man in the isolation ward? He's convinced he's on death row for murdering someone. Truth is, he only injured the other party. If you tap the ceiling below his room, he screams. It makes a good morning alarm for the other patients.

Oh, me? As you can see, I'm a decrepit old man.
Ah yes, some would call me the "Wise King" ever since I figured out the Golden Rule of the world and obtained the ultimate magic.
People who aim to steal the ultimate magic show up from time to time and give me grief.
Indeed, that happened not too long ago...

As soon as they found difficulty in persuading me, they used the magic of "alteration" to steal my magic one after another.\nAll that was left was the ultimate magic, so they locked me away in prison.\nThey warmed me to brace myself if my attitude didn't change the next day.

It was that night.
As I was wrapped up in despair, the sound of flapping wings struck my ears.
Yes. It was my familiar who appeared. One who'd served me for many years.
Once I saw the dagger in its mouth and the sad light behind its eyes, I knew.
Ah, I see. You mean that I should take my own life with this?
Oh, what a kind familiar I had...

I unsheathed the dagger and held it in my throat...
and then plunged the dagger into familiar's chest.
I bathed in the spray of red nectar of life, and felt the stolen magic returning to me. Using the magic of escape I succeeded in running away.
...Hm? Why do you look at me like that?
A familiar is only as good as its use for its master, right? Surely, it's proud of itself wherever it may be!

Having found success at a young age and rolling in money, everyone asks me how I am.\nMy social status combined with the attitudes of those around have spoiled me.\nBut you want to hear about what made me reflect on it all?

Close your eyes and immerse yourself in the darkness.
 Focus your consciousness on the cosmos expanding before you.
Do you see it? The countless photospheres floating about?
They are the stars of the galaxy.

Among the myriad of sparkles, I'm just a little brighter than the surrounding ones.
If you look broaden your range of view, such brilliance will soon become hazy.
From the viewpoint of unceasing history, I am such haziness.
It's unpleasant to grow, it's just a lifelong dedication. To grow spoiled is impertinent, and is but a lifelong diligence.

[Scholar]
It is said that all successful people of this era loved this violin solo.
They would lend their ears to important research, hallucinate about universe, realize their own vulgarity compared to the brilliance of the stars, and neglect their studies. Wouldn't you suppose?
In any case, one can say that sometimes it's important to stop listen to the music.
If I were to become a virtual idol, I'd never allow anyone to take my place at the top.
Don't mention other idols' during my stream. I won't accept your apology, either.
I also won't tolerate men who have fun chatting with girls in my audience.
But if you can follow those rules...\nI'll make sure to reply to any comments that support me.\nEven in the wee hours of the morning.
If I were to become a virtual idol, I promise to never turn your smiles upside down.\nI'll keep bringing all of you joy.
And to keep you all from worrying, I promise not to collaborate with men.
But no matter how careful I am, there may be allegations of sexual favors or disagreements with other female idols...
I imagine you'll all be concerned if that were to happen, but I will speak up. Because if I don't deny it, it may cause a misunderstanding.
Rule #1:\nI enjoy falling asleep during streams.\nIf you find yourself lucky, spread the word and make it a trending topic on social media♪
Rule #2:\nIf I make it to a collab stream, don't forget to praise me! But don't attack me if I don't wake up before it's over!
Rule #3:\nDon't expect in person collabs.\nSleep is an everyday affair. Even if I'm up and it's raining, I probably won't go.
But if there's a place that would accept me as I am...\nI'm sure it would be wonderful.

Hey hey!
I'm Gems Company representative of Miyazaki and BL!
Hinaka Hoshina!
Have you guys heard?!
SINoALICE is collaborating with Gems Company and I'm the only character!
So today I'm going to stream myself pulling from the grimoire!\nHere I go!\nCool! I got Red Riding Hood! She's my favorite!
This Hamelin guy seems enticing.\nI can see it now, Aladdin x Hamelin.\nBut then again, Aladdin has a reputation...
(After a continuous monologue about BL as she pulls from the grimoire)\nOh! I got myself! Yippie!!!\nThank you for the crystals my wallet friends (Parrah and Noya)!!!

I am a man who lives by bushido.
My sovereign, by a bad stroke of luck, was defeated in battle and forced to flee to the main castle.
However, the enemy's pursuers were closing in. I had no choice but to stand guard and hold off the enemy here.
My allies, fall back quickly!
Come, enemy soldiers! Let us partake in typical battle...!

I had found myself in the middle of a dense forest.
I knew I fought valiantly, but didn't I perish in front of the swarming enemy?
"You, human. What's with your attire?" I heard a voice say. When I turned to look towards it—my eyes were agape in wonder.
There was a fish with legs growing out of it, some bizarre deformity.

This monster had no knowledge of the country or the war I had mentioned. According to the monster, the entire human race was under his control.
"I have no idea what you're talking about!" I was screamed, when several humans appeared.
They smiled at me. But all their eyes were out of focus.
The monster then spoke. "Calm down. You will be taken care of by your own kind."
Driven by fear, I turned around and ran.

I passed through the forest and was speechless at scene unfolding before me. A barren wilderness that stretched beyond the horizon. On top of that, fires everywhere.
"The scars from the hyperdimensional weapon remain deep, and have twisted the dimension. It's too dangerous. I will protect you."
The monster had caught up with me. I nodded my head in agreement.
...Several years later. I had a womb implanted in my body and gave birth to a monster child.
If I stay here, I'll be protected from the outside. But deep down I knew, I was defeated...

The bear had a dream of a country where laws were enacted to judge one's laziness. In that country, to prove their competence, waves of citizens boasting of their short sleeping hours were on the rise, causing an epidemic.
The situation only grew more serious as many began refusing sleep to gain promotions.\nAnd thus, a country-wide hunt for sleeper had begun.

Although Congress was well aware of the problems the law opened early on, they colluded with the insomniac extremists to protect their own position and continued to add laws that would pass judgement on those who defied them.

A year later, the same legislators who passed these laws would continue to be subjugated by them. That was until one day all of those law makers had be removed and replaced. Joining hands, the new legislators were right in their ways, and so began the reform of the law...

The deep bass booms of fireworks echoed all around. The battle that we, the holy knights wage against the aberration Barbery rages on day and night. Our fight shall not end until this, humanity's enemy, has been defeated. That's how it was supposed to be. However, one day I was struck behind on the battlefield, and when I awoke, subjected to the humiliation of captivity.

I opened my eyes to a prison cell. I was tense, unsure what would greet me, and surprised to find a normal group of people. To hear them tell it, the holy knights had suddenly declared them to be 'the Barbary' and began to persecute them. My mind was in a turmoil of confusion, as I slept in my cell that night.

I was woken in the deep of night by a battle cry, and knew that my fellow holy nights were raiding the prison. The scene as I breached its walls at last took my breath away. My fellow knights were chasing down and slaughtering innocent civilians.\n\nI shouted for them to stop, but they paid me no mind, continuing the massacre.

They brought me before the captain. He frowned, peering at me. "Looks like the hypnotism is wearing off," he murmured, and waved me away as my mind reeled, putting together the pieces. There were no 'holy' knights, no righteous battle against a foe of pure evil. I'd only been being used, a tool to grab more money and fame.

I sunk into a black despair as I realized my hands had slaughtered innocents, however unaware I had been at the time.

I glanced at the captain, at the swords of the men around him, and steeled myself as I lunged forward. There was a sharp crack of bone as he hit the ground under me. I smiled, even as I heard swords ring free of their scabbards all around me. Better to die as myself, and atone for my deeds in hell, than to lose my mind to these monsters a second time.

Boy, what are you doin' round these parts? This ain't no place for a kid. Heh? You wanna join my band of mercenaries? ...I see. You wanna get stronger so you can take revenge on those bandits who murdered your parents, eh? Have it your way, then. Welcome to the family. I'll give ya this bow. Take good care of it, yeah?

Ahahaha! You're a natural, boy! You shot four enemies dead in your first battle! Ya know, I was round your age when I got my first taste of battle. Though, I was too shaken up to do a damn thing. But you, kid? You've got talent!

You sure have grown. You were still a tiny lad when I picked you up way back then. Time flies, doesn't it? What's that? You found a merchant family with a nice lady and wanna loot their home? Leave that stuff for the battlefield, boy. What's changed you, boy? Whatever happened to avenging your parents?

Sigh... How'd it end up like this? The kid attacked the merchant's home, assaulted the lady there—all for her husband to fire an arrow in his back. I knew I should have stopped him. That's on me. Still, it makes me wonder. Those ruffians in the vicinity were probably a bunch of cute kids some years ago themselves.

Well then, how should I begin this strange story? I come from a village out in the countryside. It's a really quiet place with an extraordinary view. But you see, even though there's no wind in my hometown, we still have windmills spread about turning their impellers...
How is it a windmill if the impellers aren't catching the wind? That's a good question. Even I found it creepy when I first realized it myself. It's as if the windmill itself is alive.

Yes, they are spinning. Those impellers are indeed moving. I've seen it myself. But if they're spinning, then it should be creating wind, right? Or shouldn't it be the wind that's making them spin? Then, as my eyes followed their movement...I noticed something.

When my eyes move, so do the impellers. Do you get it? Those impellers only spin around because the your eyes are, too. Our eyes don't need to rely on the wind to spin. But the eyes spin because the impellers turn. Isn't that strange? ...Hm?
As a devil worshipper and dissident musician, I'm going to make an instrument that challenges conventional ethics. It'll shock the world. I'll craft it from my mother's casket.
My mother was an idiot. She ignored my musical talents, and would never come to listen. We couldn't talk, as it would always end in a fight. Right to the end, our relationship was a broken mess.

I couldn't bring myself to go to the funeral. After it was all over, I went in to see her one last time. No more arguments now that she's dead, right? She still had that same shitty look on her face. I got so mad, I smashed the casket.

And it turned out the casket was full of my records. You've got to be fucking kidding. You liked my music? Why the hell didn't you say so?! Well, you'll have the best seat in the house every night from now on. I'll play loud enough to make the dead dance...

In the dead of night, a witch stared up at the moonless sky, her breath sending tendrils of white vapor into the air. In the pitch-black darkness, not a sound was heard. The witch knew she'd never see the dawn.

Ashes of the dead blew in the air, covering everything on the land. The sky was stained with thick, black smoke. The witch was immortal, but she knew no other life would survive long in this environment.
How long before everything in this world would be taken by the darkness? The witch had the power to save the world, but what would be the point if it was fated to fall to ruin again?
