In a show of kindness for those perishing, the witch waved her wand and sent a tiny light into the sky. She hoped this ray of light would offer some comfort for those nearing their end, but by then no one was left to see her moon. Alone in an eternal night, the witch wept silently.

I'm an explorer. An independent soul with no appetite for power. All I care about is finding treasure! That's the only thing of true value to me. So when I heard the tomb of the legendary Fire Lord had been found, I immediately sought out an aristocrat friend of mine. What did I go there for? I needed money, of course!

But I was shaken when my friend's husband refused to invest in my travels this time. He usually had no issue funding my expeditions. Apparently his business had failed so he couldn't afford it. Things only got worse when I returned home. On the table was a note from my wife explaining how fed up she was with all my traveling. She'd taken the children back to her parents' house.

I wanted to drown my sorrows that night, but I resisted the urge, and instead wrote to every potential patron I could think of. My efforts were rewarded, and I soon found a new source of funding. With that, I put together an expedition team, packed up my gear, and headed out.

At the back of the tomb there rested a portrait of a woman with a club in her hand, kicking the ungainly Flame Lord. I had heard rumors of the Fire Lord being a henpecked husband, but...I guess truth really is stranger than fiction. In a sense, I identified with the poor guy.

[Clean-cut Man]\nSorry for dropping in without warning. I hear you're having a hard time with your son, who refuses to work and lives off you like a parasite. I have a proposition for you. Let me fill you in on what I do as a side business...
[Tired Wife]\nLike that guy said, I'm at the end of my tether in more ways than one. Hey. Why don't we give it a try? It's a small price to pay to get rid of that cancer that torments us.

[Bittersweet Husband]\nFancy that... The moment our son entered the barn, static electricity ignited the grain particles in the air, causing an explosion... We won't have to suffer any longer. Was that the grain we bought from that new supplier, Fire God's Blaster? Apparently, they don't pay their workers well, but morale is always high.

[Friend with Shut-in Son]\nSorry to hear about your son. My boy was recruited by the sales guy for a food supplier called Fire God's Blaster. The money's not great, but he seems very enthusiastic about the job. Is it true your son was also approached, but he turned down the position so he could stay at home?
What are you gawking at me for? Don't you know it's rude to stare at people? Hey, enough with the screaming. I can't stand it when people do that.
What's that? Am I alive, you ask? HAHAHAHA. I'm dead, stupid. Can't you tell?
I'm just trapped. Hey, will you help free me? All you gotta do is smash this stone.

Thank you. Now I can finally get some rest. This is the first freedom I've tasted since the bone begged me to smash it out of its stony prison. Now it's your turn. Good luck convincing the next fool that comes along.

Gravekeeper's Journal: In the Dead of Night\nI patrol the graveyard each night, lantern in hand. That's my job. Whether rich or poor, many people leave trinkets in the casket of a loved one to aid them in their next life. Grave robbers seek to make these trinkets their own, so it's up to me to catch them. One night, I heard the scraping of shovel on soil...

Gravekeeper's Journal: In the Dead of Night\nI came across a man digging up a grave. I raised my rifle and called out, "Drop the shovel and turn around!" Flustered, he shouted back, "My wife yet lives! They buried her alive! I must save her!"

Gravekeeper's Journal: In the Dead of Night\nI scolded the man, "Leave the dead in peace! Drop the shovel!" His face twisted in rage, the man yelled back, "Don't be stupid, my wife is alive!" A moment later, a skeletal form burst forth from the half-dug grave, and announced in an eerie voice, "I am alive, my love!" Then, the cadaver bit off his head with a sickening crunch...

Psychiatrist's Notebook\nThe Gravekeeper's Journal ends there. Perhaps this event caused his mental breakdown. He is now a shell of his former self, muttering incomprehensible words without pause. Is his record of that night accurate, or was it a figment of his imagination? I hope to confirm this one day.

Every morning I go to the beach and throw out a fishing line. But this morning, I noticed a letter in the bucket I use for my catch. I read it, and that night I "cleaned." That's how I eke out a living.

Fishing and "cleaning" have more in common than you think. If you miss the tide, there's no point sticking around. You take your shot, and if it goes wrong, you get out of there. Simple, right? The truth is always simple.
And another thing. Don't mess with the catch. Even a fish with gorgeous scales can produce a deadly poison. If you think it might be dangerous, just let it off the hook.

...Hahaha. That's what I get for not practicing what I preach. The bugger resembled my ex-wife, so I saved them and tried to lure them into my arms, but they stabbed me in the chest. It's my time to go with the tide.
He killed to protect the forest.
All who sought to harm the forest or hunt its wildlife were his enemies.
He was no lover of nature at heart.
This was his revenge for being exiled to the forest and forced to make it his home...

Beneath the deep blue sea dwelt a demon guarding a sword of legend, and a bounty has been offered to the one who can bring it to heel.\n\nThat's where we come in! All aboard! We're setting sail for a brighter, richer future!

...Goddamnit! They didn't tell us. We didn't know! It's a demon! How can it use spirit magic?! We started with a crew of ten, and it's already managed to brainwash four of them. I was able to do three of them the mercy of freeing them from that horror, but the fourth...?\nI know you're hiding somewhere, Merith! I'll make it quick, just...!"

A-hah! There you are! Just throw down your weapon! I know you don't want to live like...Hey! What...Wh...Why are the rest of you attacking me? Don't tell me you've all been...No!\n\n...Tch. In the end, they overpowered me, trussed me up, and tossed me away into the the blue depths, into the monster's lair.

The two men stared at the unbreathing corpse. "Another failure," sighed one, shaking his head. His patron, the noble funding these experiments replied, "You're sure the ritual does what you say? We can really use this to recreate humanity?"\n"Yes, I'm certain. We each have the potential inside of us, a single shining spear sunk in the deep waters of our psyche. With my magic, I can send people to that place, create the trials they'll need to overcome in order to truly awaken."
The door had not always existed. It was created, to cut of this place from the outside, and then it was shut and sealed with the strongest of bindings.
Months turned to years and then decades, and it came to pass that there were no longer any who remembered what was on the other side of the door.

It had never been a secret to the door's owner. Indeed, the world beyond the door had been an everyday thing, to her, and something she valued greatly. So much in fact, that upon her death she decided to protect it with a last testament that barred any from crossing the threshold.\nHowever in time, her family lost power to a revolution, and with it, the ability to safeguard the door. Its seal was broken.

In the days before the seal it had been a beautiful garden, with flowers and trees of all types. Sealed away from the care of human hands for decades, however, it had turned into a wild and chaotic wilderness, such that the people of the future, looking upon it after stepping through the door for the first time, could not comprehend what about this place would ever drive someone to so passionately protect it.

Good day, thank you all for coming! I'm so glad I could be here to greet our new friends. You're going to love it here, it's wonderful. I'm pretty sure it's the last little slice of paradise left on this planet. Let's all get along and help each other, why don't we?

We specialize in ecosystems here, you know? We make sure everything has its own place in the food chain. For our own nutritional needs, well, we're doing amazing things with algae, and with al the cultural relics stored in the Tower, we really lack for nothing.

There's only one rule: Do no harm.\nThat's it! Just don't endanger other people and you'll be fine. No need to think too hard about it, everyone's pretty nice here and no one ever starts fights. Oh, right, I forgot! See that glass wall over there? Sometimes you're gonna see flashes of things on the other side but don't worry about it, that's perfectly normal!

[Planet-Eaters]\nWe're happy to announce the opening of a new Planetary Zoo. A few years ago, we selected a few dozen samples and culled the rest of the life on the planet. The samples living within the Zoo are manged by the Sword of Illusion system, and many seem to have gotten the impression they are being invited to live in a place called 'Eden,' which records show was some sort of garden of the gods.\nAlthough they do look quite harmless and even funny, we must ask that you refrain from entering the enclosures or from giving them food.

It seems he found the bone at the bottom of the sea, and that he found its gently curving shape to be beautiful. Thinking it belonged to a fish or some other sea creature, he crafted it into a bow inspired by it's lovely natural curve.

He began to use the bow he had crafted, and with its use came dreams. Dreams of battle. Dreams of riding a mer-horse across the seafloor, lungs untroubled by the waters. Dreams of dispatching nautical demons one after the other, using his trusty bow. Such dreams he saw every night, but dismissed as mere fancies.

However, it seems these fancies became his reality. The mer-horse found him and begged his aid. Drunk on the glorious exploits of his dreams, he gladly leapt astride the horse and headed for the seafloor.

He disappeared into the dark depths of the waves, only to float to the surface sometime later, bereft of life, lungs burst. It seems, outside his dreams, his human body was unable to withstand the cold airless pressure of the deep sea.
In this world brought in by ravens, people who slept for long periods of time were considered sick and given medical treatment.
On the days I'd sleep for ten hours at night, I'd need another six for my afternoon nap. Everyone says I'm sick and can't help but worry about me.
If you find that so weird, how about you tell me the longest you've ever slept? The way I see it, it's even weirder for your body to wake up on its own.
I wonder what the next world is like. I hope it's a world where everyone's asleep.

[Hopeful Young Man]\nHey, is that where that "Hadesism" religion is based? Where the reincarnation of the Demon King presides? I heard it became an independent district by paying an outlandishly high tax. Is it true that their disciples made a pact to live a pure and righteous life in the demon world in their next life? I wanna be a disciple, too! You gotta let me meet him!

[Demon Lord's Mother]\nIt never ceases to amaze me that my little boy is the reincarnation of the Demon King. He even has the power to turn fowls and livestock into to stone with a single glance! And when he gave that passionate oration, there was no doubt in my mind that I should stand by him!

[Demon King's Neighbor]\nThat kid is the reincarnation of the Demon King? My grandma really loved that little boy, and I mean, we've always been close. He's a good kid. But just between us...he's an antisocial nerd at heart who was bullied growing up. But now he's united thousands upon thousands of people. In this life, anything can happen.

[Demon King's Friend]\nI still regret it to this day. It was supposed to be a joke at first, you know? I found a beat-up sword in a warehouse and said, "You are the reincarnation of the Demon King. I served under you in a past life." Then all of a sudden he gained these supernatural powers... If I had kept the sword instead of giving it to him, it could have been me presiding over "Hadesism."
[Item 1: Limestone]\nWhen sprinkled with weak acid purchased at a local chemical shop, it dissolves in a plume of intense white smoke. The dense carbon dioxide produced tingles the nose.
[Item 8: Centipedes]\nI trapped one crawling around the attic in a bottle, and poured in sulfuric acid I stole from a lab. It dissolved into mush as its torso writhed about.

[Item 14: The old lady next door's pet]\nI gave the animal an anesthetic, locked it in a tank, and filled it with strong acid. The beast didn't fully dissolve, so I poured in more alkaline chemicals. A foul order began to emanate, until finally the furry thing melted away.

[Item 15: Glum Boy]\nI gagged the boy and bound his hands and feet. Placing him in a bathtub, I doused him with powerful acid. While he struggled violently, smoke rose from his flesh and his bones melted into sludge. Hmm. Whoever wrote this picture book was a real freak of nature. I hope they suffer the same fate as my poor little Peachy.

Girl A: "I've been having weird thoughts lately of a poisonous scorpion sneaking into my room."
Girl B: "At least it was a dream. Otherwise you'd be dead right now."
Girl A: "Yeah! I'm glad to be alive!"
Some Days Later
Girl B: "Did you dream it again?"

Girl A: "I did. But this time it was roaming around my room."
Girl B: "Any idea why? There might be a solution for it."
Girl A: "Maybe! I'll think about it!"
Some Days Later
Girl B: "Did you come up with anything?"

Girl A: "The nightmares started after I gave you that violin I got gifted."
Girl B: "Maybe they'll stop if I give it back, then."
Girl A: "Yeah! Hand it over!"
Some Days Later
Girl B: "Actually, now I'm starting to have dreams of that scorpion."

Girl B: "That violin was given to place a curse of death on your family. But it only works if the violin is in your mansion. They wanted it returned ASAP, and threatened me. But you asked for it back anyway, so it's not my fault, right?"\nGirl A: "Yeah! ...Wait, what?"

Life is too short to experience all the wonders it has to offer. That's why I travel. As I was climbing through the hills and fields, I saw a mountain in front of me that wasn't on my map. At its summit was a large tree reaching up towards the sky.

Suddenly I came across a group of men and women. The leader called out, "I'm this group's guide. Did you stray from the party before us?"\n"I'm not sure what you mean," I replied. But based on his expression, he didn't seem to believe me.

I followed the mountain trail with them hoping to reach the Evertree at the top. But after a while, I realized no matter how far we walked, we'd get no closer. And each time the wind blew down from the peak, the group would lose more members. That's when I asked them why they kept on walking.

It was the guide who spoke to me again. "We are on the boundary between this life and the next, and we dead will eventually reach the other side as long as we keep walking towards the Evertree."\nOvercome with fear, I darted in the other direction. But the path down seemed to stretch on forever. Would I die the next time the wind blew from the Evertree? Damn it...!

On the tenth of August,
everyone was playing by the river,
Aladdin diving in
just like always.

And just like always
big brother
was watching over us.

I thought he might
want to play too, so I asked,
but he said no.

He just quietly watched us,
like he always did.
I wonder why?
Playing together would be more fun.

On the seventh of November,
there was a festival
at a nearby church.

There were a lot of young
priests in training
there to help.

I thought it was a really good chance
to learn a bunch of new knowledge
so I could help out Sis more.
So I asked the priests about many things.

After the festival,
we went to the baths to clean up from running around
Sis scrubbed me until I was sore, even though I didn't even need it.

On the third of May,
Mommy said we could buy whatever snacks we wanted,
as long as we shared with everyone.
She even gave us 1,000 gold to get the snacks with.

I lost at rock paper scissors,
so I only got 100 gold, though I was really sad.
I bought five of my favorite yogurt cups.

Aladdin won at rock paper scissors,
so he got a bunch of fancy snacks.
I was really jealous. I stared at him until he shared some with me.

To say thanks for him sharing,
I shared my yogurt with everyone, too.
Actually, I always wanted to share my favorite with everyone,
but I was too embarrassed to do it before.

On the seventh of February,
I understood.
We all wanted to help out Sis.

Even Aladdin understood.
If we could be smarter, then
Sis wouldn't have to work so late all the time.

But I wanted to help Sis more than anyone else.
I understood Sis more than anyone else. That's why I was reading different books than Aladdin. I wasn't gonna let him win.

...But today, Sis praised Aladdin
instead of me.
What did I do wrong?
Someday, I'm gonna figure out how
to get Sis's love all for myself.

On the twenty-ninth of September,
Children are so unpredictable.\nWhich is to say, I can't take my eyes off of them for a second.

I wonder if I put my own mother through this kind of stress?
When I think about that,
I admit I do feel a little guilty.

Even so, there's something amazing in watching them grow.
They're nothing like their idiotic adult versions.

Watching the children I've raised
running around during Field Day makes me feel so proud.
Prouder than I've ever felt from doing well at work or beating a game.
Prouder than I've ever felt for anything I did myself.
Don't make eyes at him? Even if you say that, I can't just ignore the fact a man is talking to me.
Are you sure you're not just jealous? Then you can't blame me for doing it! I'm not responsible for how you feel. Besides, if you just got close to him yourself, your problem would be solved...
I have just the spell for it, too! Apparently, if you fill this vial with another man's bodily fluids without the man you love noticing, your wish will come true!
What are you waiting for then? Standing here talking to me won't get things done! Good luck! I'll be rooting for you! (Not that any of this is true.)

There once was a prince who was lazy, pigheaded, envious, womanizing, egotistical, quick-tempered, and gluttonous. Naturally, a man like this had a terrible reputation. So to redeem himself, he suggested that his father, the king, create a law that required all life to be respected.

"My reputation will be off the charts!" the prince exclaimed. But he was foolish to think this. The market could no longer sell meat and fish due to the law, which made killing any creature punishable by death. As a result, those who worked in these industries lost their jobs and public order was thrown into disarray.

The people directed their anger at the prince. The king also lost all the love he had left for his son, so he tied him up with rope and threw him to the masses. "Do what you wish with this sinner," he said to his bloodthirsty citizens. They approached the helpless prince with murder in their eyes.

"Wait!" Just then the disabled and injured shielded the prince with their bodies. "We were the first to be discarded by society for being weak. The prince saved us! We won't let you kill him!"\nAnd so, to repent for his sins, the prince renounced his right to the throne and now sweats his days away in service.
I don't know a single person here.\nDeprived of accurate information, they've begun jumping at shadows. Withholding the truth is truly the root of all evil.

The nation is hardly strapped for cash. In fact, they have several hidden hoards, both within their borders and without, filled to the brim with enough treasure to shock the most jaded cynic. Why then, I ask, would someone lie and claim we're on the verge of bankruptcy? Clearly, they hope to drum up a good excuse to raise taxes on people newly anxious about their livelihoods.

Does that make you angry? Good. Then I say, direct your hate at the privileged few. They who restrict information, they who refuse to speak the truth to the people below them. Make them understand that depriving people the information they need is the seed of all other deprivations.\n\nMy fellows, I ask you not to stand for this secrecy and censorship any longer!

Hm? Oh, right. Yeah, some guy was waving a staff around screaming about deprivation or something. Turns out he'd escaped from a hospital somewhere, or something. I think they carted him back wherever he came from.\nNow, enough of that. Are you ready to get back to work? This has already deprived me of a crazy amount of revenue, so for your sake you'd best not deprive me of my time on top of it.

Oh boy. At first, I was overjoyed to have married a beautiful lyre player, but I wasn't aware of her extreme mood swings. But everything's fine now. In order to avoid her wrath, I had a spell cast on me that would make me more receptive to her senses. It should help keep her happy...
My worries are over. Now that I can sense exactly what she's feeling, I know how to please her when we're alone! She's not as prickly as she used to be, and I'd say we're a happy couple!

I discovered something surprising. Apparently, my wife likes it when I'm rough with her. When it's just the two of us, I take advantage of her fantasies...and the indescribable feelings that wash over me are quite addictive!

I threw a punch at my wife during our alone time. She was furious, and beat me savagely. In the end, I was the one who became the target of abuse. Now that she can perceive my senses through magic, it's her who savors the thrill of pummeling me nightly...
Play, and eat, and play and eat again! Over and over, and I'm so bored of it!
The world seemed so fresh and new at first, but there's nothing new left to do!
That's why THIS time, in THIS world, I'm going to eat even MORE! I'm going to eat and eat until I hit my utmost limits!
And in the next world, I'm going to eat even more! And after that, even more...\n\nMr. Tiger? Is this world empty already...?
There was once a kingdom that fell into ruin due to a disease said to have been brought on by a single man.

Overthrowing a regime is a near impossible task. For once one authority falls, another will step in to take its place. But this would not discourage the man from accomplishing his goal. Determined to take down the kingdom, he stole a forbidden weapon—a pistol that ate away at its targets.

When the pistol was fired, it would infiltrate the target and gnaw away at them from the inside. First fell the king. Then one after another, his successors succumbed to illness. Not longer after, the king's ministers and soldiers would all be claimed by the disease.
The leaders of the rebels fell at the hand of the gun. One by one, the rampant infection ate away at the citizens until they died...

A land ravaged by war over long-running disputes was conquered by a great man who excelled at axe throwing. In the blink of an eye, he decapitated all his enemies with his whirling axe, killing them instantly. Without a doubt, he was the greatest axe wielder in the realm.

For his valor, the man was called into the king's guard and given a magnificent axe bearing the kingdom's coat of arms. It was larger and sturdier than any axe he had wielded in the the past. Although he had distinguished himself in combat, this was an honor beyond belief for a common man, and so he swore to slaughter all who turned against his king.

His chance to fulfill this oath came quicker than expected. A neighboring country had sent out a massive army to claim the kingdom's territory. The king was out surveying his lands at the time, and was immediately surrounded. With a roar, the great man sent his heraldic axe whirling through the air, and beheaded all the encroaching soldiers.

However, much to his dismay, he had unknowingly sheared the necks of both his comrades and the very king he had sworn to protect. The heraldic axe handled much differently than his previous ones, and so the great man went from hero to traitor in one fell swoop.

I shot myself in the head, but nothing happened. Thinking I'd been tricked, I stormed off to the vendor. But on my way, my head began to feel lighter, and the pain just disappeared! [Diary of Cress, Captain of the Kingdom's Elite "Axe of Mercy"]\nDaily education has helped our newest recruits crush the brains of our foes without the slightest hesitance. With mercy in mind, our troops are in high spirits, and capable of committing atrocities at will.

Strange and mysterious plants had begun to invade the entire kingdom, and despite the measures taken to combat them, they would always flourish again. In an act of desperation, the king sought help at the hut of a sage he had banished for admonishing him. The sage handed him a staff.

The king returned home and waved the staff in the air. In an instant, the mysterious plants withered away. The king and his attendants looked on in amazement and rejoiced. They set out to eradicate the rest of the plants from the realm.

However, the food chain was disrupted when the insects and other creatures that had come to rely on the plant lost their food source. The realm faced an unprecedented crop failure, and food supplies were depleted. Even the king began to turn pale.

With bloodshot eyes, the king visited the now frail and bed-ridden sage again. "You gave me that staff to carry out your grudge against me!"\n"So what if I did," the sage responded. "I see now that life is as fleeting as the morning dew." He looked at the bitter king with satisfaction before taking his last breath.

12/11 21:00\nThat day, I was busy editing my exposé about the suspicious facility. I had considered pitching it to another publisher, but that recent attack made me think twice. I decided to publish the article online myself.

I didn't want the article to go unnoticed, so I had to give it a sensational title that would grab everyone's attention. After coming up with something creative, I attached PDFs of the reports containing solid evidence of their illegal activities. After several revisions, I finished my work just before 2 AM.

12/12 01:59\nI read over my article again, but I just didn't have the same confidence I did when I wrote it. Is it convincing enough? Would it be played off as fake news? Paper reports weren't going to cut it. I needed to gather more concrete evidence.

I reached out to two seasoned investigators. It was a bold request, but I asked them to capture video footage of the human experimentation in the facility's basement. It was much riskier than smuggling documents, but they agreed to help. Their determination was admirable. I owe them big time now.

12/16 20:30\nHad a surprise visit the a female investigator. When I opened the door, I was shocked to see her white coat and golden hair covered in blood. I asked if we should call a doctor, but she said it wasn't as bad as it looked, playing it off as just splatter.

Turns out, she and another guy were exposed as spies at the facility. They managed to escape, but not without taking out a few scientists. The other investigator got separated from her, and they lost contact.
She assured me they had shaken off their pursuers, but from the look on her face, it was clear the crisis was far from over. All I could do was prepare for the worst.

On top of all that, she brought something I'd been desperate to find—the human experimentation footage I requested. She pulled out a blood-stained SD card from her coat pocket and handed it to me. This was the breakthrough I needed, but everything now seemed grim.

12/16 20:45\nI inserted the SD card from the female investigator into my computer and hit play. It showed a room with plain white walls, a scientist in a white lab coat, and woman who seemed to be a test subject. I knew the man. It was Sato, the same scientist who showed me around the facility.

Inside the room, there was a bed with clean white sheets. The test subject was laying down wearing some kind of headgear. Something similar to a VR headset. Wires extended from the headset to a machine that resembled a heart monitor. I could see Sato grinning as he looked at the graphs on the machine's screen.
I fast-forwarded and watched the woman wake up an hour later. She seemed confused and incoherent. Sato nodded as if he expected this, and put the test subject back on the bed.

As the woman went through cycles of sleep and wakefulness, her eyes gradually lost their light. Then she started screaming and thrashing around. A huge shadow encroached from the edge of the screen, crushing the woman's head. It was a gruesome sight that made my stomach turn, but I knew this was the evidence I needed for my investigation. All that was left was to include the footage in my article and make it public online.

12/16 21:00\nThe female investigator I've been working with shared her proposal for future communication. She was wary of potential phone tapping, and told me to download a chat app instead. She also instructed me to encrypt my messages for added security. After spending an hour explaining how to decrypt her messages, she left.

12/17 22:00\nNow that she was gone, I backed up the videos to my cloud service. It was times like this I really regretted opting to subscribe to my apartment complex's painfully slow connection. While it uploaded, I heard a sharp knock on my door. I opened it, half-expecting it to be the investigator again saying she had forgotten something. Instead it was someone else entirely.

The man introduced himself as Maeda. But I was certain he was Sato.\n"No, I'm the Maeda you're investigating."\nThen it hit me—Maeda was the head scientist responsible for the subjects' mental breakdown in the videos. My instincts kicked in, and without thinking, I threw a punch at his face when I saw his hand reaching for his pocket.

Just as I took down Maeda, I wasted no time fleeing my apartment. I jumped the flight of stairs and rushed outside. As soon as I made it out, I heard an explosion. I covered my ears and looked up to see flames and smoke billowing out. Then I realized I had left my PC with all the data inside.

12/20 23:35\nI checked my phone and realized the video data hadn't uploaded to the cloud service. Maeda had destroyed my home and all evidence of the human experimentation. Panic set in. I had nowhere to go and had lost my final ace in the hole. I'm now hiding in a cheap hotel in a port town in Kyushu, far from Kanto.

12/20 23:40\nIn the dimly lit room, I opened Iwama's email. The pitch-black image attached reminded me of my dire situation. Regret gnawed at me for not handling things more smoothly. I felt defeated, a survivor who had lost so much in this madness.

12/20 23:50\nMy phone vibrated, and I saw a familiar name flash on the screen. I opened the chat and read the encrypted message: "Meet me in front of Shinjuku Aria." I wanted so much to rush there, but I was stuck. Should I stay or go? Was this my chance to turn things around or another trap?

12/21 00:00\nI clicked on the URL I noticed attached to the message, and a live video started playing. It showed the front of Shinjuku Aria. I saw my female partner's brain being removed by a blood-covered man as he laughed hysterically. Shock and horror washed over me as I realized the man was the one who had gone missing. What had I gotten myself into?

"Rule 0: You have the right to disband a rule by vote."\nI am the king's aide and second-in-command. Until now, all rules have be absolute, however, a "Voting Rite" was held where citizens could vote to change rules. Now, let's see what sort of ballots were made...

That princess had a smile as bright as the shining sun. Adored by the people, never had she looked upset. However, the day the princess was diagnosed with an incurable disease, her smile vanished.

The day she lost her smile, people all across the land became crestfallen, and clouds gathered in the sky. The people tried to make her smile again, but nothing seemed to work. They racked their brains to find a solution.

It was said that if the princess were to die, the lands would succumb to darkness—never again to see the rising sun. One day, a witch produced a mirror that could seal a person within for all eternity. Hearing this, the people rejoiced.

Even if she were to smile again, she could die at any time. The princess learned of their plans to seal her inside the mirror so she would smile forever, and tried to flee, but couldn't escape. Just then, a light as bright as the princess' smile flowed forth from the mirror. People all over cheered, believing the sun would never set again.

Two men on the road sat by a fire, wolfing down a meal.
"Hey you always walk around with that spear like that?" 
"Yup, never lost a fight with it."
"Dang, that's gotta be one badass weapon."

Out of nowhere, there was a rustling in the bushes, and a bandit with a bow jumped out. "Drop your valuables if you want to keep breathing! And you, lose the weapon!"\nThe man with the spear stood up, still gripping his weapon. Then he slammed the butt of the spear into the ground and tossed it over to the bandit like it was no big deal.

"Ah, this is a fine weapon," the bandit said, checking out the spear. Just then, the metal clasp on the end broke, and the spearhead jabbed right into his hand. While the bandit was howling in pain, the man whipped out a knife from his pocket and stabbed him to death.

"See, we won."\n"It was just luck the spear broke."\n"Nope, that wasn't luck. The spear's been messed up for ages." The man fixed up his weapon and sat back down to finish his meal like nothing had happened.
What remains at the end of a battle are countless screams, wails, and regrets. Or the boisterous laughter of the victors. This instrument was created to evoke scenes such as these.

First, the neighing of war horses and frantic clamor of the battlefield resounded. Following that, the full ferocity and ravages of war were unveiled in musical form. It was a heartbreaking song, but the lyre's tone was superb.

Eventually, a time of peace came to the land. The lyre continued to play the same war-torn melody, but lost its pull on the people's hearts and fell out of favor. The musician who owned it thought it was because the sound was imperfect.

The musician believed more sounds were needed to create a melody about war that would touch the heart. More screams, more shrieks, and more howls. So they traveled the lands to seek these out. And in time, the lyre came to be known not as an instrument that conveys the miseries of war, but one that perpetuates them.

The retainer's king was a fool. He predicted that when he died the king would bring disgrace upon the realm and be forced into many unfavorable treaties. However, thanks to his well-conceived plan, its legacy was guaranteed to endure.

But the loyal retainer's death instead triggered the foolish king to change his ways. He studied daily and became more involved in politics—a complete 180 from his old self. Well done indeed. You have destroyed all your enemies and saved your country from peril. Your name is known across the lands, and for your valor you bask in fame and glory. But you do remember what I said? It's time to hold up your end of the deal. Now is your time to fall!

Give the strongest man in the village half of our rations to find aid at a far off village.

All I wanted was to bring happiness to the villagers. It was a possibility I just couldn't abandon. So I mixed poison in the food during the small banquet we had before sending the young man off. I sent him off a happy man, which brings me here, seeking penance.

However, I was taken aback the following day when he showed up to the review. He shouldn't have been able to move after yesterday. So why? When he walked past me, he said, "You're looking fresh today. Hang in there."

It freaked me out so much I ambushed him late at night, killed him, tossed his corpse in a carriage, and buried him in an unmarked graveyard. A fire broke out and destroyed a large farm and now the neighbors are claiming compensation...?!
I just thought of something. I think it's normal for people deemed successful by the public to still experience suffering.
For example, let's say you're the youngest swordsman to win a tournament. But if you start to stagnate, you'll be called a failure.
Naturally, it's difficult to hold onto your title after each competition. And once you overcome that, you'll only see a world where no one can outmatch you.

Even if there's no one standing against you, you may still find significance in overcoming your past self. But as human beings, we'll eventually give into age. The pain of not being able to do the thing you once could must be unbearable.

Pitter-patter, splash, rustle, sprinkle. Open your mouth and let the raindrops fall onto your tongue. Savor the memories of the clouds that once overlooked the town. Enjoy the lovely lives of the different people in this rainy city, and taste the flavors that someone unknown to you may bring.

That drop was from the spilled wine at the lord's party. A newborn baby accidentally knocked over a cup on the table. The wine saw the lord's smile and his wife's panic. The spilled wine dried up, rose up to the clouds, and turned into rain, carrying the taste and aroma of a happy household.

That drop was a tear shed by a beggar's cat. The beggar who owned the cat was lazy but kind. He always gave food to the cat first before looking for his own. The beggar died of hunger, and the cat shed a few tears. The tears dried up, rose up to the clouds, and turned into rain.

It was the dazzling sun, the blue sky, and the beautiful scenery that only the clouds could witness. How beautiful and pure the sky is. However, the people on the ground were only interested in what was happening down below, even when they looked up.

For many years the man had peered through his binoculars for a chance to lay eyes on the fair lady on the other end. But despite his attempts, he could only ever catch a glimpse of her from behind. Still, he had no doubt she was beautiful. Memorized by her figure, his feelings for her grew day by day. Then one day, she appeared before him. It was unmistakably her.

She came closer. Her face was hidden by her long hair. She took small, slow steps toward him. He felt an urge to turn and flee, but couldn't pull his eyes away. Glue to where he stood, he continued to stare at her like he had through his binoculars.
Then she was next to him. Suddenly, the woman crouched down and looked up at him from below.
When his corpse was discovered the next day, his face was frozen in a grotesque death mask...
Once there was a certain someone.\nThey wondered to themselves why people bothered giving unwanted advice and warnings to others, when such things were known to cause only pointless bickering.

And, there was another certain someone.\nWhy, they, wondered, did some people buy up all the staples, as if they were the only people in the world who had need of them? As if it wasn't nearly certain that someone else needed them more?!
There was also a certain someone, who was given advice.\nImagine, if you will, their feelings upon being told that rising early to exercise would make a significant difference in their life.
And I, who was seated next to all three of these someones, really couldn't care less about any of it. I'd much rather have fun, so I asked them all to play with me.
The queen's scepter holds absolute power.
Whenever the queen raises her scepter, all bow down in reverence.
Anyone who dares to disobey will be caught and face execution.
That's why the queen's scepter is an undeniable symbol of authority.

My foster dad was abusive towards me. The only thing I had to look forward to was the action play the local theater troupe put on every Sunday at the square. I looked up to those heroes who punished evil and shed a single blue tear.

The abuse I endured wasn't a kept secret. Everyone knew what was going on, but they just turned a blind eye to it. That's because being the local councilor, my dad held a lot of power, so no one could defy him. Over time, he'd get such a kick out of his behavior that he even threatened to sell me out.

I ran to the town square and to the hero who had just finished his performance for the night begging for help. The hero sighed and handed me the sword from his waist. "Sorry, kid. I'm just an actor looking to put food on his plate. I'll give you this, but don't come bothering me with your troubles again."

That night, I took the hero's sword and removed the greatest nuisance from my life. My actions got me locked up in a reformatory where I spent most of my time staring at the sky through prison bars and performing daily labor. Just then, I noticed a drop of water sliding down my cheek. It was a single blue tear—an offering to my lost adolescence.
Who is to judge whether justice is truly justice? In a city of virtuous people, this has been debated for years.
The judge who hands out justice for crimes must have a pure and righteous heart. Only with their true sense of justice are they able to punish the guilty without the slightest remorse.

This is why young children were chosen for the task. Innocent children who have yet to be tainted by the impurities of the world. Their little hearts are filled with justice and they solemnly pronounce the verdict.

"Those who randomly attack people, those who don't pay reparations, those who produce counterfeit money, and shoplifters are all to be sentenced to death! We don't like bad adults!"\nThe virtuous people of the city applauded and proclaimed this to be sincere and righteous justice.

How can you call yourself a poet when you wear torn up rags for clothing? You want to eat your words, dress in words, and drift away into a galaxy of rhymes...? Hmm. But in order to grasp "true language," it requires altering your brain. ...You have no idea what I'm talking about, do you? Then let me tell you what "true language" is...

Have you noticed? This fever that has left you sicken for three days and nights is the result of "true language" penetrating your brain. This language has direct access to the galaxy of poetry and causes a profound shift in the listener's ability to perceive reality, altering the perception of the world itself. By the time you master it, you will have abandoned all of humanity. Do you still wish to learn it?

Well I say, that was some superhuman effort you put into it. I'm impressed you were able to keep up with my long and arduous training. You can now access the galaxy of poetry in its "true language" as much as you desire. There are no more obstacles to hinder your love of poetry!

To the best of my ability, I tried to propagate the "true language," but I had to end my endeavors early when I realized the hippocampus of the brain of most people was punctured when they heard it. So, today I lie out yawning on the street, thinking about the future at my leisure. I am the most noble and elegant person in the world, adorned in beautiful verses.
Today more than yesterday. Tomorrow more than today.\nThat is the key to saving money.
Even if you're poor, stay positive.\nWith that kind of outlook, life's more fun than you'd think.
Spend less and put in more effort.\nIngenuity is the best part of saving money!

I didn't need much to live this month.\nThe secret to living a happy life is not to compare yourself to those above you. If you make a contest over who's the most unhappy, you'll only tire yourself out!

The daughter of a noble family fell deeply in love with a commoner, and they eloped together hand in hand. However, they were apprehended by the girl's enraged father, who gave his daughter a sword and ordered her to kill her beloved husband and their newborn baby. Distraught, the daughter turned the Bereaved Blade towards her husband and child.\n\nThe lord and his advisor shared their joys and sorrows, sleeping wherever they could lay their head and consuming coarse food. Eventually, the lord conquered the continent, but differences in opinion caused a rift to form between the two. When his advisor requested, "Please kill me and demonstrate your resolve to your subjects," the lord unsheathed his Bereaved Blade.

The two brothers were both talented and illustrious leaders who governed their territory well. However, when illness struck, something changed within the elder brother. He became delusional and believed that his younger brother was disregarding him. This in turn transformed him into a tyrant. Encouraged by his followers, the younger brother eventually murdered his elder brother with the Bereaved Blade and declared himself ruler.\n\nO children of humanity, your tragedy is my joy and sustenance! Those who possess me will inevitably be compelled to kill someone dear to them, and mourn their loss. Now, who shall present me with the next display of agony? May you tremble in wait!

Today's lecture will be about this sword. Firstly, are you familiar with the term bone marrow? It refers to the liquid substance inside bones, which is believed to have a role in blood production. And that's precisely what's in this sword's container. It is not known why this artifact sword contains bone marrow. However, we do understand its effects. When this sword strikes the spine, the liquid is injected into the target, causing it to convulse and die, regardless of how strong or resilient it may be.

Numerous experiments were conducted on various living creatures, including monsters and humans. All were successfully killed. Recently, the existence of a phenomenon called immunorejection was proven in the medical field, and it is speculated this weapon also utilizes that reaction. Further research to confirm this is planned, using giants as the next test subject.\nUnfortunately, the research group's report was very disappointing. During the test, marrow was injected into the giants' spines. But while this species is known their short lifespan and fragile bodies, they were somehow strengthened. The giants broke free from their restraints and slaughtered the researchers. In conclusion, it seems this served as therapeutic treatment for the giants.

The swordsman was skilled and quick-witted, but he placed great emphasis on his own aesthetics. He took great pleasure in breaking the opponent's sword when dueling, and declared the match worthless if their blade did not snap. Having broken many swords in the past, he devised a weapon for efficiently breaking an opponent's blade, and convinced a blacksmith to craft it. After much trial and error, a weapon that satisfied his needs was forged, and he named it the "Bladebreaker."

One day during a duel, the swordsman broke his opponent's sword as usual with his "Bladebreaker." However, it was a move his opponent had anticipated. They had another blade hidden away, and used it to launch a surprise attack. For a moment, the swordsman was taken aback, but managed to break that sword too and win the duel. He had to break two of the next opponent's swords before they drew their main one. It then took three broken swords before the following opponent drew their final weapon. The "Bladebreaker" swordsman muttered to himself, "What have I done? My spirit might break before their swords do..."

In a burial chamber deep within a tomb, three adventurers were giddy with excitement upon discovering a pile of gold stuffed inside a coffin. "We did it! We found it!" exclaimed the overjoyed thief.\n"We're going to be rich!" cheered the wizard.\nGrinning, the warrior bludgeoned the other two to death with the hammer he'd found inside.

Without a shred of guild for murdering his friends, the warrior's face lit up as he carefully stashed the gold away in his pack. To him, the other two adventurers were merely tools to increase his chances of reaching the treasure.

He was so close to his dream of living a life of luxury, and he couldn't let anyone get in his way. But suddenly, a violent earthquake shook the tomb, blocking the passage from which they had entered. The warrior cursed and turned towards a different route, only to find a locked door blocking his path.

If the thief were still alive, he could pick the lock, and if the wizard were still around, he could try using magic to open it or search for a hidden passage. However, the warrior had killed them both. Frustrated and desperate, he pounded the door with his sword, triggering a cave-in that buried him alive under the rubble.

Welcome, child of man. I am the God of Beginnings, and I offer my congratulations to you for being the first to reach the throne of the gods! Your accomplishment is truly remarkable, and I would like to reward you by sharing the secret of the world's creation.
At first, I sat on this throne and played a fixed melody on my harp. This melody kept everything in harmony, and the world functioned in a perfect cycle.

However, as time went on, an intense desire took hold of me. The repetitiveness of playing the same melody became excruciatingly dull. Even if I played as I pleased, it didn't matter to anyone. This marked the beginning of a tragic event...

The jarring melody I played created ripples, and impurities slowly infiltrated the once-pure world. Mold began to grow on the surface of stars. This catastrophic error was a result of the gods' caprice, and it serves as the origin of humanity and the world. Oh, you look forlorn. You are free to keep this knowledge to yourself or share it with anyone you choose.

Before the crack of dawn, I was roused from my slumber by a bright flash piercing my eyelids. I caught sight of a glimmering light crashing down in the snowy plain. As a seasoned forest ranger, duty called, and I had to investigate. I set out into the wintry wilderness with my trusty hunting dog in tow.

After scouring the area with my canine companion, I stumbled upon a staff standing tall in the snow. I pulled it out cautiously, only to watch it crumble into a lump of salt right before my eyes. Strange, right? I reported the incident, but no one up the chain of command paid it much heed.

A few days later, our country was struck by a series of terrorist attacks. Chaos reigned as powerful individuals met their demise one after another. Meanwhile, I found myself dozing off in the countryside, not out of choice, but because I was perpetually fatigued.

In my dreams, I found myself wielding the staff, casting dark magic that plunged people into the depths of fear. Upon waking, I pondered these visions with a furrowed brow. Could something from the sky have possessed me when I grabbed that staff, making me unwittingly commit terrorist acts in my sleep? I lacked the courage to confirm it. All I yearned for was a deep slumber without those haunting dreams ever again.
Since there's three of us, we all get the same treatment. No sweets, no toys, no compliments, nothing.
Since there's three of us, we all get the same treatment. The amount of times we are hit and the resulting pain is shared between us.
Since there's three of us, we all get the same treatment. Our value of life and self-esteem are also the same.
It's too much! We should just become one! Let's put ourselves together and become a whole!

You want me to close my eyes and take a deep breath? Alright, I'll do it. Let's see if this popular "Breath of Life" hypnosis therapy thingy really works. You want me to speak my mind? All right, prepare yourself.

Thanks to the "Regulation System," human society has been optimized, allowing people to live up to two hundred years. But there's a downside: we lack freedom. We're assigned to designated zones from birth and forbidden to cross the "walls." We have to follow the rules without question. Honestly, we're treated like like animals. What's the point if we can't even summon the courage to tear these walls down?

Some people fit easily into groups, and they're probably the majority. But I'm a loner at heart, and I don't like being grouped together with others. The "Regulation System" should take into account and respect individuality... *yawn* I feel tired all of a sudden... And sleepy...

Wait, did I fall asleep? What? The "Breath of Life" treatment is over? I guess I do feel rejuvenated. I used to whine about the system, which probably wasn't healthy. Babbling about tearing down the "walls" like some naive kid... I better make an effort not to cause more trouble for the "Regulation System."

Um, are you two married? I see. You're married now but you came here not knowing you had been in the past? Interesting. So something caused both of you to lose your memory, and then you fell in love again? If that's the case, allow me to play a song of reversal. Listen carefully to my strings...

You were a knight? You don't say. And your wife was a priestess? Let's go back and investigate further, shall we? Listen to the sound of my strings... Everything is fine. Close your eyes and relax. Take in deep, slow breaths...

I need you to both calm down and listen. You were a righteous Holy Knight. And your wife was the high priestess of a pagan religion. You fought and killed each other's friends and family out of a deep rooted grudge. That's when you fell of a cliff and knocked your heads causing you to lose your memories...

Good grief. After regaining their memories, they went back to murdering each other, then knocked heads and got concussions again. Well, it is what it is. But this time I'll avoid them making another scene by playing my Lute of Reversal until they're cute, innocent babies.
What's the mater with you? I'm your friend, aren't I? So why won't you look at me the same as yesterday?
Sorry about that. Whatever I did to offend you, I'm sorry. I must not have noticed.
I know. I can understand that it's hard to just push everything aside and joke with me again.\n"But... The flames of hope still burn inside me!"
I can't sleep with all these voices.\n"C'mon, burn! BURN! BURN! BURN!!!"\nA full, hearty, and joyous laugh...
I keep dreaming of that moment over and over. You were hanging onto the crevice in the snowy expanse, and as I desperately clung to your hand, it slowly slipped away, and you smiled as if giving up.
"Just let me drop. At this rate, we'll both fall. So let go of my hand. Thanks for everything you've done for—"
Before I could hear your last words, I swung the axe in my other hand down into your brain. Your expression at that moment was a work of art.

I couldn't let you go with a smile on your face. I hope your body and soul will be frozen for eternity. As for the children inside me who died with one kick from you, may they find solace in this act.

Long ago there was a writer who lacked any talent. Caught in a deep depression, every word that flowed from his pen was lackluster and unworthy of praise. Then one day a man claiming to be a fan came to his door asking for an autograph.

The fan went on to explain that he had come from decades into the future via time machine. In his time, the writer was famous, and the fan had read all his books growing up. He could recite passages word for word. The writer was overjoyed.

When the fan asked to read his unpublished work, the writer readily agreed. After flipping through one disappointing page after another, the fan raised their head and noticed the author had snuck into the hallway where the time machine stood.

"I want to go to the future where I'm fawned over..." the author admitted. Infuriated, the fan strangled the man to death.\n"I can't go back now. I'll have to stay in this era and take on his name, writing the rest of his works. I have them memorized word for word." The end.
He slew scores of people daily.
In the tumultuous era he lived in, enemies lurked everywhere. He rarely let his guard down, carrying a sword constantly and striking first to avoid being slain himself.

One night, in a fitful slumber, he had a vivid dream in which he was a king who had abandoned his people as they faced an enemy siege. To his surprise, his people had managed to defend their land and establish a new, prosperous nation, but at a great cost. When he learned the news on his deathbed, he felt a small measure of relief.

As he opened his eyes, he found himself face to face with his foe. Without a moment's hesitation, he grabbed the sword lying next to him and struck them down. Despite his victory, he could still hear the sounds of more enemies nearby, and he knew the battle was far from over.

[Samurai Corps Report No. 1]\nAmidst our arduous training in the seas, the waves seized us with their might. Yet, to our astonishment, we were graced by the fortune of being swept ashore a heavenly isle. Endless summer and awe-inspiring natural beauty had been bestowed upon this sacred land.

[Samurai Corps Report No. 2]\nThe paradise was inhabited by only one man, who lived a simple life caring for his flock of sheep while singing and chanting in a half-naked state. The fruits he harvested were a true delight, with so many different varieties to choose from that you could never tire of them!

[Samurai Corps Report No. 3]\nUpon the hill, where the sun met the sky, lay a grove of apple trees that offered a view of unparalleled beauty. It was as if the trees themselves were the guardians of this paradise. I humbly suggest dispatching a band of knowledgeable and skilled warriors to appreciate the wonders of this idyllic land.

[Half naked man]\nAhahaha! My Exquisite False Lure worked like a charm. As planned, many others will arrive shortly with a bounty of supplies. And once they arrive, I will use my powers to transform them all into mindless sheep, who will serve me obediently.

Exterior Material:
 ・ Deep Cooling Layer x1
 ・ Hidden Air Layer x1
 ・ Soul Binding Layer x3
 ・ Meat Insulation Layer x5
 ・ Protective Outer Layer x3

Life Support Systems:
 ・ Main Life Support System Fuel Complement (Human Sacrifice x3)
 ・ Secondary Oxygen Supply x1
 ・ Status Display and Control Device x1
 ・ Impossible Treasures x5

Equipment Backups:
 ・ Gunner Mode (Backup Projectiles)
 ・ Breaker Mode (Backup Sword)
 ・ Healer Mode (Backup Cleric)

"*$#is is Dorothy, over."
"Launch rockets are all green."
"Whenever you're ready, Princess Kaguya!"
"Roger that."
"Launching Princess Kaguya Prototype...!"

The merchant found himself in a tight spot. He couldn't capture slaves to sell at the market anymore. Then, a mysterious figure clad in black appeared before him, and placed a sharp single-edged sword believed to summon demons in his hands. After the merchant drenched it in animal blood, he successfully summoned a handful of small demons.

The merchant followed the stranger's instructions, and disguised the demons as human children before selling them at the slave market. Surprisingly, they sold like hotcakes! The nobles who bought them were delighted with their tireless work ethic, and their unquestioning obedience.

One fateful day, a voice inside the demons' heads spoke to them.\n"Today, be free from the mortal world."\nWithout a second thought, they crushed the heads of the nobles, and devoured the heart of the merchant who summoned them before returning to hell with their souls.

Young demons were dispatched to the mortal realm, destined to endure brutal treatment as slaves to nurture their hatred towards humans. Once they completed their initiation, they emerged as formidable demons, bent on subjugating humanity.

Amongst the nomads who resided in the mountainous region was an unspoken agreement. One must never set foot in Valley of the Dragon, for it was said to be a cursed place. Strong winds are carried through the canyon there, echoing like the shrill roars of the dragon tribe.

It is said the remnants of the dragon tribe were wiped out in the last war. Despite this, never-ending roars spill forth from the Valley of the Dragon. The tribe's final resting place, it is said the valley is filled with their vengeful souls. As a result, no one has entered it for hundreds of years.

Then one day a spirit whisperer visited the Valley of the Dragon. If the valley really was filled with the souls of the dragon tribe, he wanted to converse with them. The man wandered the valley, pushing through strong winds that threatened to knock him off his feet. However, his search was in vain. All he found there was a single large egg.

This egg of the dragon tribe needed to be kept warm for a certain period of time, or else it would continue to lie dormant without hatching. So the man wrapped the egg gently in a blanket and departed the land. From that day forward, the winds that blew through the valley fell silent. It was as if it was relieved a descendant of the dragon tribe had been found. Meanwhile, the man returned home and fried the huge egg. And enjoy the meal he did.
"Anonymous Quote #1"\nIt must have been tough for you. Children with a similar background as yours are called adult children.
"Anonymous Quote #2"\nPeople are creatures who break if they don't know love. So don't be afraid and take my hand...
"Anonymous Quote #3"\nDo you have to experience something similar to understand it? I understand that feeling too. Probably because I've had similar experiences.
"My response"\nYou're all wrong! This is how I've always been!♪
Can one recognize and acknowledge their own mistakes?
Can one bear the mistakes of others without criticizing them?
Can one forgive their own comrades or those who have violated their beliefs?
Can one realize that their anger may have been instigated by someone else?
There was a nun so faithful and merciful that the people of the city called her a saint. One day, while volunteering at the church, she brought back an orphan she saw on the streets.
That orphan loved the nun. But when he tried to monopolize her affections, he became violent towards the other children and hurt the sister's feelings.

Seeing that she could not turn a blind eye to this any longer, the nun locked the boy in a sermon room and urged him to reflect on his actions. However, it would be a mistake she would forever regret. Heartbroken at being abandoned, the boy hung himself.

Despite never being with a man in her life, the sister suddenly became pregnant. It was then that she began to hear things. "I love you."\nShe was dumbstruck. "Is it you in my belly...?" She knew she must end her life to avoid unleashing this evil spawn upon the world...\nHowever, her resolve grows duller with each passing day, as she remains trapped in her own grief.

I am a master of wizardry. With a flick of my wand, a hazy path is instantly revealed. By following this path, I can enter the treasury easily without setting off any traps. That's how I was able to snatch a few of the castle's treasures. Don't believe me? See for yourself.

Now Minister, the king gave you full responsibility of guarding the treasury. If such mismanagement were to come to light, the king would sentence you to death. I don't think I need to keep reminding you of this. You know very well how our lord can be.

So I have a proposal for you. Abandon your wealth and bring salvation to the poor. That way I will return the treasure and you won't be dismissed. What? You don't give in to threats? How will you make up for the stolen treasure yourself? Oh? Then do as you please.

Let's not do this again, Brother. There's no such thing as the hazy path. It was just a spare key that got us in. You know, when you started touching and breaking things in there, you scared me to death. I'm done helping you out, so you apologize to Father. Understood?
Impurity has been made a scapegoat to maintain order.
People's anxiety and uneasiness are gathered in one place, branded as impurity, and thus by eliminating them is order maintained.
That is what makes impurity such a beautiful thing. It's an offering that bears all curses, cast by people due to their unfortunate birth and circumstances.
Being special or unique has its own value in the world. It's no wonder some merchants would rescue these impure offerings under cover.

A king known for his love of war decided to have his finest soldiers carry weapons adorned with a ram. The ram was thought to be a good omen since it had long been a symbol of war, strife, and struggle.
One of the most wondrous pieces of workmanship was the ram bow given to the archers. Not only did it have an elegant design, but it was much more powerful than the conventional bow.

The king asked the bowyer about the secret to crafting such a fine bow. He replied, "To tame a sheep, you need a shepherd. So I infused shepherd's blood into the bow's riser. A few drops from the tip of the thumb is all you need."

From that day on, all the weapons in the country were adorned with a ram—bows, swords, and spears alike. And with them, the kingdom conquered one country after another until they ruled the entire continent. Around the same time, many shepherds of the realm went missing. However, it is not known how their disappearance is related to the war.
Birds have it good. And the peacock has it best of all. The male is much more beautiful than the female. How wonderful it would be if humans were the same.
I want to be more beautiful that the women of my species. But most human females are far more gorgeous than I could ever strive to be. Agh! It pisses me off. How I wish humans were like peacocks.

I thought of a way to become more beautiful than all the women of my kind. Plastic surgery? Don't make me laugh. Why should I have to aim to improve myself? I'll just sink all the females far below me.
Like a bird, like a peacock, may all women be ugly. Hideous, malformed creatures. If I use my staff to smash the faces of every woman I meet, the world will finally recognize my beauty.
If my existence was of any worth to someone, I would have been rescued from this cage of loneliness sooner.
I have no worth. None that I believe in. So I'm happy to be wanted by someone, for whatever means.
Since I've found my value, I want to make friends with someone who feels just the same as me. Someone who also used to be a loner.
Being with someone who makes you feel valued—that's a true friend.

While touring a limestone cave in a certain tourist area, my friend and I got caught in a cave-in. We failed to escape our predicament, and spent the night trapped. We talked the night away and fell in love. I felt this tragedy was a harbinger of joy.

She suggested we get married straight away. I thought we were moving a bit too fast, but I took it as a sign of her enthusiasm and reluctantly agreed. She then pushed against the nearest wall, and with a thud, a large boulder moved, revealing an exit to the outside.

After we got married, we made the cave our new home. But we fought often. She seemed to always find issue with me, and I struggled to keep my cool. Above all, I still had no idea why we were living in such a place.

As the years passed, the ground gradually subsided and the limestone cave began to sink. Now a feeble old man, I continue to live there with my wife, though we rarely smile or show compassion for each other. I have now come to believe that married life is a straight line to the abyss. There is no such thing as a harbinger of joy.

A group of traveling merchants became lost in the forest, and after wandering for some time, stumbled upon a strangely quiet village. Upon entering a dilapidated eatery, they found a bard sitting in a single seat on the empty floor, strumming his harp. "Welcome, esteemed travelers. Would you like to hear a song?"

"Hey, we have customers," the bard called out, and a middle-aged man with hollow eyes appeared to take their order. Soon enough, their food was served, and the merchants finally began to relax. However, one of them noticed some gnats falling into his soup. As he looked up, he saw countless bugs swirling around in a frenzy...

Seeing the horrified expression on the merchants' faces, the minstrel smirked and strummed his harp. "Don't worry, they're my minions," he said. The middle-aged man shouted at the travelers, "Run! Ever since he arrived, most of the villagers have been eaten alive by those things! You'll be next!" The merchants realized the gravity of the situation and bolted outside.

The swarm of gnats came surging towards them, and as they turned around, they saw the bard had snuck up on them from behind. One of the merchants jumped on him, and the harp's strings snapped as they hit the ground, causing the bugs to go wild. With an insectile hum still ringing in their ears, the merchants fled the forest. They passed on this tale of terror, and no one ventured into the forest ever again.

Seared to the bone by the burning flames, immersed in an acid sea, and frozen through by a violent blizzard...it was if all of the torments that ever were or will be had been blended into one. Merciless, cruel, and endlessly violent, I was overcome with this unbroken litany of suffering, powerless to resist it to any degree.

Chills wrack me, a bitter, malicious cold spearing my flesh. Ah, 'Malice'...such thoughts are what has laid me low. Pure, malicious evil. Hate so deeply embedded as to be unconscious, motivating an equally thoughtless slaughter. As if I'm trapped in a black mist, overwhelmed by powerlessness.\n\nPlease, I can't stand this anymore. None of it, no more, please, just let me fuse with it, just free me from this pain....

Something tickles the back of my mind. My comrades' smiling faces on the battlefield. My smiling family, my love, smiling at me. That's right...they were the reason I stood against the Dark Dragon God, I wanted to protect them...but...I lost. I lost, and was devoured whole. Perhaps I should have given up, then. On life. On happiness, but...\n\n...No!

This specimen of bone belongs to the Dark Dragon God, who once nearly destroyed the world. Take a good look at it. See how the bone has been gouged out, all the way from the nostril to the right eye socket? That's right, this is where the god was pierced from within by a glaive. One of the many heroes it had devoured whole managed to turn the tides with a miraculous strike.

Ahhh, thank you. I feel like I can relax a little bit now that the poison's been bought. I mean, I thought I'd never stop grieving when my husband told me he'd die before he stopped his affairs. Well, I'll make sure of that!\n\nWhat? Rethink things? What's there to think about?! Ugh, just mind your own business.

Sorry, look, I didn't mean to say all that. Geez, how embarrassing. My husband and I had a talk and this time he promised he'd never cheat again! So I guess I'll return the poison.\n\nWhat? It's just sugar water? What the hell, I trusted you! You cant just...LIE to people like that!

Augh, I can't believe this happened. My husband made me tea. He never does, so I was overjoyed, but...it tasted so weirdly sweet. He must have tried to buy poison from that same person! This must be that sugar-water...UGH! He was just trying to get my guard down so he could murder me with poison! He must still want to be with his lover!

What's the matter, got a tummy ache? Hah! I slipped some REAL poison into your coffee. Serves you right. What? Don't look at me like that. This is your own fault for trying to poison my tea.\nWhat? "It was just regular sugar"? You mean it? Oh. Oh, no. Someone! Someone help! Poison!
Despair can be deadly.
Closing oneself off to the world can lead to death.
Recognizing one's own ignorance can be fatal.
Approaching death can reveal the contours of life.
My dreams are what keep me going in this world.
At bedtime, Mama reads me all sorts of books, each one promising a world of wondrous dreams. And my papa, he shields me from knowing things, so that I never have to experience them in my dreams.
But sometimes, the weight of the world just feels too heavy to bear. Even the sweetest dreams can't replace the bitter realities while I'm awake.
I can't help but feel it's my fault my parents have it hard. But maybe that's just the way life is meant to be. It can't always be rainbows and sunshine.

I'm a writer who makes a decent living. On my way home from a signing event for the release of my new book, "The White Dwarf Staff," a man approached me.\n"Good to see you again, comrade," they said.\nI racked my brains trying to think who they could be, but drew a blank.

"Do you not recognize me, comrade?"\nThe man looked crestfallen.\nHe went on to explain that our mother star was now a white dwarf, and would soon explode. Seeking a means to avert this, I apparently performed a sacred ritual to link my consciousness to a life-form from another planet with a brilliant creative mind.

The memories all came flooding back, as if a dam had burst.\n"It all makes sense now. That's why I've written nothing but stories about dying stars."\n"Yes, 'The White Dwarf Staff' portrays the very crisis our home planet faces, and I was convinced of your identity after reading it."

"Let us return to our planet together and seek another way to avoid annihilation."\n"Yes, of course."\nI nodded with a smile, struck him on the head with my staff, dumped his corpse in the river, and burned the murder weapon to ashes in my fireplace. Return to a dying planet, when I've already established a new life here? I'm afraid I'm just not that sentimental.
From the moment I met you, you've been crazy about that girl. I tried all I could to pull you away from her, but I just can't seem to engage you physically or emotionally.

I had to have you, even if it meant we'd never speak again. I sold my soul to the devil for a bow that petrifies its targets. You were supposed to turn into a statue when I shot that arrow through you.
Yet somehow you continue to move and live a normal life. It took me a while to realize it wasn't your body that turned to stone, it was your heart.

With a heart as cold and hard as stone, you've lost all the love you had for her. And now you'll never fall in love with another again. If I can't have you, you deserve to live a lonely life of solitude.
Doll 1\n[Suiginto]
"Bonds are fatuous. The world only needs Father and I..."
[Obstinacy]
(noun) the quality or state of being obstinate\n1. "Obstinacy is what longs for a bond."
Doll 3\n[Suiseiseki]
"Only you yourself can overcome unspoken grief."
[Intense]
(adj) existing in an extreme degree\n1. "The intensity of it is why it's so fragile."
Doll 4\n[Souseiseki]
"My master wishes death upon a certain human. It is my duty to hunt lives. Nothing more."
[Pain]
(noun) mental or emotional distress or suffering\n1. "I could be vulnerable because I knew pain."
Doll 2\n[Kanaria]
"I'm fighting. That's the Rozen Maiden pride."
Affection
(noun) tender attachment\n1. "Her affection lights up the darkness."
Doll 6\n[Hinaichigo]
"I don't want us to fight and hurt anymore."
[Innocence]
(noun) freedom from guilt or sin\n1. "Isolation is the fear of innocence."

A criminal being pursued by knights fled into the rugged mountains and sprained his leg. When he was on the brink of despair, a sorcerer who called himself "Zephyr" came to his aid and led him to a hut at the summit. There, he was met with the grueling task of transcribing Zephyr's magic incantations from morning until night.

The criminal sensed he was being exploited and attempted to sneak off. However, Zephyr begged him to stay, saying, "I am blind and have only a short time left to live. I wish to leave behind the secrets of wind magic. Won't you assist me?"

The criminal initially agreed and put Zephyr off his guard, waiting until nighttime. He then stole the great sword that Zephyr treasured and struck him while he slept. "Don't take it personally," he said. "I don't have time to hang around for your self-gratification, old man."

As the criminal tried to descend the mountain, a fierce wind blew and prevented him from moving forward. "Wind, obey Zephyr's sword! Clear a path for me!"\nHe swung the sword with all his might, and a gust of wind lifted the weapon into the sky. The blade flew swiftly on the wind and pierced his left chest, leaving only silence behind.

Alright, it's getting exciting now! The Gladiatorial Punishment tournament has finally reached the finals, and the crowd and I have reached peak excitement! But the competitors are even more fired up! Let's hear what they have to say!

Oh my, both fighters are really pumped up. Can you hear their shouts?
"Will I really escape my death sentence if I win?"
"If I'm released, I'll leave a shit on your skull!"
It seems both fighters have their sights set on victory! As expected, surviving this far has really set them apart!

Now, many of you in the audience may already know this, but I too was once a gladiator and won the championship here. In other words, winning revokes your death sentence, so rest assured! And now, before you all riot, may the finals commence! Let's begin!

A round of applause for such an intense match! All hail! Fantastic! As promised, your death sentence has been revoked! And you now have the right to challenge a former champion. Me, in other words! Amazing! And if I refuse, I'll be killed by our bloodthirsty audience!\n"I'll split your head and piss in the crack!"
At night, my mother used to say that everything we hear and see until the morning is nothing but a dream. No matter how bad the nightmare is, we will always wake up because it's just a dream.

So I stopped fighting and endured it because it was dream. The obscene words whispered into my ear every night, the looming large and dark figure that pressed against me, even the sensation of hands stroking my skin—all of it was just a dream.

The figure that appears in my dreams every night must be a kind of demon or nightmare. So one day, right before it was about to penetrate me, I shot the panting figure, with a small bow and arrow hidden under my pillow. The arrow seemed to pierce a part of its body.

The enormous figure screamed and rolled over. Somehow, I thought it resembled someone I knew. Then my mom ran towards the figure and screamed, but it's all just a dream. If I wake up, it'll just be another morning. Right?

This country has been thrown into an endless war, and frankly I've grown tired of it. That's what I used to think until recently. His Majesty praised me for my past battles and whenever I touch the spear he bestowed upon me, I recall the honor I received.

I've wielded my spear on every battlefield. My comrades praised me for my skill, and my enemies fled at the sight of it. No matter how dark and difficult the battle, I was calm because I had the spear bestowed upon me by His Majesty.

During those days of battle, I lost my lover and many of my comrades, leaving me alone. His Majesty, who had become ill from the long years of war, passed away. But I was alright, thanks to the memories of the honor bestowed upon me by the spear. As I grew older, I worked as a spear master.

Finally, the time has come for me to entrust the spear to a warrior's disciple who is talented but troubled by the battles. When I passed on the spear, a bright light shone on the disciple's face. And...what about me? At my request, the disciple joyfully pointed the spear in my direction.

In recent times, there has been an abnormal increase in heinous murders. The victims are so brutally mutilated that they can no longer be identified, and the perpetrators uniformly claim vague motives such as being "driven by impulse." Moved by patriotic concern, I began investigating.
