I wondered if the blistering heat and frustration were causing more people to act violently. After cross-referencing various sources, I believed that to be the case. However, even if we could explain the cause of these sudden outbursts, it still wouldn't explain the extent of the damage inflicted upon victims.

We received information that an abnormal magical energy was flowing into the waterway. It turned out that a witch living near the reservoir was conducting forbidden magic experiments, and the waste material was being discharged into the reservoir. It seems this caused many people to misinterpret "hot" and "heated" feelings as the desire to "kill" and "destroy."

I led a group of knights to apprehend the witch, but she refused to be captured and instead doused herself in oil and set herself on fire. The flames spread, and our "hot" and "heated" feelings compelled us to "kill" and "destroy." As a result, we were all trapped in a prison of destruction, our bodies so brutally mutilated we could no longer be identified.
Long ago, the world was swept by a great flood.
Men and women looked back on the past and shed tears every day.
Those tears accumulated in a jar.
Drop by drop, the tears swelled higher. And those tears were the source of the flood that washed away the world...

I am a violinist, a wanderer without a home or family. But I am never lonely. When I feel the weight of solitude, I draw my bow across the strings and immerse myself in an eternal melody. In this way, I am always able to converse with the great maestros who loved music as deeply as I do.

But one day, I woke up from a nap while playing my violin. Strangely, I felt more tired than before I slept. While conversing with the maestros within the eternal melody, I realized just how much I had to learn and improve upon.

Recently, I have found myself sighing more often than usual. The thought of being reprimanded by the maestros fills me with dread and makes me afraid to play my violin. It is hard to imagine that I once played the eternal melody with such single-minded devotion.

As for why I stormed into a citizen's orchestra concert hall and began assaulting everyone with my violin, let me be clear: it was the maestros who ordered me to do so. They commanded me to eliminate all those who dared to sully the eternal melody with their amateurish playing. I am not to blame for their deaths!

My parents only had eyes for my siblings and never seemed to care about me. When I felt lonely and on the brink of despair, I would tell myself, "You are a child of the Floral Sprite. Don't cry, the flowers are always smiling at me."

Despite my parents' lack of love, I refused to let a bitter heart grow within me. I, too, am part of the great chain of this planet. Since I am a product of love myself, I know that I must also love others.

I apologize for boring you with my story. Congratulations on the opening of the orphanage. I've brought some flowers from my home garden for you to plant. Let them bloom beautifully and bring smiles to everyone's faces!

Don't worry, leave it to me. First, I'll disassemble the body and dissolve it with medicine. Then, I'll mix the remaining solution with soil from my flower garden and plant it with the flowers all around. After all, I am a child of the Floral Sprite. Even the most horrifying murder victims must be incorporated into the chain of the stars.

One of my subordinates quit the other day. And he left with these words,
"I can't follow you if all you do is take the credit of your subordinates."
You know, I'm the one who's held accountable for all your behavior, so I deserve as much.
...Huh? Who are you? And what are you doing sitting at my desk?

What? You can't fool me. That's my name.
I'm asking you again. Who the hell are you and why are you pretending to be me?
...Won't drop the act, huh?
Good, my secretary has arrive. Get this man out of my sight!
Wh-what did you say?! That man there is an impostor! The name you spoke belongs to me!\nMmh... I see how it is. You're both in on it.\nUnforgiveable! I'll crush your skulls with my mallet!

Huh? You're asking if I, a general with such outstanding military prowess, has become incompetent or has lost the ability to bear the weight of vanity?\nOh... Well, now that you mention it...\nHave it your way! I'll lock myself up and dwell on it...

I was a bit on the tipsy side that day.\nA fortune teller told me, "You'll be a divorcee. There's a problem with your wife." Angered, I reached out to the woman and grabbed her by the chest.\nUnfazed, she continued. "Try unlocking her mind with this," and gave me a book.

As soon as I arrived home, I proceeded to examine the book. However, it was written in a script I'd never seen before, let alone understood.\nYet somehow, I began to understand what my wife was thinking.\nMy wife, who I've always thought as a modest and family-oriented woman, was out with a man. And the two of them were plotting to kill me.

I considered separating from her, but then I would be forced to pay her alimony.
I tried to meet with her man.
When I did, I then was able to read his mind as well.
I found out he swung both ways and that he wanted me. So I seduced him and together we murdered my wife.

I saw my chance and killed the man, making it appear like a double suicide. A murder done out of passion.
Then I left. Escaping my crime, a free man in the town.
But I became afraid of the looks from others. You can never know what others are thinking deep inside.
I should move out into the countryside, away in the fields...

This is a story from my dad from his days as an explorer when I was little.
He spoke of a kingdom in the north of beautiful gems. You could find gems everywhere you went.
In the treetops, bottom of rivers... And sometimes even inside the fish!
Heheh. Just imagine the look on chefs' faces.

The kingdom mostly made its livelihood with crafts.
They made a whole bunch of stuff with the gems they mined.
Then they would load their goods onto carts and travel miles upon miles on steep roads...
Just to sell their crafts in the distant port towns.
But they never let it known that their kingdom was rich with these precious jewels.

What should have been a strictly kept secret was somehow leaked to other lands.
The rumor quickly spread...
And the kingdom was destroyed before I was born.
Outside kingdoms swept the land bare of it's gems. And now it's nothing but a barren mountain.

This flute is a relic from the Gem Kingdom, handed down to my father from a certain kingdom.
It's famous for showing beautiful visions to those who hear it.
Can you see it? The mountains and rivers are filled with glittering gems.
This illusion is what the kingdom once was.
It was noticed by an adventurer who even identified the location.

It's said that a fatal error occurred on this planet long, long ago. But no one knows the details.\nAnyway, as a result, this led the once 4-legged creatures to become 2-legged, and are now reigning over Earth.\nThese altered creatures are no longer a shadow of their past selves.

It was then a certain prey was presented to the horned lion, the king of the 4-legged creatures.\nAnd when he saw it, his expression was filled with rage.\nHairless arms and legs, hardly any muscle on its entire body... And it once oppressed the 4-legged beasts. A creature known as a "human".

"Tear it in half!" order the horned lion.
But a few hours later it was reported the "human" had escaped.
It were 4-legged beasts, formally known as "dogs" and "cats", that had escaped with it out of a sense of familiarity.
And so the enraged lion lead its team in pursuit.

When the lion caught up with the group, it shot an arrow. It pierced through the "human" who protected the "dog" and "cat".
"We couldn't handle the forbidden technology. It's because of us the things are like this. You must restore this planet to the beauty it once was..."
And with that, the "human" passed away.
Afterwards, the horned lion had a bestowed him a funeral and set up a proper government.

My Lord, I've come to report news on the Knights of the Order.\nI was just about to be captured by them, but after a fierce sword fight, I was able to fled to the commercial district, a cease-fire zone.\nBut the moment I stepped foot into the area, I was captured.

The knights had began to discuss something in front of me.\nWe don't have the right to capture him here. Perhaps we should overlook the matter.\nNo, no. We captured him the very moment he stepped in. That's what happened.

Their never-ending argument continued in vain, but leaned toward the conclusion of turning to their superiors for a decision.
They looked like a bunch of cowards, so I told them,
"I'm here undercover by your superiors! You don't want to aggravate them by getting in my way, do you?"
The chaos it stewed allowed for my escape.

My Lord! Why order for my execution?! I've brought wonderful news! The men are cowards and not to be feared!
...What? I am the coward? Just because I said "after a fierce sword fight" yet the sword at my hip shows no signs of blood?
You think I was ordered to spew lies and catch you off guard?
Heh... Nothing gets past you!

A man with a habit of comparing himself to others with a wish to die cried out to the sorcerer.\nI want to die, but I don't have the courage to do it. Isn't there anything you can do?\nThe sorcerer replied, "Then try dying, and you may gain the courage to do so."

The man used "Scorpion Paralysis", a secret medicine brewed by the sorcerer to paralyze himself.\nThe day of his funeral, the attendees mourned over his death, their eyes briming with tears.\nThe sorcerer, however, observed the scene apathetically.

When the time was right, the sorcerer spoke to the crowd.
Late at night, when the man's paralysis subsided, he shared with him all that he learned.
The man was grief-stricken. So much so that the shock killed him.
The sorcerer watched the the poor man succumb to his death, all the while thinking back on the information he learned.

"Whenever I saw him moping around, it made me feel a little better about myself. He was the real lowlife..."\n"No one else was as miserable as him... And that gave me hope to keep living..."\nThe sorcerer then thought to himself. Perhaps this had saved him.

"There is no paradise where men rule. There will not be peace until I find and consecrate a temple protected by the grace of God."\nThe scholar shrugged off his family's attempts to stop his journey, and set out into the wilderness, cane in hand. However, he was unable to endure the burning heat and hunger that consumed him, and he eventually collapsed.

When he awoke, he was inside a cave. He noticed his body had been healed. "Are you okay?" a voice asked within his head.\n"God! Is that you?" he exclaimed.\n"I am a man who renounced his body in the pursuit of knowledge. I have no desires. When I see someone in need of help, I offer my assistance."

The man told the voice of his journey in search of a temple protected by the grace of God. The voice then replied, "That place exists within everyone's heart. The search for material fulfillment is endless, where only destruction awaits."\n"Know that what you have is enough. Unite your heart with your family and build stronger bonds."

The scholar returned to his hometown with tears in his eyes. In time, he was canonized as a saint for his studies and efforts to help his family. His favorite cane was left for future generations as a sacred relic.\n...But there is more to the story that serves no importance. The voice that spoke to the scholar was actually a mischievous spirit from a barren land who enjoyed teasing travelers.

The sword was said to produce a flame that changed shape according to the wielder. Since its size proved one's power, soldiers throughout the realm fought to claim it as their own. Those who ultimately won the blade then raised the blazing sword into the air as a display of might.

After countless battles, the sword wound up in a small nation. There it lay undisturbed for several hundred years, until another major conflict broke out. The king of a militaristic nation who had heard rumors of the sword ordered the entire realm and its citizens to be burned to ash in search of it.

When the king finally held the sword in his hands, he proclaimed with enthusiasm, "This burning flame is undeniable proof I have the strength to rule a mighty kingdom!" Then he tossed it to a captive slave. "Wield it. Show me how weak you are." The slave took the blade in their hands and... Well, what do you think happened?

Faced by raging flames, the king ordered the slave's execution. But the captive fended off the king's soldiers and escaped to their ruined homeland with the sword. The sword's strength was in fact tied to one's will to live. Power alone will not set it ablaze.
Hey! Haven't seen you for ages! What's with that blank expression on your face? Have you forgotten us little guys now that you're a millionaire? I'll give you a hint, then. Ever seen this axe before?

A few years back, I started a small trading company with a couple of friends. Everything was going great until a deal went bad and I had to file for bankruptcy. Debt collectors hired a bunch of shady types to catch us, and we were forced to put on a show.

They threw a few of us into a circular arena surrounded by a wire fence. In the center was an axe. Whoever got their hands on it first and smashed everyone else's head in would be spared. That was how the game, the "War Axe of Strife," worked.

You tried to drive out all the newcomers so you could maintain control over the business district, didn't you? You had me kill my own friends while I shed tears of blood. Well, it's your turn now. Get in there and experience the War Axe of Strife for yourself.
Well I'll be damned. Some machine went off the rails and now everyone's dead. We can't just leave a pile of corpses out for everyone to see. They deserve a proper burial.
We can toss the bodies into the giant crater the weapon made. When I threw a few rocks in there, there wasn't even an echo. It should make a good resting place for the unnamed masses.
I lost count of how many we threw in already. Yet I still don't see 'em piling up down there. Well, it's probably for the best, since they're all really mangled. I'll sing 'em an elegy in tribute.

Wakey wakey, and welcome to the world. Down the birth canal comes our little baby. Huh? Too graphic for you? It's hard to be serious when considering a baby's feelings. You hear that? They're wailing in woe after being forced into a world beyond salvation.
He stabbed her heart with the spear, almost like adorning it with a jewel. Then, something unexpected happened. The woman remained alive, and her heart continued to beat as proof of its resilience.
The woman was driven to despair. It was supposed to be a lover's suicide. Together they simultaneous thrust their spears at the other. But tragically, she survived while her lover died.

She sought a way to follow him to the grave. She stabbed herself over and over with every weapon she could find. She threw herself into the river and hung herself with a rope. But no matter what she tried, she just wouldn't die.

Over time, the woman's heart that had rooted itself to the spear eventually rotted. Still the woman could not die, for by now she had become an immortal demon. Night after night she cried...but only her heart had died. Now she seeks out couples to plague women with the same lonely fate.

Coming back from school, I found my grandpa moving things in the yard.
"Gramps, where's Granny? I want a snack."
"Good timing. Call the old hag over here."
When he turned to look at me, his eyes were bloodshot red and gripped a gun in his hand.

Grandpa handed us both a shovel and told us to dig.
"I'll be burying my wife in this hole after I shoot her."
I tried to stop him, but he wouldn't listen.
Following his orders, Granny silently dug.

"I fought with a friend on the same battlefield. But then he left me there and took this pistol from me while he was at it."
"Next thing he did was tell my wife I was dead and used that chance to console and get close to her."
"And ya know what happened? That there slut opened up her legs to him. That deserves punishment!"
Gramps pulled the trigger, blowing Granny's head off and then shot his own.

When my parents returned home, I explained what had happened. Then they buried the pistol and their bodies.\nAccording to my father, the ghost of the pistol would come back to haunt us. So it was best to keep it a secret.\nBut even after 10 years, I'm not sure that was for the best.

I had just returned home from my first day of being promoted to a managerial position.
Welcomed by the smiles of my wife and daughters, the day's fatigue seemed to melt away.
What happiness. What joy.
Surely these wonderful days are here to stay.

At the ball last night, I was asked by many gentleman for a dance.
But I was prepared this time. I had my attendant carry a notebook with them.
If you wish for a dance, please sign your name and wait your turn.
It's hard being so popular.

The script for my last play was a huge success. It received outstanding reviews. Far more than it deserved.
Which is why I'm having such difficulty with my next one.
But if I can get past this, I'll be up there in the ranks with the greatest screenwriters.
It's quite the hurtle, but not impossible. I can do this!

[Historian]
The more records I read of the Millennial Kingdom, the more I doubt the theory of it being destroyed by a meteorite.
It's just not possible for this many people to be happy. Could it be these records are just lies and exaggeration?
What if there was a fight with those living in happiness and those who weren't... Resulting in a dreadful outcome?
I fear the worst.

[A anecdote of how an unusual chair came into fashion]\nThere once was a king who took the people's tax money and spent it on luxury goods and beautiful princesses.\nAll who criticized his actions were to be executed.
When the citizens rushed into the castle, the workers and princesses all ran for their lives.\nBut the king remained seated on his throne, making no attempts to escape.
The king was captured and was to be executed in front of his own people.\nHowever, according to his wishes he would ot be beheaded or hanged. Instead he would be bound to his throne and burned alive.

As he sat comfortable on his throne, the king was engulfed in flames.\nThough arrogant, his pride as he sat burning there left an impression on the people.\nLater, a chair modeled after him would become popular among the kingdom.

I was once an honorable knight, but no one respects me since I've retired. I'm tired of being treated like an old man!\nI'm stronger than I even was during my prime years!\nJust you see... Come, Great Sword. Grant me all the food and drink for two!

Ahahaha! Behold! My wish granted in an instant!
This is only the beginning of my power. I can have anything. Gold, women, you name it.
What? You wanna know how I got this power?
Who knows. But this is nothing for a knight of honor!

I'm too loud, you say?
Nonsense! Let the neighbors holler all they want.
Though, it would be nice if they'd all be gone!
...Hm? That's quite the racket going on over there.

So the neighbor and their guard dog were are dead...
Supposedly blood from a third party was also at the scene, but it's yet to be identified.
What if there's a spirit in my sword that has been following my orders all this time?
And if the spirit killed itself along with them, then that explains why can't use my powers anymore...

The Fairy Rose Flute was an instrument that could only be played once. Once air flowed inside its pipe, the chrysalis would hatch and a rose would bloom. When the butterfly died, the rose would wither.\nWith those words, the fairy parted with the instrument, giving it to a human as a token of friendship. And for many years, the flute was put on display without ever being played.

Eventually, the human gave birth to a child who became fascinated with the flute. The child asked when the chrysalis would turn into a butterfly and when the rose would bloom. The human didn't know how to answer.

The human gradually felt more and more drawn to the flute. Each time the child got excited about seeing the chrysalis hatch, they dreamed of what kind of butterfly would emerge. And each time the child talked about the rose, they fantasized about how beautiful that rose would be.

At long last, the human blew the flute. Butterfly wings extended from the cracked shell, the rose blossomed, and a beautiful melody resounded. Moved by its beauty, the human immediately regretted not playing it until now. But when they finished playing, the butterfly died, the rose withered, and the flute faded away. From that moment, humanity lost all connection with the fairies.

I was a fiend on the battlefield, as a warrior of great military prowess. I left none alive as I slashed through all who opposed me. Then one day I fell ill. I overlooked a wound infected with poison, and now I must heal before I can engage in battle again.

The doctor told me the only way to cleanse a body clouded by poison was to drink clean water, drop by drop like rain dripping into a muddy puddle. Though impatient, I heeded his words and focused on my health.

The civil war was reaching its climax. I cursed myself for not being there for my people. I was left with no other choice. To speed up my recovery, I traveled to the sacred mountain, collected raindrops imbued with primal vitality, and guzzled them down. After a few days, I departed the mountain fully cured.

However, when I returned the civil war had been quelled. Absent when my country needed me most, I fell from grace. I was put out to pasture, and resigned my post.\nSince then, I spend my days watching raindrops—damp and heavy, drenching my heart...

Driven by a wholehearted desire to determine the golden rules of the world, I journeyed to discover the secrets behind the world's creation. Sifting through screeds of documents, I confirmed the existence of a staff that sealed within it the origin of all souls. And here it was, propped up on this hill just as was written. Bracing myself, I reached out my hand.

When I pulled out the staff, the soul sealed inside sparkled and glowed. At the same time, thoughts rushed through my head. The soul was frightened, and it took all the patience I had to calm it down enough to finally communicate with it.

I asked what made it afraid. The soul replied it was because this place was formed from distortions. Originally, the universe was nothing but an ocean of thoughts. Those who blocked out those thoughts escaped by creating a container called a "body" where their soul could reside.

"Souls become corrupted if they remain in the midst of a civilization overrun by these foreign 'bodies'" it exclaimed, before fleeing into the sky. As I watched it go, I felt a sense of the transience of life. But I was convinced. If that is how the world came to be, it explains why such inequality and irrationality are tolerated.

The lantern fell on an icy, snow-covered mountain. But no matter how much snow or hail from the harsh winter weather blasted down on it, it's light would never fade. A strong golden flame shimmered and flickered within.

It was said that a lone phoenix guarded the mountain, and anyone who dared approach it would never return home alive. One boy ignored the villagers' warning and proceeded with the climb...but as expected, he was never heard from again. The villagers blamed it on either his death or a curse brought on by the mountain deity.
"Oh, I finally found it."\nHundreds of years had passed when the lantern turned up again. Entranced, the old man reached out and bathed in its blazing light.

"Do you know how the legend of the phoenix goes? When they reach the end of their lifespan, they burn themselves to death."\nThey do this to be born again in the next generation, taking on a new body to protect the mountain for all eternity. Yes, it was all for the greater good.
Everything you eat becomes the flesh and blood of your future self. You can't expect to be healthy if all you do is binge on powders and pills, no matter how nutritious they say to be.
No matter how delicious it looks or how grumbly my stomach gets, if I gorge on greasy food I'll just regret it come morning.
But the only reason I can say such things is because my heart and soul is healthy! And though I know I shouldn't, my hands just have mind of their own!
In conclusion! Late night steaks are the absolute best! A guilty conscious is also makes the best seasoning!♪

My dear son, your striking good looks and manly charm have set you apart from the rest, and it's only natural that others envy you. But don't worry, I'll make sure you come to no harm. So please, forget about marrying into another family, my dear. Oh, hold on a moment, someone is coming.
Oh, it's you again. Let me remind you that we're no longer married, so it's best if you keep your distance. What brings you here, anyways? Ah, it's about our son again, isn't it?

So, you thought you could convince our son to become the knight commander's son-in-law, did you? Well, I have to hand it to you, your plan was quite cunning. However, our son made the wise decision to stay with me. I'm done speaking about this, so leave.

My dear son, you are my shining star, radiating with such dignity and masculine grace. When I sealing you in a coffin of ice with our family's prized staff, I knew you'd be mine forever, body and soul. Let's spend the rest of our days together, basking in the glow of each other's company... Hahaha, haha...
Doll 5\n[Shinku]
"To live is to fight, isn't it?"
Noble
(adj.) possessing outstanding qualities\n1. "Wearing nobility to hide one's weakness."

There once was a man who had lost everything—his family and relatives—in a tragic accident. Consumed by grief, he sought solace in the armory where his family's treasured weapons were kept. He spent his days there, drowning in despair. But one day, he stumbled upon a crystal sword with a design unlike any he had seen before. Strangely, it had no scabbard. Despite searching high and low in the armory, he couldn't find one.

Determined to give the sword the treatment it deserved, he sought the help of a skilled blacksmith to craft a suitable scabbard. But in a matter of days he discarded it, convinced by his keen sense of aesthetics that a makeshift solution wouldn't do justice to the sword's exquisite beauty.

With the crystal sword carefully wrapped in cloth, the man set out on a journey, traveling far and wide. He met connoisseurs, collectors, and weapon dealers, listening to their stories and examining various scabbards in his unwavering quest. His tireless efforts were reminiscent of the legendary phoenix that rises from the ashes.

Years passed, and the man still couldn't find a scabbard that matched the sword's magnificence, but he never gave up hope. Then, in his final moments, a serene smile crossed his face as he lay on his deathbed. "This sword helped me rise from my darkest days like a phoenix," he whispered. "I am grateful to have encountered it. Please lay it to rest with me in my coffin." With these words, he breathed his last, knowing that the sword had brought purpose and meaning to his life.

Excerpts from a Soldier's Journal\nIn the year x3x, in the midst of a brutal war with a neighboring country, I stumbled upon this strange-ass spear. Didn't have much say in the matter, 'cause it dragged me towards the enemy's skull all on its own. Turned out the bastard was some fancy-pants knight with a damn necklace gleamin' with a red gemstone.

Excerpts from a Soldier's Journal\nEver since that war, life's been smooth sailin' for me. Ain't felt an ounce of fear in battle with that spear in hand. But lately, been gettin' this eerie sense of déjà vu. Like I've lived through these same damn events before, in some sorta endless loop.

Excerpts from a Soldier's Journal\nLost track of how many times I've lived this damn life. Blame it on that cursed spear. Seems like it's messin' with my head, givin' me glimpses of the future. Now, it's year x3x, and we're gearin' up for a showdown with a neighboring country.

Soon as I set foot on the battlefield, I knew how it'd play out. Had that damn red gemstone necklace hangin' 'round my neck, like a grim reminder. And there's this young buck comin' at me with a spear. Ain't it a fuckin' twist of fate, facin' my own death over and over again.

A hunting chant echoed out from beneath the snowy canopy. No soul would dare enter this accursed forest. The dreaded gods are driving the beasts out with their ancient song. Lock your doors tight and keep your weapons handy. The beasts are headed for the village.

Demons, bears, and wolves alike fled into the village. The gods had no intention of capturing them. They merely wish to witness the frenzied chaos that ensues as beast and villager clash. The more blood spilled, the better.

From village outcasts to cherished daughters, those from all walks of life were lost in the bloody battles. The more pleasure the gods derived, the sooner the next bloodbath began. Sometimes the villagers prevailed, while other times they were overrun. Both man and beast were toys of the dreaded gods. But the more the gods rejoiced, the more bounties the woods provided.

One day, a mother who had lost her son set the woods ablaze. The fire soon spread, and the beasts fled from the flames. The villagers drove them back, and waited for the gods to emerge, but none did. Finally, when the woods were reduced to ash, the villagers realized the gods did not exist. They were free from the dreaded gods, but had also lost the bounties of the woods.

[Quack]\nI used to be just a regular citizen, but recently they started calling me a "quack," and that's how I ended up in this hospital. Memories of my past life as an astral body living in a "conceptual city" suddenly resurfaced. The city was contaminated by mental waves, and all of us astral bodies perished.

[Quack]\nThe "conceptual city" was a unique place where astral bodies like me existed as transcendent beings, with only our minds and not being bound by physical bodies like pathogens. It's hard to put it into words. You don't understand? Then just forget about it.

[Quack]\nLately, I've been struggling with a sense of despair and shame. It's hitting me hard that my past self was an astral body. I used to live without even realizing my own lowly status. I wonder if there's any medication that could help me cope with these feelings. Thank you.

[Hospital Director]\nI was surprised to find a reincarnated astral body nearby. Sacrificing a few individuals to escape the pollution of mental waves and possess a human body was troublesome. Now that this body is empty, it seems a shame to just discard it. Considering the previous body I possessed had a heart condition, maybe I should swap with this one.

You know, there's a tale in our country that says not to plant red licorice in your garden because it's tied to an ominous bug - a butterfly with wings as red as fresh blood. Pretty bizarre, right? But funny enough, I've never seen one myself.

Those red butterflies flutter their wings like they're ablaze, almost like fire! Back in the day, people used to freak out and chase them away from their gardens, thinking their houses would catch fire. Can you believe that? It's ridiculous! I mean, without those superstitious beliefs, we might have spotted those butterflies by now.

But hey, check this out! I found an amazing artifact in the museum's basement. Ta-da! It's a gorgeous flute with a red butterfly design. How cool is that? Maybe with this flute, we can lure those butterflies to us too. Let's give it a try!

Whoa... Look at that! The whole town is on fire! The flames spread like a butterfly flapping its wings, mesmerizing! With this magical flute, we could travel the world playing it, and maybe one day those butterflies will appear in front of us too. I wonder which will happen first, the world turning crimson or the butterflies showing up?

Long, long ago, in the corner of someone's heart, there was a tale of a memory that may or may not have existed. The sun used to co-exist with humans, nurturing crops and sustaining life with its warm rays. The crops, in turn, nourished the livestock, and the livestock nurtured the humans. The sun was revered as a living god.

But as time passed, doubts arose. How long would they depend on the sun's blessings? Fear grew, and a desire to destroy the sun before it could abandon them took hold. The sun vanished from the sky, leaving behind a void.

In the sun's absence, a staff was crafted from a grand tree, believed to be the sun's embodiment. Its wielder rose to become the village chief, proclaiming themselves as the sun god. However, the staff soon became a source of conflict, igniting flames of war on earth. Despite the sun's departure, it was said to have left behind a memory that continued to illuminate the land.

Since then, the sun has never descended from the sky. It yearns to burn itself, to turn into ashes, and sear the flesh of living humans. Yet, this legend has long been forgotten by those on earth, lost to the passage of time.
I've dreamed many times of a chain of sorrows, endlessly begetting more sorrows.
Revenge following from hatred. A world of such deprivation it brings forth people who know of nothing but stealing that which belongs to their fellows.
Without adequate food or shelter, people left so listless they cannot even brush aside the flies that cling to them. Plagues that ravage devastated landscapes.
Truly, it's a mere trifle to arrange things so, to craft a world which overflows with sorrow.

An ill-omened daughter was born to a noble family on the night of a new moon. They believed that raising this cursed child would bring misfortune to the country. Fearing condemnation, the parents abandoned the child deep in the mountains one day. The crying child was soothed by the animals of the forest. They kept the child warm, fed it, and did their best to raise it.

Under the animals' protection, the child grew into a kind-hearted young girl. One day, she came across a small bird. Its wing had been injured after it was mistreated by children from the town. The girl did her best to nurse the bird, keeping it warm and applying a herbal poultice to the wound. Eventually, it recovered and flew happily up into the sky.

One day, the little bird returned to the girl. Hearing from it that a great calamity was imminent, the girl rushed down the mountain to warn everyone. But the townspeople just hurled stones at her, cursing the return of the ill-omened child. She went back to the forest in tears, and was met by her animal friends, who told her they were also livestock that had been abandoned by humans.

There is no need to explain what happened to the people at the foot of the mountain. Our republic rose from the ashes of their town. Through the wisdom and mercy of the Creator, who sought to live in harmony with the animal kingdom, we have escaped destruction at the hands of countless foreign invaders. Our flag still bears the motif of a little girl and a small bird.

One day, a neatly dressed man found himself in a dangerous situation. He stumbled upon some robbers who had just entered a store, but they were so engaged in their looting that they paid him no mind. In that critical moment, his self-defense weapon, which he had in his pocket, was triggered...
The man wasn't particularly strong or athletic, so he reluctantly started studying self-defense. However, progress was slow, and it didn't seem to come naturally to him.
Growing frustrated with his inability to defend himself with practice, the man started carrying a weapon for on-the-spot protection.

Initially, the man had taken up self-defense because his father had taught him that "a gentleman should be able to defend himself in times of need." When the robbers heard the sound of the arrow fired from the man's weapon, they became enraged and shot him and the store owner with the gun they had brought to intimidate them.
It was already chilly during the day, but once the sun went down, it got even colder.
How much longer will this photoshoot go on? Her breath as white as snow, she rubbed her frosty cheeks, admiring Little Match's Girl's courage.
I'd take her spot if I could...but that would defeat the purpose.
I hear some countries have a cap on working hours. I'm sure it gets ignored all the time, but it'd be nice if they had a limit in place for photoshoots like this.
Leaves yet to turn their colors. I think that describes me as I am now.
If I work hard during this photoshoot, will I turn a beautiful color?
I'm but a match that couldn't sell in the cold. If only I had found my light back then, and escaped this tattered life...
I like to scrimp and save. I can't go back to a life where even eking out a meagre existence is beyond reach.
The photoshoot was BOOORING. But I got to play with everyone, so that was fun.
No matter where I play, everyone seems to find me.
I don't get why Snow complains so much when she's clearly enjoying herself. Matchy was trying to follow along, too.
Still, I don't want some dumb photoshoot to get in the way of my playtime. I wanna play even more games with everyone next time!

The bottom of the sea is a mystery. Down in its depths was said to live a lonely Sea King. But he wasn't a real king; no one resided there but him. Because he was so lonely, he'd occasionally come to the surface to greet the fishing boats. On those days, the sea would become treacherous.

One day a flute washed up in a coastal town. When it was blown, no sound came out. "Is there anyone who knows how to play this?" the town's residents asked as they passed it among themselves. But no one could get it to produce a note. When everyone got bored of trying, the flute was eventually discarded.

A boy picked up the flute. He looked different to the others in town, and for that he was shunned. "No one asked me to play the flute." He brought it to his lips, and out came a melody tinged with loneliness and anger.

That day, the sea was very rough and the fishing boats all capsized. A tsunami swept in, and soon the town was swallowed by the sea. To the Sea King's delight, he found himself surrounded by new friends, and the boy became just like everyone else in the town.
A fully automated breadcrumb machine... Breadcrumbs are supposed to help trail one's path.
But if we have the technology to create this, wouldn't it have been better to develop a more reliable machine to prevent people from losing their way?
I'm sorry, Brother. We're all out of bread. We must have used more than we thought...
Now we'll never find our way back home. But I don't mind being lost, as long as we're together. Forever and ever...
Thou art the chronicles of seven grand nights. On the first night, God created the world. On the second night, he breathed life into a golden statue made in his image, creating the first human being.
On the third night, God taught man language, morals, and the art of living. On the fourth night, man worshiped God and built a shrine for him to reside in.

On the fifth night, God felt discontent for humans too pure and righteous. On the sixth night, God summoned a fiend and commanded man to destroy it with a sword. On the seventh night, man, God, and the fiend, were all struck down, and the earth became the land of death.

[Blacksmith]\nWhile I was forging a sword to offer at the Seven Nights Festival, I came up with the plot of my next script. But I'm not sure if I got it just right. ...Was that I roar I heard?! Was that...a fiend?! ...Uh, old man, how long have you been standing there? Huh? You're God?! Wait, is today the sixth night?!

There's a new continent on the other end of the ocean that has created technology to generate a previously unknown energy. It sounded like a fast way to make money, so I boarded a ship with a bunch of other young men. "Here's to setting sail towards our blue ambitions!"

It wasn't until a year later I returned to port with a tiny group of newly hired men. The family members of those I originally left port with surrounded me, asking what became of their sons. My heart was heavy, and I struggled to find the words. "The technology to generate this new energy was not ready. The energy escaped, and everyone was killed."

I gave the families back their belongings and paid them condolence money for their losses, but of course this wouldn't satisfy them. When they insisted on more details about how their sons had died, I could only reply, "They gave up their lives to preserve the peace of the people of that continent. I'm proud of them."

...How could I tell them the truth? That the new energy was extracted by breaking down living bodies into a special solution? That I turned the young men into energy and drank it myself? But you guys don't hold it against me, do you? We sailed away hand in hand towards our blue ambitions.
I've grown accustomed to heat. It's as vital to me as living itself.
The scent of smoke has seeped into my very being. Now it's a rather pleasant aroma.
Inhaling the smoke often makes me dizzy. Suddenly, I experience a severe bout of vertigo.
The last words I hear before losing consciousness are always the same. But even that voice has become familiar to me.

Isn't this gun here a beauty? Heheh, it was a special order. I used to fight in the war with this, you know? Really brings back memories. I was a big hero back in those days. What? You wanna try it out? Maybe next time!

What's this? You wanna learn how to shoot a gun? Hmm, I guess I can teach you a thing or two. But there's nothing in this village I could use it on. If you find a suitable target, you let me know, yeah? Then I'll show you how it works. You're bored? We should be grateful to have that leisure in this village.
My daughter is just the cutest. She's comin' back from the city soon, so I plan to escort her with this gun. You've never seen me shoot it? Exactly, cause this toy's just meant to scare people off.
And that's how it works. Only shoot when you have to. Don't alarm your opponent. You weren't really cut out for this. But I appreciate you givin' me the chance to show off my skills to my daughter.

War had broken out between two neighboring realms. A soldier on one side feigned illness after being sent into battle to avoid his duties. Continuing this ruse, he lay down in his tent and a medic came to see him.

After hearing his symptoms, the medic supplied him with some medicine.\n"Be sure to take this after each meal."\nThe soldier answered with a half-hearted grunt. He had no intention of moving a muscle, and planned to remain bedridden until the war was over.

The soldier continued to play sick. Upon checking his pulse and retina, the medic chuckled, then jabbed a hypodermic needle into his arm.\n"You didn't take your medicine, did you? And I hear you've been saying things that compromise our nation."

"You've been spreading rumors that this war was contrived to stimulate the economy. Is that right? Well, one whack of this hammer and the venom will disperse, so you'll never have to worry your pretty little head again."\nAfter that, the soldier complied with his orders, and left to fight on the front line.

Long ago, a hero and his party spent the night in this village while passing through. I asked him to take me along when he left, and he replied with a stern look.\n"In good time. However, you are still but a child, so you must first hone your skills with the bow and await my next visit."

After working the fields, I go to the woods on the village outskirts and practice the bow for hours. That's been my daily routine for some time now. The hero has not yet returned, but I trust he will honor his promise!

As my bow skills improved, I learned to hit targets at range with pinpoint accuracy. But the hero has still not come back to the village. No matter! A time will come when my skills are needed, so until then I will wait here faithfully!

One day, word arrived in the village that the hero and his party had defeated the evil overlord and restored peace to the land. Determination ignited within me as I grabbed my bow and departed from the village. Yes. It was time to embark on a mission to hunt down the hero who had made such a mockery of my existence.
Ah, you finally arrived. You have no idea how long I've waited for this moment! It's time to pass the torch over to you at last. Oh, and just so you know, refusing isn't an option.

It must be over 30,000 years since I took this post. During that time countless civilizations have sprung up and crumbled, but the human species somehow survived. I had no idea it would take so long to stamp it out completely.

Hmm. You don't know what I'm talking about, do you? I guess I'll have to explain. It's your duty to take over from me and create a new Summer Sun for this world that's been returned to a state of nothingness. You will ascend as a god and write your own annals of mankind.

Why should you do that, you ask? Because it was you who grew tired of the world and wiped the human race from the earth. That makes it your duty to create the next legacy. Take it from me, I did the exact same thing all those millennia ago. Now you must await your successor in the eternal prison of godhood!

My parents were betrayed by a politician in the city, and ended up killing themselves and my siblings in despair. As the sole survivor, it's no surprise I grew up to be a hardened criminal. After robbing a bank with an accomplice, I didn't hesitate to beat them to death with my lantern when pretending to hand over their share.

A guy I often run with who's connected led me through the gate safely. Once we were in the clear, I beat him to death with the lantern. I see no point in bloodless betrayal. Heh. Half-baked empathy can be fatal.

I bought a false identity on the black market and assumed a new name. Of course, I beat the middleman to death with the lantern afterwards. Then I bribed all the locals in positions of influence to get in their good books. I had plenty of money to grease the gears, after all. They let me join their inner circle, so now I'm in politics in a certain city.

Sorry if you were expecting to hear a tale of woe after all that betrayal, but I'm all about sucking the marrow out of life now. You want to know which city I'm in, so you can steer clear? You better get with the program and study politics. Be ready, so you never let a politician stab you in the back.

Welcome, traveler! This is a realm of flowers blessed with an everlasting spring breeze. Known as a land of beauty and leisure, people flock from afar to visit. Since you're here, allow me to show you around the castle town. Don't worry! You're in good hands!

Amazing, isn't it? Every single blossom in town is tended to by the locals. Some even grow so attached to certain flowers that they refer to them as one would a daughter. Hm? You wish to know why there are so many men around? Oh, that's just a coincidence. In this realm, men take a strong interest in looking after the flowers, too.

Now, let's go and explore the castle! The realm is fortunate to have very generous royalty, so the castle gates are always open. And within lies the country's greatest treasure: a magic flute. What do you think? So cold and sublime... Isn't it beautiful? Perhaps you would like to play it, too?

How could you not be interested in such an alluring flute? I guess you have no eye for beauty. No matter. As soon as something beautiful captivates you, you'll be transformed into a puppet in the blink of an eye. Yes...just like these flowers.

I'll tell you right now, I'm no liar or swindler. This staff really does let you see into the future. I knew it'd be creepy to do that outright, so I used butterflies to express the prediction. How could they lock me up and call me a calamitous devil when I've taken such care in offering the gift of insight?

Wondering what my fate would be, I tried making a prediction with the staff. A bejeweled butterfly that remained motionless appeared. I guess that means I'm not getting out of here anytime soon. As much as I hope the prediction is wrong, I'm no fraud, so it must be true.

One day, there was a change in the prediction. A swarm of yellow butterflies began devouring the cell that held me, and the bejeweled butterfly that remained motionless within was gone. Does that mean my comrades will come and break me out of jail? A ray of hope shines down upon me!

That day, a horde of golden beasts were unleashed within the jail, and began devouring both the cells and the prisoners within. So the bejeweled butterfly didn't disappear, it was eaten. Uh-oh, I see one of the beasts eying me up. But you see now, right? I was never a liar or a swindler.
What is it about tears that fascinates you?
Were you born like this?
Perhaps you were destined to play a role in evoking sorrow from others.
But then, what was the point of being brought into a world already so full of sorrow? I never asked to be born. And now my very existence is the source of my misery.
Since learning of the outside world, there are now times I am alone by choice.
I have also met those who were not alone at first, but now face solitude after experiencing loss.
I know the terror of being left alone. So I chose my own way to keep us from drifting apart.
But...no need to read too much into that. Having someone by your side isn't all that bad, is it? You feel the same way, right?

The kingdom was shrouded in a dense fog, making it nearly impossible to explore beyond the walls without a map. Every so often, invaders would attack the capital, prompting a select few hunters to be entrusted with individual maps to navigate through the mist and take down the enemy lairs without causing any harm to the town.

The Oracle Priestess entreated three skilled hunters to aid the realm. This time, the invaders were far more formidable than any they had encountered before, and the priestess requested that they join forces and fight together against this new threat, instead of working independently.

The hunters were presented with a large map by the priestess, who had previously acted alone. Although they lacked cooperation and mutual trust, the hunters recognized each other's abilities and pledged to go into battle against the invaders together.

Unbeknownst to the hunters, the world had been devastated by an invasion from a parallel dimension, and they now found themselves in a land of the dead. To defend humanity, forbidden corpse magic was utilized to turn zombies into soldiers. And now, a powerful technique had been developed that merged three zombies into one formidable entity. "We'll call this weapon the Predator's Trident," said the Oracle Priestess, who was also a necromancer, with a smile.

Once, there was a struggling musician who longed for fame and success but had faced repeated setbacks. One day, a merchant approached him and handed him a harp, saying, "If you want applause, take this instrument. But remember, sacrifice is always a part of the equation."

Armed with the harp, the musician performed in various places and received thunderous applause for the first time in his life. He was overjoyed and became increasingly obsessed with his newfound success. He started dreaming more often and found himself nodding off during the day, but he paid no heed.

Then, one night, the musician began having nightmares. In his dreams, he played the harp uncontrollably, and his fingers moved of their own accord. He was unable to stop playing, and the experience became a terrifying nightmare where he lost control of his own will.

Several days later, the musician was arrested and charged with heinous crimes—killing a pregnant woman and extracting the baby from her womb. It was also said that he infused his beloved harp with the victim's blood. "It wasn't my intention It was this harp! It played me like an instrument!"\nDespite his claims, the authorities deemed his words lacking in remorse, and sentenced him to death.
[Confession No. 8767965993]\nOne of my deepest regrets is when my friend confided in me about her husband's alcoholism. I was too quick to tell her to leave him immediately.
But the only way to tackle addiction is to identify and resolve the root of the issue.
If it turns out the problem came from his surroundings such as work and friendships, or a situation that doesn't necessarily involve his wife, addiction is difficult to cure.

I made a list of the negatives of loving someone with an addiction. After some time, my friend went red-faced with embarrassment and burst into tears, saying, "I told you it was my husband because I was too ashamed to admit to it, but it's really me who's alcoholic."

Behold! I won this Harp of Eternal Beauty at the end of a grand adventure! All who pluck its wonderous strings can maintain their youth! Oh wow! I didn't think you'd be so overjoyed! So um, you'll marry me, will you?

Huff...huff...huff... Finally, it doesn't hurt anymore. What? I was on the verge of death from poisoning? Wait a moment, where did she go? She left with the harp at dawn in the company of a handsome actor?!
I followed her. I chased her relentlessly for months, years, and eventually decades. Each time she fled, her youth intact, replacing the aging men who clung to her with younger versions.

I became a hobbling old man, but my persistence won out. Cornered, she knelt and begged. "I'll marry you! Please forgive me!" she cried.\nSmirking, I smashed the harp to pieces and said, "Now you'll never escape old age. You'll live the rest of your life in despair and disappointment."
[I'm against Christmas]\nI had a rough time cleaning up the mess from last Christmas.
Nutcracker wasn't invited to the Christmas party because he was getting annoying.
Then the triplets ate the strawberries I was saving for last.
I didn't want to partake in it from the start, but whenever Christmas began, Snow would give me this funny look as if to say, "it's not so bad, is it?"
[I'm for Christmas]\nWhy you ask? Simple. It's good business.
Food, lodging, retail, not to mention all the stakeholders. It's a glorious holy night when most of the year's profits stream in.
Dead who flock to money, Santa Clauses who can't get their hands on the most popular items.
There's no more need to fear failing to fulfill customer requests. As long as you join Aladdin's Business Association, that is! Join now, and we'll waive the membership fees!
[I'm against Christmas]\n...Well, not really. I just don't want to be separated from my brother.
While everyone was having fun, we would have tried to sneak out together, but Snow would have caught us..
Then when I finally found a place where we could talk away from everyone, Dorothy's firecrackers went off and I couldn't hear a thing he was telling me.
I just want to be alone with my brother this time of the year. Maybe I should put that on Santa's wish list.
[I'm for Christmas]\nBut I like the atmosphere of the city as the Christmas season approaches more.
It's that air of a nervous man and the cold that makes me miss the touch of another person's skin.
Even shy men with their reasons for not expressing their true feelings will easily accept an invitation out.
Then again, I don't really like the hustle and bustle of it all. Every year I have too much on my schedule and end up regretting it. I need to be more careful.

[Third-rate musician in training]\nI became my master's apprentice dreaming of one day becoming a musician in the future. But no matter how hard I tried, my fingertips fail to produce a harmonious chord. Tomorrow all the students have to take a common test, and if I fail...I'll be thrown out. Oh, what am I to do!

[Third-rate musician in training]\nAll that worrying made my brain melt like cheese. I ran out of the dormitory and wandered outside. But when the sun had set, I was too exhausted to walk back home. When I reached the forest, I spent the night practicing my harp.

[Third-rate musician in training]\nJust as I was getting fed up with the dissonance, that's when I saw it. A giant fish flying across the silver moon. A beautiful, elegant fish. The sight moved me beyond words and I played my harp with increasing passion. \nI'll practice without sleep and take the test in the morning! With that fish watching over me, I'll pass with flying colors!

[Forest Ranger]\nAt the center of a group of felled trees was an immense amount of blood. I can only imagine it's the work of that "fish." The fish is a figurative entity that lives in these woods. When something triggers it to materialize, it feeds on its prey. Usually they're harmless, unless something bothers them. I wonder what could have been the cause.

I'm an artist by nature. But alas, the masses don't take art seriously and would rather indulge in other vulgar activities. And thanks to them, I can't sell anything I make! One day I had a dream in which I met a strange, psychedelically deformed creature. The moment I awoke, I instantly went to paint it.

That very evening, a visitor came to my studio. And would you believe it? It was that same creature I had painted! I was absolutely astonished. That's when it said to me, "The Roaring Seas Emperor has summoned you."

Guided by the creature, I crossed over to the Land of Roaring Seas, located in an alternate dimension, and had an audience with the emperor. The emperor's appearance was so terrifying, no words could properly describe it.\nHe said to me, "I want to hire you as a court painter. I accepted his offer, thinking it would be all right for a short time.

After working my fingers to the bone for the Land of Roaring Seas, I regrettably returned to my former world. However, my sense of beauty had been warped to the point I could no longer paint anything other than images that physically repulsed others. My artbook, the Art of Roaring Seas, was immediately banned after all the trouble I went to publish it. I fear no one will seek out my talent like that again...
Which do you think is greater, the light generated by someone who realizes their mistakes and repents, or the darkness created by someone who refuses to repent?
When we shine a light on others' faults, is the illumination provided stronger than the darkness that can arise from our good intentions?
What is this intrinsic characteristic that persists even when it is corrupted at its core? Was the universe born to be at odds with itself?
If the world is inherently distorted, can we set it straight by correcting its origins? That's what I used to think, at least.
I'll be your protector, now that I finally have the ability to do so.
I'll learn to love myself too, because I know better than anyone else what I need.
As long as I kept moving forward, I felt like the sky was the limit.
The path of choice and progress is full of failures. Sometimes, I wonder if it wouldn't have been better to remain ignorant and let others pull my strings.

Atop the hill, in his lavish estate, lived an amiable gentleman. But beneath his polished facade, he harbored a dark secret—he sacrificed innocent children to monstrous creatures that dwelled in his mansion's shadows.

One day, a child escaped from being devoured by insects and raised an outcry, catching the attention of curious neighbors. The intrepid investigator, known for his unwavering resolve, exposed the gentleman's heinous activities. Stripping away the gentleman's facade, the investigator imprisoned him in a pot, filled with the very insects he had nurtured. The once affable gentleman met a grisly end, reduced to bones.

Since then, the investigator's life turned harrowing. Haunted by hallucinations of insects whispering in his ears and lurking in the shadows, he concealed his turmoil from concerned attendants' inquiries, tormented by the incessant buzzing in his soul.

During a subsequent inspection, the townspeople expressed gratitude to the investigator, presenting him with a silver tray. But to his dismay, the tray was filled with writhing insects! Revolted by the scene, the investigator recoiled, but it was too late. Deemed beyond saving by the church knights, he met his demise by an arrow, ending his existence.

Bah! That so-called fortune-teller! Our family now controls every crucial position in the empire—prime minister, grand marshal, archbishop—and our glory and prosperity know no bounds! The naysayers who speak of proud empires crumbling need to check their facts, because we are invincible!

I've taken care of every political enemy! I've bribed those I can and killed those who refused to bend to my will! I've banned the sale of weapons and the act of plotting behind closed doors! With this, there will be no coup!

My fear of growing old and losing my edge as the leader of our clan is a distant memory. Our emissaries to the celestial realm have finally returned with the elixir of immortality. Now that I have eternal youth, our clan will reign forever!

After countless struggles, we have triumphed and captured every member of that wicked family! Today marks the dawn of a new era! But that one fellow, what a joke! He gulped down the poison he thought was an elixir of immortality, and now lies bedridden, drooling and laughing. Perhaps he's dreaming of better days.
It was a sword with a blade as dark as night.
A strike from it was like being engulfed in a black tsunami.
Everything that got caught in the tsunami's path was swallowed up and hacked to pieces.
Leaving only silence in its wake, it spread out like the sea in the darkness of night...

Welcome, it's good to have you here. With the power of my Glassbook, I can see into the deepest recesses of your heart and mind. Even the most labyrinthine thoughts can be unraveled by my magic. My dear girl, you are the first chosen guest from this hotel to see me. What is it you would like to inquire?
Your inability to fall in love comes from a lack of confidence? My, that's adorable. But perhaps there is a deeper cause to that. I'll see though your heart like glass...

Hm? Isn't this... Have you come to me before about the same problem at a different location? I thought so. I could keep it to myself, but since you'll find out eventually, I'll tell you now. My dear... You're pregnant.

[Newspaper article]\nThe other day, a man was arrested for opening a suspicious clinic and suspected of offering consultations to weak-minded women, swaying them to engage in questionable conduct under the pretext of "directly opening their chakra."

HAHAHA! I did it! In the midst of battle against a small group of enemy forces, I took advantage of the turmoil and smashed my axe through my comrade's head! Man, I hated him! All the superiors loved his clever ass. But now that he's gone, there's nothing stopping me from climbing the ranks! It's strange... I'm almost certain my face reflected on the bloody blade when I killed him...

...It's been weird since I returned to the barracks. Everyone either says that they saw me in battle or asks why I bothered coming back. But this is the first time I've ever set foot here. Is everyone in on some joke I don't know of? That doesn't seem right either...

When I consulted a scholar knowledgeable in haunting, he said to me, "that's a doppelganger." A doppelganger is said to be a being that looks exactly as yourself, and whoever meets them will die. The whole story sounded like complete bullshit, so I tried to laugh it off, but my insecurity led my feet to a bar in hopes I could drink the fear away.

As I drunkenly staggered down the street that night, I heard footsteps approaching behind me. I turned around and shouted, "Have at me then, doppelganger!" However, there was no one there. "Show yourself! Where are you hiding?!" I sprinted down the alley hollering into the main street. The sound of horse hooves, angry shouts, and the image of a two-horse cart was directly in my path. The last I saw was the look of surprise on the driver as darkness enveloped my world and my shinbone snapped in two.

On the outside, the man appeared to be kind and gentle in nature, but inside he was cunning and wicked. Having lost all his money from gambling, he hoped his wealthy uncle would let him borrow some money. However, when his uncle refused to offered any, the man snuck through backdoor while pretending to leave, grabbed a nearby water jug, and beat his uncle to death.

The man brought the murder weapon back to his home to keep hidden as an investigation into his uncle's death was conducted. In the end, authorities ruled his death as accidental and the case was closed. The man was now living the life of his dreams with his newly inherited wealth. Until one day, his wife complained of illness and retched up the food she had eaten.

Since that day, strange happenings began to occur within the man's mansion—such as windows breaking and unusual rumblings in the middle of the night. When the man got a conjurer to examine the house in person, the conjurer said, "I see...a gentleman with his skull caved in wandering the house. He's looking for the jug that crushed his head..."

The conjurer's words sent chills up the man's spine. Soon after, he confessed to murdering his uncle and hiding the murder weapon and was locked away in a cell. However, what the man did not know was this was the conjurer's goal all along. Hearing the news of the man's imprisonment, the conjurer merrily reported to their dead master's grave. For they weren't a real conjurer, but the house steward for the man's uncle. Doubting the nephew from the very start, they sought to avenge the uncle's death.

Me? Yes, I'm the musician going around soothing the souls of the dead with my violin. I was told that a war broke out in the east where many perished. It's my duty to do what I can to appease those who wander the earth.
Good, that's another soul purified. Hm? You were lured here by my performance, too? What's that? You want me to write a letter to your family back home on your behalf?
I see. So your son also died in that war. Yes, a certain soul came to me for help in writing a letter for him. I have it if you'd like to read it.

Did the soul tell me his name? All I can say is when I prefaced the letter with "I don't know their name," and I read the letter to everyone who came to visit me, they all left with a sense of hope for life, and I'm grateful for that.

I want to return to a status that rightfully suits me. I let out a heavy sigh glancing at the vast territory around me. How I long to live a carefree life out in the countryside. I was but the youngest son of weak nobility. And things would have stayed that way if it weren't for my old childhood friend.

My friend was no ordinary being. He was a demon who could predict the future as if he had lived it and recite the laws of many different of worlds. He claimed to be just a regular human who twisted the fates of the people around him.

He carried out all kinds of reforms. However, his enemies continued to grow in numbers while no one would stand as an ally. Finally, even the king despised him. He became a heretical favorite who undermined his own position. I couldn't watch it any longer, and so I stopped him.

I set my friend on fire, and the king immediately destroyed all his great laws and accomplishments. Despite that, no problems arose. The idle people and nobles loved their lives of decadence. And so did I. I didn't need a reward for killing a traitor.

[Antique Bookstore Owner]
Welcome! Oh? What do you have there?
There's some kind of mud all over your book.
Huh? It's slime?
Well whatever, same thing!

Are you here to sell this?
I'm not saying you came to the wrong place or nothin'. We do buy antique books.
Just keep in mind it might not be worth all that much.
So then, how much are we askin' for the sticky thing?
Mind tellin' me what the book's about?\n...You dunno? Come on, it's your book, ain't it?\nHaven't you read it?

Huh? Rimuru used this book?!
Well I'll be damned!
This is a national treasure!
I take it all back! I'll buy it at any price!!!

[Cleaning Staff]
I work in the cleaning business.
Most of the time I'm asked to tidy up houses or just pick up trash in the streets.
It's a good thing there's not many litterbugs in this country, but someone still has to rake up all the leaves and stuff.

So here I was, raking up leaves deep in the forest when I came across something.
That something? This sword.
The whole thing was on fire.
Like, that's not normal...right?

Anyway, so I brought the thing back into town.
Before I knew it, word had gotten out about this thing, and ya know what happened next?
Rimuru himself came to see me in person.
The very moment he saw the blade, he had this sad look of nostalgia in his eyes...
I can only imagine how important it was to him.

Rimuru took the sword with him when he left.
Sometime after that, I found the sword again, this time lodged in front of a stone monument.
Unlike before, there were no flames.
I wonder if its related to the person buried below?

[Street Booth Owner]
You'd be surprised to hear what that girl is really like.
When she's with us she's no stranger to cooking and sewing.
On top of that, her friendly personality attracts all sorts of people.

At times I wish she was my own daughter.
I've even joked about it a few times.
It's become a habit to invite her over. She never complains, in fact, she seems pleased to help...
Oh, I'm going off track.

But that's the truth.
The problem is she's the princess of the ogre clan.
She's much stronger than any of us could hope to be.
The first time I saw her with that wand of hers, I was awestruck.

There was a gang of hoodlums who invaded the country. With a flick of her wand and they dropped on the spot.
Later I asked her what she did to them, and you know what she said? She used a spell to put them to sleep.
It's no wonder she's a close friend of Rimuru's.
Is there any man out there worthy of such a woman?
Marriage is all we seem to talk about recently.

[Wandering Child]
Woah, what is this?
Is it a toy? It's really cool.
It's not stealing if I found it, right?

Ugh! Why is it so heavy?
At least I got something cool to play with now!
How do I use with it anyway?
Oh! Maybe if I look through this hole I'll find something in there.

Just as I was looking through the hole, someone grabbed the toy from me!
It was a pink-haired girl with pigtails.
I've seen her plenty of times before. Oh, what was her name... Oh yeah! Milim!
My parents warned me not to get upset around her.
Is she that scary?

"You're 100 years too young to handle my gun!"
Milim took the toy off me and handed me candy instead.
"A token of my thanks. I was looking for this!"
I popped the candy she gave me in my mouth. It was sweet.
I don't know about my parents, but Milim seems okay to me.

● asked God, "What is that there?"
God replied, "Those red fruits on the tree are apples."
It was then ● learned the word 'apple.'
● took a bite of the apple. It smelled fresh and sweet.
● then began their search for more apples.

It was later that ● met △ and shared an apple with them.
△ seemed to like it.
One day when △ found an apple, the Devil said to △, "Why share your apple with ● when you can have it all to yourself?"
And so, △ ate the entire apple themself.

The Devil then went to ● and told them what △ had done.
For the very first time ● learned how to kill people with the sword in their hand.
Red dripped down from the blade. Was this an apple?
The Devil replied to ●'s question with a 'no.'
Then what about △'s red stained xx? The Devil said that was an apple.

● took a bite of △'s apple.
When God found out about this, he disappeared in grief.
With God gone, the Devil bounded ● to the earth and named them "man".
And in return, ● called the Devil "God" for teaching them many things.
After treating an injured demon from the sea, he gave me a splendid bow.\nWhen I drew the bow back as if ready to shoot, the waters pulled back. And when I released it, a surge of waves raged in.

The first shot destroyed a mountain. The second engulfed my village. And the third shot aimed right for the sky.\nUpon that last shot, it down poured for many days; the rainwater sweeping away everything.

It was then that I met the demon again. He laughed at me, asking if I was trying to destroy the world.\nI smiled and wrapped my arms around him.\nAll I wanted was to become your bride and make all the souls of the world my bridesmaids.
What was I to do? I cared deeply for my friends and family in my village, but I had fell in love with a demon. I had made my decision.\nSo, please. In the name of love, die. Everyone, die for me.

Hey. I want you to be honest, as my wife. Do I look tired, lately? ...Huh. I thought so. I guess the senior guys have been going a little too hard on me during training. Perhaps I should talk to that mage you recommended.

Hey. I swung by that mage. It went great. She was kind and understanding, and gave me some herbs to help. Oh, and she told me there's someone around me who's got it out for my and that you, my lovely wife, are the only person I should trust. Ah, and that it would help if I only ate food you cooked for me.

Hrm...why did I act like that with the new guys, again? Today, it was like I couldn't even stop myself, my hand moved on its own and the sword just...Knight Commander! Knight Commander, what's happening to me? Hm? Let you see my eyes? How come?

So my wife was conspiring with that mage to hypnotize me into ruining myself...I'm still in shock, though taking bloody revenge on the both of them did make me feel a lot better. Oh, and by the way, Knight Commander, the wards I got to protect myself seem to be reacting to the sword you gave me. Hm? Maybe I was just imagining things. Huh? I'm guarding the King's chambers tonight? And I should make sure I bring this sword? Understood, sir!
It was in the middle of broad daylight when a man suddenly went on a rampage, chopping masses of people into pieces with his sword. After many victims, the guards finally had him restrained.
The sword he wielded was wonderfully embellished—in fact, it was as if the sword itself lured the man with its bewitching beauty with promises of sweet pleasures.
It only came into his possession when he stumbled upon it at an antiques shop. However, at the time of purchase, he was unaware of its reputation for driving its master crazy.
The man would then testify during interrogation that he murder for the sake of his blade—that cutting down every other female was the only way to proof his undying love for her.

It was a glorious spring day. An elderly couple drawn out by the idyllic weather found a man wearing tattered robes in their garden. "I am the Dark Lich, an undead lord once sealed within the vase you pulled from your shed! I am here to bring ruin to the world!"

"Is dinner ready yet?" said the old man to his wife. "We just ate, remember?" she replied. The Dark Lich grew annoyed, as the old couple seemed to pay him no mind. "Do you not fear the visage of death before you?!" said the lich. The elderly pair ignored him and sat down to relax on the porch.

"We should put some flowers in that vase we found in the shed," said the old man. "That would be nice," said the old woman. Seeing them reach for the vase, the Dark Lich flew into a rage and lashed out at the old man. "Don't touch that! I am yet to fully awaken!" Sent flying by the blow, the old man hit his head and died.

"What have you done to my husband?!" the old woman shrieked. She struck the Dark Lich in the head with the vase. It shattered, destroying the contents and reducing the undead lord to smoke and ash. The shock of this caused the old woman's heart to stop. The deaths of the couple were never explained, and no one would ever learn they had saved the world from ruin.

There was a gentleman who had recently been plagued by stomachaches. The pharmacist prescribed him a white powder. "Take this together with your meal."\nAfter some time, the gentleman began to feel much better, exclaiming, "This pharmacist knows what they're doing!"

The gentleman came back in claiming of insomnia. The pharmacist prescribed him a white pill to clear his eyes. "Take this together with the other medicine I gave you."\nAfter some time, the gentleman began to feel much better, exclaiming, "This place has me sold!"

The gentleman returned after another mysterious bout of insomnia. The pharmacist prescribed him a white drink to help him sleep. "Drink this before you go to bed."\nAfter some time, the gentleman began to feel much better. Since then, every time something happened, I increased his dosage.

The gentleman is now fat and bloated. He's on so many medications, he hasn't been eating well. His wife worries it's due to all the drugs he's taking.\n"You dare doubt the pharmacist?! If I don't take my medicine, I'll feel even worse!"\n"But dear, don't you find it odd that this white medicine turns into bread when baked?"

In a large forest to the west, there lived beautiful butterflies. It's said that anyone who laid eyes on one would be instantly mesmerized. Though many tried to catch one, none succeeded. And so, they came to be known as phantom butterflies.
What makes them phantoms? Because they are so few in numbers? No, there are plenty out there. But these butterflies are truly illusory, and if you try to touch them, they disappear.

One artist found a way to catch these butterflies. When he learned of their attraction to beautiful sounds, he had a harp made that produced a sound to lure the butterflies in, and trap them as if they'd found their way into a cage.

When the butterflies heard the harp's melody, the illusion broke and they became real. They were even more beautiful than the artist had imagined, and he was mesmerized. Desperate to keep them in their physical form, he played the harp on and on. Which of the two was the real captive?

In a kingdom on the coast, there lived a handsome prince. Because of his young age, he wasn't involved in politics, but his realm was drawn into a war. And so, he hid with his attendant up in a high tower to wait for the fighting to end.

The prince's kingdom was losing the war. However, as long as their moon-blazoned flag continued to fly, they would not be defeated. Upon hearing this from his attendant, the prince prayed every day for the flag's safety. And so the flag continued to wave.

One day, the prince's attendant died suddenly. She had chronic heart disease, and declined rapidly after it took a turn for the worse. This devastated the young prince, but he continued to pray for the flag and wait for someone to come for him.

At long last someone came for the boy, but when they entered the tower, all they found was the lifeless body of his attendant. Upon inspecting the window, they saw the prince had jumped to his death. He had seen his kingdom's beloved flag reflected in the sea, and believing it had fell, was overwhelmed with despair and ended his life.

Hey! How about you treat me with more respect?
That's right, I'm talking to you.
You gotta be more gentle with me unlike those other magical items.
Don't use crude magic or leave me lying around.
Heh? Agh, wait! Don't be waving me around like that either!

Are you listening?! What the heck are you doing?!
You don't use wands to hit monsters!
What do you mean you're bad at magic?!
...Don't look at me like that. Stop it! Cut it out!

...Let's talk about this, okay?
You're a wizard, and I'm a wand.
We gotta work together, you know?
