But that doesn't mean you can just smack me against a monster. How about we have a little heart-to-heart and make some magic toget...AAAAGHHR!!!

What is that war hammer?!
That's called cheating, you know! What do you need that for when you have me?!
How dare you! You're outta your mind if you think I'll forgive you for this!
...Oh. You're just friends? Sorry, I misunderstood.
Well, off to crack the skull of another monster today!

Upon hearing the dreadful news, my heart raced even faster.
I couldn't believe that my father's ship had been wrecked.
On top of that, the location of its wreck is home to some of the most dangerous marine animals, including sharks.
I was almost taken by despair until hearing one survivor had been found. It gave me some hope.

I was met with disappointment when I arrived at the hospital. The man in the bed was of my father's age, but it wasn't him.
I asked him about my father, but the man didn't know him.
But there on the table next to him, I caught sight of a harp. And my blood began to boil.
"That was my father's harp! Why do you have it?!"

"Please, calm down. I'll talk," the man said.
He then went on to tell of him and my father clinging onto a plank together while adrift at sea.
As they drifted, they came upon a creature barely alive and devoured.
"And then we merged into one..."

I was astonished. The man had changed into my father.\n"I came from outer space, but then collided with a ship from this planet. It caused a great loss of body tissue as a result. So I let those two devour me, linking them to my internal universe to keep me alive. Now it's your turn."\nThe being resembling my father clutched my arm and chuckled.

Oh, dear Father. Please save your lost lamb.\nAs a fisherman, I spend most of my days out at sea. But for a few days now, out of nowhere I hear the voices of lost souls. It's rather troubling to say the least.
What was the soul saying, you ask?\nWell, that depends.\nSometimes it's somethin' trivial like philosophy n' other times it's vulgar. But I won't go there.
Have I heard from God himself?\nHm, that's a tough one. I guess I've heard some things kinda holy n' stuff.\nBut who's to say.

Oh, dear Father! Why must you lock me away?!\nKeh?! What'dya mean I'm the chosen one? Jus' 'cause I can hear things don't mean I hear the voice of God too, let alone have responsibility in makin' you my disciple!\nN-no! Please let me out of here!

[Hot-blooded Young Monk]
My Lord! The Son of Man is a sinful creature jealous of thy neighbor, longing for thy failure, and drags thyself down!
I too am at times devastated by these ugly souls.
Please protect our hearts from such jealously!

[Pure Young Monk]
My Lord! Tis been ten years since man has been freed from all jealousy!
We no longer have reason to envy others.
Oh, how different the world appears. Such beauty! Full of light and hope!

[Peaceful Adult Monk]
My Lord! How long has it been since we've rid ourselves of envy?
Here on Earth, the people don't fight. They greet each other with smiles and kindness.
Isn't this world just as wonderful as your heavenly paradise?

[Sorrowful Elder Monk]
We live in a world of peace.
But within our conservative lives dwells an air of impatience.
There aren't many people remaining nowadays. They've gradually dwindled away.
My Lord! I pray that you return our jealousy to us! I cannot leave this world until it's been fulfilled!

[Blacksmith's Apprentice]
Welcome to the Weapon Shop! How may I help you?
Oh, this spear here? Sorry, it's not for sale.
Again, I appreciate your interest in it, but we aren't selling it. Not even to the highest bidder.
But you're right. It is a very special weapon indeed.

There was a woman I fell for. It was love at first sight. And this spear was forged just for her.
She was the most beautiful woman I had ever seen. I could tell there was a dark side to her, but even that swept me away...
The two horns on her forehead meant she's a member of the ogre clan.
But this spear... I made it with her in mind. Oh, how wonderful it would be if she were to wield it.

My only regret is that I failed to ask her name.\nNot like I could have. The moment she appeared I was running away from a monster. I thought I was about to die.\nBut if I ever see her again, I'm going to offer her this spear and ask her out! I won't miss a second chance!

What? What do you mean she left?
Where did she leave to? Is she not a resident here?
No... I can't bear to let this go unrequited.
She was my muse! My Juliet!
If only I could have given her this spear and seen her smile once last time.

[Tailor's Daughter]
One of my hobbies is to make dolls out of the scraps from work.
I design them myself.
Have you heard of personification?
I like to imagine what a low-grade demon would be like as a person.

So, that's what I do. I take that image in my head and turn it into a real live doll!
I used to get strange looks from people when they saw my creations, but when Rimuru saw them, he cheered me up.
You see... He gave all my dolls a name.
...I'm grateful for it, but at the same time its a bit dispiriting.

Low-class demons don't come to this country, so there's really no point to my fantasies.
I felt really sad about it.
But then just the other day, one finally showed up!
Guess what kind it was?!
A slime! Not strong slime like Rimuru, but a real low-class slime!

After meeting that slime, I came up with a new creation! Which is this doll here!
I named it Snowy because it's white like the snow.
What do you think? Cute, right?
Me and Slimy Snowy are going to be best friends!
The night he got the book with the octopus on the cover, he began to see visions of the city sinking to the bottom of the sea.\nSoon it would be all that he could think about.

Once upon a time there was a giant alien invertebrate that came to the planet and fought with its native species for control.\nThe city the aliens and their families built as their base ultimately submerged.
Those who worshiped the giant invertebrates as a god plotted a way to resurrect them.\nPart of their plan was to create a spell book that possessed those who read it and gather more followers.
It wasn't long after that he was possessed by this octopus god, and was never seen from again...

What do you mean you want me to send a false report that our rations haven't arrived?!\nTough it up! We're the most powerful iron-blooded knights to walk this continent! So what if we're being held captive!\nTh-That's a big hammer you got there. If you're going to crush my left arm, so be it.
Heh... Heheheh. I-I'm fine. See? Just a little sting, is all.\nI don't need my left arm. I've still got my right!\nHuh? Now my right arm, you say?

Okay! Okay! I'll shout that 'the enemy has taken our provisions and we'll surrender unless given help.' How does that sound?\nOh, you have something special for me for opposing you? There's a lovely nurse waiting for me below?\nI'll be off then!

Damn bastard! How dare you tell the guard to wait for the rearguard's arrival!\nThanks to you, the enemy is on the move again! We lost our best chance at overtaking their fort!\nBut out of respect for your loyalty in giving up your arms, we'll be sure to give you a proper burial.
To me, fiction and reality are one in the same.
The real world is far from what I dreamt it to be.
Why was I even born? Has my role in life been set in stone all along?
Surely no one would be forced to suffer such a tragic fate. If only I had enough hope in my heart to say that with a straight face.

Indeed, I am the one who defeated the enemy general. That exquisite blade is for me, my liege? I never imagined my actions would lead to such an honor... I'll never forget this gesture. I pledge to serve at your side until my dying day!

My liege, I advise you to curb the drinking. Supplies are running low, and morale will suffer unless you show the men you are willing to make sacrifices. Hm? We should raid the nearby village if we're short on supplies? Please reconsider, my liege. No! M-My liege! Wait!

Ah, so you survived, my liege. Yes, my son fought valiantly to secure a path of retreat, but he fell in battle. As ordered, he served as your double without question, and gave his life so that you may live. Hm? It's only natural for a soldier to make such a sacrifice for their lord, you say?

It is an honor to meet you, Emperor. This is the head of my lord. Did I slay him because I feared for my life? Well, it's true I was no longer willing to make the ultimate sacrifice in his name. I had the ill fortune of pledging allegiance to a truly wretched soul. However, I will take the blame for not guiding him back to the path of righteousness. Allow me to end my life by running this dagger from ear to ear...

Since childhood, I longed to serve as a court musician, enthralling all with my melodies. The Twin-head Eagle Harp, the symbol of the court musicians, held a special place in my heart. Despite financial obstacles, I immersed myself in study and secured a spot at a prestigious music academy.

I was an outlier among my wealthy peers, but fate intervened when a stranger noticed my talent at a concert and offered me help. With their support, I passed the court musician's exam. Grateful, I sought out my benefactor, only to find out that he was an affluent elderly gentleman.

The old man confessed his previous desire for the harp with the twin-headed eagle, which he had failed to obtain. But I soon realized his sinister intentions. He envied me and trapped me in his mansion, subjecting me to dark magic with the twisted aim of taking over my body, and discarding his own flesh.

I refused to be a pawn in his twisted game. With a concealed dagger, I silenced his evil schemes, claiming his wealth. My scarred body hidden behind a mask, I made a solemn promise to a talented young boy at the academy's annual concert. Soon, I'll seize the Twin-head Eagle Harp as my own, taking control of the boy's body.
I can tell that you've suffered a lot. Committing that crime must have been a difficult decision for you. Thank you for sharing your story with me. I'll definitely come to visit you again.
Congrats on your release! I'm impressed they let you out so quickly for being a model prisoner. Let's celebrate with a drink first. I would be honored to join you.

I'm convinced your incarceration experience was a test imposed by the heavens. The world needs you now more than ever. I know you better than anyone, and believe that together we can make a difference!

When I was young, I used to catch butterflies and sell them to a magic shop for some extra cash. Now, I have the power to control criminals and make them commit all sorts of crimes, like theft, arson, and murder. Check out this latest codex. Take your time browsing through it.
Lookie, lookie! This outfit's edible! It's ingenious! Oh, but I think I might regret this invention.
It's got snacks, peaches, hamburgers... The perfect balance of sweet and salty! Hm... It could use a bit more variation in flavors!
But they're gone forever once we eat them, right? Maybe she can make improvements on it so that all the yummies will auto-restore!
Ooh! Ooh! And maybe a unit that alters the taste! That way it's always something new! Then after that maybe...
My younger brother is a genius. Clever and quick-witted unlike me, as frankly I'm not anything special. But that's okay. I still have my lil bro to be proud of.

One day, Mom's favorite foot-pedaled sewing machine broke. My little brother rolled up his sleeves and took up the challenge of fixing it, but after an hour he scratched his head and shrugged his shoulders.

I tried to fix it next. I was actually surprised how easy it was to repair. And Mom praised me for it. But then in the middle of the night, my lil bro accused me of being the one who took the parts out in the first place. "Just because you can't outdo me doesn't mean you should stoop that low."

[Statement of defendant, Juvenile A]\nAn elder sibling was arrested after he beat up his younger brother, locked him in a barn, and blew it up with him still inside. The motive for his actions was a hurtful remark made by his sibling that inflamed his insecurities and already wounded pride.

[Expedition Leader]\nWhile roaming the barren wilderness, we discovered a location marked by an axe thrust into the earth. We dug below and uncovered the ruins said to be the resting place of the Sunjewels. Legend has it those who seek the Sunjewels are doomed to spend all eternity in hell. What a load of crap. The Sunjewels shall be mine!

[Expedition Leader]\nWhat's this? Some kind of projector? Hmm... It seems to be a device for visualizing childhood memories. I recalled the days when I was a little terror causing trouble for my parents, and it brought a tear to my eye.

[Expedition Leader]\nThis is no ordinary telescope. It shows the world from the seat of the gods, granting a glimpse at its...*cough*...seedy underbelly. Intriguing! The more you look, the more interesting things you find. It's hard to put down.

[Sunjewel Custodian]\nSunjewels are artifacts left behind by galactic travelers. All who sample their pleasures become addicts, doomed to forever seek stimulation. More will come to loot these ruins, but all will end up helpless prisoners of the Sunjewels, and rot to dust. Their fate will remain a secret for all time.

[The 16th King]
My son, I imagine you think of me like a walking time-bomb that can explode at any given moment.
But there's something you must know.
I don't act of my own accord. It just...happens.
As if a gunshot goes off in my head and I snap uncontrollably.

[The 16th King]
Once that gunshot goes off, I become erratic and make irrational political decisions, resulting in the suffering of many people.
I am aware of my actions and take full responsibility.
However, it is beyond my control.
I've tried countless times to suppress this part of me, but whenever that gunshot resounds...there's no telling what I may do.

[The 16th King]
And now the people revolt, demanding my execution.
Please son, take this rifle and shoot me. Use my death as a plea for mercy from the people.
When they spare your life, you can live the rest of your days in peace in the countryside.

[The 1st~15th King +16th King]
In the moment the 17th King shot the 16th King in the head, I acted quickly to have the deceased king's mind transferred into his son's.
This Rifle of Destiny has been passed down for generations as a collective consciousness of the royal family.
One day, may that same gunshot ring in the ears of the seventeenth generation and slaughter the fools who have expelled us!

I burn everything in my path. Anything and everything, without exception. There's nothing that can escape my flames. I was forged to consume and annihilate whatever I cling to, leaving nothing but ashes in my wake.
Homes, people, nations, and even entire planets, I reduce them all to cinders without hesitation.
They call me the Flames of Ruin. A grandiose name, isn't it? It's ironic, really. If I were to share the reason for my existence, nobody would believe me.
The old sorceress who created me only wanted her damp firewood to burn better. Can you imagine? If she only knew how I am being used, she would be astonished.
Talking to women is difficult for me. They say, "I want you to see what's inside, not what's on the outside." But for me, it's hard to separate the exterior from what's within.
Talking to women is difficult for me. I don't know what to say when I'm told, "I bought this bag because it was so cheap!"
Talking to women is difficult for me. But I know they like colorful meals and after-dinner teas. Along with sweet treats.
In comparison, talking to a man is easy. The content of the conversation is almost irrelevant; all you have to do is whisper in his ear and tell him how much you like him.

Father, I need your advice. I play the flute in the church band, and well, some people have been peeing behind the temple where we practice. It's ruining the sacred sonance, and I don't know what to do.
Father, I need your advice. I asked those who pee behind the temple to stop like you said, but every time I do, someone else starts doing it and ruins the sacred sonance again.
Father, I need your advice. I asked the church knights to keep an eye on the back of the temple like you suggested, but now even one of the knights is doing it and ruining the music.

Now there's a big fence at the back of the temple where they're doing some construction work. So no one's peeing there anymore. But, I must confess, I kind of miss that peeing sound. Maybe it was the sacred sonance all along... What do you think I should do, Father?

There was a girl in a wheelchair who spent her entire life in a mansion. Not once did she walk on her own. But despite her circumstances, she never stopped smiling. She'd tell everyone how satisfied she was with her life. The compassionate butler who took care of her was always at her side.

One day, a young girl approached the mansion and began to beg. The girl in the wheelchair took off her red shoes and said, "These red shoes will bring you good luck. Don't take them off until something good happens." Years later, that young beggar would grow up to be the richest and most beautiful woman in the city.

Then the girl in the wheelchair said to her, "Since good luck found you, you can give my red shoes back." But the woman refused to return the shoes. One late night when the city was asleep, a shadow attacked and chopped off the beautiful woman's feet and absconded.

Thinking the feet would make the wheelchair-bounded girl happy, the butler put them on display in her room. At night, the girl put on the red shoes and danced around her room. Since the butler was unaware, the number of amputations across the city continued to rise, and the girl's illness was never cured.
Even at death, he would not part with his sword. It was the only friend he could trust.
After his passing, the successor to the sword had suddenly gained a talent in combat—their techniques and fighting stance were practically identical.
Until finally its new wielder was slain by his enemies, as if the sword itself had given up on him.
Despite the sword's many users through the years, seemingly fresh blood would continue to drip from its blade—possibly shedding tears in memory of its former master.

How long have I been wandering through this snow, clutching my halberd? I feel weak, my body heavy, and my legs ready to snap like twigs. At long last, my body gave in and I collapsed to one knee. Just then, a mist rose before me and revealed a field of flowers. Instinctively, you reached out your hand.

With a crash, he fell to the floor awakening him from my slumber. He cursed at the pain. His hands trembled as they reached for the bottle of liquor on his nightstand. But he grabbed it, and gulped it down. Recently, he could sleep all day and still be tired and irritable when he woke up. And that dream... That sweet dream would always end just as it was getting to the best part as if to mock him.

Night after night the dream would return, mentality exhausting the king until he could take no more. He instructed his physician to bring him a variety of medicines, all of which he mixed with wine, and all of which he swallowed at once. He laid once more on his bed. Except the next morning he would not awake—his cold body discovered by his attendants.

When the crowned prince learned of his elder brother's death, he called in a shaman. "Halberd of Spring's Last Snow... The spell worked, Your Highness," they said.\n"Yes. Your way of making death a natural desire rather than a curse was the right move," the prince responded, before slashing the doctor with his sword. Wisdom drowns the wiseman. Not even the shrewdest shaman could prepare himself for this ending.

I see. So you're in tears because they called you a freak of nature. Here, take this needle and stitch into your face the memories that every girl desires. Each stitch will make you more beautiful than before. But be warned, the pain will be excruciating.
My, how beautiful you look! I see you've done ten stitches. You've made many friends and the boys have been kind to you? It's good to see you happier.

How beautiful you are indeed... Almost a complete transformation. What? Over fifty stitches? I'm impressed by your will. Oh? You're leading men around by the nose, having them pay for your every whim? Keheheh... That's quite bold of you.

Oh dear, the poor beauty dropped dead. That's what you get for abusing the needle like that. There's no need to mourn for a girl like her. Her youth and beauty will be admired for all eternity. She was the epitome of stitched memories... Keheheh.

[Anna]\nShe's a compulsive thief who steals at any chance she gets. I have a feeling it's greatly influenced by her pathological desire for other people's belongings rather than a need to steal. Not only does she take anyone's possessions, she steals from her lover, and creeps into their bedroom at night. ...She may be lacking in beauty, but you could consider her a poisonous blossom.

[Maria]\nA romantic who easily falls in love and doesn't hesitate to sleep with the opposite sex. If not carefully watched, she'll cheat on her husband in a flash, eventually resulting in a bloody affair. However, that doesn't seem to bother her. ...She is easy on the eye, through she, too, is a poisonous blossom.

[Lina]\nRaised by drug addicts, she's quite knowledgeable on all things pharmaceutical. After she seduces her men, she forces them to engage in snorting her supply to double their pleasure. After she gets what she wants from them, she slits their throats while they're still weak and defenseless, before stealing their valuables. This one is by far the most poisonous.

[Head Butler]\nThe Master is an odd fellow. He keeps taking on all these maids riddled with issues. I can understand the pleasure he finds in ordering around the world's most vile women, but I wish he would put himself in my shoes. I'm the one who has to manage these venomous blooms...
[Mother]\nGood, you're finally home. Go wash your hands and I'll get started on dinner. By the way, you kids have been hanging out together quite a lot recently. What are you getting up to?
[Mother]\nHm? You're playing a game of Conquest? I've never heard of it, it must be something new. What's that flute you have there? Do you need that toy to play?

[Mother]\nThere's no sound coming out of it. You can't play it unless everyone blows at a specific time? I see. So that's the rule of the game. But it's strange. The moment I blew through its pipe, I felt a sting in my brain...

[Mysterious Visitor]\nWell done, children. Thanks to your efforts I've successfully gained control over the thoughts of the city's population. May we now feast on them and hijack their bodies as we adapt to the circumstances of the world. Wahaha, the game has only begun...!

I never had much interest in philosophy, but I do wonder about the meaning of my existence at times. On days like today when I can't sell a single match, all I do is sigh as groups of noisy kids pass by.
I watch on as all sorts of people walk past slowly. I carry on plying my trade as usual, raising my voice in a vain attempt to sell these matches no one seems to want.
The children chatting excitedly as they walk by become youths, then adults, then elderly. They age before my eyes, and I continue selling my matches.

Sometimes I wonder about the meaning of my existence, but I guess I should accept this is what I am. A tiny bastion of flame severed from time's cycle, watching over others from an unchanging eternity.

The underwater exploration team reported back with astonishment and excitement on the discovery of underwater temple ruins. The king immediately increased their manpower to conduct a full survey of the area, in the hope of finding treasures of historical value.

At the end of the extensive excavation, no treasures were found at temple that had spent hundreds of years beneath the waves. What was uncovered, however, was a mace wedged inside the temple's cracked floor.

The mace was brought to the ocean's surface and cleaned off. After restoration, the mace from the underwater temple was unveiled in front of the royal castle, attracting crowds who flocked to view its stunning brilliance.

To mark the mace as property of the kingdom, it was hefted lightly upon the castle's floor. But just as the mace made contact, the foundations sank, sending the castle into the ocean's depths. The mace returned to whence it came—along with its new home.
[Alcoholic Hunter]\nDarling, I'm home! You won't believe the amount of game I caught today! Tonight we drink! Come and prepare the feast!
[Alcoholic Hunter]\nAlcoholic is life's medicine! The more you drink, the better things are! It adds color to this mundane existence of hunting, and feasting.
[Alcoholic Hunter]\nGet over here and I'll give ya some lovin'! After shootin' all 'em bullets, I gotta let loose some of my own! Kahaha! Don't be shy now!

[News Article]\nThe decomposing bodies of a couple found in a forest cabin appeared to be the result of domestic violence and alcohol poisoning. The husband, assumed to be drunken at the time, attacked and beat his wife to death. It is believed as a result of his actions, he spent several days of heavily drinking, until he succumbed to alcohol poisoning, rotting away with his wife's lifeless body.

A timid archaeologist and his trusty assistant stumbled upon a remarkable discovery at an ancient site—a massive sword entwined by a fearsome snake! Despite being buried underground, the sword was still intact, and to their astonishment, the snake spoke when the archaeologist cautiously gripped the hilt. "Follow me, and I shall transform you into a mighty warrior," it hissed.

From that moment on, my strength grew by leaps and bounds as I wielded the powerful sword. Following the snake's guidance, I honed my swordsmanship and gained not only physical prowess but also unshakable courage. I traded my career in archaeology for the life of a seasoned mercenary, earning a reputation for valor on the battlefield and climbing the ranks to receive a noble title for my distinguished military achievements.

But that's not all—I also found success in social circles, charming others with my eloquence and wit. I even won the favor of the king and became his trusted advisor, all while marrying a renowned beauty. I basked in the adoration and envy of those around me, living a life of opulence and luxury.

As the timid archaeologist envisioned this future for themselves, tragedy struck. They collapsed in the corner of the ruins and died. The snake, which had been coiled around the sword, revealed its treacherous nature by striking its venomous fangs into archaeologist's finger. With a final glance at their lifeless body, the snake and the sword vanished into the depths of the earth, leaving the assistant falsely accused of murder and condemned to die in prison.

Who said that those who believe will be saved?\nIn the midst of madness, there was a certain city on a certain world. From the turmoil 'it' emerged, and asked a soldier, "What have you learned over the course of your life?"

This tale harkens back to years ago, when in a time of strife a child smiled shakily and said, "If we win the war, we'll have our plates filled with rice!" This harmful tradition was passed down from parent to child. 'It' took pity and raised its axe.

Years later, that same child became a soldier\n"All we have to do is win the war. ●■ everything in your path!"\nTheir eyes bloodshot, their cheeks gaunt, they sought to destroy everything. Yet they could not break free from the flawed teachings of their parents. Showing mercy, 'it' brought the soldier's life to an end.

Those who believe can be consumed by their own superstitions, wishing their beliefs to be true. As of yet, no one has shaken free of these teachings, but that time may come. The savior of trembling souls continued to swing the axe amidst the sadness.

You really think I hated my wife enough to blow her brains out with a rifle? Nah, not even close. I had no issues with her. But my mom, she'd always say my wife wasn't up to par. Said she lacked charm and couldn't cook to save her life.
You think I don't feel a thing about taking out the woman I married for love? That's not true, man. It still stings like hell. But my mom said she wasn't good enough, so what could I do, right?
Why didn't I mention my mom in court? Seriously? Do I really have to explain that dumb question? It's obvious, ain't it? What kind of son would rat out his own mom?

My mom kept a watchful eye on me 24/7, threatening me with a rifle every time I messed up. I couldn't catch a break even in my cell. What, my mom's been gone for ages? It's just my fucked up imagination? You... I've heard enough!

As soon as I stepped into the ruins, a cold breeze brushed against my neck. I had been sent to check on the vanguard unit, who had not returned before the formation of the second reconnaissance team, but I knew something was wrong. And then I saw them—members of the vanguard lying collapsed in the corridor.

Eventually, I realized that something was amiss. All of the vanguard were alive and had normal pulses. Their pupils were open and they seemed perfectly healthy, yet they lay completely motionless and unresponsive to my calls.

In another room, I came across an inscription. It indicated that a fearsome monster called the "Wind Spider" had been sealed in these ruins. Had the vanguard been attacked by this creature? If so, why were they left alive and abandoned?

As I continued reading, I felt a chill run down my spine. The "Wind Spider" is known to sneak up silently from behind, cut the spinal cord of victims, and then control them like puppets. The next moment, I felt a sharp pain in my back and collapsed. Eventually, the vanguard members stood up and began walking slowly towards the exit. Oh no... Unless something is done, the capital is doomed!
Thank you all for coming! Today we're gonna rock the stage with some cheerful tunes! Take your time and enjoy it to the fullest! Let's forget all about the mundane world, until the very end!
As I play my solo on stage, I hear the sound of banging on the door. The echoing shouts, "This place is dangerous, get outta here now! The fog outside has become a swirling vortex!"

No matter how much I ignore it, the banging on the door continues relentlessly. Losing patience, I stop and shout, "I'm not leaving, so leave me alone! It's crazy outside!"\n"Are you mad?! Staying indoors is just as dangerous! Evacuate now!"

The forces of gods and demons are at war, and the fog of destruction swirls due to forbidden spells. In the hall of a tavern filled with skeletal remains, I play a flute made from the bones of an unbelievably huge fish, desperately trying to keep my sanity intact. I won't go outside! That's right, I'm staying put until the very end of the world!

Long ago, there was a man known for his wicked ways. He committed countless evil deeds and was eventually sentenced to death. Even in the afterlife as a vengeful spirit, he held onto his resentment towards the society that had condemned him.

The spirit was determined to unleash his wrath upon the living. At first, he contemplated resorting to indiscriminate killing to express his anger. But then, a thought struck him. Was simple murder enough to convey the intensity of his fury? After all, as a spirit, cursing and killing humans was all too common.

This led the spirit to come up with a new plan. He decided to deny humans the right to die. He would prevent them from passing away due to old age or illness, as a manifestation of his seething rage. It would be an extraordinary and terrifying experience for humans, he believed.

And so, the spirit's powers prevented many patients and elderly individuals from meeting their natural end. He communicated through dreams and mediums, ensuring that people knew it was his doing. As the story spread, some even expressed gratitude and proposed building a shrine to honor him. Little did they know, the spirit's anger only grew more intense...

When people weigh out their options before making a decision, there are those who just sway back and forth like a scale, unable to fully commit. They lean to the right, but they're just one push away from going left. They lean to the left, but they're just one push away from going right. And then there are those who are perfectly balanced and unswayable in either direction.

Some people make a decision by quickly leaning all the way to the right or left. The easiest way is to tilt the scale all the way in one direction from the very beginning, that way it leans toward one side.

So I decided to create a scale that always leans to one side. Instead of having choices, you simply put two stones on it and it'll choose for you. But when I had people try it out...many panicked and moved to stop it. As it turns out, everyone has the answer within themselves.

If that's the case, I next thought to create a beautiful scale that sways gracefully. It seems that people who like to weigh out their options consider the time they spend pondering important. So I created this beautiful scale and again had people give it a try. However, this time, many were unable to come up with an answer.

Dear child of man, it is unfortunate that you possess only an extremely low level of intelligence. To make it comprehensible for you, I shall lower my level of intellect to your kind. What brings you to the village of our Masked Tribe?

Oh, I see. You are interested in the Masked Tribe, a group of highly intelligent thought beings. However, your motivation to seek all truths is too frivolous. It would be difficult for someone with such a narrow outlook to join us.

If you are desperate, I will invite you to the world of highly intelligent thought beings. We are getting bored of the human world and were about to leave this village. Although you may not become our equal even after years of study, you will be able to grasp the truths of the world to some extent. Now, put on this mask.

After finally acquiring knowledge of highly intelligent thought, I returned and found I had lost control of my intelligence, forgetting the language of the dull and ignorant, and losing the ability to communicate with humans. Even if I were to pursue truth, I have no means to convey it! And this mask...I cannot take it off! I am completely at a loss!

I'm actually envious of those who can get angry and find meaning in it. It's like they've unlocked some sort of power, using it as a catalyst for change. But for me, getting angry has always felt like banging my head against a wall, achieving nothing...
It must be tough for those who have something precious to protect. When that precious thing gets hurt or exposed to danger, they can't help but take action to keep it safe, I guess.
It's incredible how some people can live in a narrow-minded bubble, oblivious to the vastness of the world. They charge ahead with tunnel vision, refusing to broaden their perspectives.
To be honest, I can't stand myself. But I can't just erase the knowledge I've gained. It's not like I can stop being me...
All I had was my studies. I never knew how it felt to be loved, and I really believed my life had no worth until I found I was adept at academic work.
But as I continued to study, my view of the world expanded. I was taken in by an institute with some hard-to-pronounce name. I made a lot of friends with similar backgrounds there.
But then a bunch of grown-ups threatened by our intellectual power came along and killed everyone except me.
I regret it to this day. I wish I hadn't run as soon as things went south. I wish I never promised the others to live on in their stead if they perished.
The light of a flickering match flame is fleeting.
Such a thin piece of wood breaks easily between two fingers.
Even the slightest drop of moisture can prevent it from igniting.
Day after day, I repeat the same mind-numbing tasks. But it wouldn't take much to end my life. I'm glad to have survived another day.
"You see this instrument? It's said to be in the shape of a woman in some countries."
Mr. Scorpio came to me with a boy and his stringed instrument. I neither knew the name of it nor was I interested.
However, the resonance it made was similar to a human voice... Memorized by the sound, I had forgotten I was hungry.
At some point I was dreaming we were stuffing our cheeks with meat. When I awoke up my lips were sticky with gravy and sandwiched between them was a note that read "Thanks for the meal."

A lone traveler who journeyed far and wide passed away one day. Despite being all alone in the world, many people knew of this traveler. Wherever they traveled, they would stay for a while, drawing pictures of the scenery in their sketchbook.

After the traveler died, the sketchbook was sent back to their hometown as a keepsake. The traveler's childhood friend knew of their talent for art, and thought that perhaps they could sell the pictures in the book for a decent amount of money. However, when they tried to look inside the book they found it was bound tightly with string, and would not open.

Years went by, and everyone in the town grew old and started to forget about the sketchbook. But one day, the string binding the book finally fell away due to age, and the book opened up. The childhood friend, who was in need of money at the time, peered inside.

They found every page smeared with paint, with the words "These beautiful scenes are mine alone" written within. It was then that the childhood friend remembered the traveler's unpleasant personality, and realized that no one in their hometown or on their travels had thought highly enough of them to keep the sketchbook as a cherished memento.
Modifications, transformations, complex mechanics... Is this what men are into?
Roaring bass and convoluted controls... Is that what appeals to them?
The reek of oil assailing the nose... Do men actually like that?
I didn't know men had so many interests. Thanks to Dorothy's valuable information, I'll make even more friends!

Hey there! How's college life treating you? Getting the hang of it yet? I feel you. The struggle is real, trying to keep up with classes and sacrificing precious sleep. But hey, here's a little hack I swear by—take a whiff of this coffee's aroma, and you'll be buzzing with energy in no time! Go ahead, give it a shot and see the magic!

Hmm, still rocking the sleep-deprived look, huh? So, did you try that thing I told you about? Did it rev up your study game a bit too much, making it hard to chill out? Haha, gotta find that sweet spot, my friend. Don't go overboard!

Whoa, you're looking even more worn out now! Wait, did you get hooked on that trick I shared and can't put the brakes on now? Well, take it easy, pal, 'cause I won't be sharing anymore. Time to find your own groove, alright?

You blew my mind with that "aromatic coffee" sleep hack. Seriously! Now everyone's pulling all-nighters, and civilization leapt forward a few decades all at once. You're still grappling with grogginess from lack of sleep, huh? Hang in there, buddy. Hopefully, it's just a phase that'll pass soon!

On the outskirts of town stood an ivy-twined church abandoned by its congregation. As the people's beliefs began to fade, so did their memory of the building. However, it was recently rumored that the blind had taken to worshipping there.

A young man with slumped shoulders was out walking in the frigid wind when he bumped into an old man with a white cane. After apologizing, the old man asked out of concern what was bothering him.\n"I lost my job and was swindled by a money-monger. I have nothing left to live for."\nThat's when the old man advised him to visit the church.

When the man stepped inside the church, he saw a priest with a cane. He explained his distress in detail to the priest, who simply smiled compassionately back at him.\n"I can see you are suffering. I shall relieve you of the pain."\nAs the priest waved his cane, a dazzling light pierced the bottom of the man's eyes and...his world was enveloped in darkness.

"The filth of this world was never fit to be seen," the priest said. In the darkness, all he could focus on was the priest's kind voice. "The Church will supply you with provisions. Just live life imagining the beauty of the world in your heart." The young man rejoiced, and with tears streaming from his eyes, he vowed to follow the priest's words.
Burn! Burn it all to the ground! Swallow the heavens, earth, mankind, and everything that lies between! Roar out your rage! Set all souls aflame!
Only when a raging fire burns everything in its path may a new world be reborn from the ashes. Destruction brings creation. In other words, this flame is God. And I am the absolute god of this world!
The other gods warned me not to give fire to the children of man, and yet I chose to disobey them. With their new acquisition, the humans sparked wars that caused their numbers to dwindle.

As such, the human species stagnated. Without external stimuli, they cannot develop further. Given this, it should be us to set them aflame so their inert hearts and minds may finally reach the peace and tranquility they desire. Yes, destruction brings creation...!
As a responsible idol, I make sure to read and respond to every fan letter I receive. It is my duty to acknowledge the love and support that my fans show me.
While I am grateful for the increasing number of people who support me, it's difficult to prioritize getting enough sleep.
The amount of fan letters increased dramatically after I started appearing on TV, and I began to attract a few haters.
I try to respond sincerely even to haters, but legal action may be necessary for letters that have razors tucked inside the envelope.
Brother, someone was following us again today. They might find out where we live like last time. Can we try to lose them in the crowds at the department store?
Brother, our phone number got leaked again. Someone working for our phone company is behind it, so there isn't much we can do.
Brother, there's an account that keeps posting our location to people. It's really scary. I'll report it to authorities and have it deleted as usual.
Brother, it feels like we're never alone. There are so many fans, haters, and reporters from weekly magazines constantly following us. It feels like we're constantly being watched.
I was forced to use social media to get more fans, and at first it was a breeze. All I had to do was ignore my fans and they ate it up. Easy peasy.
But then one day, I accidentally destroyed the argument of a fan who thought they were some know-it-all.
If I ignored fans who argued with me, they would talk trash and call me a coward. But if I actually engaged and proved them wrong, they would just tell me to chill the fuck out.

When I posted about collaborating with another male group, I got some heat because apparently it would ruin the image of a certain member. Why even bother posting anything when people are just so damn annoying? Fucking losers.
The gifts that I received have been a fascinating collection of comic relief.
However, it escalated as most things do. It all began with a suspicious electronic device.
Upon solving the complex puzzle, I discovered that the device contained not only a GPS system, but also an array of surveillance equipment.

Subsequently, it evolved to a point where some individuals went so far as to implant bugs within plush toys and employed various tactics to evade detection by management. Consequently, receiving gifts has been banned.
Well, look who's back. For a man you sure love perfume. Oh, is it because I'm beautiful and smell delightful? Oh dear. You're quite the charmer, but I don't mind.

Oh my, you really do come here often, don't you? Wait, did you say you want to take me on a date? I would have preferred a more graceful invitation, but I don't mind your directness. How about on my next day off?
Sorry, dear, we're already closed for the day. What's that? You came all the way here to propose to me? That's so sweet, but we have quite the age gap. What's that? You would die for me? Hmm...

I'm over 80 years old, you know. You're simply dazzled by the scent of that perfume, mistaking me for a young beauty. If I stewed a young person like you, it would make a fabulous perfume. After I made you sniff that drug, you've become paralyzed. It'll all be over once I crush your head with this mallet...
[Man]\nOver seven days, I created the heavens and the earth, but the human heart remains untamed. It needs a little tweaking. Now there, let me administer a drip to your heart.

[Man]\nWith competition the people have finally come alive, but in their haste for results, they tend to neglect their morals, which will eventually lead to destruction. Now there, let's change the components of the drip.

[Man]\nHmm. It seems that people are not taking such extreme actions as before, but now they seem a little too quiet. The human heart is truly hard to fathom. Oh well, I must change the components of the drip once again.

[Newspaper Article]\nA black mage who repeatedly snuck into the royal capital's waterworks bureau has been arrested. He was delusional and saw himself as a god while administrating magic "heart drops" to the tap water, causing mental disorders in people. It is the accused himself who truly needs "heart drops."

I see you got the bow. Who am I? I am the supply officer for that bow. While the bow can easily be drawn by even a child, it has the power to pierce steel and penetrate boulders. The source of its power is not the bow itself, but the flame lit upon it.

It is no ordinary flame, but a magical conflagration fueled by people's malice. However, its power is limited. When it becomes unstable, the flame must be replaced. But where can such a flame be found?

Only at a breeding ground for malice. The slums? No, the royal palace. Malice is rampant there. This flame was lit with a palace candlestick. Envy, jealousy, ambition, hatred...all kinds of malice exist there. More than enough to fuel the flame.

Now, before exchanging the flame for a new one, I have one job to ask of you. I want you to shoot someone in the royal palace. The palace is quiet now. But one arrow will cause it to overflow with malice. They are suspicious of everyone already, so the bow's effectiveness will increase. Any objections?

What's this, a lamp? Oh, you're gifting it to me since I'm always buying gardening supplies? Hmm, so if I rub it, a genie will appear and give me some tool that will help me get past future difficulties? Hahaha, I'm just a humble gardener. No need to tease me like that.

In the end, I didn't accept the lamp from the peddler. But if I don't win in the next gardening show, life isn't going to get any easier. Should I use it to repay my wife, who's always supporting me on the sidelines? N-No, that's wrong. It would be against the rules!

I did it! I finally won! And with all the requests pouring in, I became rich in no time. But soon, I realized something was wrong. My wife, who had always lived frugally, was now going on extravagant shopping trips. That's when I saw my wife talking to that peddler in the town.

One day, I waited for my wife to go out and searched her room. Inside I found a fretsaw, limestone, and that lamp in a hidden closet. It suddenly all made sense. She either received it or bought it from that peddler. It's a shame, but she made her choice. I'll have to kill her before she kills me...!

That smug look on your face ain't fooling me. Look at the spine! There's a blooming lily on it. And that red petal that blooms on the magic book... Rumor has it that it's just a book for show-offs. Haha, it's a famous story in this country.

All the scholars in the country have been talking about it, pretending to know what it's about, but no one can really explain the content. It's pure smug self-satisfaction. That's how it got its nickname the "show-off book". Maybe someday someone will make out its true nature.
What? You wanna read it? Sure you're smart enough for it? Ahaha, sorry. Well, you can try. No reason an amateur can't... It's good to read books.

Hey you! I was worried when you didn't stop by for awhile. So, did you like it? Was it interesting? Err, did you understand what it's about? Interesting... It does look like a picture when you stare blankly at it. Everyone trying to explain the book's content is going to look foolish now.

This flute was a gift for helping a beauty with scarlet lips. If I play it before bed, I dream of an alluring woman and can indulge myself in unimaginable pleasure. Heheh, I've never been so happy with a gift!

What in the world?! How is my wife pregnant when we haven't slept with each other?! She insists she hasn't cheated on me. She used to be attractive, but now she's just a fat lard. I can't believe there's a man who'd even want to sleep with her.

My sister and even the neighbor's daughter claim they're pregnant, yet they have no idea how it happened. I-It couldn't be... Have I've been sleepwalking and wandering about after playing the flute? The idea terrified me, so I smashed the flute, but the next morning it was back on my pillow. And whenever I look at it, I have this intense urge to play it...

Whenever I see the flute, I must play it. So I gouged out my eyes to stop myself. But still when I fall asleep, that beautiful women continues to appear in my dreams. And now, even when I wake up, I see her in the darkness. With it, a baby's cry rings in my ear. And every time I hear it, it grows louder and louder and louder...

In an area known for having sightings of a specific wanted beast, I carried my heavy sword and waited patiently for the opportunity to claim my kill. Along the way, I saved a sorcerer who had collapsed. When he came to, he said to me, "I owe you for saving my life. Allow me to offer my magic as a token of my thanks."

After some time, I finally responded. "My apologizes. I'm not very good at coming up with things on the spot. Can you give me some more time?"\nThe sorcerer then replied, "Then wait I shall. However long you need. My magic is universal, and can grant you anything."

It was some years later that I would recall that meeting. When I went back to my hometown and learned my cat had died from an illness, I remembered he still owed me a wish. I thought maybe he could bring my cat back to life. However, when I went to seek him out, I caught a cold and pickpocketed for the first time in years.

But as my luck would have it, I would not meet the sorcerer again. By the time I reached his home, I was told that he had died chocking on his food mere days earlier. The doubts then began creeping in. Could it be that the reason my life had been so uneventful until now be because he had protected me with magic until he could grant my favor? Is his death the reason why I'm getting sick and into all sorts of trouble again?

A brother thief was stuck with misfortune when he was captured by the castle guards.\nWhat's worse, is that not one lives to see the light of day again after being tossed into the prison chambers.\nBefore the previous king died of illness, we could be more open in our thieving without care of the repercussions. However, now the country's become much quieter.

We now live in fear of the newly enthroned queen...
Although her name and appearance has never been revealed, she is famous for her love of the death penalty.
One of her favorite punishments is smashing the heads of criminals with a giant club.
Would you risk stealing a loaf a bread for that?

Don't tell anyone I told you this, but...
I was walking past the prison earlier when a paper airplane fell from the sky.
See for yourself. It must have been written by someone in the chambers.
Apparently the queen is just a runt who can't even speak. That rumor about smashing heads is just a lie.
What a joke!

The real story is...\nThe runt was forced into taking over the throne, but since she didn't want that getting out, she fabricated a scary rumor that would keep the people silent and under control.\n...I'd wager she'll live for another ten years or so, then we can live free like fools again.

This here is the Demon Tower. It stands on the border of two countries. One day a man found himself as the tower's watchman with access to all corners of the city, and a feeling of superiority rushed over him.

His eyes met the woman's again. There was no doubt she was looking straight at him. A good woman... His woman. The tower watchman stared down upon her for some time. His eyes would follow her relentlessly, and she would look back, terrified.

One day he noticed her running, as if trying to escape someone. He couldn't let anyone lay a hand on her!\nHis infatuation with her had pushed him to the edge. Pulling out his bow, for the first time, something other than the woman entered his line of sight.

Ah!\nBy the time he loosed the arrow, it was too late. It pierced the beast right between its eyes. Blood poured from the man's forehead... The beast the man had shot was none other than himself. This here is the Demon Tower. It stands on the border of two countries.
[Student]\nTeacher, the scent of these flowers reminds me of the time I was invited to a tea party by a fairy. These flowers were floating in the tea, and it smelled really good!
[Student]\nI remember the tea and the cookies they served with it were delicious! And the the fairy asked me to go to Fairyland with her!
[Student]\nWhy didn't I go with her? I did go. We rode inside this round object and flew really fast like a laser!

[Teacher]\nThere aren't supposed to be any kids who remember the "tea party" after whiffing the ghost flowers. It was a close call, but the Memory Eraser took care of the anomaly. All children we abducted under the age of 10 had their brains remodeled from the ground up. Maybe a double check is required.

A world in ruin where withered time accumulates and the wilderness of death is endless. Long ago, I heard that an extraordinary amount of cosmic rays rained down on this world, causing the ecosystem to go haywire. Now no one ages, dies, or can reproduce here.

According to legend, the one who claims the Staff of the Withering would be saved. One day, while scavenging for abandoned items with a fellow scoundrel, I found something within the junk. One look and I immediately knew it was the legendary staff. It had an aura of omnipresence about it.

As I reached out for it, I felt a sharp pain at the back of my head. My vison blurred and I fell to one knee. As I tried to stop myself from emptying my stomach, I watched my friend run off with the staff.\n"You bastard! Wait!" I hollered, chasing after him...until I eventually found his clothes beside the cane lying on the ground.

If I pick up the staff, withered time will return to normal, and I'll return to dust? So this is what salvation is. I sighed in bliss, but my peace didn't last long. I stared long at the staff, but no miracle came. It must have used up all its energy turning my friend to dust. How much longer must I live in this decaying world before I find my salvation? I wish I'd never heard that cruel legend.

Begin tutorial. Become a holy knight?
→Yes
No
I am a holy knight! I posses a sword of sacred power!
"I am a messenger of God, destroyer of all evil!"

An impoverished person commits blasphemy right before you... Will you cut them down?
→Yes
No
Down with the poor! Wait. Why do they look like...
The poor peasant was a fallen angel!

Slay the fallen angel?
→Yes
No
No mercy for the fallen! Wait. It appears that...
The fallen angel tasked the holy knight with completing a trial!

"This power is wasted on those who judge all as evil through the lens of their own values."
The Holy Knight's sword has been damaged and the sacred power has been lost!
Restart tutorial?
Yes
No
This is my sister's treasure—a small glass jar containing a sparkling heart. If you listen closely, you can hear a faint thumping sound.

"To me, this heart is a testament to life."\nMy sister's smile is so beautiful. Unlike me, who was born with a weak body and spent much of my time lying down, she exudes such vitality. I can't help but feel envious of her.
One day I smashed the glass jar and crushed the glistening heart. When my sister saw this, she screamed as I coughed up blood and collapsed. ...Now her screams are fading away.

I knew she cherished my heart to keep the light of her dear younger sister from going out. But my hatred for her ran so deep that I extinguished that faint flicker right in front of her.\n...Serves her right.
[Confession No. 237439]\nEverything annoys me these days. My airheaded wife thinks she can get in my good books just by letting me have my way with her.
Everything annoys me these days. For some reason, my boss thinks he's better than us just because he read some self-help book for workers, even though he doesn't even understand the basic principles.
Everything annoys me these days. This young guy flaunts facts to tear down the views of those around him, not realizing that men can be ruthless when their pride is wounded.
But the thing that annoys me most is my own stupidity, which got me in this mess in the first place.
The bear showed me a lot of dreams, and the people who lived in those dreams each wiled away the time in their own way, their own little respite from the world.

There was one person who lamented they could never start anything new because they had no time.\n\n...But, I looked at their life, and saw that they had a lot of time. So much time, and yet they never did anything with it.
There was a person who never did any work, and only slept all day.\n\nWhen I tried to figure out why, thought, I ended up sympathizing. I understood why they preferred to sleep their life away.

There was a person who was harsh and unforgiving of any laziness in others, despite being rather lazy themself.\n\nI've learned then, from looking at so many different worlds, that laziness comes in many shapes and sizes, and flourishes in all kinds of different circumstances.

A man washed up on the shores of a remote, peaceful border country. Rescued by a fisherman, he gasped for air and declared, "I am a messenger from the kingdom of God. Child of man, thank you for rescuing me."

He spoke of a holy kingdom beyond the sea, protected by a sacred barrier, where everyone lived lives of abundance. The all-knowing, all-powerful presence ruling over it wished to welcome more people into the fold, and thus sent the man as an envoy to the outside world.

Rumors about the man spread by word of mouth from a court lady who had tended to him, and soon the entire country was abuzz. Being a remote land with few pastimes, people became obsessed with the man's story. Some argued they should build a giant ship that could carry over a thousand, while others haggled over the price of the right to board it.

Observing the frenzied scene, a traveler muttered to himself, "That guy's from my hometown. He's a pathological liar who got himself locked up for causing trouble back home. In our country, it's taboo to kill people, so he was subjected to the Blue Sea Succor ritual to purify his soul. It's basically a sea burial." The traveler smirked. "I can blackmail him and get a cut of the profits."

Tomorrow I'm attending my first meet and greet event, with a friend who invited me to see their favorite idol, Snow White. Not usually my thing, but I get the appeal I guess.\n\nThe event went smoothly, and I found that Snow White was much more approachable than I had expected. Surprisingly nervous, though.

I kept tagging along with my friend to see Snow in person. Before long, it became a regular thing. Snow began to recognize me and seemed less nervous. I've heard that being an idol can be tough, so I want to be respectful and keep it casual...\n\nThat meet and greet was amazing, especially Snow! I wish Snow would notice me like that. Why does the next meet and greet have to be so far away?! I want to see my Snow!

As a fan of male idols for the past 34 years, I've always had a soft spot for strong male friendships. Recently, I've developed a newfound love for Gretel from a unit called Phantom Tale. They're currently holding a meet and greet, and I'm considering attending to ask them some questions.\n\nWhen I asked Gretel what kind of person they like, I was ignored. I was hoping we could at least have a conversation, but... If this is how they are, I'm not sure how long my feelings will last...

Wait a second. I see now that Gretel's feelings towards their brother are natural and pure, and I was wrong to try and interfere. I feel terrible for attempting to disrupt their bond. I should be ashamed of myself.\n\nI don't need recognition from Gretel or their brother. I'm here to support both of them. That's what's important. Everyone! We must work hard today to protect Gretel's and Brother's sanctuary! We'll distribute glow lights in Gretel's colors and follow the original call guide. There's a lot to be done, but together we can do it!

The person who rescued me when I was being hit on turned out to be a member of an idol unit called Phantom Tale. They go by the name Cinderella. Maybe I should see them perform live someday.\n\nInitially, I attended one of their concerts as a way of thanking Cinderella for saving me. My first impression was that it was just an ordinary concert. However, one particular event during the concert changed my life—I made eye contact with Cinderella.

I brought it up at the meet and greet, but he said, "You can't expect me to remember everyone." I don't think he meant it, though. After attending several meet and greets, I can tell he remembers me. Tomorrow's concert is going to be great!\n\nDid you see those side glances?! For claiming not to recall me, he looked straight at me more times than I can count during the concert. Cinder is the best! I'll follow them forever!

It all began with me casually watching an idol show. It was a variety show featuring fresh faces in the idol industry. I wasn't doing well at work and wasn't feeling particularly motivated, but the show left an impact on me. During the show, one of the guests named Dorothy gave an opinion on the ideal idol. Snow White's answer was typical, but I was blown away by Dorothy's statement that went against the norm.

It was then I became obsessed with this existence known as "Dorothy." I was instantly a fan. I went to as many meet and greets as I could to learn more... Until finally, Dorothy saw something special in me! I was given various drugs to help Dorothy understand the fans better. Is this a drug that converts one's idol love into muscles...? I'd be more than happy to take it! I'll do whatever it takes to prove my love and adoration!
Thanks to the dreams the crow showed them, countless people were led astray by their own greed.
Some cut down their rivals, desperate to be with their beloved, only to be imprisoned for the rest of their days.
Others awoke in the dead of night and sought out sweets, intending to eat just one, yet devouring everything in sight.
All they had wanted was a little more fun in their lives, or so I'd heard. Each had their own circumstances and reasons.

I hate you with a passion. You told me you loved me. You said we'd be together someday. Were those days we spent making love an illusion? No one else makes me feel like you did on the nights we shared. Nothing compares!
This is so frustrating. I even introduced you to my family, thinking of our future together. They were so impressed by your performance! You were just too good to keep to myself.

I resent you so much. You take advantage of my kindness, cause me endless torment, and this is the reward I get? Since I moved in with you, it's like a switch has flipped! I can never get back the innocence I've lost, and you have to answer for that!

Groom Status Report\nThis concludes the results of using the Magic Detective Agency's "Verses of Enmity" to assess the sentiments of the groom's friends at the wedding. It seems the groom has a mysterious scent that proves irresistible to even members of the same sex. I also found myself in his company last night and...wow.\nThat is all I have to report. If additional research is required, please contact me for a separate quote.
The beauty of truth has an essential radiance that never ages.
Literature that captures the essence of human nature. A dress that captures the essence of one's silhouette.
Those who follow trends look for the flaws of popular works, failing to understand the essence of beauty, further creating counterfeits in the name of improvement.
So many people are shallow thinkers. That is why there seems no end to trend backers and the flood of counterfeits in the market. The providence of society continues to repeat itself.

On the street corner, carried on the wind, the beautiful melody of a harp can be heard. The minstrel, plucking the strings with his fingers, conceals his face behind a thick veil. The mourners, draped in black, gather around him. The music he plays was said to heal the hearts of those who grieve for loved ones, and was well-known throughout the town.

"I wish I could have fed my son better." A woman holds back her tears as she speaks. She lost her son in an accident last week. "If only I had more money, I could have paid for my wife's medicine," a man says. He lost his wife to a disease. Separation in this life always causes pain for those who are left behind.

But at least, let your feelings reach up to heaven. Allow me to play my harp for you.\nThe people healed by the music of the traveling minstrel left slightly calmer, sharing words of gratitude with him.

"Well, I guess I have enough inspiration for my next work." Late at night, when the world is asleep, the minstrel carries his harp with a satisfied smile. Several months later, in a neighboring kingdom, a novel with the cheesy title of "The Book That Moved a Nation to Tears," written by a certain author, became a massive success. But that is a tale for another time.
You showed me a world of dreams, and I trembled, chattering like a clam.
Following orders...that much, at least, I can do. I did do it, even if my heart wasn't in it.
I did my best to do as I was told. I tried. I tried so hard, and I just kept trying, but...
In the end, what was left of the person I was, was no more than a hollow puppet, so false and empty that even calling it by name was a lie.

I reckon I done killed that witch from the snowy mountain and grabbed her flute. They say if you blow it in the snowfield, the yeti gonna come running from afar! Catch that sucker and we'll be rolling in cash, yeehaw!
Dang it's cold, I'm shivering my boots off! Been wandering around playing this flute, but ain't nothing happening. Well, shoot, let's go that way and see if anything pops up.
Geez Louise, it's freezing! My snot done turned to icicles! I been walking so much, I'm plumb tuckered out, but I ain't seen hide nor hair of no yeti.

What, you reckon I need to wear some insulation gear? No need for that, I ain't feeling a bit cold. What? You saying I look like one of them big, hairy creatures? Well, gosh darn, that's a hoot! Yeehaw!

Welcome. You don't often see children here. This temple is a sacred place where the protectors of the realm, the dragons, reside. The dragons are believed to be reborn every thousand years. They dedicate their lives to guarding the beautiful gemstones bestowed upon them from the heavens.

Long ago, twin dragons were born on a milestone year, causing great commotion among the temple's people. According to the country's customs, only one dragon could guard the gemstones, which meant one of the twins had to be sacrificed.

It was inconceivable for human hands to slay a dragon, as they are considered messengers of the gods. After much contemplation, the people decided to have the two dragons battle each other. A strong country required an even stronger guardian deity. But in an effort to protect the other, the young twins used their own fiery breath on themselves, and both eventually succumbed to their injuries.

See that staff over there? Two dragons protect one gemstone. It serves as a token of humanity's foolish mistake, and a reminder to pass on their noble spirit to future generations, like you. That's why it's still displayed in the temple today.

The mansion's maid is repulsed by the master's twisted desires. He's a bald, bloated geezer whose inflated cheeks and pinched eyes make him look like a human whoopee cushion. He puckers his lips, slick with grease from his lavish feasts, and wails like a big baby, "Waah!"

To take care of this grotesque, oversized infant, the maid is paid handsomely. Don't get it twisted, the master isn't insane or anything. He goes to work in the city during the day, and does his job competently. But once he's back in his mansion, he's a foul creature that has no qualms about pooping and peeing wherever he pleases.

Whenever the baby gets cranky and starts screeching "Waah!" at the top of his lungs, the maid whips out a fancy butterfly rattle with intricate engravings and coos to calm him down. However, one day she lost her temper and bashed the baby with the rattle.

The mansion's maid loathes the master's kinky cravings with every fiber of her being. The master pouts his lips, slick with gooey sweets, and whines, "More! More!" That's when the butterfly rattle morphs into a larger, more durable tool for a new purpose, and the master crawls around on the floor like a pitiful infant, crying and pleading.

The man seethed with a burning desire for revenge against society. Day after day, he pored over the details of his plan, determined to make it a reality. Just as he had everything figured out, a strange device arrive at his doorstep. Without giving it a second thought, he placed it next his pillow.
One night, the man had a vivid dream that pieced together all the moments in his life where he had felt truly accomplished. Those moments, while insignificant to others, were everything to him.
When he awoke the next morning, his thirst to exact revenge on the world had dwindled, and it wasn't until later he realized the mysterious device had disappeared without a trace.
What the man didn't know was that the device was a mystical tool, secretly delivered to those thought likely to commit crimes by the kingdom's seers, who saw visions of the future.
Confession No. 17764\nBelieving that all lives should be treated equally, I once denounced a lord who siphoned the blood of his citizens to aid his ailing daughter.
Now I face a difficult decision. Do I sacrifice the one I love most to ensure the realm's survival? Or do I turn my back and let my homeland wither?
I now finally understand that lord's anguish. If I had walked in the shoes of the one I decried as evil, I would have no doubt made the same choice.
No one path is right for everyone. In the end, we must make our own choices and accept we will be criticized for them.
[Confession No. 6497547]\nFor the sake of my dead family, I tried to be stricter with our diet than most people.
However, trusting in folk remedies only caused my daughter's health to rapidly decline.
Ashamed of my ignorance, I turned to books penned by experts—ideas with more basis in reality—instead of taking baseless advice from my friends.
Later on, I discovered that so often what was believed to be right was revealed to be horribly wrong. Oh, God. What am I to believe now?

There was a notorious assassin whose movements were as swift and elusive as a lizard. His trusty weapon was a mystical axe imbued with powerful magic, capable of creating copies of its wielder. Using these enchanted decoys, he would confound his pursuers, just like a lizard shedding its tail to escape from danger.

Despite his unparalleled skills, the assassin was not infallible. One day, he made a grave mistake and unintentionally assassinated a high-ranking member of the underworld. This blunder catapulted his notoriety to new heights, causing even the authorities to hesitate in directly confronting him, believing him to be untouchable.

Realizing the magnitude of his error, the assassin panicked and fled, relentlessly pursued by those seeking retribution. Yet, time and again, he would leave behind clever decoys to mislead his pursuers, assuming new identities and altering his appearance. This dangerous game of cat-and-mouse persisted as he skillfully evaded capture, constantly changing his name and face to remain undetected.

However, as the assassin repeatedly shed his old identities like a lizard shedding its tail, he became plagued with uncertainty. He started to question whether he was the original or just one of the many copies he had created, leaving him in a constant state of distress that haunted him until his final moments.

I've gotten used to people telling me, "Whenever I look at you, I feel foolish for my efforts." Despite that, there are still those who refuse to give up. But in time, they realize how lonely this life is.
Since then, I have witnessed many overcome countless sorrows to reach my level, and shed tears as their efforts were rewarded.
But that is far from the end. A genius will create new standards that destroy existing values, throwing pretenders into hopelessness.
But this is nothing to be upset about, for they too have now reached a position where they are told, "Whenever I look at you, I feel foolish for my efforts."

I had made a name for myself as a fantasy novelist, but always had trouble coming up with good ideas. Then one night I heard a shrill horn in the distance. Enraged that someone would partake in drunken revelry at such a late hour, I rushed outside.

I was astonished by the sight that greeted me. An airship flew down from the sky and landed in a nearby cemetery. A man in ferryman's garb played a discordant horn, and people began lining up to board the airship. To my horror, it dawned on me that they were all residents who had died in the past few days! Without thinking, I joined the end of the queue and went aboard the ship.

The view from the airship was breathtaking, but I turned at the sound of swords clashing and angry shouts, and saw the dead were killing each other. A violent struggle had broken out over the right to be reincarnated as a newborn child. The guards watched on and laughed at this grisly display.

What happened next, you ask? Well, I had no stomach for killing, so I waited for my chance, then jumped from the airship. From that day on, I lost my appetite for fanciful tales, and gave up writing fantasy novels. Instead, I now publish detective stories rooted in hard logic. But when my time is up, I may find myself once again boarding that—No, it doesn't bear thinking.
June 6\nI had a really scary dream where everyone was gone and I was all alone playing in the sand.
I asked Sis if she would cry for me like I do when she's gone.
She gave me a super big hug that made me feel all warm and fuzzy inside.
Then she said, whenever I get in trouble for being bad and getting yelled at I should ask if I'd be sad if she were gone.
August 9\nToday I read a book called The Happy Prince. He gave all his things to the poor but nobody said thank you before he died. That made me feel so sad. I wish someone said thank you.
I read a book called The Little Prince. It said important things can't be seen with your eyes. But I didn't understand. That made me feel a bit sad. Maybe I'll understand when I'm bigger.
I asked Sis whether she wasn't important, because I can see her. She said sometimes you don't know the importance of things right away, but you will later.
Sometimes I don't understand things and that makes me feel sad. But maybe someday I will know everything and it will make me happy again.
January 3\nThanks to Aladdin's help in the raffle, we won a trip to the hot springs.
But I felt bad for Aladdin, cause he had to use a different bath.
So, as a child genius, I had to take action!
Woopsies. The drug to change your gender didn't work out. But no worries! I got another one that will get rid of your X#X#, so...
November 28\nI was asked what I want for Christmas. I said to eat three pieces of candy all at once.
But what I really wanted was a toy computer. But when I saw all the zeros on the tag, I kinda just gave up.
I know we aren't rich, so I'd rather Sis spend more time with me than buy some neat toy.
And because she spends so much on us, I promised I'd makes lots of money and buy her a big diamond ring when I grow up!

It's amazing how time flies. One day, I looked up and noticed that my little ones had stopped collecting acorns. Seeing them grow up fills me with happiness, but there's still this twinge of sadness, too.

Watching those kids grow up isn't the only change that's happening around here. Recently, I've been reading more books to prepare for when they become rebellious teenagers. It's amazing to see how much they've grown, and how much I've grown too.
I recently read a book that helped me understand the concept of letting your children go as they become independent, but it also brought up some worries. Will I be able to let go when the time comes?
Will I become a grandmother someday? While building a family isn't the only path to happiness, I feel like I've come into my own as an adult, and the future doesn't have to be all downhill.

I have taken too many lives and accumulated too much karma. I desire to abandon the way of the samurai and live as a farmer, cultivating the land. This spear was brought back from the battlefield, with the heads of my enemies hanging from its tip. Yet, I cannot bring myself to discard it. Instead, I shall repurpose it as a scarecrow.
A strange dream befell me last night. The heads of those I've slain, hanging one after another from the spear that stood in my fields. All wearing the same resentful expression... What could it mean?
I had another unsettling dream. The heads on the spear in my fields were unmistakably my own. Is someone attempting to curse and kill me with black magic? They shall not have their way!

Ah, that former samurai, he was the one who spoke of heads growing on spears. It seems he lost his mind, slaughtering his neighbors and eventually meeting his end at the hands of the castle's soldiers. As he predicted, his own head grew upon the spear, a truly terrifying sight.
A brave swing from the mighty axe.
Gracefully and valiantly, I swing my arm, which has become one with the axe.
The axe dances through the air with the lightness of the wind.
The severed head spins through the air, before finally landing on the ground, leaving only a gust of wind in its wake...

[Room 203, Aspiring Artist Philo]\nUgh! The neighbor next door is constantly playing their terrible violin from morning until night. Hey, can you give it a rest already? I'm telling you to stop that ear-grating performance, can't you hear me?!

[Room 102, Up-and-Coming Sculptor Cyrano]\nOh no, here we go again! That person upstairs...I can't stand to listen to their screeching melody anymore! They're getting in the way of my great artistic endeavors. This is so disrespectful!

[Room 302, Amateur Singer Marietta]\nWhat's up with the person downstairs? They keep playing that annoying violin and it's driving me crazy! I feel like I'm going to have a nervous breakdown if it keeps up like this! I can't take it anymore, I'm going to go down there and complain!
