[Landlord]\nRoom 202? She's a woman in her prime who aspires to be a violinist. But don't get any weird ideas, especially when it comes to those who pursue art for beauty. She's...so ugly that other residents who saw her face became bedridden from shock. But she's an artist like the rest of us, so I can't be too harsh to her.

The young girl grew up in a privileged household, surrounded by beautiful flowers and butterflies. However, one day, she was abducted by a man and taken to a dirty abandoned building. The perpetrator was the owner of a rivet sword, which possessed powerful enchanted rivets that he used to inflict excruciating pain upon her.

The rivets bound the girl and subjected her to an incessant, agonizing torment. She gradually grew accustomed to the pain, which was never enough to cause her to faint. As she adapted to her situation, the pain intensified, escalating her suffering.

Years later, the man was captured and sentenced to death for another violent crime, and during a scan of his brain, the authorities uncovered his history of attacks. They raided the abandoned building where he had kept the girl captive and finally freed her. Her parents were overjoyed to be reunited with their daughter, but it was short-lived. A few days later, the girl disappeared once again, last seen heading towards a brothel on the outskirts of town.

When they found her in the ruins, she was with a man she had met at the brothel. She brandished the rivet sword causing him constant pain. It wasn't unbearable, but it was relentless, just as she had endured. Surrounding the man were several butterfly specimens, which the woman had taken from her home.

My mom is super strict. She's always trying to make me eat vegetables, but I hate 'em. They're all gross and buggy and stuff. The other night at dinner, I tried to leave my veggies on my plate, and my mom slammed the handle of her sword on the table and yelled, "You're not leaving this table till you eat your veggies! Don't you know that not eating your food is worse than any crime?!"

Then she went to the kitchen to do the dishes. As I stared at my plate, feeling lost, I heard a little voice by my feet. It was a mouse! And it was talking to me!\n"Hey kid, my spaceship crashed on this planet, and I'm stuck here until I can fix it. Can you share some of your food with me?"

I saw this as a perfect chance to get rid of my veggies, so I gave them to the mouse. When my mom came back, she saw my empty plate and finally let me leave the table. I brought the mouse back to my room and listened to its story. It said it was going to take a few days to fix its spaceship, so I asked if it could help by eating all my veggies while it was there.

The next morning, I woke up to a giant mouse in my room! It had grown as tall as the ceiling!\n"The food on this planet is full of bacteria and germs! I'm having a bad reaction! Help me!"\nMy mom saw the mouse and freaked out, swinging her sword around. It was a crazy fight, and in the end, both the mouse and my mom had collapsed and were not moving. I felt all dizzy and fell over too.
"This is a song about lovers who've drifted apart."\nI should have forgotten those words by now... Why do songs remind us of the past so vividly?
According to my findings, matters of the heart are imprinted deep into memory, and music and other sensory triggers can evoke associated memories.
This could be an opportunity for a new business venture that meets potential customer needs. I have to create a business plan before competitors get ahead of me.
But, not yet... I want to dwell on the past a little longer while this lingering memory remains.

In my 200-year-old mansion, there's a spear displayed. It's odd to have such a dangerous weapon in the home of a tea-drinking noble who enjoys the garden. One day, a visiting military officer commented on the spear's presence in a wealthy mansion, surprised to see it there.

The spear was missing from the military for a long time. I told the officer that it symbolizes strength and is meant only for the future commander-in-chief. I suggested he take it with him, since nobles who dislike conflict have no need for weapons. The officer happily took the spear when he left.

During this season, the garden is filled with blooming roses. As I have my tea, the morning newspaper arrives with news of a recent military dispute over the same spear. Sadly, the officer I met was among the casualties.

"Welcome back, it looks like you went through another tough situation," I say as I put the spear back in its place in the mansion. My grandfather used to tell me the same story 50 years ago - a spear that symbolizes authority, but can only be wielded by those with no appetite for such things. It's only fitting for those born into nobility to possess such an item.

On a peaceful afternoon, a painter was busy capturing a rainy day on canvas. An art dealer had heard this was his way of documenting the future. Feeling a certain sympathy for the struggling painter, the dealer made him a bet. If it rained the next day, the painter would win.

Another peaceful afternoon, another visit from the art dealer. The dealer had won the bet. But with a serene smile as bright as the sun on his face, the painter said, "I haven't lost yet." The painter's latest masterpiece featured a crimson sunset.

The dealer was not amused by the painter's refusal to accept his loss. "Who would buy a painting like this?" he grumbled, pressing his cigar against the canvas. However, the painter chuckled and said, "Ah, I see... This burn mark is your future."

The day finally came when the artist won the bet. After acid rain had melted everything away, the sky turned red, and fireballs fell from cracks in the heavens. When the dealer saw the artist as he fled, he noticed his canvas was painted black.

It is common for humans to indulge in gluttony, lust, laziness, envy, and unfounded anger. These tendencies are rooted deep within human nature. Many believe that at the core of every soul lies greed and that the very essence of humanity is inherently evil.

I persisted, moving from west to east and vanquishing the forces of evil. Despite my repeated efforts to exorcise them, souls kept returning to the mortal realm, as if there was no end to their suffering. Alas, this world is nothing but an endless cycle of hellish torment.

Exhausted from my battles, I sought refuge in a remote temple. There, I communed with my inner deity in hopes of finding a way to quell the darkness within me. The next two years passed by in a blur, and by the end of it, my body had become as emaciated as a skeleton.

Filled with a sense of enlightenment, I venture out into the garden, gazing up at the warm rays of sunlight. In the grand scheme of the universe, my actions seem insignificant, and it would be imprudent to cling to fleeting emotions of joy or sorrow. To atone for my past selfishness, I shall smash my skull with a hammer, in hopes of pacifying the turmoil within my soul.

There was a group of boys living in poverty in the corners of a society filled with prejudice and discrimination. They earned their living by collecting items that washed up on the beach. One day, a stunning and finely-crafted sword was found on the shore. The group was overjoyed.
However, the sword gave off a chill that made the boys hesitant to touch it. When they bullied a kid to pick it up, he said, "I can't. It's too cold to touch."

The group wouldn't take no for an answer. As they forced the blade into the poor kid's hand, he turned into ice, the sword still in his grip. The boys were terrified and ran as fast as they could. However, they were abducted by a person who happened to be nearby and suffered a fate worse than death.

Many years later, society had evolved into a place where discrimination ceased to exist, and the once frozen child thawed out and was revived. Unlike in his previous life, this new world treated him with respect for his detailed knowledge of an ancient civilization. It is said he now lives a life of wealth and comfort.
I can't do this anymore. I don't know if I should stay at this job. No, the pay is good and there's nothing much to complain about...

If I told you what happened, you'd think it was trivial. See, I've been cleaning up a bunch of burning debris that was scattered all over the old square. It was a request by my employer, the minister.
Oh, right. Everyone is happy now that the square isn't a mess anymore. I got a really good bonus for it, too, so I'm glad for that. I shouldn't be worried about anything else, but...

I heard last night's food charity held in the square was packed with the city's biggest snobs. The king was so disgusted by them, He had his own execution squad, the Demonic Lava Ordnance, lay in wait and kill them all. There really are some things you wish you never knew...
[Watchman]\nHah! Showin' yer face here again, are ya? Too bad! You ain't gettin' through! My spear will stop you in your tracks!
[Watchman]\nNot givin' up, eh? You've got guts, I'll give you that much. But you'll need more than that to defeat me!
[Watchman]\nWhoa there! Don't make this harder on me! Keep yer eyes on me and give me all you got!
[Partner]\nYou're always quick to react whenever you see a nice guy. That's why I used this cursed spear to jinx you. Now you'll suffer whenever you lay eyes on a man. You reap what you sow.

The prince lamented at having to marry a princess from a neighboring kingdom. No one had offered their hand to the homely princess, now well into her twenties, so she was hardly a prize for the playboy prince. But his father urged him to marry into wealth to help fill the kingdom's empty coffers, and he could not refuse.

After the wedding, the prince was dismayed to find his wife was as plain as rumors had suggested. His philandering uncle took pity, and gave him a magic tome, saying, "I'll teach you a royal secret." The prince cast the spell within, and a figure that was his spitting image appeared before him.

To escape his predicament, the prince instructed his doppelganger to spend the night with the princess. A few days later, the curious prince asked, "How was it?" The doppelganger replied, "Not bad at all. I think I'm falling for her."

Curiosity got the better of the prince, and he resolved to spend a single night with the princess. But one night stretched into several. As the prince left her bedchamber one evening, the jealous doppelganger leapt out and slew him. From that day forth, the doppelganger took over the prince's duties, both in politics and in the bedroom.
The wolf showed me a dream of a world slowly being consumed by sand.
In that world, order was shattered by threats and unrest. Deprivation and killing ran rampant. And there was nothing anyone could do about it.
I don't know what the wolf intended in showing me this dream. I don't care about that world filled with fear and anger. All I need is my brother.
And even if my brother was to turn to sand, I wouldn't be sad. He's body will remain a handsome statue, forever unchanged.

Listen closely to the resounding voices of the gods in the sky, and let the celestial melodies of the stars captivate your ears. Fear not the tears of the heavens, for they hold a deeper meaning. Ah, shooting stars, are they not? Then offer your prayers, my dear children of the gods.

The sagely stargazer regaled us with wondrous tales. Though the star songs may seem enigmatic, they possess a soothing power that calms the troubled soul. But what does it mean for all to fade into nothingness? It's a conundrum, indeed, dear sage...

Your songs resonate with the heavens, evoking tears from the celestial realm. As your melodies fill the world, sorrow overflows. Yet, there is still hope to be found. So, be virtuous and ascend the hill today, my dear ones.

On that fateful day, a cascade of shooting stars descended upon our village. We gathered atop the hill, offering prayers and singing star songs. Shed not too many tears, for surely a profound sadness has befallen you...
My name is Grimoire Weiss.\nI am an ancient tome of profound wisdom.\nAfter awakening from my long slumber, I traveled the world with my most beloved friends.

She was a woman lacking respect for her elders.\nShe'd continuously talk down to me, calling me nothing but paper and even set me aflame.\nHowever... Her rash words were also the driving force that moved us all.

He was a compassionate and gentle boy who loved his friends.\nHis manor of dress was odd, but his kind words warmed everyone's hearts. This I know to be true.\nI wonder if he, too had felt any relief from his sins.

He was a cheeky guy, but not one you could just leave behind.
We've been through a number of rough times together. I'd tell ya about it, but... I'm running out of time.
If... If only I had an arm...
Then I could have...hugged...him...

Upon hearing an old lady from the village caught a cold, I immediately collected my medicinal herbs with some boiled water, and rushed out from the library. I nursed her and remained by her side until her symptoms calmed down. She was extremely grateful for it.

I read a picture book to a group of children from the village. It was of an old tale about a brave, courageous man who triumphs over evil. I watched their expressions alternated between joy to sorrow to the story's pacing. I'm glad they enjoyed it.

Devola and I performed a song for the people at the village tavern. In addition to the regulars who drank there, elders and children were part of the audience. At the end of our song, the entire crowd smiled and cheered.

Every day Devola and I have been staying late at the library thinking of a plan to make life easier for the villagers. They're indispensable "vessels" for the project, so we need to do what we can for them.

I craved it. Blind violence and blood-thirsty carnage. And I found it. I finally found it. A vessel stained with anger and hatred, seeking vengeance for the murder of her parents. I possessed that woman and gave her "power."

That power turned the woman into a beast. One swing of her blade was enough to cut through stone and her grazes healed in an instant. She began downing every foe before her in the name of vengeance. I was delighted to witness the fruition of my desires.

The woman's destruction didn't end there. After having her revenge, she continued to exert her "power" for the sake of her friends. Along her journey, her anger and hatred showed signs of waning, however, I gave it no thought. All I desired was to continue bathing in her bloodshed.

Because her body has reached its limit, her power has lost control. Still, in the midst of the clashing of blades, I could feel her desire to protect her friends. Yes, this is the violence and carnage I crave. But why is it deplorable and empty?

I was in a dimly lit cabin when I met a kind man.
He taught me how to write a letter.
What should I write on a blank piece of paper...?
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――



――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

Apparently, a letter should start off with the name of the person you want to give it to.
Of course, I'd want it to be his.
I hope he'll be able to read my sloppy handwriting...
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――
　　Hans


――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

At the end of the letter should be the name of the person who wrote it.
Of course, that would be the name he gave me.
Is it odd my chest feels warm writing it...?
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――
　　Hans

　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　Luiz
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

And in-between these two names, I'm supposed to write how I feel.
And tell him what I want the most.
I wonder if he'll be happy to receive this...?

――――――――――――――――――――――――――――
　　Hans, Thank you　Thank you　Thank you
Thank you　Thank you　Thank you　Thank you
　Thank you　Thank you. Luiz
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

This here is a magical dagger. Strong and tough! You can carry it anywhere, and for a reasonable price!
How 'bout it, Mister? Would you like to buy one?
Huh? Me? A bad salesman?
C'mon...

This magical dagger was forged by old man Hee Hee!
He was the greatest blacksmith.
Isn't it just beautiful? It hardly looks half a century old!
What? It needs more prestige?
I guess old man Hee Hee alone doesn't cut it...

This is a magical dagger made by old man Hee Hee's wife's grandmother!
Well? A magnificent decoration, don't you think?
Huh? Still not enough prestige?
How much further do I need to go?

This is a magical dagger forged by old man Hee Hee's wife's grandmother's brother's son's daughter's boyfriend!\nHow 'bout it, Mister? Would you like to buy one?\nThe hell with you! You're just pulling my leg!

My father was once a great sage.
They say a great celestial explosion is what created this world.
Possessing a staff with a fragment of the explosion at its core, he was revered as a savior.
But now he is locked away in some prison, and no one knows where he is.

The sage failed to recite the stars and complained that the world was headed towards destruction.
And because of this, they say he became a sinner for causing a stir in the world.
I wondered if maybe I can save my father.
So I turned to all sorts of crimes in search of him.
I was jailed, and escaped from many prisons across the country, until the day I finally met him.

His eyes were hollow, muttering the same words over and over.
There was no sign of my father left.
Giving up, I decided to escape the prison.
That night my father turned to me and said, "A new savior will appear."
That was the last time I ever saw him.

I snuck into the royal palace for the mage's staff.
When I finally found it, the celestial glow that had long faded away lit up again.
A new savior had been born. I would never forgive this world for ruining my father.
The destruction of the world the wise sage spoke of was just beginning.
It caught us by surprise when he stabbed his own family.\nIt was an act of childhood grudge that rushed to the surface in a single emotional outburst...

Once on the battlefield, he loaded his gun and shot his way through the onrushing enemy. But then he wounded up alone. The enemy soldiers were closing in on him and he was out of ammunition. Just as he was about to be killed, he sunk the spear point of his gun into the enemy. He wouldn't have made it out alive if it weren't for that gun.

When he came back home, he had almost forgotten about those bloody days on the battlefield. But then he stabbed them: his family.\nUnbeknownst too him, one of his relatives had also once killed a man. It was an unavoidable act of poverty, but the Holy One brought justice to the deed, using the hand of whom had blessed them.
Holy blessings never come for free...

Kneel down and rest your ear upon it.
You can hear a sound echoing deep within the earth.
It's the earth singing.
The shuddering of stone.
The words of our ancestors from ancient times.

Be barefoot and mindless.
Allow your heels to tread the ground and your toes grasp the mud.
Stand tall and let your steps be heard.
The earth, where all living things have fallen and met.
Listen to the trebles of the past.

Our ancestors are speaking, the past is shouting.
Live, survive, keep on living.
Don't be like us, don't follow us.
Don't be a rock, stone, dirt, or mud.
Life shines only when it's alive.

Every past is a loss to living.
History cries its desire to live towards the future.
Dear ancestors of the past—clods of earth.
The present is fed by the echoes of vindictiveness.
The past's greatness is but the past.

[Wise Sorcerer]
Are you okay, boy? I'm glad my magic made it in time.
What? You want to get back at those robbers?
No, there's no point in it.
[Wise Sorcerer]\nIf I won't help, then I need to report them?\nNo, what I'm saying is, those who conduct evil deeds weren't created properly by God in the first place.

[Wise Sorcerer]\nEarth has prospered further than God's expectations. As such, it became impossible to manage and inferior products got mixed in the process.\nI have no problem killing robbers. Given time, they will be long forgotten.

[Report to Lord Michael]\n....The young man who gave his report was immediately expunged, each record of him carefully erased.\nIt seems that someone in the human realm is beginning to see through our negligence. Immediate action must be taken.

Welcome! Come on in! Are you selling this here instrument?
You don't play it anymore?
Oh, it's your dead wife's...
You might wanna reconsider selling it then.
Well, I do have this one story...

One day a man came in to sell his instrument.
He said it belonged to his dead brother.
The strings were broken and no one laid a hand on it.
But he said he could always hear a sound coming from it.
So I told him I'd fix 'er right up.

I'm not going out on a limb saying the dead wanna play, but I'm sure there's someone out there who'd like to hear it.
So after repairing it, the man told me, "the sound stopped."
But after a few days, he heard it again.
Do you have an idea why that is?

Because he got lonely. He missed hearing it.
So this time, he was the one who picked it up and played it.
Now, are you sure you wanna sell yours?
...I see. Come and see me again when you want to sell it.
I'll offer you a good price for it.
So much to eat ♪\nI know! How about some yummy, cough-curing fried shaman fish?!
So much to eat ♪\nOoh! I'd like a pot of shark fin stew!
So much to eat ♪\nBut wait! A mountain of pancakes made from eagle eggs sounds delish!
So much to eat ♪\nI want a whole roasted boar!\nI hope we're rewarded with something juicy! Collecting these materials is hard work!
Behold! My marvelous automata, a breakthrough that shall shower me with untold wealth and free humanity from its toils! A decade hence, mankind's very existence shall be reborn!
As the machine's fame spread, the wages paid to human workers plummeted. Soon, all manner of labor in the next generation will be entrusted to these mechanical marvels!

From one automaton per household to one per individual, the world transformed rapidly. With automata to do the work, people's days were filled with leisure. It was the realization of an idyllic society, long sought after.
Yet, indulgence and wealth led to currency's demise. Nations abandoned money, plunging the world into strife. Regret is all that remains, for having tampered with the inviolable creation.
Analyst Report, Elliott Waves, Granville's Law.
Cross trades, golden crosses, call options.
Tin parachutes, Decoupling Theory, duration.
This is all knowledge that I, a nobody, forced into my brain to gain power. The nights I feel anxious, I dream of my childhood.
I keep getting chat notifications. But I'm glad to be needed.
Girls who are jealous of me try to hurt me with their words. Even if it is malicious of them, I'm glad I have no ill-will towards others.
I don't need anything in return. I just want to share my true love.
People say my parents' teachings are a curse. It's up to me to prove them wrong.

When people die, their souls are transported to a place called the Underworld. The king of the dead sighed in his throne. "I'm tired of dealing with souls from the living. It'd be nice to play with the living from time to time." Seeking a new thrill, he decided to toss his staff up above ground.

The mysterious staff had the ability to connect the Underworld with the living. A woman picked up the staff and made a wish. "Please may I see my baby..."\nThe staff glowed and the mother's stomach throbbed. She burst into tears as her womb swelled up again.

"Oh! I felt it kick!"\nDay by day, her stomach grew with the active fetus. The mother who had once lost her will to live from the loss of her child was brimming with life. Her spirit rejuvenated, she prepared for the birth. However...

Her joy was short-lived, as the fetus gradually stopped moving. Her mother's intuition knew exactly what had happened. She grabbed the staff and forced it down her throat until both her and her child's soul drifted down into the Underworld. Even now, the king can be heard sighing over the increasing dead.

Clink. Clink. Clink.
The scraping of metal, chain mail swaying.
The knight pushes forward into battle, all for the sake of the motherland.
Clink. Clink. Clink. Clink.

Thud. Thud. Thud.
The sound of iron piercing flesh, cracking of steel against bone.
The knight decimates its enemies, all for the sake of the motherland.
Thud. Thud. Thud. Thud.

Skret. Skret. Skret.
The rattle of hauled loot, children returning home.
The knight welcomes his new family, all for the sake of the motherland.
Skret. Skret. Skret. Skret.

Clank. Clank. Clank.
All for the sake for the sake of the motherland. The motherland.
Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank.
No. The motherland means nothing to that knight now.
Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank.
Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank.
All for the sake of the motherland. The motherland.
Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank.
It's the silk of fate.\nKnowing you, I shall begin living a life of truth.
It's the forbidden fruit.\nProtecting you, I shall sink into wisdom's abyss.
Those are the flames of anxiety.\nThinking of you, I shall endure eternity's darkness.
That is a reunion of bitter tears.\nWho are they? Why is it not me who's besides you?
[Confession No. 897699]\nI broke the village rules and spoke my true feelings.
I tried not to let on how much fun I was having, while wiping away tears from laughing way too hard.
I should have laughed when he married my sister, too.
But when he unexpectedly hugged me...only unspeakable words filled my mouth.
[Confession No. 79537]\nA great war once ravaged our land, depriving our village of its youth.
In a bid to avert the village's downfall, our elder made a tough call to offer free meals and shelter to weary travelers. Fortunately, our village had ample savings to sustain us.
Though we knew it would only last as long as our food held out, life returned to the village. But without any youth settling down and starting families, our future seemed bleak.
And so, we resorted to desperate measures, taking in travelers without apparent ties, leading them underground, and... Oh, the burden of our sins weighs heavy upon us.

I can still breathe normally, and the water pressure doesn't faze me at all. Yet, there are fish gliding through the air, and I can navigate through the watery atmosphere too. It's as if the entire world has been plunged underwater.
Then an official notice arrived, urging me to seek out and confront the wielder of the mythical Leviathan Blade. For days on end I searched, swimming through the depths looking for this being.
Finally, I confronted the sword-wielder. After exchanging blows, I deflected their sword and ran my blade across their neck and torso, bidding them farewell for eternity.

The being voiced their final words. "Don't you find this underwater world strange? I sought to destroy the ringlea—."\nThat struck a chord with me. Who gave me that order, anyway? I guess there's no point dwelling on it, though. For now I'll swim alongside the fish...

The sea in these parts was known for its gentle waves. There were tales of the waves soothing crying babies, carrying drowning children to the shore, leading sinking ships back to land, and washing pretty shells up on the sand.

A priest who was passing through remarked that a god inhabited the sea, and the people became convinced this was the reason for its gentle waves. But one day, the waves delivered them a man's bloated, decomposing corpse. The people lamented, fearing they had angered the sea god. They decided to offer up one of their number as a sacrifice to quell itswrath.

The sacrifice was bound with coral shackles and thrown into the depths. Waves leapt up and swept the body back and forth, until eventually it was torn limb from limb.\nSince that day, the sea has carried no more corpses to the shore, but its gentle waves are a thing of the past.

The people did not know of the sea god's love for his daughter. He had sent waves to save her from drowning when she was a child. And again to rescue the foundering ship she had boarded to search for the body of her father, a man fond of shells who had been cast into the sea. Finally, when she was offered as a sacrifice by her people, he had desperately tried to keep her afloat, but to no avail.

I have been in this dimly lit hut for as long as I can remember. The people of my village worship the sun, and I am its living incarnation. To preserve my divinity, I am forbidden from coming into contact with others.

I have never felt lonely. Those who tended to my needs spoke not a word, but all manner of creatures were brought to the hut to keep me company. The shrill buzz of insect wings, the smoothness of reptiles, and the warmth of small animals... These things helped me stave off solitude.

One day, the village was thrown into uproar when the sun failed to show its face. I was taken outside and felt the touch of human hands for the first time. A beautiful young maiden ran her fingers over my body falteringly. I felt a rush of blood. The villagers shouted that we must be joined as one.

Impulse took over, and I seized the altar's spear and pierced the maiden's body, just as I had done to the insects, lizards, and animals. The maiden gave a shrill cry, but her innards were just as smooth, and her blood just as warm. I felt the same love and connection. The village descended into chaos, but I paid no mind.
Hah! My birdcage trap worked! I'll boil every last one of you feathered fiends alive for feasting on my fields! Huh? What's that wavering portal? No! I'm being pulled inside!
What is this place? Oh, I see someone... A talking bird?! Huh? You took pity on my ungainly form and made me immortal?
You're talking nonsense. I hate birds, anyway! What the hell's going on here? Is this a bad dream?! Aha! I see another portal forming! Free at last!
I know this smell... I'm back in the fields! Wait... I'm stuck inside my birdcage trap! I got turned into a bird?! And if I'm immortal, I'll be trapped here forever...
You worked your way to wealth, but it has failed to fill the void in your heart, hm? And so you came to me, the Vault Keeper, for advice? Here, take this key and find the vault it fits.
Ah, I see you found the vault and brought back the youth within. But will youth fill the void in your heart? I get the feeling such a thing will prove tricky for one as hardheaded as yourself.

You've squandered your fortune on the frivolous trappings of youth? I see you took my little dig at you to heart. Well, at least you got a chance to let loose and have some fun. Now, time to return the key.
Whew. I knew they'd come at me and try to claim the role of Vault Keeper. Now I have another soul to add to the vaults. There are endless uses for such an avaricious spirit. Keheheh.
Pink ribbons and frills... You can't expect me to go out in this outfit! I'll be made a laughing stock!
Why would Dorothy drug me with sleeping pills and force me into this getup? Does she think she can beat me at my own game?
I must be slipping. A few years ago, I wouldn't have trusted food given to me by others.
And I don't care if it is for some commemorative event. Turning around to randomly find someone pointing a camera in my direction is a my worst nightmare.
[Flirtatious Mademoiselle]\nHey, handsome, are you free? If you're up for it, how about taking a stroll with me? Then, we can go somewhere private and get to know each other better...
[Provocative Madame]\nWow, you're quite the catch. Want to have some fun with me? I'll even pay if you're interested. How much would it take?
[Sultry Lady]\nMmm, I know that smell. I bet you haven't been with a women before, have you? Lucky for you, I can show you the time of your life. Ready to explore uncharted territory?

[Child of the Sea]\nAs I prepare for the rite of the sea, I take a deep breath to push away all distracting thoughts. But this beach reserved for nobles is awash with worldly desires. At this rate, I won't be able to keep up with the annual cleansing...

A voice told me to slash diagonally from the upper left and parry a thrust from the right, so I did. Before I knew it, a mountain of bodies had piled up, though there was not a drop of blood on me. It felt as natural as breathing.

Just when I thought I could finally rest, reinforcements arrived and leapt to the attack. In the back of my mind I wondered why I had to fight them, but I found myself lashing out with the blade all the same.

I survived the onslaught, and was suddenly struck by life's transience. Just as I was about to throw down my blade, I felt a sharp pain in my brain, as if it was being lashed by electricity. Pressing my hands to my temple, I let out a sigh. What was I doing here?
The blade told me how to fight. Over time, it began to dictate my other actions, and I came to obey it without question. I'll spend the rest of my days a lone wanderer, without a will of my own.

A certain hammer embellished with wildcats and said to grant one's desires caught the attention of a young man. Desperate to have it, he paid a hefty sum for the item and excitedly hurried back home contemplating all the things he could ask for. Money? Unlimited food? Oh, the possibilities.

Just as he was about to make his wish, a gruntled voice came from the hammer. "I am the Wildcat. I've been asleep so long, I forgot how to use magic. In order to manifest your desires, I'll require some help. Heavens, it's nothing too complicated. First, a great amount of salt..."

Once the young man prepared the salt as requested, the hammer shared with him some of his good fortune. Delighted, he agree to more orders in hope that his wish would come true. From collecting holy water from the church, fire from a scared tree set ablaze, he ran about exhausted from all the work.

"Goodness, you did well with all my demands. I appreciate it. All that's left is to smash this hammer as hard as you can."\nThe man obediently did as was told—and the hammer shattered into pieces. From the shards leaped out a wildcat...and ran off into the distance.

The people have been cursed by the Ice Princess' fury! Their body temperature has drastically decreased to temperatures below freezing! One touch from them can turn others into popsicles! What are we going to do?

The Ice Princess chuckled. The citizens of the nation now had the luxury of walking outdoors in sub-zero temperatures without the need for winter clothing. They should be comfortable. But the issue wasn't as simple as it seemed.

The princess whiled away her time. Her citizens could no longer embrace each other due to them freezing solid. More importantly, this prevented them from reproducing! Everyone worried anxiously at what this would mean for the future.

The Ice Princess sighed and lifted the curse off the people! Everyone returned to their lives and made up for lost time. However, the princess will become angry again in time. When that happens, the citizens of the nation will yearn for their princess' sigh once more, and so the cycle continues...

There was once a pair of scoundrels, one stubborn and oafish, the other obsessed with magic. They came across a faerie in the woods, and attempted to capture her. The faerie fought back with her Blossombow, but was eventually pinned down.

With the captured faerie in hand, the oaf couldn't wait to sell her for a profit. But his crazed counterpart walked up and delivered a crushing blow to the back of his head, killing him instantly and claiming the faerie for himself.

The magic-obsessed maniac took the faerie back to his lab, where he boiled her alive to make a potion that amplifies magical power. He cackled maniacally, knowing he could either drink it himself or sell it for a fortune.

The next morning, the faerie-killer was found dead with an arrow from the Blossombow lodged in his throat. It seems the bow itself was sentient, and the faerie was merely an accessory! Either way, there are now two fewer scoundrels in the world.

Amidst the depths of despair, a glimmer of light shone through. As the light pierced the darkness, a shadowy figure emerged, its features illuminated by the flickering flames. The figure, once human, stood motionless, staring blankly into the crimson glow.

Ah, this is when I was still human. Yes, I was me! That red flame is a reflection of myself, as I once warmed my freezing body by the fireplace, as I once cooked with my lover. That red flame embodies my very essence! I crave that red, I desire it!

Another shadow approached, gradually taking shape from the darkness as it drew closer to the light. The fiery glow painted it red, staining its very soul. Soon, other shadows arrived, drawn by the light, and as they gathered, the red hue grew ever more vibrant and intense.

After a while, the shadows began to merge and intertwine, appearing to struggle against one another. The illuminating lights of memory were no longer visible. The flames flickered and the shadows lost their distinct forms, dissipating into the air along with the ego that once drove them.
I've painted this dreamworld, not with all things soft and lovely, but coated it in all of my oozing, seething hatred.
There was someone, someone there who put on false tears to twist the emotions of others.
Someone who put on a show, who layered lies and wound themselves around their victim, marrying them to bind them tighter.

And it made me mad. Furious. Enraged, to see someone use such deceit all to sate their own desires. Their greed. And it makes me wonder, is it even possible, anymore, to live in this world and still keep your hands clean?
[Wanted Outlaw]\nKeh! It didn't take me long to bust outta jail splittin' that water pipe! Ya only live once, am I right? Might as well go all out! I'll break and take everything in my path!
[Wanted Outlaw]\nKeh! Watch those folks run! Bustin' the levee got 'em so panicked they left all their belongings for the taking! What the hell do I care if I'm troublin' others? It's my life!
[Wanted Outlaw]\nKABOOM! Down goes the church and away with their riches! Why save a place that deceives the poor? I can make better use of it swingin' at these statues for target practice!

[Guard]\nThat prisoner with the grin? He slipped and smacked his head on the ground when he tried to escape his cell by cracking the water pipe with an axe. Now he lives in a fantasy world. He got what he deserved.

A villainous king, misgoverning politics, and a country unsettled.\nThe younger patriot prince offers wine to his older brother at the banquet, as he gently admonishes him. But his words fall on deaf ears.\nSo with the sword hidden in his cloak, the prince sighs inwardly as he murders his brother.

Having lost her husband, the indignant queen flees to a neighboring country.\nThe neighboring country began an invasion, later called the "funeral battle."\nThe patriot prince takes a seat in the ceasefire negotiations along with the queen, who stabs him to death with a hidden dagger.

A prince but five years old becomes the new king, and his guardian queen becomes the de facto supreme authority.\nWhile the queen is at ease in her room, her maid appears and slices the queen's throat with a hidden dagger.\nShe, who had been the mistress to deceased patriot prince, has avenged his death. And now, she stabs herself in her throat, choosing to die.

The savage clans who'd been suppressed by the villainous king's skill in battle, chose their time to attack. The child king was frightened and offered to surrender.\nThey refused his surrender, burning the royal capital and all its citizens.\nExperts claim to this day... "Wouldn't the bloodshed have been avoided if the young patriot had just kept his sword in his pocket?"
A certain shepherd lived on the scenic hill.\nWithout a family, he hired a few quiet but hardworking servants to take care of the sheep.

The shepherd was very kind and gentle.\nA merchant who often traveled by the pasture once said of him...\n"No matter what happens, that man never jumps to anger, never raises his voice, and never gets highhanded with anyone. That's a rare person nowadays."

One day, an aggressive war broke out between neighboring countries, and people burned out of house and home evacuated near the hill. The shepherd warmly accepted them.\n"You must've had it so hard. Now then, just take it easy and rest here."

The next morning, the shepherd and the servants grinned as they tied up the people with ropes to be sold to slave traders pretending to be merchants.\nIndeed, he was both a shepherd and an evil wolf in sheep's clothing.
Mr. Crow showed me a dream a world where wishes come true. Oh, how I wish I could live in such a place. If only it existed.
In that world I met an inspiring chef—and his wish came true! But just as quickly as it was granted, passion for cooking also disappeared.
There was yet another boy who dreamed of becoming a chef. After entering the profession, he made a wish to own his own a flourishing restaurant, but...

Once he became the greatest chef in the country, drowning in wealth and fame, he had lost all desire and his health began to deteriorate. It was then I learned how great a power desire was as a means to live.

[Fugitive]\nPhew, I made it into this cave without getting caught. No way I'm dying in some stupid war when I could be back home and holding my sweetheart in my arms again! I'll lay low here for a while.

[Fugitive]\nFeels like I've been here for ages now. I wonder if the war has at last come to a close. Then again, this cave is surprisingly snug and cozy. Maybe I'll take a power nap, recharge my batteries.

[Fugitive]\n*Yawn* That was a much-needed rest. Now it's time to sneak out and scout the battlefield. Wait, where's the exit again? Hmm. Why do all the paths seem to lead into a never-ending downward slope...?

[Lumberjack]\nThese footprints lead deeper into the Pit of Eden. It's where souls of the departed with strong ties to the living world rest, and even us locals dare not approach... May they rest in peace.
At first I wasn't excited about it, but before I knew it,\nI realized I was enjoying myself.\nAnd it's all thanks to everyone being here with me... I'm sure.
I don't like how getting sweaty makes the yukata stick to me.\nBut I didn't notice because I was too focused on my aim.
The welcoming flame main event was a more beautiful sight than I could've imagined.\nBut for some reason...it made me feel just a little sad.
Time flies when you're having fun.\n"Now that I think about it, we didn't take any pictures together..."\nIt came to mind suddenly, and I felt a little pang in my chest.
I know, on that day I thought...\nCould this be a dream?\nThen surely the time will come when I'll have to wake up.
If it's fate to eventually disappear...\nIt's not wrong to give in to the pleasure you feel in this moment.
I thought that food stalls and such were trivial.\nI never thought my values could change like that at such a time...
This world is filled with beautiful things unknown to me... I forced to realize it by the tears of the girl who touched me in the end.
If I'm with my dear brother,\nI'm happy even in the pouring rain.
If I'm with my dear brother,\nI don't fear any pain.
If I'm in my dear brother's memory,\nthat's enough to satisfy me. At least, that's what I thought...
But it's not so bad really. To disappear while being watched over by someone else. Someone other than my dear brother.
I'd been waiting and waiting\nfor this day to come.
And finally my wish comes true.\nIt's the very first and very last festival,\nso I'm going to have fun till I drop!
But the festival won't last forever.\nThe end will come sometime.\nBut I won't lose to that! I'm aiming to hit all the stalls!
Thank you, Alice.\nI made some good memories at last.\nWe'll keep being friends to the end!
That snow illusion magic you use is incredible! It brought me such joy to see the scenery of my homeland!\nI spent my life without a single hope at the demon army's prison camp, but then hope arose!
You've shown the other prisoners all sorts of sights from their homelands too, you say?\nI see, I see! I'm sure they're so glad, as am I! I hope you'll show me my home again before long!

What's that you say? You even showed the demon army what our homelands look like?
Come on now! That's not right!
Are you on their side then?
Or is it...that they threatened to hurt you?

It's a shock that we prisoners, despite having lost our souls, united to break out of the prison and take over the camp.\nBut it's a pity that your life was taken by a flying arrow.\nSurely this day will be known throughout the ages as the day the Blossom Ice Hammer fell...

Hey, what's the big idea?
I heard you got a pickaxe of your own and joined the miners in their mining.
But what's gotten into you now? You spend all day spaced out.
Where did your passion go?

What now? The volcano shifted, and the metal settled in the ground for a better lode, huh? So we should take our time and wait, you say?\nListen, here! I only invested in this venture because you were willing to take a high risk for a high reward!

If you won't work, I'll withdraw my funding and seize your assets!
...Yeah? What'll you do then?
What do you mean I'll get that water pitcher over your dead body?
——Hey, you two! If you're gonna fight, go all out. Let's see some spirit!

This water pitcher is strange. When I look at it, I get so calm.\nAlmost as if, I could just sit back and wait for the metal to finish settling and make a nice lode.\nMaybe I'll even give up the investment gamble and switch to a steady, profitable business...
After smashing and slaughtering its prey, the club summoned an unprecedented cold wind to the land.
A sorrowful wind, as if to mourn its victims.
And the wind blew through the desolate land for many years.
Called long ago to blow through the final scenes of a massacre, it continues to chill the air to this day.

The symbol of beauty is the rose, and the symbol of hideousness is the frog.
And the good news is that no one has seen a frog for years now!
Oh, what a splendid thing that is!
The rain of bullets by the hitman was a rueful comfort indeed...
Hmph. The crack-shot gunman, suited to the scent of roses, shall die here, I suppose...

Crawling out of the soil with a swish, I thought desperately through a foggy mind.
How odd. I, suited to the scent of roses, should've been shot dead. And yet...
A figure slipped into view, and gave me a scare.
It was too awful to speak it aloud, but it could only be described as a frog man!

I lay collapsed on the ground when the frog man said...
"Oh, good! You were terribly injured, so I planted a...seed to put you to sleep."
"What? What are you saying? Who are you anyway?"
"As you can see, I am a species of frog. In our long hibernation, we were blessed with God's will and waited for the time to become rulers of the whole world."

"That's absurd! You'd never be rulers even in 100 years!"
"Says the man who slept for 100 years. Every living creature is a frog now. And yes, that means you too."
I was stunned to see myself in the hand mirror that the frog man had taken out.
Instead of a beautiful, rose-scented young man, I found an ugly frog man in my reflection.
With a dreadful croak, I quickly hopped away...

[Mysterious Youth]
Are you meeting someone at this beach?
I see! You were hoping to catch the maestro of that famous orchestra and become his apprentice.
Indeed, he often takes his walks here.

[Mysterious Youth]
But you should think twice!
It's hard to be a success in music. It's not enough to just love it.
And you may be confident in your skills, but that's not all it takes.

[Mysterious Youth]
Oh, I had no idea! To think you could win such accolades despite being so young!
Still, I dare to say that you should quit now.
Even if you have talent, it won't do here.

[Haggard Man]
I never thought that maestro would only use someone who would allow him a physical relationship.
 The one who warned me must've been used as a plaything too.
Oh, that I could wash away this filthy body and soul into the sea...
In ancient times, even before humans appeared on the surface, the spear has been thrust into a body.
The land where it was lain was submerged, and a deep sea city was established there at the bottom of the ocean.
But it was undying. And since that time, it continued to sleep within the underwater city.
Someday, when the spear is pulled out of the resting body, it shall awaken and bring ruin to the world...

Come one, come all!\nBe they King Arthur's knights of the round table, Nobunaga the shadowlord, or Jeanne the saint... Great heroes have gathered like glittering stars!\nAll aboard for the mainland to restore peace unto the world!

One may ask...
"Why are we here? Who are we fighting?"
And one may answer...
"Lest we forget that we were driven here! There will be no tomorrow unless we defeat those who deny our existence."

Another may say...
"If so, pray tell, from what were we born?"
The names of their fathers and mothers are put forth, but...
"Do they really exist in flesh and blood? If so, what of us who were born from such?"

Behold, boys and girls.
In despair of the people, God descended to command the world and burned all its tales at this water's cape.
When you stand here, you can see a ship in the waves.
A ghost ship carrying heroes whose legends have been passed down for thousands of years in history.
[Confession No. 8721767]\nThe dry, sand-covered country exuded a captivating aroma of spices. Far off in the distance, a massive royal palace loomed, proudly showcasing the nation's prosperity.
A strong coastal breeze swept through, swirling the fine fragments of sand, momentarily obscuring my vision. As I wiped my eyes, I noticed a young boy wearing weathered clothes clinging to my feet.
"I don't have any money for you," I said, rebuffing him firmly. Yet the boy simply smiled and followed me.
Acknowledging the immaturity of my actions, a tinge of remorse washed over me after sprinting away with all my might. I couldn't help but wonder about the reason behind the boy's infectious smile.
Before Snow had realized it, all that remained was a single hag, utterly alone amidst the ruins. Sensing Snow's presence, the hag turned and began to speak:
"Why the long face, dearie? Could it be that your values are faltering? Do you suffer for some grand, higher purpose?"
"That must be some dream of yours. Looking back on my time here, I've come to realize something. That is, the happiness I've experienced is abundant—it could fill an entire mountain."
Snow listened until the hag had finished, then drove her blade through her heart. 'Your happiness ends here,' Snow thought, believing she had wrought not death, but salvation.

This one? Looks like a toy, right?
Actually, it seems that it was developed by a child who intended for it to be a toy.
Well, I should say, it's the "Ultimate Gun" that he thought up.
It shoots foam the liquid loaded in the cartridge.
You can keep shooting until it hits the target.

And listen to this. The father who was an inventor
started selling it as a weapon instead of a toy.
Everyone around made fun of him at first.
I mean, can you really use something like that?
But in fact, this was a fearsome weapon.

The liquid in the cartridge can be anything you like.
Aqua regalis, acid, venom—whatever! Thanks to that, it's highly lethal.
So it eventually came to be used for war.
It's been designated as an inhumane weapon because of the number of lives it's taken.

The father seems to have commercialized it to give his child a good life.
But having been accused of developing an inhumane weapon, the child died by the gun. His father's dream burst like a bubble.
What's more, the gun was simplified shortly after that,
and now it's just a toy.

Only thanks to the desire for knowledge that humans have seeded inside them, we writers can eat.
In the countryside where I came to the interview this time, it seems that the two authorities in the medical world are arguing against each other.
One is rich and the other is extremely poor, but how did the difference come about?
I'm going to expose everything!

I've heard stories about it in nearby rural areas, but the poor doctor wasn't very well received.\nAn old man stubborn and snobby about everything, and he didn't take opinions from others at all.\nWhen it came to the rich doctor, I heard so many praises it made me sick.

I stayed at a hotel that was reasonably priced and drafted a book.
Suddenly, I felt nauseated.
I emptied the entirety of my stomach  onto the floor. A servant ran in to find me squirming about.
But he makes no move to help. Just stands by and watches.
Hey! Why are you just standing there dawdling?

[Rich Doctor]
What's this? Not a spy from some institution, but a writer?
In that case, there's still the risk of leaking information.
I can't let anyone know that stubborn old doc is innocent, and I'm the one placating the people by doing everything including corpse disposal for the right price.
Remove the organs and dispose of the flesh. And don't forget that book too.

The ocean as far as the eye can see. The reverberation of the waves.\n...A stylish house on the beach. A place of peace just for me. And then one day, a man appeared and said matter-of-factly, "I will stay here."

Naturally, I refused the unscrupulous declaration.\nBut the man paid me no mind and settled in the vacant room.\nHowever, as we shared a roof, ate together, and talked with each other, he seemed less distant to me.

Eventually, I came to realize that he has a warm heart. Only that he can't express his intentions well in words.\nAt some point, when I had relented my heart to him, I made a confession.\nI confessed to being a spy, collecting confidential information about this country.

He sighed.
"Let us both tell the truth. You categorically denied all allegations of espionage brought to you, and even gave our torture experts some grief."
"I used magic to create this virtual world, extracted your spirit into it. You are no longer of any use."
He squeezed the trigger of the gun...

The opulent marble mansion had an exterior decorated with countless colorful flowers in bloom. It was once known as the Hall of Harmony, a symbol of tranquility due to its inhabitants' contributions to peace. But now, a young girl resides there alone, the sole heir of an estate shrouded in mystery. Over thirty young men have gone missing in the vicinity.

As I delved deeper into the mansion's lore, intriguing details emerged. The young girl apparently has a penchant for doves. Doves, once a rare sight at the mansion, have now practically taken it over. Any theories as to why, partner?

Upon further investigation I discovered there were no mating pairs of doves present. I also spotted piles of dove feathers and bloodstains behind the mansion. All signs point to a lone assailant going on a rampage. A stakeout might be warranted. I can handle it, so leave it in your partner's capable hands!

Curiously, my partner never returned to the detective agency after that. When I revisited the mansion, the young girl just stood there, smiling sweetly. Yet, an inexplicable sense of foreboding washed over me. Was it the sight of the doves crowding around her, covered in wounds? Or the deranged gleam in their eyes as they followed the young girl's every command? The mystery deepened...

Alright, Darling! Mind if I sit next to you? Aww, don't you just look adorable. Hm? You don't want me to sit here? Why not, it won't cost you anything, I just want to sit for a bit, really!\n\nStill no? Even though I just want to sit down?

Oh, poor you, Darling! Your wife must be sooo strict! She doesn't realize how wonderful and charming you are! Whenever you're next to me I want you to just be your wonderful self, alright? Don't worry! Why would she think there's anything going on between us?

Oh dear, your wife found out about us? Well, this is a marvelous opportunity, isn't it? Why not divorce her and stick with me instead? I mean, just think about it, she hurts you so much, doesn't she? And don't I make you feel soooo much better? Haha, right? Hurry up and send her packing!

Alright, thanks, that's the entire payment, and here's the evidence of his affair. Pleasure doing business with you! You know, it's weird how many women hire me when they want to break up. I'm doing a brisk business, I tell you! Him? Oh, he's moving into my place any day now. I can't wait, I'm going to eat him up! Every morsel...

My dad told me he was a famous adventurer! You can't blame me for sneaking in his room after hearing that. I knew there'd be even more secrets hidden away, and I was right! I found the journal he kept on his adventures, and inside it was a black feather!

How much longer is he going to quiz me on my travels? He even suggested going on an adventure together. If it weren't for him being born, I'd still be out there roaming. Looks like he's been snooping around in my room. Hm? Isn't this that cursed grimoire...?
This feather must be from a monster my dad defeated! Dad is so cool! But why is my back so itchy...? Oh! Dad's going to kill me if he catches me!\nI panicked, and fled up into the sky.

It's been a few years since I last pursued my prey. Upon returning to the village, I was praised by everyone for finally slaying the monster. It was a satisfying feeling. Afterwards, I carefully placed the black feather I'd taken as a trophy back into my grimoire.

An unusual-looking instrument, isn't it? This is the culmination of our blood, sweat, and tears. These days music is not enough to satisfy the masses. Perhaps with the peaceful times we live in, people seek new and exciting twists to their entertainment.

Let me play a song... Heh heh. Fascinating, isn't it? The carousel on the base really moves, and the speed it turns and the horses that appear depend on the song. It's the perfect gimmick to delight an audience.
You want an encore? You really want to hear the Somnichord play, huh? Then let's get serious. I'll perform again next time we meet. And when I do, I'll play a proper song.

You see, this carousel feeds upon the crowd's desire for fun. Once they hear a song, they snap out of their daze and go home. They don't understand real music. We pay the cost of putting on a true performance, and awaken the crowd to the gravity of their situation. A worthy endeavor, don't you think?
Aladdin arrived in a world inhabited by people manipulated by addictions. There, various forms of anger and fury in human form ran wild.
Furious, rage-filled, vengeful, backstabbing, emotional, insufferable, intolerant people...
Stomping on the ground, throwing temper tantrums, heads boiling with indignation, faces flushed, shooting piercing glares, livid with animosity...
Countless and diverse feelings of anger. And the people who came up with words to describe them all were ruled by the very words themselves.
Aesthetics and Nature
The Flowers of Evil, The Picture of Dorian Gray
The Essence of the Novel, Cynicism
Beauty's Essence, Beauty's Definition
[Aspiring Violinist]\nI am ready. Implant a reflex circuit in me so it feels like I'm being sliced by blades when I mess up.
[Aspiring Violinist]\nAaghhh, the pain is killing me! ...I'm still not there yet! I need to get even better!
[Aspiring Violinist]\nCrap, it still hurts like hell! How much do I need to level up to finally be rid of this pain?

[Instructor]\nOh, him with the sour notes? He pledged to improve by placing magical constraints on himself, but it seems he found pleasure in the pain. He'll be producing discordant notes until the day he dies.
This zero-gravity thing is a lot of fun! I didn't know space was full of playthings with tons of room to move around!
Dorothy told me less is known about the ocean's depths than land on Mars!
Next time I gotta ask her to make something so I can play with everyone in the deeper than deep sea!
I think she called it hydraulic pressure? And that it would flatten me like a pancake! I bet there's tons of fun playmates in a world like that!
Animals have the good life. They can sleep whenever they want, wherever they want, and for as long as they want.
They're free, don't have dumb rules to follow, and they don't have to worry about common sense.
Animals are clever, too. They just live wherever they feel most at home.
But they're also helpless. With the help of science, humans can respond to all sorts of deviant weather and environmental changes, but animals...are easily wiped out.
How long has it been since I've last stepped on the moon? Much seems to have changed from what I remember.
It puzzled me at first, but when I thought back on all the tales I heard on my journey, I came to one conclusion.
Yes, for all the tales I heard, there was a moon for each. And in each very different story, the experiences and changes the earth went through were enormous.

Furthermore, if such infinite possibilities exist in the universe and in the realm of uncertainty to humans, who's to say there isn't a world where we can fulfill our desires...without ever having to meet our author?

I tell ya, I've been an architect for a hell of a long time. But man, that overnight millionaire's mansion was a pain in the ass to build. They had me plant all these trees in his garden 'cause they love trees and all that nature stuff. Do they realize we're living in an age of machine magic?

So the other day I had a chance to visit the place. The whole family came out dressed in nothin' but scraps of cloth wrapped around them! They said, "We're dressed to match the wonderful work you've done with the garden." It was quite the scene!

When I went inside, I saw rain and snow! It was astonishing, really, but the owners didn't find it the least bit strange! It's was like this mansion was the only place in the world cut off from the rest of modern civilization!

I just couldn't get enough of it, ya know? So I snuck into the garden one night and got caught in a trap. The family ran out with their axes hollerin', "Sacrifice for the King of the Forest!" and smashed my skull in.
My friends and I went to the mountains for a picnic. We're finished here, yeah? So lets head back. Oh! Check out that beautiful lake! Don't mind if I take a quick sip... Huh? This is—!
Hearing my surprise, one of my friends came to my side. "Oh wow. This lake is beautiful!" And not a moment later, he had bent down, cupped the water in the palm of his hands, and took a sip.

"This lake is filled with wine. We can't let anyone else know about it! It's our little secret, got it?" My friend nodded in agreement, but to our dismay, our other friends came hustling in our direction.

I lowered my gun now spewing out smoke. Surrounding me were the bodies of my friends, sprawled out like a beehive. I turned back to the lake and swallowed as much drink as I could. "Matured greed is such a lovely taste! I'm going to drink this lake dry!"

I've never been much of a people-person. I've always been this way. And because of that, I felt like the black sheep of society and lost myself. Hiding under the veil of darkness, I attacked unsuspecting travelers with my dagger and stole their valuables.
With the money and goods I collected, I was just able to make it by. But the more days went by, it became more difficult and painful to survive in the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

Often, I found myself wandering aimlessly. When the sun was high, I'd rest under the shade of a tree or take shelter in a cave. When dusk came, I continued wandering again. Simply being away from human brought me a sense of relief. As if all the turmoil and frustration built up deep within my heart had eased and relaxed.
Before I knew it, I had turned into a bat. I sometimes wonder if my chiroptera friends were once human as myself. No, maybe not all of them. Just those who have been turned away by their peers.

It was an artifact with coral-like branches wrapped around its core. The only power it possessed was that to protect itself. I decided to embed the artifact in my body so I could control and manipulate it, using it's branches to bound, skewer, and crush monsters. Thanks to its power, I made my way towards becoming a first-rate magician.

As I rose in power, I tried to enjoy the world in my own unique way. But how could I enjoy myself knowing everything would be destroyed. Unknown beings from another world had appeared, and with an endless supply of magical power taken from the stars of their world, they wreaked havoc on the planet.

I fell into despair. It was then that my artifact spoke to me in the form of a heartbeat. It wanted to grow—to extend its branches limitlessly. However, I was incapable of providing the magic needed for such a feat. With me as its source of power, it could only grow the size of a common tree. But I had a plan...

For three long years I followed the beings until I had found the origin of their power. I shoved my artifact inside and gladly welcomed my death. Now grow. Grow as high as you can reach! Just as I was about to lose consciousness, I witnessed a gigantic tree rising to the heavens—to the very stars where magic was dying out.

[Prodigy's Shadow]\nYou were like that as long as I can remember. You worked hard, studied, and fetched water every morning. You were like some kind of fairy, a good person who no greed in your heart.
[Prodigy's Shadow]\nYou always helped me with my studies whenever something didn't click, without looking down on me. You really were a good person, like a fairy.

[Prodigy's Shadow]\nBut only one of us can advance to the Royal Academy. I'm sorry I pushed you into the water and made it look like an accident when I killed you. But, you'll forgive me right? Because you're as kind as a fairy.

[Professor]\nWhat a shame. Right after you were nominated for the Royal Academy, a school of fish fell from the sky and crush your skull. Was this a water drawing fairy gone rogue? Whatever the reason, may you rest in peace.
[Bandit Leader]\nHand over them valuables, folks! And don't go glarin' at me. Blame your lousy bodyguards! We're the Glacial Lance, and we leave nothin' but a trail of dust in our wake!
[Bandit Leader]\nDamn, I messed up and got busted. Guess I gotta spill the beans, then. Just spare my life, okay? We ain't done nothin' wrong, I swear.
[Bandit Leader]\nThe regime put the Glacial Lance together to stir up trouble, givin' 'em an enemy to fight and win over the people. We ain't really bad, you see.
[Jailer]\nWhere's that guy that was on lockdown? Huh? You wiped him from the logs, and I'm never to mention the Glacial Lance again? Hmm... I guess he got on the bad side of the wrong people.

You worshipped me as a god and yet... Curse you humans! You're mad to used me to kill another god! Never! This is unforgivable!\nMy final breath was a roar of resentment and malice, mixed with the poison that consumed me and divine flames.

She was an offering—no, an assassin to the dragon she worshipped as a god. We never exchanged many words, but I liked her, even when I learned she was being poisoned. Then she was devoured by the dragon.

The poisoned dragon ascended into the heavens with a raging voice and drenched the land with poisonous flames as its final punishment. I was the only one who survived. Only because I had taken the same poison she was fed. I don't need healing. I want to preserve this connection I have to her...

Many years later, I returned to the village still engulfed in the poisonous blaze. With a bow carved from the remains of the dragon, I fired an arrow with a bottle strapped to it. When the bottle broke, the liquid inside dissipated into a mist, smothering the flames. However, the remaining flames consumed the village and the dragon's carcass once again. But with this, my connection to her became unrivaled.

The compassionate priestess of a church often spoke in a gentle voice that touched the hearts of the villagers. The people would bow their heads and pray in the direction of the church when they heard her. Black smoke rose from the chimney of the church, where the priest was singing a funeral hymn for the deceased.

One day, a traveler visited the church and greeted the priest, asking if he too was doing penance to God. The priest responded and the traveler shook his head gloomily. He then asked the priest if he would be so kind as to listen to his problems, saying, "Wherever I go, I see terrifying ghosts!"

The traveler had been haunted by ghostly apparitions for years, and no matter where he went, they seemed to follow. He felt troubled and at a loss, and wished he could find a way to escape the phantoms that plagued him. Seeing his distress, the priest smiled kindly and said, "Perhaps I can offer you a song that will help bring you peace."

The priest's gentle voice brought comfort to the weary traveler. As a breeze wafted through the church, one of the travelers suddenly disappeared, leaving no trace behind. "Ghosts can be elusive," the priest murmured sadly into the empty space. "I would love to speak with them more, but whenever they start to sing, they vanish into thin air."
The tiger showed me a dream of a world of only children. Although it was destined to perish, it was still animated and vibrant.
Since the world excluded adults, a line had to be drawn between children and what was to be considered an adult. However, no one could agree on this issue, and so it remains in debate.
Is a child someone who can't think for themself? Are you a child as long as you don't go through puberty?
This discussion would go on for years between the world's elders as if they were afraid to come to an inevitable conclusion.

"We've got you now! Hand over the book! You're in violation of the "L" prohibition!"\nGulping hard I braced myself for capture as I heard the inspectors closing in from around the corner. They were after "Still Waters," a book related to "L" content that was to be disposed of by the administration. But there's no way I'll let them have it!

Just as I was about to make my escape, I was blocked by a man and woman. "So, you're the one with Still Waters. Relax, we've come to help."\nCalmly I inquired their identities. "I'm a patriot who escaped underground to hide from those inspectors who forbid "L" content. Come, I'll show you to our hideout."

The pair led me to the underground hideout—a safehouse for all who cherish "L" romance novels and films.\n"Now," the man began, "let me read that legendary novel—Still Waters." I chuckled and reached into my pocket.

Some seconds later, I gazed down at the crowd of silent corpses—shot down by their own pistols. I sighed. Romance is man's greatest weakness. We are imperfect because of it. However, thanks to the management program, it's become much easier to find a lifelong partner. The world doesn't need "L." That is why us undercover inspectors exist—to eradicate it from society.

[Heaven's Angel]\nChild of man, blessed are you for saving me when I had fallen. By the way, you have so many interesting animals in your home. Sprinkle just a few drops of this perfume on them...and you'll gain the ability to read their minds.

[Dog]\nAhahahaha! I love humans! They're so much fun! They take me for walks, pick my fleas, give me lots of food, and is my best friend! Thanks! A dog has to pretend they love their owner if they want to survive and live the good life!

[Cat]\nKeheh... Humans are useful to have around. If you ignore them long enough, they'll give you milk or fish. My owner thinks they have me wrapped around their finger, but it's me who controls them. How stupid they can't see it for what it is.

[Neighbor]\nWhat? The neighbor's animals are all gone, you say? I don't really know the details, but I heard he gave them away for medical research. It's sad really. He used to be such a gentle man with a love for animals, but now he's changed. He looks so grim all the time. What could have happened?
What is the lion trying to tell me by showing me this dream? A world without men would be better off destroyed ASAP.
Humans are odd creatures. If there's no men, it's women who fill in their role. But deep inside they're still women at heart, aren't they?
Maybe I'm focusing too much on appearance and gender. But you know, I really did think I could get along with this person, if only a little bit.
Just as I had made up my mind, the lion brought me back to reality. I suppose in due time, I'll know if this ending was for the best or not.

The world's been tainted by corrupt mana from the ancient weapons that world powers unleashed upon each other. But check this out, mister. Blow on this Forest-Breathing Flute, and a pocket of fresh forest air will spring up around you.
I know, the world's already done for. But why not take this flute so you can cross a few more things off your bucket list? It'll keep you away from death's door a little longer, at least.

Boy, you lost a lot of weight since I last saw you, mister. Your skin's all pale, and you only have a few wisps of hair left. I guess the same goes for me, though. Go on, blow the flute one last time and get a lungful of good air.

What? You figured out how to cleanse the corrupt mana? You were an arcane scientist for one of the big nations, and wanted to atone for the mess those ancient weapons made?! Hey, don't go dying on us! Tell me what you learned first! Come on, get your eyes back open!
[Confession No. 513913649109408]\nI don't get it... I did nothing wrong. I just replied when they struck up a conversation with me.
Maybe I should just go to the bathroom when it looks like they're gonna talk to me. But that'd make it obvious that I'm avoiding them.
Why do I have to bow out, anyway? I liked them first.

It looks like things didn't work out for those two. Good. He doesn't belong with a girl who picks on the weak when nobody's looking. I know it isn't nice to take pleasure in someone else's misfortune, though... I guess I don't deserve him, either.
[Confession No. 497429034890238]\nMom's always angry and Dad is always working.
I don't care about my little sister. Nobody understands me.
Though I was born into a wealthy family, we all wore masks that covered up the turmoil within.
A lot more people grow up in even worse circumstances. I am grateful to have my parents, but that feeling of being misunderstood during my adolescence will haunt me for the rest of my life.

There was once a King who loved sanguine beauty and treasured rubies above all, and came to be called the Ruby King. His people rebelled against his cruel tax regimen, defeating the knights and surrounding his palace. Trapped, he turned to forbidden magic to save himself.

Unable to find the King anywhere in his palace, the peasant army breathed a sigh of relief, thinking him fled. Just then, they noticed the single sword that lay fallen below the vacant throne. It drew the eye of one of the men, who exclaimed at its exquisite beauty!

In a moment the group of them all stood transfixed, eyes glittering with greedy desire as they surged forward to crowd around the sword.\n\n...They made quite a sordid spectacle, and the Ruby King, who'd transformed himself into the sword looked on it with haughty derision as he willed them to fight each other for the sword, to fight until all was washed clean in blood!

Then, a bellowing call cut through the group as the captain rallied her men.\n\n"Look at yourselves," she shouted, "Are we as foolish and weak as the hated King, to lose our heads over this ruby trinket?!" Hefting her warhammer, she brought it down on the jeweled blade, shattering it...

I'm a celebrated escape artist. Now, I'm sure the security in Hell is top notch stuff, but listen—there's no place on any plane of existence that I can't break myself out of. Hm? What the hell is this place? There's no warden! There's no guards...!

Hey hey hey, wait just a minute, how do they keep people from escaping, then? It's like they're just inviting people to run away! Huh? A winged lion...? I don't see anything like that...\n\nWell, whatever, I'm just gonna get out of here.

If I get through those gates, I'll be home free.

Except...now that I have gotten through them, there really is a winged lion. In an instant, I'm surrounded by flame, burning, burning, but never dying...

Hell's inmates cowered and trembled as the demons set up a great, echoing howl.

The warden looked on, smirking at the man's torment. He always enjoyed this moment the best. The instant of hopeless realization. Flexing his mind, he reached out to the tormented soul, stripping away the memories of his 'escape,' and settling in to watch the man's next, hopeless attempt.

Oh, King! Congratulations on the roaring success of the expedition to the Ice Kingdom! I am honored you've called on me to attend you after being wounded by arrows, as it seems your wounds were made by the Everfrost Crossbow.

Those shot by the Everfrost Crossbow will find their base body temperature gradually dropping, and their skin beginning to ice over. After a few months, they become naught but ice sculptures. It's a weapon that inflicts a terrifying curse, indeed!
But, oh, wise king! Please do be reassured! I'll boil you a tincture that has truly unprecedented healing properties. It's just...the ingredients are quite rare, so I am afraid it won't be cheap...

Well, I never! Our oh-so-wise king doesn't nearly live up to his reputation!\n\nGH...! Wh-What...?! Where did that bolt come from? Wh-...Why is it so cold... Why does the ice creep across my skin...?!
My wedding date is past, and now a new life is growing! Hehe... I wonder if it's going to be a boy or a girl!

People though, I never did have much use for other people. I've wed myself to dark magic itself! But...it really was worth it—all the passion I spent, it let me get my hands on the mysteries of transformation magic.
I can make myself into a lot of different animals but the peacock is my favorite! I've never exactly been the type to draw eyes when I go out, so being so striking is a refreshing change.

And when I spread my lovely tail, well, I was pretty popular with the peahens, let me just say. That's right. They all wanted a piece of my peacock spear, if ya know what I mean! I'm just fascinated to see what those eggs will be when they hatch!

The Good Husband:\nThe child we were blessed with was spirited away mere moments after being born, cradle and all. At the time it was a terrible shock, and my wife and I lived each day in tearful sorrow.

The Good Husband:\nHowever, now I think of things differently. No matter how much we sorrow and suffer, our child won't return. And, surely, being carried off by fae is not so terrible a fate. Surely our child will live their life in freedom.

The Good Husband:\nThen, one afternoon, I began to build a bower in secret, without telling my wife. I found a hidden spot and dug the foundations, and...huh? I...discovered a cradle buried there. What...what does...does this mean...?

The Evil Wife:\nWhew, that was close. I'm glad I managed to get rid of the brat before my husband suspected anything. He'd've definitely figured out the kid wasn't his, eventually. I probably shouldn't wait too much longer to start my new life as a widow, either. At least he's probably still got his guard down...
Duchess:\nThat countess, brimming with wit and beauty...oh, how I hate her so! With her father, the shrewd earl away for the moment, now's my chance to saddle her with the scandal of the century!
Duchess:\nTch! I tried to embarrass her in conversation on literature, but she easily deflected my statements...\nSurely she's inherited that sharp mind from the earl. Oh! I truly do hate her!
