Duchess:\nI've finally found her weak point! She nearly died as a child after being attacked by a dog, so I'll simply make sure to bring a dog to our next tea party! She's sure to embarrass herself terribly in her panic!

The Earl's Unyielding Heart:\nI ensured that the dog the young duchess had secured for this plot would be keen to the scent of her own perfume. Should she go forward with her plan, she is likely to suffer a most unfortunate attack during the tea party. It was the earl's will, that in his absences his butler should watch over the household, and see that no harm came to his daughter.

On such a perfect moonlit night, it is lovely to see the moon reflected in still water.\n\nHurrying home would put the most awful damper on such a wonderful night. Why don't we take our time on the walk back, and take in all the beauty of nature?

I let out a cry like a broken bell when I see her...\n\nLit up by the moonlight, a singer beautiful enough to make my heart do somersaults, standing in the reeds near the shore and practicing her singing with a devilish smile.

My heart is racing, running ahead of me, and I stifle a gasp...\n\nThere's a man and a woman concealed in the tall reads, and nearby the conductor of a popular orchestra lies prone, her breathing ragged.

On such a perfect moonlit night, it is lovely to see the moon reflected in still water.\n\nBut the moon, she's not nearly as lovely up close as humans tend to believe. I think about that for a long time, as I make my way home.

Once a parent and child found a bottle while combing the beach. The father opened it, only to find it was empty. Bored and disappointed, he made to cast it aside, but his child bade him stop, exclaiming that waves were trapped within.

When the child listened to the opening of the bottle, they heard the shushing sound of the waves. They loved the bottle very much, and believed it remembered the sounds of the ocean waves. The father chuckled indulgently.

Every day the child carried the bottle down to the sea, to let it remember more of the ocean. Today however, they found terrible weather upon arriving at the shore. The waves were high, and the small child was overwhelmed by their ferocity. Eyes shut, they raised the bottle to an ear and called back the usual, calm sea. When they opened their eyes, so it was.

Or, so it was for the child. Everywhere else the rain came down in driving, diagonal sheets, and the waves rose to towering heights, and the wind roared fiercely. The nearby town was devastated by the hurricane, but all around the child the sea was calm and still, for the calm sea loved the child as much as the child loved it in return.
The detective's assistant...? Isn't there a better role for me?
For example, Dorothy would be better suited for this.
If it were her, she'd be able to give a brilliant performance with all that her mind comes up with.
But I guess I'm asking for too much. I'll just enjoy this moment in my own way.
A mystery film without a detective is nothing more than stargazey pie that lacks sardines. It's very existence is a tragedy.
I can understand the killer's motive, but did they really need to take the lives of others? Or perhaps that's the mystery of it. It's sad.
And what was the purpose of dressing the one character in black? And the voice changer? Did we ever find out what the murder weapon was? There's just too many plot holes in this story.
But the saddest part of all was when the corpse of "that person" suddenly appeared, especially when they played no important role in the story...
Look at my outfit, Brother. Don't I look good in pants? I like it.
I never cared for these pipe thingies, but I could give it a try. It'll be awhile before they need me on camera again.
Actually, never mind. I don't like smoke. How much longer is this shoot going to last anyway?
They don't even know what they're doing. It's taking away time I could be spending with you, Brother. Maybe I should be the one to put an end to it all.
I see. Since you inquire what I am, I am obliged to answer. I am what you call a shaman. Indeed—to submerge the raging seas.
I do not hold earthly or spiritual beliefs. If you ask why, it's simply that I have no need for such things.
I do not ask for much. Just bow your heads as I wave my staff, in deep concentration of the great sea.
Blood splatters with each flick of the staff, raging into an ever increasing bloodbath. But not to worry, it will subside once they're all dead!
[Rookie Reaper]\nAfter several years of apprenticeship, I'm finally recognized as a full-fledged reaper! With this scythe, given from my teacher, I'll hunt down every last soul there is!♪
[Rookie Reaper]\nIt might sound tough, but being a reaper is pretty easy work. That's because this scythe here tells you exactly the time and place to hunt for souls!

[Rookie Reaper]\nMy teacher liked to call me a clutz for obvious reasons, but despite that I still graduated! So all those apprentices out there, don't lose hope! Give it your all and you can be a reaper, too!

[Reaper Teacher]\nMy apprentices, please take what he said with a grain of salt. That student is such a clutz, I had not choice but to give him a custom-made scythe. It's that scythe that does the reaping, anyone can use it!
The world the sake showed her was a kingdom of the just and the good, where everyone went about with a smile on their faces, and each day was lively and full of cheer.

Until one night, they discovered an old woman muttering of grudges and grievance, hidden away in the gloom of a twisting alley. It seems that at least some of the people of this world were hiding resentment behind their smiles.

Although everyone in the country acted happy, played the the part of the good neighbor, yet they possessed a darker side, all the small human evils they shoved into the black recesses of their hearts.

Sympathy. Good intentions. Well meaning advice.\n\nEven when offered with the most sincere kindness, these things are known to be the root of untold suffering. She learned that the darkness in the heart of humanity flourishes so easily, nourished by even the best possible of environments.

[Rookie Knight]\nYou must be the renowned heroic knight! It is an honor to meet you, sir! I am but a knight in training, returning to the country on vacation. I'm shocked to find you living out in these parts!

[Rookie Knight]\nOh heroic knight, I've come to be of service! Shall I cook a meal or perhaps chop some wood for you? You want me to leave? What ever do you mean you dislike people? Please don't say such things!
[Rookie Knight]\nHeroic knight, I've returned! What ever do you mean I'm agitating you? Seeing my presence again angers you? I see, I've crossed a line again. Then I shall do as you wish.

[Knight Captain]\nI never would have thought our heroic knight would imprison our rookie and then turn his sword against us. Ever since his wife passed away, he's outcasted himself. Perhaps that boy got too close to his heart and adhered to it.

[Ex Holy Knight]\nWe were stranded in enemy territory with no means to fight back, so we called for a cease-fire against the demon army. They agreed on one condition: we must serve them fresh brains from a living sacrifice each day.

[Ex Holy Knight]\nI was the first to offer up my life, but my troop shielded me and held me back. I watched on helplessly as future victims scooped out the cerebrum of the sacrifice for the next day's offering.

[Ex Holy Knight]\nI finally snapped on the night I saw the last of my troop offer up their brain. With fury firing my strength and determination, I broke through the enemy forces and returned home. Although my sword drank buckets of their blood, it would never be enough to bring back my comrades...

[King's Aid]\nBy that account, the old man would had to have cut out the last brain himself. The coward clearly sold his comrades to the enemy to escape with his life! The kingdom's Holy Sword—our pride and joy—is now a relic covered in moss...

A poor girl got hit by a carriage, smacked her head, and had been stuck in a coma ever since. One admirer went to great lengths to wake her from her slumber. When a doctor told him she might awake through the joy of listening to her favorite music, he set out to see her estranged brother.

The brother was pained to hear of his sister's fate. He brought out a flute and began to play it for the young man. "I used to play this song to her when we were little," he said. "Please take it."\nFeeling optimistic, the young man took the flute. But on the way back he was beset by thieves and dropped the flute while making his escape.

The young man returned empty-handed, just as war broke out in the country and the knights called for people to evacuate. He could not find another infirmary to take in the girl, and it would be impossible to escape with an unconscious body in his arms.

But the young man would not be defeated. Crafting a flute from a small branch, he played the song her brother had taught him as best as he could remember. Still she slept. He played the song again. And again. And again and again.\n"...Quit that racket. How am I supposed to get any sleep?"\nThe man jumped at the sound of her voice. His resolute dedication had roused her from her coma.

[Confession No. 5834212097498]\nMy mother was a tough woman. She raised me on her own, in a society where women already had it worse off than men, but through education she widely gained the public's trust.
But even a good mother such as her can't prevent aging. At first, she was forgetful, but over time she began to have difficulties eating and doing daily tasks.
Then last month, her health deteriorated so much that she couldn't even recognize me. For no reason she'd start yelling at me and wandering out in the middle of the night.

Then something out of the blue happened. My mother, looking unusually happy, patted me on the head while looking up at the moon. "I'm sorry for all the trouble I've caused. I think I'm ready now." Hearing those words, I wrapped my hands around her throat, and...

The queen of a kingdom suffered from anxiety, and worried whether the king really loved her. One day, a witch said to the queen, "I'll change how you look to test the king's love." That day, the queen went missing.

The queen, now in a magical disguise, claimed to be the witch's daughter. The witch convinced the king to marry this daughter, though he was still left distraught by the queen's disappearance. The pair had six sons, but the children were not welcomed by the newly wed queen, who turned them into swans.

The seventh-born daughter lamented her six brothers' predicament. The witch said to her, "There's a way to get your brothers back." The daughter resolved to perform the spell as the witch instructed, but the queen found out and had her marked for execution.

Just before she was burned at the stake, six swans flew in and interrupted the execution. The daughter and her brothers then transformed into a gun, with which the king promptly shot the queen. The witch laughed merrily and said, "The queen has finally been slain by my sweet girl."
That jailer thinks he's gonna behead me for my crimes, but I'd like to see him try. I learned a few tricks from a channeler a ways back. He'll never lay a finger on me!
What's the point of this jail, anyway? I can just slip into my meditation, shift over to the astral plane, and... Hahah! See? I'm out, simple as that!
Before I slip away, time to deface the walls of the knights' post! Huh? Why can't I pick up this brush? Oh no... Did I leave my body behind, and just shift my spirit to the astral plane?!
I checked the book of executions, and there was my name, among the other prisoners executed early morning. I better sew my head back on quick!\n...Shit, now my head's on the wrong way!
Everyone seems so carefree, but the reality is, things could go south real quick and destroy these lives we've built. The anxiety eats me up every night.

Out in the fields, we work until our hands are covered in blisters and our necks are stinging from sunburn. We have no doubt in our strength, but it amazes me that this was the norm for people in the past.
Our shack needs to be repaired before the rainfall causes a leak. And traps need to be set to stop vermin from gorging on our crops. It's not all farming that's required of us.
But I shouldn't complain. Compared to those who originally cultivated this land, we're blessed. But where did they find these farming tools? Did they trade with other islands?
I had forgotten how good it felt to take a bath after a tiring day covered in mud.
It's strange. Before arriving here, I spent countless sleepless nights worrying over all sorts of things, but now I sleep like a baby.
I have dinner with everyone, bathe, sleep, wake up... Farm work is hard, but maybe the simple life is better suited for me.

It's not all easy, though. For example, you can't do anything at night due to how dark it gets. Then Sleeping Beauty wakes me up whenever she tosses and turns in bed. And of course the toilet... But what I did learn is that happiness can't be assessed based on convenience.
I had a feeling that these thorns were nimbler than they looked.
Moving around is tiring, but if I can get the thorns to do all the work for me, I won't have to expend any energy.
Did I just invent something? I'm just like Dorothy!
It's not quite ready yet, but eventually I hope these thorns will finish everything for me.
I pray for bountiful harvests and see that the business of those who wield me prospers. Be silent and listen to my guidance.
I had my wielder divorce his useless, squandering wife, but he remained hopelessly in love with her, and cast me aside out of spite. No matter. He shall have his bountiful harvest.

My next owner abandoned me as well. When I revealed the whereabouts of hidden treasure in a nearby cave, they dashed out to retrieve it. But lo and behold they came back infuriated. All because they hated cobwebs and spiders.

After that, I was taken in by a new owner, who thrust me into the earth and dressed me up as a scarecrow! Well, I suppose I'll pray for a bountiful harvest here for now. It's only a matter of time before I move on somewhere else.

The world became desolate. Flowers withered and plants died before they could bear fruit. In the face of this devastation, one man walked the land planting seeds. These were no ordinary seeds, and because he had no water at hand, he sprinkled them with his own blood.

A woman spoke of a time when the land was covered in green. His first gift to her was a bouquet of flowers he'd made from paper. But the gift was short-lived, as later that day, rain turned it into a soggy mess. Heartbroken, he vowed the next one would be stronger.

That same day, the rain transformed into a terrible storm. However, having made his promise, he would not return to the woman until he kept it. The rain poured and poured, and streaks of lightning danced across sky. He looked up, smiling.

The seeds sprouted, growing into a field of iron blossoms that would be unscathed by rain. The man kept his promise. Lightning struck the earth and in an instant the man vanished. After that, nothing but his iron blossoms would bloom across the world.
Bread is much too expensive to buy. Heck, it's nearly impossible to even get your hands on it!
All I have is oatmeal and flavorless soup. I wonder if those with a more primitive lifestyle eat better than me.
I don't have a bed either. Usually I sleep on straw with a bunch of animals. So when I shared a bed with Sleeping Beauty for the first time, I was surprised how much it didn't hurt!
Where I come from, the whole town is dirty and it wasn't uncommon to get mice or bug bites during the night. Compared to that, living here is like a dream come true!

These are the findings of an archaeologist. A set of old rust-covered crossbows were found at an excavation site believed to have been a paradise created by heavenly beings long ago. The people who lived on the land prayed to the heavens for peace and fertility.

Because it was customary to shoot arrows into the sky as a display of gratitude, ceremonial arrows were produced. Some even believed they could bring wealth. However, production of these arrows halted during a historic war that stained the earth red.

During the war, the sky turned black, and a great number of arrows rained down from the heavens. It is said that the wrath of God caused mankind's extinction. The arrows of gratitude were bathed in so much blood that by the time they were excavated, they had turned to rust.

Excavation of the site also resulted in many sacrifices. The natives were driven from their land, their houses were destroyed, and the ground torn apart. One native swore revenge, and shot arrows into the sky for years. When the archaeologist looked up, the sky had turned black—an omen of mankind's second extinction.
Son, I'm worried. If you keep playing around instead of focusing on your studies, the Jawmolishers will come and get you.
What's all the sobbing about, son? You were playing outside when masked Jawmolishers surrounded you and said you were dead meat? Hahaha. I told you, didn't I?
Thanks for getting my kid back on track, Jawmolishers. You sure know how to keep the youth out of trouble. What's this? A bill? I can't pay this... Can't you give me a discount?
Hey, brat! We're the Jawmolishers! You better run back home to your books and-Huh? I sound like the man from the tobacco shop? Y-Yeah right! Just get the hell outta here!

In a certain country, in a certain castle, there was a certain tome engulfed in roaring flame. No one knew who had written it, or even what precisely was written in it, if anything. How could they? No one could touch the damn thing.

The people of the country loved to tell tales about it. Some said it recorded a method of obtaining eternal life. One say that if you read it, you'll come into possession of a great treasure. The tales grow grander with each telling, spreading as if scattered by the wind, until they drift all the way to the king in his castle.

One day, the king issues a proclamation, offering to grant the book to whoever is able to touch it without harm. The citizens crowd into the castle, looking to try their luck, scrambling to be the first to lay hands on the book. They didn't stop, even as the flames threatened to scorch away their hands. The king's expression twisted in disdain as he saw his people made so ugly by their own overriding greed.

An awful odor began to pervade the castle and the king had the book dumped into the baths, eager to be rid of the whole thing.

Sadly, one mustn't try to put out an oil fire with water.

The fire spread, until the castle, nay, the country itself was nothing but an endless plain of fire. It seems that there had no longer been anyone left who recalled the tome's true purpose: a vessel to contain the country's calamitous wildfires.

He had great courage, a true master of his craft, even when forced to use his magic, and was feared as a Demon Knight by others. Why exactly did they fear him? Because, of course, of the gun he wore at his hip.\n\nIt was said that anyone struck with one of the magic-infused bullets fired by this gun would have their soul destroyed, and live on as a crippled, empty husk.

Now, the Demon Knight had a lifelong nemesis, a Holy Knight, with whom he clashed often. She had for herself blessed weapons and armor to make herself strong against him, and rode forth to settle things with the Demon Knight once and for all. Their swords clashed together, whirling in a fierce and unending dance of blades. It was a grueling battle, but as it progressed the Holy Knight's superior training began to win out.

The Demon Knight sensed his disadvantage and leapt back, withdrawing from the melee even as his hand sought the gun at his belt.\n"What do you think that will get you?" the Holy Knight shouted after him, laughter in her voice. She knew the Demon knight's magic was hardly that strong, and trusted in the blessed metal of her armor to protect her.

The smile on the Demon Knight's face grew savage as he pulled the trigger, and the Holy Knight's own smile faltered, as she began to doubt if perhaps the man had been concealing his power, such confidence he showed. He practically shouted with laughter, and the Holy Knight broke an fled.\n\nHis laughter quieted, until it was a smug, private thing as he patted his gun. It was a spectacular weapon, which beset its victims with illusions conjured from their own fears, and it had never failed him yet.
Once a tiny circus troupe suffered a tragedy. The prop sword used by one of the acrobats was switched out with a real one, and the acrobat was mortally wounded during juggling practice.

"How could an accident like this could happen..." \nthe young man who is the Circus' beast tamer shakes his head mournfully at the officer questioning him.\nIn the end, the officers conclude it was simply mismanaged props, a tragic accident, as they solemnly look out over the crowd for the evening service.

"Behold, the amazing white tiger!" The tiger in question leaps from the stage, rampaging, and although the young beast tamer is able to stop it, his trusty performance partner of so many years maims and mangles one of his hands.

"I see... someone coated it with a drug to agitate him..." \nThe  young man stands in the middle of the pandemonium, examining the whip used in his act, before succumbing to blood loss.\nIt seems that the beast tamer and acrobat, grown estranged from one another, had each tampered with the other's prop, and in ensuring the death of their target, ensured the death of the circus troupe itself.

The Phantomhive butler rose early, busying himself with preparations for the day. It's nearly time to wake the master of the house...Ciel. Having prepared Ciel's morning tea, Sebastian walks down the hallway. His heart swells with memories of the young Earl.

Presented with a strawberry tart just a bit different than the one served the night before, Sebastian had said to Ciel: "Do you really hate losing that much?" He'd huffed an exasperated laugh, to which Ciel returned: "Between the two of us, I believe that criticism is more apt in your case."

Sebastian set up the garden to host the afternoon tea. Ribbons, lace, and flower arrangements... he wanted to create a special atmosphere for today. A certain young Lady had been invited to grace the manor with her smile, after all.

Elizabeth sat delightedly stuffing herself with sweets, while a long-suffering Ciel looked on. "Satisfied now?" he asked. Sebastian stood quietly by his side, carefully refilling both of their teacups. His lips revealed the barest hint of a smile.

It seems there are strange puppets with wills of their own in England, these days. Undertaker was quite interested in these rumors, for his research on the soul. The issue called for some hands-on investigation.\n\nHis inquiries turned up an interesting tidbit: the puppets' owner had invited Ciel Phantomhive over for tea.

He was curious, how would the Earl react, once he'd met the Baron and his two butlers? And to Undertaker, with his connection to the Phantomhive household, the only thing he could do for now was watch.

That night. Sebastian had managed to call Ciel back after the baron had turned his master into another puppet. Undertaker watched from the shadows, relieved that Ciel was unharmed, but the strange puppets he'd heard so much of saw how easily the plot had crumbled and merely laughed in their unseemly voices.

Dawn came, as if to wrap up the entire incident. With the Baron's defeat, the puppets had also made themselves scarce. Perhaps that only meant they'd gotten what they wanted.\n\n For his part, Undertaker turned home with a satisfied smile happy to have seen such intriguing things that night.

Her rapiers glint in the morning light as she stands in the gardens of the Midford Estate. She'd been seen, the day before in the baron's manor. By far too many eyes. True, she'd been so glad to see Ciel again after too long apart, but...

The smooth chiffon of her skirts billows out over her panniers. She has any number of cute ensembles tucked away in her closets, and has just settled on one for the day after long deliberation, when... She receives a missive from the Phantomhive manor.

"Ciel's invited me to afternoon tea!" Elizabeth set out for the Phantomhive estate at once, delighted to see the garden had been adorned with cute decorations. She found herself automatically stepping a bit lightly, in this specially prepared space.

The moment he bit into Sebastian's homemade tart, his lips curved in a smile that made her own lips follow suit. When their eyes met, it was if nothing at all had happened the day before. Ciel's expression was just as it usually was, but somehow... \n\nThat day, the two of them enjoyed a peaceful happy afternoon together.

As a member of the Grim Reaper Staffing Association, Grell was always put upon, expected to do many tiresome tasks day in and day out. Today, however, she stepped lightly, buoyed by the sense that a demon awaited at the site of her latest dispatch. Quite a demon, at that.

When she arrived at the manor, all of the butlers, including Sebastian, were engaged in a confection contest of some sort. More surprisingly, the other two butlers (she'd never even seen them before) seemed like they might actually be a match for Sebastian's skill. Were they even human?

Ciel and his party ate their fill of the completed sweets. In the general bustle of the moment, Grell caught Sebastian slipping a key from the Baron's breast pocket. She felt a thrill course through her body at Sebastian's nimble fingers and the sharpness of his personality.

That night, Sebastian set out alone to investigate the mansion.

"Now's our chance for a little alone time!" 

Just as Grell was about to leap towards him, Undertaker and Hamelin called out to her, entirely ruining the mood and throwing a damper on her plans. Reluctantly, she joined them, watching to see where Sebastian would go next.

The diminutive master of the Phantomhive estate casually reaches for his gun as memories of the previous night surface. After that night, not a single bullet remains in the gun.

"...Young master, a moment?"

He looks up at the sound of a light rap on the door.

As the door opens, a delicate aroma wafts into the room. It seems his butler has prepared a freshly baked cake, even at this early hour. 

"Would you like to take afternoon tea with Lady Elizabeth?"

As he said it, Ciel noticed it wasn't cake at all.

Elegantly displayed in the center of the plate, was a slice of strawberry tart. He recalled the butlers in the Baron's manor, and their nearly superhuman skill. He set the gun down on the top of the desk, the sound sharp. In place of the weapon, he reached to pick up the fork.

His fiance arrived, her invitation to tea clutched in one hand, eyes lighting up like sunlight the moment she saw him. Between pleasant conversation with Lizzie, and the delicious cake prepared by Sebastian, the afternoon flew by in a pleasant blur. The peaceful interlude couldn't help coax a smile from his lips.

Snow White infiltrated the estate with Aladdin, looking for the strange puppets from the rumors. The Baron didn't mind paying for skilled help, and they'd been able to get into the mansion with no problems. And really, what is a butler, anyway? She frets, feeling as if she ought to have prepared better.

She walks the vast interior of the mansion's halls, keeping up the pretense of her work as a butler, even as she gathers information on the puppets. For some reason, her wanderings seem to have lead her to the drawing room. It's coated with dust, so she decides to start with cleaning.

A few hours later... The room is sparkling and clean, surprising even the Baron. As he thanks her for her hard work, she tells him it's merely her duty as a butler... and feels a small burst of sympathy, her own belief resonating with the act of a butler offering their services freely to their master.

A few days later. The Baron sits in his study, composing a letter. Having heard a certain talented young Earl is back in the country, he's eager to extend and invitation. (Snow is less than pleased. This will get in the way of the investigation)\n\nShe tenses, minutely, mind turning over this unexpected development.

Man:\nOh, is that a little bat, lurking there? Wait...! I'm not going to hurt you. I've just gotten caught in an evening shower while I was out hunting, that's all. I'll leave your cave before too long, but why don't we chat while I wait out the rain?

Man:\nI was a terror to that household, you know? I extorted the husband and coerced the wife, and drove their child to suicide. I destroyed them, and I lived in rich comfort off of the profit from it.

Man:\nWell, rich and comfortable it might have been, but that unhealthy lifestyle came back to bite me. My liver's basically toast. I'll keel over dead if I have so much as one drink. Buuut I guess I can't complain, since I get to eat whatever delicacies I like and spend everyday in the company of beautiful women.\nWell, looks like the rain's letting up. I should get going.
Great Mage:\nWell, my son, did your transformation practice go well? Hm? You want me to teach you a spell for turning water into wine? Er, sure. I don't get it, but I can teach you that if you want!

Once, a young mage inherited a stave from his late grandfather. It was a fussy little thing.

...It's not good to overdo it, to lose yourself in the study of magic.
...You should eat something more nutritious.

The stave's constant murmuring weighed on the boy's mind.

...Go to sleep. It's way past your bedtime.
...You've gotten the formula wrong, you need to read up on potions.

One day, the boy could no longer stand the stave's constant murmuring, and threw it against the wall as hard as he could. Although it was made of metal, it shattered into dust.

It was quiet, at long last. The boy returned to his studies, but became too absorbed in his work, collapsing from exhaustion. In his delirium, he dreamed he saw his late grandfather. The old man had always scolded him...\n\nThe stave had been his last gift, the final loving act of a grandfather worried for his sickly, anemic grandson.

The fortunate boy was saved by a lucky visit from his friends, and threw himself into his studies anew afterwards, hoping to find a way to repair the stave. This time, however, he made sure to do so in a way that wouldn't get him scolded, when he reunited with the stave, the one promise he'd made his grandfather.

To throw yourself into battle, washing away blood with blood, fighting until only one person remains. It's a true battle 'Royal,' as twelve people fight for the right to the monarchy. Take your sword in hand and fight bravely!

I swung my sword in a wide arc, aiming it down at my opponent's skull and scattering their blood across the ground. One more down. There are still plenty of foes standing between me and the throne, however, so my fight continues.

I get behind them and drive my blade through their torso. Blood pours out of the wound as the final enemy falls and the cheering of the crowd surrounds the victor. Surrounds me. A voice rings out, telling me to take my crown.

The boy shot upright, drooling as he moaned, "Moooom, I'm hungry!"\n\nHe has twelve discreet personalities, and each day when he wakes, a different one is predominant. No one knows of the battle that rages within his mind.
I'm just a plain, simple tailor, but I have a secret.\nMy shop is home to pixies called brownies, and they help me with my work.
Brownies are excellent with a needle, and hard workers. While I sleep, they do work for me. They've allowed me to get ahead in my finances, and I'm very grateful indeed.
Then one day, the brownies told me that hats were going to be huge next year, and that we should make two, no...three times as many hats, to get ready.

The year afterwards, and evil wizard's experiments filled the air with noxious magical fumes inimical to hair. Hats were indeed the next big thing. We made a killing, and I was grateful to the brownies. I was, really. But...seriously guys? Couldn't you have warned me so I could save my hair?

Destruction, Inc. Craftsperson:\nI infiltrated a society of mages. Let us rob them of the magical artifacts they hoard, and use them to fuel the destruction of the world!\nWh-Who are you?! Damn, we've been rumbled!

Destruction, Inc. Craftsperson:\nAugh, how is this happening? Blowing up the lookouts was a good idea but the explosion wasn't supposed to wreck the magical artifact warehouse!\n...The flames are pretty, though. It's like a rainbow!

Destruction, Inc. Craftsperson:\nSeveral executives of the mages' organization appeared, lit from behind by the iridescent flames, shouting us down. I shouted right back but, in the middle of it all...it's the damndest thing, but all of us were laughing. Laughing for joy.

Reporter:\nThe Mage's Association was destroyed in a fire, and many casualties suffered from burns. In an odd turn of events, many of the burn victims were smiling. This may be connected to rumors that the Mage's Association was working on artifacts to bring happiness, and secreting them away in their warehouse.

"The hero drew too close to the gods and the heat scorched his wings, sending him plummeting to earth."\n\nThe youth shook his head at the quaint story of Icarus' legend. He made his own set of wings, out of the same beeswax that Icarus had used...but he couldn't use them to fly.

His mother scolded him. "You mustn't wish for freedom! Such greed won't go unpunished!"

Still, the boy yearned for the sky. His father grew frustrated, cuffing him harshly and locking him in his room.

Even so, the sky still captured his heart.

As civilization progressed, mankind invented their own ways to fly.\nHot air balloons, airplanes, parachutes and gliders...\nInnovation made people rich, and it was no longer regarded as hubris. Even so, that long ago myth inhibited people's dreams. The boy himself never gave up, even in the face of that lie.

That boy, who refused to cast aside his passion for the sky was persecuted and died in ignominy. After losing his son, her grieving parents crafted a bow from their bones. They wanted to make his dream come true. They took up the bow and aimed an arrow directly for the sun, firing. Though he lost all his power, the boy, at the last, did not fall from the sky.

Oh, Holy Seraph, please bestow your blessings on my son! Grant him a pure and uncorrupted heart, let him grow up quick and strong! I am but a poor illiterate farmer. Please let my son grow into a fine man!
Oh, Holy Seraph, my son would like to meet Santa! It's been so difficult convincing him to go to bed. Thank you for helping keep his heart so innocent as he grows!
Oh, Holy Seraph, my son got me the most wonderful cigarette case for a present. He saved up his allowances to get it for me! I truly don't deserve such a wonderful son!

Oh, Holy Seraph, now my son has grown and married, but they haven't been able to have children of their own. His wife believes they need only give it time, but it seems they have only been sleeping together platonically. Perhaps you've given him a heart that's a little bit TOO pure and uncorrupted, Oh Holy Seraph. It seems almost, artificially so.

Can you BELIEVE this?! Why, the absolute GALL of it!\nThere's this "Tome of the Gourmet" thing going around and it's supposed to be some kind of who's who of gourmets but MY name isn't in it. Unbelievable! Me! Who has pride of place as the best damn gourmet on the continent?!

I used every means at my disposal to find the man who edited the Tome of the Gourmet, and gave him a piece of my mind. And that guy, if you can believe it, he just stared at me! Acted like he'd never even heard of me before!

I told him that I knew everything there was to know about the delicacies of the continent! I told him to just try my cooking for himself. Then he'll have to add me to the Tome! He sighed and agreed, acting like he was doing me some kind of favor. Hmph! And that cheeky grin he gave me!

The editor whistled sharply, and several men appeared, restraining and blindfolding me.

"Now," I heard the Editor's voice, "Let's get to the meat of things. Try to guess the age and gender of the first person to get a taste of you..."

Finally grasping the true nature of the Tome of the Gourmet, I shivered in horror.
〇 Penalty Day\nMom told me, she said I have a real mother somewhere. But...she's somewhere else, out there all alone.
△ Penalty Day\nDad told me, he said that Mom was lying. He said Mom's my only mom, but I know the truth. I know that Mom isn't Dad's only wife.
◇ Penalty Day\nA butterfly told me, that's how I know that Dad is lying. My mother is waiting for me. So, I'm going to go find my mother.
× Penalty Day\nSuch a pretty, sparkly red butterfly. Flying around my house. It all burned down. Dad burned, and Mom burned, everything burned. I'm going with the butterfly, to find my mother.

Once, there was a serpent god.\nIt swallowed all the land, and its venom brought death to all. As the symbol of power and fear, it became revered above all other deities in a certain kingdom, a kingdom that went on to take over all the land.

As time passed, the kingdom flourished and its people grew arrogant, wavering in their faith. Invaders came from beyond its borders, and though their numbers were small they slaughtered many of the kingdom's people and forced its submission.

As more and more people moved to live within the kingdom's borders, it changed and flourished even more brightly than before. During this renaissance, the foreign born scholars came to know of the serpent god of old. Haughty, and believing in the superiority of their own pantheon, they researched the serpent god, the better to prove it the lesser divine.

In the beginning, the serpent god had been regarded as a god of healing, who had taken all the world's poison and sickness into itself. After they announced this discovery, the invaders began to fall, struck down one by one. As faith returned to the kingdom, so did the serpent god's power.\n\nIt was only natural the god should seek to eliminate the plague which had laid low its favored kingdom.
Last year was the first time I realized that the Fire-Venom Scorpion Gun's magazine was empty. I reported it to the supervisor, immediately, but was told to leave it be.

It's been little over a year since then, and honestly, it's been a pretty peaceful year.\nThe bullets which typically fill the magazine of the Fire-Venom Scorpion Gun represent the flames of the human world. For it to be empty means that there's been no conflict occurring.
According to the supervisor, we've had about a few centuries of conflict in the last few decades. They've created this period of nothing in order to maintain the balance.

To stop a war on the verge of breaking out, well, the way I figure, it means that all that hostility's still there, just simmering and spreading, right? And that's all happening because someone went and dropped the Fire-Venom Scorpion Gun into a cold, dark crevice somewhere. Someone, being me.
Defendant A:\nConcertmaster, I understand that concealing protoplasm is a serious offense. According to the laws of Harmonium, I ought to be sentenced to dissonance.
Defendant A:\nIn the beginning, there was a single harp, and the sound that spun from it, the notes it created, were the first Score. But who made the Harp? It must have been people, of course!

Defendant A:\nHumans have brought all to ruin with their conflict. Only we, who live on concepts alone were spared. Why should not we, the guardians of the arts, raise up this new humanity we have secretly bred?

Humanity's Final King:\nI sigh heavily, watching as the castle was consumed by flame. I wish the daydream I've just seen will come true in the near future. For a lover of the arts such as myself to have fed the kingdom's musical instruments to the flames...If the new world promised by the Protoplasmic Pyre doesn't come about, I...
We valient dragoons sit aside our beloved dragons and take to the skies. I hope that some day, we'll win great honors, come home hailed as heroes, and maybe even have our own merch.

The people on the ground look up at us and send out a great cheer. We wave back, all of us excited to go into battle. Every one of us thinks we'll defeat a notable foe, and woo one of our adoring fans.

In the midst of it all, one of our fellows collides with a mail bird, and plummets to the ground. It didn't strike him that hard, so he should have been able to avoid such certain death, but his every bone is shattered. He dies in agony.\n\nLet us meet again someday, friend.

As dawn breaks, I leap astride my dragon and take to the sky. Some of my fellows have fallen to their deaths. Who among us actually believes we'll become heroes? Have merch? Ridiculous. I don't know how many times I've taken flight, don't know how many times we've endlessly circled this sliver of space time turned back on itself, don't know how long we've been trapped in this torus.

Ever since I was little I've loved the sky. I've wanted to fly high just like the birds, and to look down on the earth. I'm not a bird, though. I'm a person, and I can't make my arms into wings. But...that's why I'm going to study hard, until I know how to make a balloon.

The balloon I've crafted floats upwards, lightly lofting itself into the sky. I look towards the horizon and the crimson dawn burning itself across the sky. I watch the placid river lazily winding its way to the sea. You could only see these things from the sky, this beautiful landscape unfolding beneath me.

But...although I've got this lovely view in front of me, there's no one next to me that I could share it with. I watch a flock of birds pass me by and glance down at the houses scattered over the land below, tiny as dots. In this moment I feel for the first time that I am human, and that I am alone.

As time passes, my fuel grows low, and the balloon begins to slowly deflate. I can finally go home, I think, as I sink towards the ground. There are people waiting for me there, on the ground. I'll be able to tell them of what I saw and what I thought, up here in the sky. How it made me finally come to love the earth, as well.
There are times when people are tempted by evil spirits, are there not? Well, this is what that was for me. I couldn't think of a new song, you know? It was driving me crazy! So I just...you know.
He was a musician, and never all that popular, but he had great musical sense. Honestly, he made the best songs. That's why I...I mean, I don't know what to say, I just kind of...stole them.

I was planning on spending some money on it, tricking him, you know? But he only assured me he didn't have any issues with money. Soooo...I tossed him into a bonfire and let him burn to death. A tragic accident, really.

What? Burn scars on my back? Weirdly shaped like a person? Quit messing with me! That can't be right. I've seen my own back in a mirror, you know, and there's nothing. But, well...that area does get chills all the time, and I've...I've been getting fevers a lot lately. Every few days actually.\n\nHey. You...you think I'll be fine right? There's nothing wrong...right?
A Flash of the Divine\n――　――　――\nThe Priestess' Glaive was quite sturdy, and of a fine and handsome make. And the Priestess herself was desired by all.

One day, she vanished. It was a strange happening, indeed. All the moreso, for she had told no one where she was going. The next day, another of the temple maids vanished. They were all the servants of god, of course, so people began to say the divine had simply called them back.

And again, the next day, yet another vanished. I began to feel uneasy for the first time. What was happening to the priestesses we all adored so? At length I understood. I realized that there was no god, truly.

Then, in a flash! ...I saw the Priestess swing her glaive, saw her brandish it, point it straight towards me.

No! I can feel my memories twist, my thoughts altered...

No longer remembering the Priestess, it seems to me that all is well. It is simply another normal day. The day after, another one goes missing.
Father:\nMy son's become a recluse, and driven his wife away. He's going to become like me, worthless, just posting up flyers every day. There's no joy in a life like that...

Father:\nWhile I was out posting flyers, I saw a house with a solid black envelope stuffed into its mailbox. I heard someone there died of a heart attack, a few days later. This happened more than once.

Father:\nThe next morning, I opened our own mailbox just like usual, to find a solid black envelope waiting for me. I readied myself for my trip to heaven, and set out to hand out my fliers with a spring in my step...

Son:\nMwahaha. Dad had a heart attack and now I've got my hands on all this life insurance money! Can you believe my luck? With money like this, I won't ever have to leave the house again! It'll be paradise...!
Once upon a time there lived the consul of a the world's oldest nation and a general from a nation grown rich from the trade across the middle sea.\n\nWe crossed swords in battle.

Once, there lived a valiant king who stood on the frontlines as he led his people to recapture the holy land, and a sage renowned for her wisdom and courage, who took to the battlefield as well.\n\nThey, too crossed swords in battle.

Once, there was a philosopher who saw the beauty in death, and a great novelist who believed life and death to be two sides of the same coin.\n\nThey crossed swords on the battlefield of their talents.

In time, planets were lost to ice, returning to nothingness, all of their souls cut free, and the two swords, having cut off that life, having fused themselves inseparably, spread endlessly to fill the cosmos...
Hey. Nice to meet you. I just stopped by to talk to you about your kid. They left this afternoon without saying where they were going, and I'm pretty sure you're both very worried, right?

Well, all's well that ends well, right? So, basically, you don't need to worry. They're in a Fairy Ring, getting the kind of education people normally just can't get. I mean, you remember a little while ago when their grades got so much better all of a sudden, right? That was a shock, wasn't it?

Well, your kid's got something special, that's all, and well, us special people, the loftier people, you know, well...we've got to stick together. So, if you'll just hand over your kid, we'll give you a replacement, just like 'em.

I see. Listen, it really seems like you didn't understand me... Oh, oh, now, don't worry, that's just my glamor working on you. You won't remember a thing about Fairy Rings or anything else of the sort! Just enjoy your peaceful life, with 'your' kid.
Each evening, the Castellan makes me serve him. I'm exhausted come morning, but if I even try to sleep, his club comes flying. Being a servant ain't easy.
The Castellan eats unbelievably huge meals. Well, he was an unbelievably large person, but still. I can't see how he fits it all.
There are a lot of Castellans in this town because there are a lot of castles. Each one of them has a Castellan, and a bunch of servants like me living in it.

Let's say the Castellans are women, and the servants are men.\nA spaceship came and changed them, making the Castellan's large and powerful, and shrinking down the servants. The servants can do nothing but live in fear of their Castellan's cudgel.

Confession No. 23892494278\nI think I'm stagnating. My technical skills aren't developing, and it's just one lazy day after another. I feel pressure to do something about it, but my inability to act just makes me more anxious.
I can't go on like this, but where do I start? I've wasted so much of my life, and time is running out. What's the most efficient way to practice? That's all I think about every day.

I'm really scared about my lack of future prospects. It's clear I'll eventually lose this job when I fall behind with technology. At least I had some good food today. But I get sleepy when my belly's full. I won't get any work done now, so I might as well take a nap. I'll get started tomorrow!

Another day passes. And another day passes. And another day passes. And another day passes. And another day passes. And another day passes. And another day passes. My life is an endless repetition of the same slothful day.

[Confession No. 95727047975]\nI was starving when I used up all my traveling expenses. There I was on foot when I bumped into a marvelous orchard. I knew it wasn't right, but I thought just one apple wouldn't hurt. So I pick the reddest one.

The rich sweetness from its juice caused my tastebuds to tingle. Never had I savored such a delicious apple in my life. I took two, three more bites—and lost myself in it. I even forgot where I was at the time.
It would be another ten or twenty apples before my stomach was full, and I was pulled back to my senses to realize the dire mistake I had made.

She must have been watching me for quite some time before she approached. The old lady, apparently the owner of the orchard, then said with wicked grin, "You can keep yer money. If you agree to work here the rest of ye life."
It makes me so sad, to have to wear something this revealing. At least, it did at first. I've gotten a little used to it since then.
To think I could ever come to get used to something like this...Isn't that even sadder, somehow?

I'm sure even the people who made outfits like this...those people must have made such cheerful clothes, music and dancing, must have loved those things, just so they could keep from being swallowed by their own sadness.
Light and darkness are two sides of the same coin.\nThe stronger the sorrow, the stronger the joy created in its wake.
Brother....help me.\nIt's so hard to walk in this...\nIf I fell down, I don't think I could stand up again...
Brother...I'm glad this outfit is warm, but...\nIt's really too hot, when I'm indoors, and I can't get out of it on my own.
Brother...I think I found one good thing about this outfit, at least.\nYou're right here, tucked under my arms, so even if I fall, you won't roll away.
Brother...this outfit really is inconvenient, but...\nIt's a lot fluffier and cuter than my other outfits, don't you think?

To kill a dragon is the most grave sin a human can commit. That is what the dragons taught humanity, after all. And so humanity lived obeying dragons, honoring them, worshipping them. To humanity dragons were as their mother, their father, or their gods. Even among such a populace however, there comes a turning point.

A single human killed a dragon, and consumed its flesh. The blood and flesh of a dragon was enough to release a thrall from the dragon's brainwashing, and once this had begun, the effect spread and rippled through humanity in no time at all. Humans had rediscovered their wrath. They slew their mother, their father, their gods. They ate their flesh. The first human to have slain a dragon was revered as a hero.

A man once found himself in trouble on a mountainside, dearly injured. An old dragon noticed his plight, but his wings were in tatters, and he had no way to go for help. The dragon gave of his own flesh, that the man may eat it, and before long his injuries were healed and the man restored to full health.

Many humans flocked to the dragonslaying hero to study swordsmanship. The hero, finding himself so sought out, felt he had no choice but to take up his sword. It was a sword with a very odd shape, but despite their confusion, the people copied him. However, with such a sword, and such techniques, one could never hope to slay a dragon.\n\nIn this way he began his solitary fight to return to a world without such hostility and wrath.

Auntie, it's me, your favorite niece!\nI'm a member of Sage Wand of Secrets, now, for Ladies seeking more intellectual pursuits. Auntie, you've withdrawn so much since Uncle died, so I came to keep you company!
Oh, Auntie, were you awake? Ah, sorry, I just thought I'd have some tea and snacks.\n...What? You mean the Cabinet Minister gave you these? I see! That must be why they're so delicious!
Auntie, you hadn't finished this puzzle, yet?\nWell, I'll let the dogs in to play with them while you finish up, then! Huh? Don't let the dogs in the house? Aww, don't be like that!

I can't believe my Auntie just died like that... they said her blood pressure kept steadily climbing....\nStill, at least she didn't die alone and sad! She was just like she always used to be!\nAlongside the Sage Wand of Secrets, I'd like to die in such a way.

"Gamers make everything light up. The darker people are, the more they seek light." Because of Parrah and Noya's big mouths, Dorothy went to work on a new outfit for me. I didn't want it from the start.

Standing out in the dark has its advantages. But it's also inconvenient. If I just wanted to quietly read a book in the woods, Red Riding Hood would see me and chase me around... And these clothes produce too much heat... I've had enough of this.

But after seeing Aladdin's, Pinocchio's, and Snow's outfits, I think I got lucky. ...Actually, everyone's outfits are worse than mine. They were weird and even less functional than anything I've ever seen in picture book of Wonderland.
"I've got something even better in mind for version 2! Just you wait!" When Dorothy forced this outfit on me, her eyes twinkled. I rather not think about what that could mean.
[Confession No. 4734561064542]\nThe market for fine arts is populated by replicas, and it is said that many of these replicas surpass the originals.
I used to make a living off selling these copies, until one day I began receiving praise for how fine they were compared to the original works.
It all started when a famous art dealer mistook my work for the real thing. Noticing my talent, he bought everything I had, including the replicas.
Despite that, he suffered no ill consequences for it. All my works, including the copies, made him a fortune in sales. People really are clueless when it comes to the value of art.
[Confession No. 623875346]\nJust like you secretly gazed at me, I, too, stole glances at you, careful not to be caught in the act.
I long for the day when I can meet your gaze, practicing for the moment I can return a dazzling smile.
I wish upon the stars, hoping for an opportunity to bridge the gap between us. Deep down, I want you to initiate the conversation, but it's alright.
Yet...the tantalizing distance between us, so close yet untouchable. Was I the only one who enjoyed it? How could you so easily fall for someone else?
Somehow the snake wants to make me taste that which is jealousy, but unfortunately, that's already in my nature. It's not just a phase for me.
The snake showed me a dream. An extremely unpleasant one. He showed me memories of a time when I had nothing to my name—a never ending nightmare where those with power continue to rob me.
Locked away in the depts of my memory lie my past and fragile, weak self. Facing that pain is like gouging out a wound that has yet to form a scab.
Is this a coincidence or fate? If that evil had not reached out to me back then, I would be envious for life... If only I could throw it all away. But I can't escape the root of my desires.
Apparently, the body holds more value than intellect in this world. That's a bit insufficient for me.
Surprisingly, this simple life isn't so bad. The small village lives near a water source and they get their daily meals by way of hunting and gathering.
Creating new tools is exciting, and coming up with a simple remedy has everyone dancing with joy. Who knew inviting something from scratch could be this much fun.
It seems the standard of living for these people is limited to that of peasants of early modern times. Now to go to a bigger city and show off our magical medical skills!

"I've got a few little helpers to assist you with your busy schedule, Snow White!" Dorothy said, giving a thumbs up. Am I the only one who has a bad feeling whenever Dorothy is excited about something?
They raised their heads and looked at me, confused, as if asking whether they'd done something wrong. Yes, thanks to your "cleaning up," several windows got smashed.
If only they'd stay quiet and read picture books. Despite the dwarfs' best intentions, all they do is cause more trouble for me.
However, their childlike innocence alleviates any anger I feel. If I had a child of my own, I would... Now look what you've done! That vase is too big for you to carry!
The body is a strange thing. You and another person can be of the same height, yet have very different hand sizes. There's some that are rugged and some that are plump.
I wasn't aware of this when I lived inside the tower. Mostly because I never had a chance to shake hands with anyone. Could this be a sign that I've grown up?
Humans are odd creatures. There's so many differences between our bodies, yet when I finally make a friend, the reactions seem to be limited to the same patterns.

Even our pupils are mysterious. How easy it is to spew lies from our mouth, but one look at your eyes and your true feelings are suddenly revealed. How is it we can manipulate our mind and words, but we can't deceive our own body?
The wolf showed me a dream of a "safe and secure world." It was the most disgusting and deceitful world I've ever laid eyes on.
In that world, even the sick were saved thanks to the use of magic.
In that world, even the poor could still read, write, do math, and have a bed to sleep in.
In that world, there wasn't one person who skipped a meal, and people simply died of old age. So then why were there still so many who cried of unhappiness? How deep does human karma go?
The bear showed me a dream of a world where no one worked. Everyone spent their days unproductive—cycling between sleep and meals.
The world was enriched by oil and machine automation, and since the average person had too much time on their hands, their groaned of their idleness and boredom.
I offered them to do business with me if they had the money, but they'll always turn me down.
This lifestyle gave raise to obesity-related diseases, however, money allowed them to continue on living. It's amazing how powerful money can be. But are any of them truly happy...?
Model: DLMA X3A\nGuild: Library Guildship
Construction: Dorothy's Workshop\nProduction: Prototype
Power: Nightmare Banishing System\nCharge: Twilight Crystal Engine
Armor: Ultimate Cardboard

It seemed to be an odd looking short sword. Perhaps it had been some noble's way out of an unbearable life, perhaps merely an accessory. Whatever its original use, another eccentric noble had seen fit to have it reforged into practical usefulness. The resulting short sword was transformed. Enchanted, or perhaps cursed.

Despite its meager proportions, the blade had the power to slay dragons. In the bargain, it took the lives of whoever wielded it, no matter how daring the adventurer or brave the hero. One might wonder why it was so. Was it simply that the curse it held was that powerful? No matter how daunting the opponent, its wielder need only wish it and the sword would provide comparable power. All that strength, at the cost of their life.

All the strength their own body possessed, in exchange for the power to defeat their enemies. For even as the killing blow was struck, the wielder was dealt a similarly lethal blow, draining all their strength. It mattered not whether the foe was stronger or weaker. The power slay the dragon, but by another's hand. For one of the kingdom's Champions, the price was too high, and he suffered an ignominious fall, himself.

So, I ask you, the weaklings among us, would you not try your hands at slaying monsters, had you such a tool? How great an injury do you think you could even deal the creature? Surely your strength is up to withstanding that much, is it not? You've got to put some thought into the enemy you face, weigh up the risk and the return! Yes...things are really getting started, now! Make your wager, then!

The sword was lonely. It was a loneliness that only ever abated when it felt the warm grip of a hand on its haft. For that reason, its wielders never enjoyed a long life.\nA cursed sword, a sword who stole away the lives of those who held it. As rumors of it ran through the kingdom, fewer and fewer were willing to wield it. Shut away in a dark corner of the armory, it was cut off from the world of humanity and spent its nights sobbing in wretched loneliness.

Hundreds of years passed, and the initial rumors faded into nothing. A certain noble purchased the sword and gifted it to his niece. The niece, too, tended to loneliness, and cried often over her lost parents. She loved the sword she'd been gifted, and often held it tight as she tried.\nThe girl grew, and became a soldier, taking to the battle field and winning many a victory for herself, firmly holding to her beloved sword all the while. Unlike its previous wielders, however, she did not die. The two lonely souls seemed to give each other hope and strength. Neither could bear to lose the other, to be left alone once more. Thus did the sword and the girl live a long life together, full of legendary deeds of battle.

Thus did the sword and the girl live a long life together, full of legendary deeds of battle.

One of the best things about a gun is, it's just as powerful no matter who's pulling the trigger. Of course, the wielder's skill comes into play when considering accuracy, but as far as the destructive power of the thing itself, it simply doesn't matter. The gun is the same, no matter how much energy goes into pulling the trigger, or how passionate the feelings behind it. It's said, therefore, that the gun is a great leveller, giving advantage to even the weak.

But sometimes, to put it bluntly, one needs to fight a really big monster. And when one does, maybe one needs a bullet that packs just a little more of a punch. Then, one might not be able to use their trusty familiar weapon...Or so a certain gunner thought, with no small amount of frustration. She'd added elements of magical technique to her gun.

And the result? Well...the gun gained the ability to choose its bearer, and to apply a wide variety of different effects to the bullets it fired. Bullets that grew more powerful with the strength of the wielder's emotions. Bullets that slowed the movements of the targets they hit. So many possibilities, yet all of them completely dependent on the willpower and imagination of the wielder.

Hm? You want it to heal you if you get hurt? Why not just savor the pain? I mean, don't get me wrong, I'll try, I guess. I'm just saying, I've never actually tried to make healing bullets. Okay, I think I've got it. These should heal you completely after you get hit by them. I mean, if they don't kill you instantly, that is. So, it's kind of a fun game, when you think about it!

The rule book. A magical tome that could make real whatever precepts were written within. The strength of the results, however, relied wholly on the abilities of the wielder. Fortunately, the one who held this tome had some sort of affinity, and the power brought to bear by the book was great indeed.

And of the book's numerous charms, most central was the fact that its power affected not just its user, but all others as well. For example, one could single out another person, and gift them with eternal life and youth. For example, one could similarly grant superhuman strength. And, in this example, if such a one existed, many others might travel to see them in hopes of having such wishes granted.

Such would be well advised to use caution however, for in such a case the person wielding the tome could be said to have near absolute power, the world in the palm of their very hand. Indeed, for none ever did manage to succeed in taking the tome for themselves, whether by force or by trickery, and of those who made bargains it was said the conditions of such were never favorable. They always owed her a price. Something comparable to what they hoped to gain by the use of the power.

Oh, is the price higher than you thought it might be? You never imagined that THIS would happen? Well, I certainly can't be held responsible for your own pitiful lack of imagination, now can I? Do you have any idea how boring it gets sometimes, being able to do whatever you want? So show me something I'm not expecting. Surprise me. If you do, I'll grant you your every wish. Well? I'm waiting.

The optimal solution. That was the name of the spear. It had gained quite the reputation for unfailingly running through whatsoever its bearer aimed it at. However, in actuality as a spear its properties were really quite extremely unbalanced. It's true, that guided by the spear itself, the spear's bearer would always strike home. But in all other respects, it was an utterly ordinary spear, of no particular power.

Quite an oversight, as far as enchantments go, but it was said that its original owner had been a warrior of quite astonishing martial prowess, so perhaps such extra abilities hadn't seemed necessary. It seems the warrior, though powerful, was not an expert when it came to spearwork. Thereby this warrior set out to supplement that lack of skill with the spear, and made a name for herself with only her strength, and in spite of the finer abilities she lacked.

The weapon was thought to be the sort of thing that suited a rather rigidly defined set of potential wielders, but it seems that someone quite different has managed to make a name for themselves with it. For this person had not even the strength possessed by the previous owner, although her mind was uncommonly sharp and perceptive. Able, thereby, to guide the spear to pierce more effective locations. After all, one doesn't need nearly as much strength to hit a soft target.

Which is to say, the weapon is perfect for someone like me, who can analyze exactly where best to aim. It means never having to strike someone twice. What? Mercy? You want mercy, from me? No, the president benefits most when I present her with the most optimal solutions. I'm afraid the lot of you are surplus to need.

A hammer, crafted to deliver devastating blows, imbued with flame. Yet, at the same time, it is a weapon of precision, made to exacting measurement and calculation. Its baseline destructive power was indeed immense, but each moment it spends in the heat of a battle multiplies that power immensely. It is said that by the end of a day's campaigning the thing has the raw strength to crush mountains.

A great master wielded it once, weathering the blows of enemies over and over, until one enemy rushed at him with a finishing blow, whereupon he counterattacked, for the first time. That single attack swept aside the whole of the enemy force. He earned great acclaim, while he wielded it, for never needing a second strike.

Still, some desired greater power still, and at their behest the hammer was reforged. Now, one need not simply wait for time to pass in the heat of battle, one could stoke its power deliberately through swinging it in just the right way. There were none yet who had truly been able to utilize all the power it held in potential. Perhaps, if it was used by a careful fighter. Or, perhaps...

It really is terrible, to finish every match with your first move.
What?! Listen, lady, I don't think you truly understand the power of this hammer...
Oh, I do...I understand that's why you've been waiting for me to attack.
You really are stupid! You see an opening, you attack, that's how this works!
Well, be my guest, then. If you're so eager to fall for obvious feints...
As long as I've got money, I can do whatever I like. There are so many possibilities. I could eat sweets until I burst and never worry about the consequences.
And If I've still got money left over after that...well, I could invite my dark counterpart over to play! She's helped me so much, I should give her some presents in thanks!
And if I STILL have money left after that, I'll use it to find children who were like us, and to help them somehow. If we put our heads together, we can think of some good ideas.
I wonder if I can keep winning, the way I have? It takes a lot to push worries like that out of my head every morning. In a world like this, unnecessary emotions just get in the way.

Husband are you awake? Hm? But of course, you're my husband, silly! Have we not bound ourselves together this night? You're my husband, and the leader of the Wildfowl Feather, a group of wandering warriors.

Husband mine, why don't we go on an outing today? We can visit one of the towns in your territory! Hm? Looting? Of course not! Our Wildfowl Feather could never loot one of it's own towns. If you want to loot something, we'll have to raid a town in someone else's territory, obviously!

What's wrong, dear Husband? Oh, you were upset to hear about my ex? Don't you worry about him! He wasn't suited to being the leader of the Wildfowl Feather, and the less said about the suspicious circumstances of his premature demise, the better! Don't worry your handsome head about it!

How awful, Husband dear! I can't believe you'd try to escape me. That's not very nice at all! I need you here. After all, you're just so marvellously good in bed. ...It's a shame I'm going to have to have your tendons cut to make sure you don't try something like this again, but if you do your best, you'll be back in my good graces in no time!

My new mother hated me. I was in her way. That's why she killed me.\nMy new little brother hid the evidence, on her orders. They buried me under the juniper tree, and Mother comforted my distraught Father over my lost. My little brother was to scared to tell anyone the truth.

After some time, I somehow became a beautiful bird that roosted in the branches of the juniper tree. I sang, sang of what had happened to me, and those who heard came closer to my tree to listen.\nI cried out to them to find my bones. Mother caught them all, though. She caught them, and killed them, and buried them under the juniper with me.

I was joined by many more birds, all singing of the truth, but although those who heard us could sense the truth in our song, they couldn't comprehend its details. They began to bring offerings and gifts for the juniper tree. Mother was ecstatic. She killed so many more. Father was happy too, bragging of the gifts they received.

The house was buried in gifts, and soon bandits came, drawn by the wealth. They killed my mother. Father nodded in satisfaction and my little brother disposed of the body, crushing the bones. My new song was one of joy.

I'm the star of the shore!♪\nSmall and cute and bright and fresh, a bird born to the water! I see you've all come to visit me today, come to say hi! Hello there! Hi! How are you all doing? I'm just as cute as ever, wouldn't you say?

Everyone says I'm so cute! They surround me and love me and tell me just how adorable I am! It's how I've lived, up until this very day! Hm? Huh? What's...? What is that ugly creature over there? It's so hideous! Kill it! Kill it, kill it, kill it!

I can't forgive that ugly thing for ruining my nice peaceful shoreline! I'll purge that hideous monster from my presence! Hm? Huh??? My body is glowing! What's happening?! Am I going to be even prettier than before, now? I am! I'll be so lovely!!

Boooom!!\nAhaha! Looks like that ugly creature is dead, now. The peace of my shoreline is safe. Now I can go on like before, basking in the praise of my admirers! Listening to them sing the praises of my beauty!♪ How strange they all seem to be so old...weird.

The fell king of the forest was quite lazy, and loved nothing so much as to sleep. One day he opened his eyes for the first time in quite a while and realized a little bird had gone to sleep next to him. He thought that if he were to fall asleep again, it would be nothing but bones by the time he awoke. Even so, he couldn't find it in him to resist the encroaching slumber, and lay himself down next to the little bird, sleeping once more.

...Hundreds of years passed, and the king woke again one day, to a truly annoying sound. A single bird was flitting all around him, singing. It was the same bird, a bird which ought to have been dead. "I was waiting for you!" chirped the bird. "I was waiting for you to play with me!" And so, the king played with the bird, until night fell once more and slumber claimed him.

...Another hundred years passed. This time an acrid smell woke him, and he opened his eyes to a sea of flames. "It's the volcano!" chirped the bird, "Run away with me!" And the the bird perched upon the king's shoulder as he ran, watching with regret as his favorite bedroll was consigned to the flames.

"Don't lie to me Phoenix," he said at length. "It was you who burned it all up, was it not?" The king sighed, and the bird hopped about before answering. "Well, you wouldn't wake up! You just slept and slept and slept! I was sooo bored! I only wanted to play, again!" Phoenix didn't sound the least bit sorry. The king sighed once more. It seemed it would be a while yet, before he got any uninterrupted sleep.

The war dragged on for years, practically forever, but it did eventually come to an end. A lone man build a little house for himself in the midst of a ravaged landscape, and lived a solitary independent life. No one else lived for miles around, and the winters were harsh. It was a quiet, lonely life, but the man was satisfied.

One day, the man was wandering in search of food when he spotted some metal buried within the earth. Digging it out, he found that it was a solid, expensive looking axe. This was a fortunate find indeed, as he had been in need of a tool to help him split wood. Quite happy with his discovery, he packed up and returned home with the axe.

That night, he had a strange dream. He was in the familiar lands surrounding his home, surrounded by mounds of dead soldiers. In the midst of it all was the axe, brand new in his memories, and dripping blood. The axe spoke. "This is my past. This is what I am. I am of no use to you, cast me aside."

The next morning the man took up the axe and left his house. "I was a soldier myself, once," he mused to himself, thoughts punctuated by the sound of wood chopping in the quiet forest. "Let us move on from it all, together. Two survivors, left behind by the killing." The axe didn't appear in his dreams a second time.

The officer was torn. It was his duty to lead the compliment of troops that had formed up. He must somehow take the young and untested soldiers and forge from them a power that could break through the forces of the enemy in the formidable battle to come. For only one man, the tasks laid before him seemed endless.

The officer was torn. His entire compliment of soldiers were horribly young, and green to a man. All of his words, born from years of battlefield experience, seemed only to wash over these youths, raised in a peaceful world.

The officer was torn. His soldiers had been changed after being tossed into the conflict that had set the whole land alight. They'd taken to it quite well. Well enough, in fact that the officer couldn't help but worry. He worried as he watched his newly battle-tested soldiers spend their free time battering effigies of the enemy.

At last the battle ended and the army, no longer needed, disbanded. Some of the soldiers were dispatched to a undeveloped island. Given plowshares instead of swords, but his pupils did not complain. The officer was shocked at how easily they adjusted to peacetime, while he himself was still shaken from the war, his conflicting feelings seemed unlikely to subside. The officer was torn.
The bird brought us to a world without nations. No one suffered from taxation, and no corrupt kings made their people suffer through crooked politics.
But everyone always seemed hungry. I asked why that was, and was told this world is rife with thieves who steal from others.
When I inquired why there were no police to catch these criminals, I was informed the wealthy hire their own enforcers, but this is beyond the means of the poor.
People of this world often speak of personal responsibility. They say that it can't be helped, as few are generous enough to spend their own money to help others.
The tiger showed me a dream of a world that holds lively festivals every night. I knew I'd make tons of friends in this world.
One day, two days, then three days in. I befriended so many men that I lost count. But whenever they'd look up at the full moon, they all seemed quite melancholy.
It was around the 100th day when a question popped into my mind. Who's providing the free food and drinks so we can celebrate every night?

I got the answer to my question from a large man lying in bed. "See how big the moon is today? It's getting bigger by the day, and in less than a month, it's going to swallow up this world. So you see, everyone's offering what they have so we can live out our last days like this."
[Aesthetic Patterned Technical Cotton Suit]\n$8,900
Hand-stitched black suit made from cotton. The first suit to be sewn by Maison Dorothy. The contrast between its classic silhouette and avant-garde aesthetic pattern has taken Paris by storm.
Note: Due to the popularity of this item, it may be out of stock. Please contact us to confirm availability before ordering.
Also, due to the large number of inquiries, the line for the Parrah-Noya Support Center is busy. Please wait until more staff are hired in the coming days.
Mr. Bear brought me to a world where you never have to think ahead. I couldn't believe how many people were smiling at the thought they didn't need money to survive.
A florist told me I should marry the first person I fall in love with.
I asked what if it wasn't meant to be? They chuckled and replied, then break up with them and find someone else.
I asked if they'd leave me even if they had a child. Their response surprised me. They'd never considered it, assuming the child would go with the one they liked better, or stay on their own.

The lion showed me many worlds. I learned that although each world had differences, between hot and cold, rich and poor, and all sorts of conditions, there was always an essential part of humanity that remained the same.
"Every human looks down on another." A kind-hearted, sincere young man looks down on his childhood friend who leads a depraved lifestyle and makes no effort to improve.

The most beautiful young girl in the village looks down on the prostitute who wears heavy makeup to maintain a youthful appearance. The prostitute, on the other hand, looks down on the young girl, believing youth is all she has going for her.

The philosopher, who has acquired unlimited knowledge through books and education, looks down on the masses that fall for falsified information and are manipulated through their own insecurities. Who do you look down on?
The wolf told me a story about a boy who was angry all the time. He was always alone, so he was lonely.
A stray dog that lived in a vacant lot died, and out of pity, the children wanted to give it a proper burial. The boy, however, got angry and said it'd be a waste not to eat it.

"How are we supposed to eat if you don't get to work in the fields?!" he would often yell at the youth who spent his days sleeping at home. The youth's illness only worsened due to the forced labor, and after a while death's chill took him.
