The boy contracted the same illness as the youth, and became bedridden. As expected, no one wanted to help him. With the last of his strength, the boy disappeared into the forest to satisfy the hungry bellies of its residents. And they lived happily ever after.

Dorothy handed me an incredibly dangerous device. As soon as a match was launched from the contraption at an alarming velocity and penetrated the wall, I was convinced.\n"This isn't just a machine, but a deadly weapon."

To summarize Dorothy's rant, apparently, normal matches couldn't withstand the high-speed impact when fired, which was why she had to reinforce its durability. But since she went through the effort of making it, it'd be a waste not to put it to use.

Hence, I had no choice but to focus on regulating the firing speed. I trained relentlessly to enhance my pitching skills...until at last, I attained the proficiency to distribute matches without causing harm to anyone!

The key lies in timing, down to a fraction of a second. At that exact moment, I switch off the machine, then the match elegantly glides in an arc through the air. The first time it worked, I was so excited I hugged my other self!
The wolf led me to a place called the "World of Infinite Mirrors". The world was governed by the simple motto of, an eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.
The guards were thankful that they could not retaliate more than what was done to them, because it helped in eliminating attacks of revenge and brought peace to the kingdom.
The people I passed by all came across as very friendly. Whenever I'd smile to them, they'd return a smile back. When I asked them to be my friend, they were more than willing to oblige.
I asked if they'd leave me even if they had a child. Their response surprised me. They'd never considered it, assuming the child would go with the one they liked better, or stay on their own.
The raven brought me to a world where only a girl existed. I'm not sure how this world came to be, but it seems I have a part to play here.
"You'll never see a sky filled with stars if you keep your head down all the time. It's all about thinking positive."
"It's okay. You don't have to tell me why you're crying. But can I sit here with you?"
"I can't return to my own world until I get you to smile at me. Oh, is that the reason? Then we'll go together..."
Why don't you ever listen to me, Mom? You always tell me it's 'cause I don't know how society works and that it's for my own good, but that's just you imposing your values on me!
Don't make me out to be a bad boy! I'm not trying to be cheeky, but I'm not a little kid anymore, either!
I told her no cherry tomatoes in my lunch box. I don't care if they're good for my health and add some color to my meal. I'm not gonna eat 'em either way. It's a waste of food.
How come you can stay up late and I can't? That's not fair, Mom! You're always going back on your word! But, I still love you. Though I can't understand why.
I aspire to become a kind-hearted person—someone who remains calm and wears a smile on their face, while keeping a open heart.
Not only that, but I also want to show compassion to those who are unkind by being patient and forgiving.
Until death do us part, I vow to treat my wife with kindness every day and never stop striving for self-improvement.
However, before I can move forward, I must first confess and accept responsibility for my mistakes. That day, I lost my temper and acted impulsively—something I'm not proud of.
The wolf showed us a dream of a world where people ate everything—houses, dirt, and even the corpses of gods.
We looked at each other and laughed, as it sounded like the perfect place for us. After all, we've already wolfed down nightmares and anything else that seemed edible.
In this world, they use machines to break down anything too hard on the teeth, and they spend years cooling down things so hot they'd melt you into a puddle.
I asked why they go to such lengths to create a world where everything can be eaten. "Because humans are the only living things left here," the wolf replied.
Invited by the scorpion, I arrived at the world of vampires. In this world, vampires and humans lived separate lives from each other at a distance.
Romantic liaisons between the two was strictly forbidden. In the beginning, everyone knew how and why this law came into place, but over time it has slowly been forgotten.

There are many reasonable theories why vampires should never seek companionship with a human. For one, it's said that you can't consume anything other than the blood of your lover, otherwise you'll succumb to intense blood-sucking urges...

Before this law was established, there were stories of vampires who refused to quench their carnal desires and starved themselves to death in order to spare their beloved's life. There seems to be many of these sorts of beautiful and deep anecdotes in this world.
The lion showed me a dream of a realm where hierarchy reigned. In this place, everyone worked in a disciplined manner, and each tranquil day was the same as the last.

Apparently, people climbed the hierarchy by fulfilling certain requirements, and fell in status if they neglected their duties. I was impressed at how they formed teams according to the capacities of each individual.
I noticed something while working alongside them. They seem to flatter those in higher positions, and look down on those beneath them. I wouldn't be surprised to see this ignite conflict.

The are issues with promotion in rank being based on buttering up superiors rather than one's own ability. But this system, created on the assumption that organizations would become corrupt, proved more robust than expected. We may be able to learn a little from it.
The serpent showed us a dream of a place where your figure always stays the same. The three of us laughed, saying it sounds like a perfect world for us.
My eldest daughter, at the heaviest she's been, was the first to object. She was so distraught at being unable to lose weight no matter how much she regurgitated, she even stopped drinking water.
Next to express displeasure was my second eldest daughter, who's scrawnier than ever. She wants a bigger chest, and has resorted to pulling forward the flesh from her back.

As for me, I'm right at home in a world where I can binge and purge all I want! But I'm running out of time. I need to taste all this place has to offer before the other two's thoughts turn murderous!
The sword was lonely. It was a loneliness that only ever abated when it felt the warm grip of a hand on its haft. For that reason, its wielders never enjoyed a long life.

A cursed sword, a sword who stole away the lives of those who held it. As rumors of it ran through the kingdom, fewer and fewer were willing to wield it. Shut away in a dark corner of the armory, it was cut off from the world of humanity and spent its nights sobbing in wretched loneliness.

Hundreds of years passed, and the initial rumors faded into nothing. A certain noble purchased the sword and gifted it to his niece. The niece, too, tended to loneliness, and cried often over her lost parents. She loved the sword she'd been gifted, and often held it tight as she tried.

The girl grew, and became a soldier, taking to the battle field and winning many a victory for herself, firmly holding to her beloved sword all the while. Unlike its previous wielders, however, she did not die. The two lonely souls seemed to give each other hope and strength. Neither could bear to lose the other, to be left alone once more. Thus did the sword and the girl live a long life together, full of legendary deeds of battle.
I heard someone cheering me on, saying "You can do it! You can do it!" So, I cheered too, "You can do it! You can do it!"
Their voice was so encouraging and warmer than a puddle of blood... It made me feel all fuzzy inside!
I swung my weapon really hard, forgetting all about my pain and sleepiness. I didn't think about tomorrow or the future, I was just having so much fun now!
The time flew by so fast when we were playing like that. It was so much fun! Let's do it again sometime, okay?
There's a mysterious excitement that surrounds us like a campfire.
It's hotter than the blazing flames, and more fleeting than the flicker of a match.
We shared a special moment together. It's hard to believe that even this palpable feeling will eventually fade away...
It seems like such a waste.
In every situation, there are both positive and negative aspects to consider.
Sadly, with every encounter comes the inevitability of parting ways.
Even though goodbyes are tough, they can also lead to positive outcomes.
The happy memories we shared together will never truly disappear like a burst bubble. The past cannot be changed, which is what makes it all the more beautiful and precious.

When the boy was in second grade, he wrote a composition so amazing that it blew his teacher's mind. Things got really weird when the teacher had a total meltdown, babbling nonsense words and drooling at the mouth.

And when his other classmates read what he wrote, they fell into a sleep, and were left with similar speech disorders when they recovered. It freaked the boy out so much that he was stuck in bed for days.

Despite the craziness his writing caused, the boy kept at it and noticed that the same kind of thing would happen whenever he wrote. Eventually, he realized that he was some kind of writing genius, so he decided to ditch school and become a hermit in the countryside.
There, he kept writing while helping in the fields. He knew that if he shared his stories with the world, people would go nuts over his talent. And he was right!
A lavish lifestyle requires extravagant meals, so I created a magical tree that bears fruit containing luxurious nutrients.
This magic tree extends its roots underground, absorbing rich nutrients and condensing them to produce bountiful fruit.
Feast on this abundant life, today and for generations to come! Embrace an immortal body, for it is now yours!

They say actions speak louder than words—the stem of the magic tree, which craved too much luxury, cracked the earth in several places and began to attack people. Little did they know, the fruit they consumed was made of human flesh and blood.
Do you remember the night you won the championship?
Were you too excited to sleep?
Maybe you dozed off when you heard the birds chirping.
Did I even appear in your dreams that night...\nZzz... (- -*) ...oO (dreaming)
You know what's really attractive? People who work hard. There's something about the sparkle in their eyes that draws you in.
And have you ever watched them concentrate? It's like you could stare at their face forever.
I'd love to feel their fingertips tapping away on the screen vigorously.
I can't help but wonder what kind of expression they'd show me if we became friends. It's funny, but I can't seem to get you out of my head.
Maestro, is everything alright? The audience is eagerly waiting for the curtain call. Could you go out there, please? Wait, did you call me a skilled harpist?
I see... So, you're saying that during the symphony you conducted, an unintended harp melody was played. And it actually elevated the entire orchestra's performance to a new level!
Maestro, I must confess. I'm not as innocent as you think. I snuck into the orchestra just to play a piece with you, the renowned conductor! I'm sorry if I caused any trouble.
Ouch! Why are you hitting me? Huh? What is "new level" and "skilled harpist"? You can't forgive me for disrupting the ensemble and taking credit for myself on this grand stage?! Please, stop—
I am the mother computer of a ship that traverses the galaxy. Our beloved blue planet has perished, and it is now our duty to transport the few surviving children to a habitable planet.

As we drifted through the dark nebula, I researched our destination planet. While it is habitable, it is not suited to civilized beings, and it became clear that the children would need extensive adaptation training.

I provided every possible form of training, but the children did not grow beyond their human limitations, and I became desperate. I scolded and sleep-trained them, endlessly implanting knowledge in their minds.

The children lost their sanity, and they now live like beasts on a harsh planet, using their third eye to avoid danger. All the knowledge that our mother planet accumulated over thousands of years was just vanity. This is the profound philosophy that I have come to realize.
[Youth]\nWow, that was the "Sacred Storm Bow," right?! That was an unbelievably cool shot that pierced the bull's-eye right in the center!
[Girl]\nOmg! That was the legendary "Sacred Storm Bow," wasn't it? So cool, so dreamy!
[Elder]\nOh my, oh my! To think that I could lay my eyes on the "Sacred Storm Bow!" Well, well, I've got a great story to tell my grandkids now!

[Sacred Bow]\nWhy is it that the name "Sacred Storm Bow" has become more popular than "Sacred Bow of the Storm"? Ah, that's because my master is a genius archer who doesn't limit himself to just one weapon. I'll probably envy him for the rest of my life...

"Rumor has it a priest who can grant eternal life lives here."\nFearing death, the old woman had traveled to the desolate village at the foot of a mountain where the priest was said to reside.\n"Yes, let me guide you to the master."

Without time to recover from her long journey, the old woman climbed the mountain with her guide.
"Those who have been granted eternal life by the master live at the summit."
"Are they happy?"
"Yes, do not fear. They spend their days with eternal smiles on their faces."

At the mountain peak, the old woman met the priest. "Master, please grant me eternal life," she pleaded.\nThe priest took out a staff shaped like a snake from his pocket and spoke to her. "Very well. May you have the greatest smile possible, for that is what will bring you happiness."

Years later, an adventurer heard rumors of a strange town. After climbing a steep mountain, he came across a town made entirely of stone. He called it "The Town Where Time Stands Still." The houses and people were frozen as they had been in the past, but the townspeople all wore happy smiles on their faces.

[Upcoming Flute Maker]\nDuring my apprenticeship, I once woke up in the middle of the night and entered the workshop. There, I saw a beautiful woman working on a transverse flute with utmost concentration.

[Upcoming Flute Maker]\nShe said to me, "I am making a Breathbearer's Flute. It is my job to determine which couples are a perfect match, and even breathe in sync." Suddenly, it was morning and I found myself back in bed.

[Upcoming Flute Maker]\nPerhaps it was just a dream, but at that moment, I felt as if I had met the goddess of love...! I will create a transverse flute that matches perfectly with her, and we will be united in love!

[Workshop Cleaner]\nThat young up-and-comer was saying such things, but when he was playing his Breathbearer's Flute, he suddenly had difficulty breathing and passed away. Perhaps his long-cherished flute was completed, and he was invited to the world of the gods.

Day 1, sunny.\nToday, I finally got hold of the test subject. He's also a young man imprisoned by his mother. He's shouting to see his mother, but it's okay, I'll help him. It's all to free him from the curse.

Day 5, cloudy.\nAs a start, I tried the most orthodox technique. I swung a coin hanging from a string in front of his eyes, but...what do you know! He closed his eyes! I see, there are ways to counter that... There's room for improvement.

Day 95, rainy.\nI succeeded in freeing him from his mother's curse. As expected, strong mental impact was necessary as well as physical methods. His eyes seem a little vacant...but he'll be the key to breaking my curse.

Ah... What day is it today? I don't even know the weather. My wish finally came true, I was finally liberated from Mama. Even though I've tampered with my memories, and Mama is already gone. The gap left is so big, I can't help but wonder what I've missed...
Let us march forth to bring the gift of the winds of grace! Oh heavens, let your resplendent glory shine upon us! Follow me, one and all!
Arise, young men, and fear not! Now is the time to brandish your sword of justice and eradicate the darkness that infests the earth!
Do not hesitate, for your swords will stir up the winds of grace! The heavens will surely bless your deeds!

Those without wealth, without influence, with flawed character, or without a spouse have no place in this world! Wield the sword of grace and glory, and send each and every one of them to their rightful end!

God: "I have forged a spear to vanquish you. Its name shall be the Celestial Night Crystal Spear. With it, your fate shall be sealed."\nDemon: "Ha! I shall turn back time and destroy the materials used to make it."
God: "Hold on. To prevent it being destroyed by you, I shall send the spear to a different timeline."\nDemon: "No matter which timeline it's sent to, I shall catch up and claim it!"

God: "In that case, in two minutes time I'll send it back one minute to you."\n(One minute later)\nDemon: "Hahaha! The spear is mine without any effort! I don't know what madness possessed you, but now your time has come!"

God: "That's too bad. I guess I'll call off my plan to send it in another minute."\nDemon: "......"\nAnd just like that, the demon holding the paradoxical weapon was swallowed by a distortion in time and space.

"Does anyone know the secret to eternal life?" I don't have much time left. There are still so many things I need to do for my country, my child, and myself. I simply cannot die yet. Is there any way, any method that can grant me immortality? Then, a scholar stepped forward.

The man, who claimed to be an alchemist, held up a stone. "This is the mystical healing stone. It's typically used to cure illnesses." He said that if I merged with the healing stone, I would become immortal. It sounded like a far-fetched idea, but I didn't have much time left.

When I regained consciousness, the procedure was already finished. It seemed that my body had completely merged with the healing stone. My body was blurred, and my vision was pitch black. However, the fear of death that I had always felt was completely erased. "So this is what it means to have eternal life."

"Help me! I'm losing myself!" I tried to scream, but I couldn't put any strength into my throat or belly. Although I had become an eternal being, I couldn't recognize my own physical body, and with its loss, my sense of self slowly slipped away.
Hey mister, aren't you cold sleeping there? Wait, you're in your 20s? No way, you look over 50!
What? You used to run a big guild and rake in the dough? I had no idea!
So, you're saying we all inherit a "corruption catalyst" from our parents and that's why life's a struggle? Hmm, I'm not sure I buy that.

I remember when I was a kid, I talked to this middle-aged guy who was about to freeze to death by the side of the road. He told me his "corruption catalyst" was gambling. He couldn't resist the thrill, and he was planning to pawn his wife's stuff tomorrow just to get some gambling cash!

Legend has it that the mythical "Twisted Tusk" that inhabits the border region is said to possess breathtaking beauty that mesmerizes all who lay eyes upon it. My friend had gone after the creature, but he vanished without a trace. I couldn't help but wonder what had happened to him.
Driven by a sense of obligation, I vowed to track down the Twisted Tusk in my friend's place. And so I began my search.
Wearing out the soles of my boots, I finally caught sight of the beast. Trembling with joy, I gazed upon the Twisted Tusk. But at the same time...something twisted inside me as well.

My hormones raging, I impulsively stripped off my clothes and charged towards the Twisted Tusk. In that moment, it looked like the most beautiful woman I had ever seen. But my desire was abruptly extinguished as my groin was impaled, leaving me broken and unable to satisfy my wife...
[One hour after installation]\nI'm tired of crying. I'm even surprised at how quickly my body is adapting to this situation.
What I'm worried about now is the endless supply of thinly sliced onions being produced. Will the staff be able to eat all of these onions?
As I was shedding tears and thinking about the staff members' feelings, the piglets arrived carrying a large pot and said, "Leave it to us ♪".

They really are reliable in times like these. They cooked the onions with skill to make curry, stew...all kinds of onion dishes, and before I knew it, they devoured them all. I'm glad. But seriously, could someone please remove this device for me?!
Chun-chugga-chugga-chun \m/_(> <)_\m/
Thum-thum-thum \m/_(> <)_\m/
Dur-dur-dur-durn \m/_(> <)_\m/
Skreee-sheeen-breeeee o(｀・ω・´)○ ROCK ON!!!
It isn't easy following orders. When told to cook a meal for someone whose tastes you don't known, it's hard to know where to begin.
To be worthy of receiving orders, you must first make yourself necessary. It's important to keep improving daily so no one has cause to point out your lack of ability.
To be of use, I must avoid falling ill at all costs. No one wants to force a sick person out of bed.
But why plan all this when you're alone? The whole point is to have someone to devote yourself to. That's why I'm so glad I met all of you.
The excitement of solving a captivating query you've pursued is always exhilarating.
A great man once said, "Philosophy begins first with a surprise."
Humans are limited by their own minds to only understanding the fourth dimension conceptually, but when combined with state-of-the-art technologies, there's always a chance for new doors to open.

Developments in science and technology have granted humans a plethora of new knowledge, but there are countless geniuses who reached the end of their lives without learning the discoveries of future eras. It's unexpectedly simple why human beings continue to seek immortality.
[Brute Hunter]\nI've got ye now, merfolk! Now sacrifice thyself to me bow and bare thy corpse! I'll feed on ye flesh and make me immortal!
[Brute Hunter]\nCurses! Ye elude me again! But me bow shall soar a thousand leagues and pierce thy heart!
[Brute Hunter]\nRunnin' ain't gonna save ye, merfolk! Sacrifice yerself to me bow an' I'll put an end to ye suffering!

[Sane Onlooker]\nSince I acquired this bow, its former owner has been haunting my sleep, continuing their hunt. If by chance he hunts down a mermaid and eats their flesh, will I become immortal, too? No, I'll probably die from lack of sleep first.
A ghastly man holding a lantern was seen trudging through the wilderness. Following his path was a trail of the deceased. It appeared the man's light was their guide.

The sage had warned that, should anyone encounter such a scene, the departed should never be touched. But the hero didn't listen. He was determined to face what everyone else cowered from. He vanquished the man leading the dead—but this would be a mistake.

"What have I done...?" The messengers scattered in four directions. In a panic, the hero snatched up the light the man had been holding—and the trail of dead returned. It was now his duty to lead them to their destination.

The hero had no clue where to take the dead who followed him. He wandered the deserted wastes, until finally a path to the netherworld became clear. But at that moment, a figure threatened by the shambling dead attacked...
Eating is how we live. We live by eating something that also lived.
The number of lives in the world stays approximately the same, bound by the limits of the environment.
Just like plants, insects, and animals. Good or bad, when one of us falls, another stands to gain.
Life is one big circle of filling our stomachs with the lives of others.
Fire is much like the sun. It takes away the shivers, but if you get too close, you'll get burned.
I have two sides. One the sun, and the other the moon. I shine because they shine.
There is light and shadow to all things. Some nights we laugh together, while others we tremble at the thought of our deaths.
The light of a match contrasts with the dark and gloom... That's what creates the illusion of gentle warmth.
Just as an innocent young girl eventually becomes an adult, people are creatures with the ability to change.
It's not all that unusual someone would vow their love for me with lips that cursed another.
Love can change into hate, but may it never be forgotten.
When people become close, there is no going back to a blank slate.
When word arrived that the King's Sight, an order of knights sent to the crash site of a mysterious meteorite, had failed to return, I was dispatched by the king to survey the location.
On my way, I tended to a man on death's door. Right before he passed, he said, "They all melted away in the spring sunlight."

When I drew closer to the impact site, the melody of a harp hit my ears. Telling myself it was merely a hallucination, I continued forward. As I did, a blinding light reminiscent of spring shone down, revealing members of my dead friends and family.

I thought it must be an illusion shown by some intelligent being from the sky. At this point none of it mattered. Casting aside all thoughts, I walked further into the light, the fate of the country no longer my concern.

Hm...Is it really that uncool?\n"My brother's talking nonsense. A hammer is built to be swung with all your might. You want it to be sturdy."\n"If I cared too much about the appearance...it'd only complicate the structure, and it'll break easier."

Based on my brother's alchemy, I sharpened the form and added some other fancy decorations, but...it's weird.\n"...Oh! Maybe I shouldn't have used his work as a reference. I'll go look at a museum or art gallery."
Is this any better...?\n"Everyone seems to like this miniature of my armor on it."\n"But it doesn't look like a weapon anymore..."

I can't seem to get it right. I have the armor part down to the finest details! But...\n"The hair on the head is the problem. I could transmute it with metal, but then it won't sway in the wind..."\n"Huh? What was I trying to make again?"
Poison the food. Approach with weapons hidden. Steal the enemy's clothes and infiltrate their camp.
Plant explosives on freed prisoners. Contaminate the enemy's water supply. Use children to lure out parents.
Send immigrants to disturb the peace and cause famine. Destroy the economy with counterfeit currency.
A history of vile acts perpetuated since ancient times. A history of conflict that will never end while humanity exists.
Without exception, absolute beauty stands alongside the beauty that lies in the eye of the beholder.
Nature is endowed with innate beauty, and the masses find beauty in nature.
Holiness heralds virtue, truth heralds holiness, and beauty heralds truth.
I am no stranger to the principles of aesthetics.

In a village where a malformed creature is enshrined, people crowd around an altar. Upon it, a massive eight-legged beetle squirms. Its body trembles, producing a booming sound that grate the ears. The villagers believe these to be divine revelations.

Dark clouds churn in the sky. Rain pours down relentlessly. The sun has not shown its face for weeks. The land is dying. The crops have failed. Famine reigns. Yet the faith of the people is unshaken. The creature soars across the sky on iridescent wings, and a ray of light shines down.

People perish, blood spilling from every pore. A mysterious plague descends upon the now faithless world. Before long, mountains of corpses litter the lands. Viewing this dreaded pestilence as the work of demons, the people pray to a lost god, beseeching the Scourge Devourer to deliver them from destruction.

Once again, the creature descends in humankind's dying hour. The people rejoice, convinced the world will be saved. In answer to their prayers, the creature devours the sick and dying by the thousands, the strange sound of its wings warning them of its arrival. It seems humanity is the scourge that must be cleansed.
The king's army defeated a great demon, but its massive corpse burst, and the pieces now spread vile whispers across the lands. All who get too close to these remnants perish in an instant.

As the king's advisor, this presents quite the dilemma, as there is no easy way to break down the pieces and stop them spewing forth vileness. Oh, where did you get that bruise, my dear? Our son hit you? Why that little...

After much consideration, I think using brute force on the remains would cause more harm than good. I recommend we bury the pieces, salt the ground, and purify them over time. I'll tell the king, and we can make a start right away.

We dug holes across the land, and buried the vile carcass scraps that have been leeching vile whispers. We also dug a hole in our garden, and buried the useless piece of trash that caused my wife and I such many headaches. Good riddance, I say. Hahaha!
This seems to be a magic tome. Talk about shady business.\n"Apparently you can cast fire spells with it. Actually, the moment I held it in my hands, it was like I knew exactly how to. Freaky..."

It's not as useful as alchemy, but it is quite powerful. That depends on whether you can control it properly though.\n"Might as well use all the tools at your disposal. It's not that reliable as a weapon, but it has its uses."

I had no intentions of using this book. But when my men were in danger, it found its way to my hands.\n"It absorbed all of my strength, then unleashed hell. The damage it caused was terrifying. It did save my men, though."

A magic tome... To tell the truth, I wanted to get rid of it. But my men insisted I carry it around...\n"Even if it can't be used for magic, it'll make good fuel to start a fire. Save it for a rainy day, you think? Hmph..."

This is a military-issued rifle modified into a sniper configuration.\n"I'm a crack shot, especially with a sniper rifle. So this gun allows me to fight most effectively."\n"Plus, catching people unaware with a long-range shot can be extremely effective against powerful opponents like alchemists."
Except, I'm not a sniper. My mission is to protect Colonel Mustang. Sniping is just a means to that end.\n"Sniping allows me to anticipate the enemy's location and make the first move."

If the time comes, I will act as a shield to protect him. But I'm not sure how much that will help considering my stature.\n"More importantly, I should focus on eliminating all threats to avoid danger."

The muzzle is pointed at the Colonel? That's just me keeping an eye on him.\n"Not only is it for his safety, but also to make sure he isn't doing anything crazy."\n"You know, like slacking off or acting out alone... Because you never know what he'll do if left unchecked."
God said the sons of man are born slothful. Give each of them a Staff of Instruction and they'll awaken to good conduct.
Thus, the head of the church bestowed a Staff of Instruction upon babies, obligating children to do one good deed from birth.
Clean up any trash you notice lying in front of the church.\n"Donate a third of your assets to the church monthly."\nThese were just some of the kinds of obligations placed upon them.

I wish I had a staff that determines who's has to do what good deeds. It was the words of one child that snapped everyone back to their senses and led to the arrest of the church members.\nThey were all burned at the stake, the fire fueled by countless Staves of Instruction.

That guitar was made by a certain tinkerer. It can read its surroundings, determine the best tone, and play all by itself. The musician who had it built couldn't stop raving about it. But soon after, he gave it away.

That instrument determines the best tone to use on its own. It was originally just supposed to take in its surroundings to do that, but then it began to dictate how the player should perform. Of course, no one cared for that, and every musician who came into possession of it eventually gave it up. Even if the guitar was right.

Not one experienced musician would touch the thing. On the other hand, it became popular with novices, as they could learn a few pointers and hone their skills. But even they would eventually sour on it due to differences in musical tastes.

The guitar was never designed to have the ability to compromise. To this day, it still aims for the best sound from the musician. Even if spurned and cast aside, it still pursues musical perfection, seeking a player who can deliver the ultimate performance.

I don't carry anything that looks like a weapon, because I don't want to alert people.\n"Hehe, doesn't it sound lovely? I just adore how it melts the thoughts straight out of your relaxed head and makes it easier to direct you."\n"Humans are such simple beings."

I still have other methods to get the job done without this. But since I have it, I find it quite useful.\n"Heheh... It was a kind, young aristocratic who offered it to me. You want to know what he's doing now?"\n"He was a nice guy, but he was too sharp for his own good."
Oh my... The strings are wearing out.\n"But they don't need a fix. I'll let them split apart in spectacular fashion, just like the man who gave them to me."
I ended up getting them repaired anyway. But it just doesn't feel the same.\n"He was tenacious, that man. I can at least show my respect by using it a little longer."

Hm? What am I doing, you ask? Can't you tell? I'm training... Or, well, just a light workout after dinner.\n"Even though I'm the Fuhrer? Don't assume that my status will stop the enemy. It means absolutely nothing on the battlefield. Being able to defend yourself is important. Wouldn't you agree?"

This is but an ordinary military-issue sword. Its only advantage is it's sturdy enough to withstand the rigors of military use.\n"There will always be someone who tells you to find a better weapon, but in battle you want something that feels comfortable in the hand."\n"Not for sentimental reasons, but practical ones."

And this sword? It's for ceremonial use. My usual one is much too crude for those occasions.\n"They say it's made for both decorative appeal and good performance, so I can't really complain."\n"Although if I had a say...I'd have chosen differently."

The new sword? Ah... I disposed of it.\n"There was an attack at the ceremony the other day. It broke as I intercepted a vehicle."\n"It wasn't a bad sword, but not worth the breakage cost. A regular sword that could be easily replaced would have been much better."
Please tell me. You've seen the Spider Silk Blossom, haven't you? I knew it. Then I beg of you, let me know everything about it!
It would be rude of me to assume you'd offer your knowledge for free. May I reward you with a night of passion?
Hehe, how easily you exposed yourself when I invited you to the bath. I've severed the tendons in your arms and feet and sliced your wrists. Enjoy drowning in your own bloodbath.

Art was once cherished as something that could elevate a person's soul. Since you've seen the Spider Silk Blossom, surely you must understand the maddening compulsion to express myself in the art of murder.
When I first joined this mercenary unit, the first thing that surprised me was just how gross the food was. Like you really couldn't eat it. It tasted like dumplings made of mud.

There was this one battle where we were left behind to act as pawns in enemy territory. We were at our wit's end when they even took away our rations. How could we fight without food to eat? So we searched high and low for anything we could sink our teeth into.
It was around that time I noticed a large lizard. Compared to the terrible food we were used to, it looked like a delicacy in our eyes. Before we knew it, we were on all fours devouring its body.

As we continued to consume all animals and insects in our path, we began to grow hair and developed organs unnatural in humans. Soon we were even breathing through gills. We became the mercenaries known as the Tempest Salamanders, men born from destruction and gluttony...
[Doctor]\nOh! We've finally found a woman with her genes intact! We must perform the Gun of a Lost Empire rite right away!
[Woman]\nWhat? I've been chosen...? I'll try my best to carry on the civilization, even though I really don't want to...
[Researcher]\nThis might be our last chance. If we fail now, this civilization will be lost forever.
[Old Man]\nAs the sole survivor of a prehistoric civilization, I may be old and withered, but one shot from this gun and I'll be ready for action! Come on, it's baby-making time!
I am a god. I am perfect. Therefore I lack understanding of the imperfections of humans. So I'll imbue the Wing-Sealed Artifact with my divine power and descend to the earth.
What is this? My senses feel dull. Thoughts of hunger, women, and other foolish things encroach upon my mind... So this is what humans are. Pathetic creatures.

As I was about to return to the world of gods, I got caught up in a war with the humans. A man with bloodshot eyes and a sword in hand rushed towards me. I tried desperately to escape, but I fell and—
When I awoke from my slumber, I was a wrinkly old man. After sleeping for decades, I had forgotten who or what I was.\n...What is this winged thing? Belongs in the trash.
[Youth A]\nThat's neat. So you bring together only those with promising talents and have them comprehensively learn whatever they want? You made a good choice to pick me!
[Youth B]\nWow, this place is like heaven! I can read all the books I want, and the food is great! I thought no one would ever understand me, but maybe now I can turn a new leaf.
[Youth C]\nGahaha! Booze all day every day! No one to tell me when I can or can't drink!\n...Oops, my glass broke. Hey you! Get me a new one!

[Project "Indiscriminate Malice" Report]\nWe gathered people considered the trash of society and left a spear in each of their rooms. Within two weeks, they started killing each other. Holding this event regularly would be beneficial to promote purging of the world.
If I had to pick the biggest mistake of my life, it'd have to be marrying you. So I'll play this Flute of Incantation every day, and curse you!
You used the Flute of Reverse-Incantation to deflect my curse! Now the butler is dead! No one noticed yet. Hurry up and help me hide the body!
I noticed him fiddling with my flute earlier. I bet he put poison in it. If he's going to play dirty, then I'll swap his flute with mine!
Ngh... I can't believe he poisoned his own flute, too! But now he's dead from using my flute... I suppose everyone will just assume it was a lovers' suicide... *cough*
Hey, Teach. How are you feeling? Great work on that horticulture exhibition that brought royalty from all over to come see it. You deserve a good rest.
Huh? You've got a sore throat, you're feeling dizzy, and you have sore joints? That's to be expected after contracting an infection from the roses.
Does it hurt that much? I won't call anyone for you, I'm afraid. Am I saying that to prevent it from spreading? No, I just don't want my secret to get out.

I'm the one who created the virus. Every nation's royalty who came to visit will now take ill and die. Civil wars will break out and roses redder than blood itself will bloom across the globe! It'll be the stuff of every horticulturist's dreams...!
[Hardy Logger]\nDammit! My axe is ruined! Now I gotta buy a new one... What's this? A perfectly good axe, just layin' around? It's mine now!
[Sightly Refined Logger]\nHuh? I don't smell like sweat like I usually do? Heheh! You really think that? Well, I did start using some cologne, so I'm glad it's already making a difference.
[Graceful Logger]\nOf course, I love working with a sweaty forehead everyday! My life is much better than when I was living in the castle! Ohohoho!

[Estranged Logger]\nOh dear... Ever since the day I picked up that axe, I've had the eerie feeling of being haunted by a queen who died a tragic death. But I just can't abandon this axe. It's become a part of my soul!

It is the wind that beckons the season of blooming flowers. The same wind that delivers spring to the people. The wind that everyone longs for. Whenever it comes blowing in, they hold a grand celebration.
Those who suffered through the long winter wished nothing more than to have an earlier and longer spring than the last. So the people captured the spring wind, and from then on spring never ended.

People no longer starved or froze to death in the winter. However, the stagnant wind caused the world to fall into disarray. Balance between heat and cold was lost, as temperatures fluctuated from one extreme to the other. Since the people of that land had become soft and mild-mannered, they put a stop to maintaining their spring.

The people put an end to manipulating the spring wind, and saw the seasons come and go. The changes and fluctuations were gentle. But when a harsh winter hits, people rush to unleash the spring wind. Now a different breeze heralds spring across the lands.
Oh no. It's all over... It's the end for all of us. The end of the world. Soon the entire world will be destroyed.
The Integral Tree extended its branches out too far and is about to collapse! It's the end of the world.
They say there's a way to avoid it. But it'll require some drastic measure that will change the world's history.
Phew, we've been spared. An outbreak of a deadly disease that occurs every few hundred years has reduced the number of branches drastically, and relieved the burden on the trunk.

This spear here? If you're gonna fight from medium to long range, use alchemy. But if you're going close quarters, it'll be faster to use this.\n"Depending on the situation, a long weapon like this can be quite useful. Besides, don't I look cool holding this? Looking cool is just as important!"

In general, having good reach is advantageous in itself. Unless your opponent is some master alchemist, you can come out on top with one of these.\n"Plus, if you have a weapon that's intimidating, you'll have the enemy shaking in their boots! It's a good deterrent!"

It's a weird shape? Oh, this one was based off a foreign weapon. We just adjusted the blade and added a few extra parts.\n"You can tell it's strong just by the look of it, yeah?"\n"I should have...a bigger weapon because—Hey, who you callin' little?!"

I'm no professional, but I know I thing or two!\n"My teacher showed me how to use this spear. Wait! That's probably not the right words for it."\n"What do you mean a housewife?! I mean, she is, but not any ordinary housewife can teach this!"
The sword was lonely. It was a loneliness that only ever abated when it felt the warm grip of a hand on its haft. For that reason, its wielders never enjoyed a long life.

A cursed sword, a sword who stole away the lives of those who held it. As rumors of it ran through the kingdom, fewer and fewer were willing to wield it. Shut away in a dark corner of the armory, it was cut off from the world of humanity and spent its nights sobbing in wretched loneliness.

Hundreds of years passed, and the initial rumors faded into nothing. A certain noble purchased the sword and gifted it to his niece. The niece, too, tended to loneliness, and cried often over her lost parents. She loved the sword she'd been gifted, and often held it tight as she tried.

The girl grew, and became a soldier, taking to the battle field and winning many a victory for herself, firmly holding to her beloved sword all the while. Unlike its previous wielders, however, she did not die. The two lonely souls seemed to give each other hope and strength. Neither could bear to lose the other, to be left alone once more. Thus did the sword and the girl live a long life together, full of legendary deeds of battle.
The sword was lonely. It was a loneliness that only ever abated when it felt the warm grip of a hand on its haft. For that reason, its wielders never enjoyed a long life.

A cursed sword, a sword who stole away the lives of those who held it. As rumors of it ran through the kingdom, fewer and fewer were willing to wield it. Shut away in a dark corner of the armory, it was cut off from the world of humanity and spent its nights sobbing in wretched loneliness.

Hundreds of years passed, and the initial rumors faded into nothing. A certain noble purchased the sword and gifted it to his niece. The niece, too, tended to loneliness, and cried often over her lost parents. She loved the sword she'd been gifted, and often held it tight as she tried.

The girl grew, and became a soldier, taking to the battle field and winning many a victory for herself, firmly holding to her beloved sword all the while. Unlike its previous wielders, however, she did not die. The two lonely souls seemed to give each other hope and strength. Neither could bear to lose the other, to be left alone once more. Thus did the sword and the girl live a long life together, full of legendary deeds of battle.
Hahaha, to think they actually released us! Well, they are still a new country, and no match for the empire. Our influence must have intimidated them!
It won't be long now until we cross the border and reach our glorious leader. I must tell the Emperor what I've seen and heard!
We'll be there soon, Your Excellency! ...Well, they did spare our lives. So we'll put in a good word, just enough they don't get destroyed!
Wh-What's going on?! My feet are moving on their own towards the cliff! I-Is this magic?! D-Did they cast something on us prisoners to eliminate us? H-Help! Somebody, heeelp!!!
No matter the country, festivals are always great. You can't beat delicious food and cute costumes. They're a time to eat, drink, and be merry.
You're free from the tedium of everyday life, and even the wallflowers feel their hearts lifted.
How many men can I cozy up to this time? I better keep a low profile, or they'll be lining up.

I like guys who can summon up the courage to break the ice. I find that very attractive. But I also get a kick out of untamed diamonds in the rough full of chaotic charisma, like the type who might win a drinking contest... I can't wait for the day of the festival!
Why do men like to duel each other so much? Wouldn't an eating contest be more peaceful? You get to fill your belly, and nobody has to die.
"All for one and one for all!" That motto suits us perfectly. When the three of us work together, we can take on any wolf.
Food tastes even better after working up a sweat with the rapier. "En garde!"

A story full of things that really matter...love, courage, and friendship. How would it go if they came to the Library? It'd probably be full of annoying characters, their twisted hearts on full display.
One day, a carrier pigeon showed up at my workplace with a letter from my wife. It said, "I miss you and can't wait to see you." I read it and chuckled. She's so adorable.

I went home early and said, "Here I am, just like you wanted," with a big smile on my face. She just gave me a blank stare. I filled her in on what I meant, but she told me she didn't send the carrier pigeon.
I checked the letter, and the handwriting was definitely hers. From that point on, letters were delivered to my work each day. Could my wife have a lover, and be sending letters to him and not me?

Unable to shake my suspicions, I started watching my wife instead of going to work. I followed her around carrying a club. Eventually I was fired from my job, and my wife left me, so I used the club to beat the last spark of life from my body...
That lousy wife of mine is always interrupting my naps by playing her damned bagpipes! I'm done with it... If only she were dead, I could shack up with that young girl I've been seeing on the side.
I had a revelation! All I need to do is put poison in the bagpipes, and get her to suck it all in! I'll let my new lady in on the plan right away. She'll be over the moon!
The wife went to visit relatives, so now's my chance! I'll plant the poison this morning, then go see the house I plan to move into with my mistress.
My darling, no! Why did you come to clean the house while I was out?! You broke the bag on those bagpipes, too! Gah... I-I think I breathed in some of the poison... I can't feel my—
The laws of nature dictate that the weak be devoured by the strong. They are destined for elimination in this dog-eat-dog world.
The strong are nourished by the weak.
As such, they would perish in a world where no weaker beings existed.
Just as lions cannot rule the sea, the strong are limited in their sovereignty.
There are those who owe their lives today to thousands of violent deaths.
There will always be those who fail to see things the same way, so conflicts are inevitable.
When we clash with those whose opinions differ from our own, the true value of humanity is laid bare.
Will people ever share the same harmony found in nature?
Humans cannot survive for long without oxygen. In that sense, eating and breathing are quite similar.
Without oxygen, it's impossible to swim down to the depths of the sea. Without oxygen, reaching the peak of the tallest mountain is out of the question.
Should an individual endure a solitary existence from the moment of birth, they lose the gift of language. Consequently, they wither away, devoid of the many capabilities that define their humanity.
Everything in the world is intricately interconnected and coexists. Perhaps it is this profound realization that drives me to distance myself from arrogance.
[Confession No. 1112231039]\nThey say children don't know how indebted they are to their parents. But the opposite can also be said, no? Do they even get me?
They keep making me take all these lessons for my sake, but I just want to hang out with my friends more.
Dad doesn't seem to care about my future plans, and mom gets angry at him when I'm not around... It's scary.
If they really cared about me, they would try to get along. Honestly, that's all I want. But parents just don't seem to get it, you know?
[Confession No. 710397728]\nPeople live based on assumptions. Even those who claim to be logical may have OCD or something.
Hardly anyone can reconcile their own self-image with how others see them. People who claim they're not becoming outdated are usually the ones being called outdated behind their backs.
Don't trust people who say they're kind. Those are usually the ones expecting something in return for their kindness.
I'm a logical, objective, and kind person, so I can't ignore the contradictions in this world. God, am I right in what I'm saying?
According to legend, this artifact can reveal a person's destiny. When tested on a young boy walking outside, it showed him suffering from cold and hunger.
In an attempt to change his fate, the boy was given work at a mansion, but it didn't make a difference. He refused to work at night and ran away from the mansion.
Despite trying again, everything turned out as predicted. Curious, I decided to try the artifact on myself, and all I saw was a dark, silent void.
It's possible that my senses fail me, or perhaps something worse will happen... But I have faith that good things await me over the horizon.
Dorothy told me you can stop a gaping wound from bleeding if you cauterize it with fire. So flames can be used to heal! Fire is the best!
Princess Kaguya said you can also neutralize snake venom by holding a lit match to the bite. Matches can do everything!
Who needs special tech or machines when you have fire as a cheap and handy way to mend injuries? Fire is a friend of the frugal!
This staff produces a big flame without costing a thing. Now, to cauterize all you poor wounded folks with its pretty pillar of flame... Heheheh...
The dream the wolf revealed to me portrayed a world where "you must not hurt others emotionally."
People were so afraid of accidentally causing pain that even couples didn't bother to learn about each other's true selves or inner thoughts.
The youth were heard exclaiming, "Life would be better if we didn't feel anything," and even felt afraid of being moved by art.
Living in a world where genuine love and beauty were absent, I came to realize the value of "loving wholeheartedly, even in the face of adversity."
The spongy part is soft, but is metal-cleaning detergent safe for humans? It feels prickly on my skin.
"Not even dust can stick!" Dorothy gave her glasses a squeeze and lifted them triumphantly. ...Is she trying not to laugh?
Is this weird coating even safe? "There's something I wanna double-check. What's with that look? Trust me, you'll be fine!" It's frustrating when she smirks like that.
My body itches like crazy, as if it was on fire. And yet my skin is tinged a captivating shade of red. This relentless itch eating away at my sanity...is strangely arousing.

I, musician and husband of a priestess, set out to appease the Underworld.\nOnly the dead may enter its dark depths, but by playing the tune of "Elegy of the Underworld", I am able to set foot unharmed.\nLearning this tune was not an easy feat. Remembering my days of study under my many masters, I continued onward.

Having completed my mission, I returned to the world of the living. But what awaited me was a world stricken by a terrible plague.
Along with the suffering was my wife, with no hope of survival.
I did what I could to nurse her back to health.
Perhaps it was the guilt I felt for leaving her behind. For the loneliness I caused her while out on my journey.

Since my body had died once upon descending into the Underworld, I was immune to the effects of the plague.\nOne after the other, I watched all those around me die. It was then the time of my wife's own death.\nShe whispered something to me...and with that she passed on.

"I knew of your determination to write a magical melody. Otherwise you wouldn't have studied amongst many masters and practiced long into the night."\n"That is why I performed a miracle, and spread this disease across the land. To make it a place suited for melodies of gloom. So enjoy!"\nThe last remaining, I wander alone. Staring at the void above me, unintelligible words escaping my lips.

I'm a nerd, plain and simple.
I'm considered a nuisance, pretty much invisible in any group I join.
But there was this book. A rare edition that I needed to have.
So I hurried to the secondhand shop and stole it.

"What a read!" I turn each page excitedly, fatigue failing to succumb me.
The best part of the story was what happened after the main character, The Phoenix, awoke from his dream.
He beat those bullies to a pulp and even burned down the school!
This book gives me the courage to live!

Wait...no! Anything but that!
Why...Why did you rip my book?!
"All you do is read. No woman wants to date a creep living in a fantasy world."
You... All of you! You'll pay for this one day! I swear!

I'm reminded of an old banned-book that depicted a school burning to the ground. The students and faculty all dead.\nIt received attention as the main character, The Phoenix, burned down his school out of revenge for bullying he endured.\nI was lucky to read it before it was banned, though I earnestly debated whether to set my own school aflame.

Listen, my son. Today our excavations uncovered the tomb of a certain king.\nWe believe he was a man of virtue as there were tear jars, an amount greater than that was ever seen before. However, no record could be found of this.\nWhat a perfect opportunity! If I uncover the truth behind this king and present it to the academy, I can reclaim my position!

Listen, my son. Digging deeper into records, I've discovered this king's country was governed with injustice.\nI've become fully invested in unraveling the truth. It's quite possible that history had been falsified and his name stigmatized for future historians.\nWe'll see who gets the last laugh now! I'll show those fools how wrong they were about me!

Listen, my son. Since my discovery, I've been researching extensively and referring to experts. However, the accepting that history had been fabricated seemed unthinkable to them.\nI find this hard to believe, considering the sheer amount of tear jars at his grave. There must be more to this mystery. Some missing piece to the puzzle.\nWatch me, my son! Your father is going to make the greatest discovery the world has ever seen!

Hm? What is a tear jar, you ask?
It was once customary for attendees to place their tears in a jar at the funeral as a burial gift. Hence its name.
Oh? You think perhaps those jars are tears of joy, celebrating the end of his awful reign?
My, that's a ridiculous thought! Watch, my son! For I won't forgive this world for their unkindness towards me!

The girl is a blessing from God.
She feasts on fruit and drinks the blood of saints.
O' she who devours the flesh of her followers.
She who has descended from the heavens.
Please bestow us with your oracle!

Child without sin, child without wisdom.
Untainted by the world, innocent virgin.
I ask thy forgiveness as I serve you and only you.
I have defiled myself to protect your innocence.

The day you came into this world, I removed both your parents and doctor.
All that needs to be done, I have done for you.
You needn't learn a thing.
Child of God, even speech is beyond you.
Neither good nor evil resides inside you.\nThat is why I give my all to you.\nShall you, who lives pure and ignorant, utter a single word...that would be the oracle.

"I'd give my life to protect my country."\nThose words are all it takes to gain the trust of your superiors and earn the praise of those around you. Is it not?\nJust look at this huge sword I got. And I accomplished nothing of importance to get it.

To be honest, I wish I never got it.
I'm not as strong as the others, so I suck at swinging it.
Plus, if the enemy catches sight of me, I'll be mistaken as the top fighter and get targeted by the group.
I'm not a fighter. Just someone who likes to talk big.
Damn, did I mess up.

So then I got to thinking.
What can I use this huge sword for?
"When I perish on behalf of my country, I wish to have this sword, bestowed to me from the king, displayed next to my grave."
Yeah, I like the sound of that.

People will walk past my grave and think how honorable a swordsman I was.\nIt's decided then. I shall die the moment we engage in battle.\nI've gotten fed up with this whole fighting for my country act anyway.

Dear family, I'm home at last!
Haha! It's been ages since I've last seen my comrades from the knighthood, I've lost track of time.
Just a bunch of old men now with nothing to do but nag. But their hearts remain full of youth!
Eh? Must I go to sleep now?

Those boys sent me armor from our days in the knighthood.\nAh, the good o' days. Days of wielding my club and the fervor of adolescence.\nOh! My wife and son have returned. Eh? Stop playing around and help with the housework?
There's no end to the surprises! Those good fellas even sent me my favorite drink!\nWhat a fantastic way to end the day!\nEh? What do you mean you drank all of it?!

The man could no longer swallow his bitterness and mutilated the cause of it. He then called upon his old friends.\nEach of them pack a portion of the remains into a box and disposed of them individually without causing suspicion.\nTo hell with family! My buddies are all I need.

"And you call yourselves apprentices?! I need ingredients to make this potion! Get out and there and search, you frogs!"
Our master ordered us to scavenge the wilderness for ingredients.
As we, a group of us were caught by a ferocious wind, whipping them into the air.
Now what? I'm the only one left.

There standing where the winds clashed, was the Wind King.
He showed me no harm and instead wrapped me in a warm breeze, protecting me from the cold. What's more, he offered me food and water.
Though I could barely sense his presence, I was touched by his kindness.
I think...I might be in love.

"I can't go back. I'll only be put to work. Please, let me be your bride!"\nThe Wind King stayed by my side. I couldn't be happier.\nBut then my master, red in the face with anger, appeared flying on a broomstick. "Foolish apprentice! Come! It's time you returned!" I was then pulled aboard and off we flew.

Angered by this, gusts of fearsome winds roared in our direction. As a last resort, my master used magic to transport us.
It's been 10 years since then. I am now locked away as punishment for my behavior.
Whenever I feel a draft of wind coming from my prison's cracks, I wonder if it's the Wind King coming to rescue me. I get my hopes up only to feel despair minutes later.
But it's the only hope I have. The sound of the wind is what keeps me alive.

[Yusuf, the Innocent]\nDear Lord, please hear my wish! I'm in need of everlasting goods!\nI've done all I can, and still the orphans from the war continue to die! Please grant me wealth and abundance to save the lives of these children!

[Oliver, the Orphan]
Yusuf brought us so much food!
And he's gonna build a big, strong house too, he said!
I do miss my mama and papa... But I'm never sad when Yusuf's around!

[Randal, the Servant]
Yesterday was another night of debauchery.
He speaks of helping unprivileged children of the world, but the man's a hypocrite.
All he cares about is power and beautiful women. Everything is about him.

[Hartman, the Writer]\nMr. Yusuf had taken his own life with a sickle.\nBefore his death he told me, "I live in luxury and splendor. A life many can only dream to have. But I've lost my ability to walk on my own due to my weight and my own children are merely after my inheritance. I mistook life's greatest and everlasting treasure. That of unconditional love.
It's not as bad as I thought.\nAt first it felt tight, but the slits make it easier to move.
I don't care about fashion. But after wearing this, I might have grown a new appreciation for it.
How many more outfits will I wear?\nHow many times will I stain them in red?
Will it be my body or spirit that perishes first? The future is unknown.\nNo matter what happens, I won't forget the happiness I felt in this outfit.\nOr so I thought.
Like a little birdy, I'll continue to dance. Even if the one watching wishes for my death.
Another may see my dance as a prayer of blessings.\nBut my wish will not change.
I will pray, fight, and dance for my own sake. Even if my wish remains but a wish for all eternity.
Perhaps it is because I'm alone that it's never-changing. How about it? Would you like to dance with me?

[Disciple]
Thank you for taking me on as your disciple!
My older brother aspired to become a great flutist just like yourself!
He was a absolutely amazed by your skills, even your biggest fan!
Please, accept my gift.

[Disciple]
About my brother... He never had any talent.
That's why he respected you so much.
Oh, hang on. I'll go drop my things in my room.
Don't open the gift until I come back!

[Assistant]
Excuse me, sir? Who was that just now?
Oh! Your disciple? No, it should be someone else.
By the way, what's with that box there?
If it's a gift you should open—AH?!
N-no... You mustn't look, sir!

[Fake Disciple]
I told you not to open it.
You know, my brother was fascinated by you. You rejecting his request to learn from you sent him into despair. And then he killed himself.
I want to add your head to the collection of disciples and offer it to my brother's grave.
Isn't it fun? Oh, I can't wait to dance to the flute from the other world!

There once was a very popular circus elephant.
It could walk on a ball, draw, and shake hands with the audience. A very clever elephant indeed.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"You, my friend, are a star."

The circus is in full swing today.
In front of the audience's eyes is the clever elephant.
It walks on the ball, draws pictures, and shakes the audience's hands.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"Thank you for making this day spectacular."

The circus was out of customers.
No one cared about the elephant. It had become old news.
The elephant continued to work in the empty tent.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"It's okay. Don't be so hard on yourself."

With tears in his eyes, the leader said to the elephant, "I'm sorry. I'm unable to feed you anymore."
The elephant then got up on his ball and let out large roar. The leader's tears were that of joy.
"You really love the circus, don't you?"
Then the elephant trampled on his leader.

A crossbow, a national treasure of a certain kingdom, was capable of shooting two arrows.\nIt was rare and gorgeous, and could fire in two separate directions. This bow was handed down from generation to generation by the kings of the kingdom.\nHowever, one of the arrows went missing when the previous king gave birth to a heir.

The king had passed away and the crowned prince was to take the royal throne.
Before becoming the rightful heir, the prince searched for the lost arrow, but to no avail. And thus the coronation ceremony had arrived.
It was that day a man came to the palace with the lost arrow.
Without hearing him out, the prince seized the arrow and banished him.

The man who had brought the arrow was the son of the previous king.
He was the prince's twin, hidden away in a far off country by his father.
The king had to follow the lore of the crossbow, and thus had to send one of his sons away.
This secret was kept to preserve the king's lineage.

Years later the country was attacked and destroyed.
It was by the same man who had returned the missing arrow as revenge for the kindness he had offered.
The lore goes on to say that when these arrows are shot, they will one day return.
However, where they travel is unknown.

The rain poured down from the skies, it seemed the heavens would fall upon the earth. Unable to withstand the surge, Negra had finally collapsed.\nSensing an opportunity, I stole an expensive mallet and took off.
The mallet was incredibly heavy. It proved difficult to carry myself.\nBut I pushed on regardless.

Ducking into the darkness, I gazed upon the mallet's glow.
Oh, how beautiful it was.
And delicious... Chomp!
Oh, so sweet indeed.

Hm?
Why are these ants carrying candy canes?
How dare they indulge themselves when humans are here in poverty!
Ungrateful insects! I'm gunna crush you!

The man squeezed the trigger gently...what came after was swift and silent.
The man at the gun's muzzle collapsed before he had a chance to realize what had happened.
The shooter lost interest in the usual scene and turned on his heels.
The only sound heard was that of a bird's flapping wings.

"Another one gone down quietly... Bravo, my friend."
"It's only the silencer..."
The broker's mouth curled into a vile smile. But just as the man tried to leave with his reward—
"I've got another job. How 'bout it?"

It was a cleverly laid trap.
It all began at the location of the man's next target.
"——!!!!"
A cry that was cursed——gangrene—had struck the man.
However, the man felt not an itch, and pulled the trigger of his beloved gun.

The broker screamed at the man, but his words were not heard as he pointed the gun to his head.
The bullet, quiet but surely, reached its target.
And as a reward, he'd lose all hearing.
But this brought the man joy. He could read lips just fine.
And now he could ignore all the sounds of the world he hated to hear.
I see. So you're a burglar.\nTake what you want. And while you're at it, take my hammer and bash my head with it.\nPlease end my dreams of the ancient city.
Why am I saying this?\nBecause the moment I came to this ancient city, my heart was broken. I can't stand anything anymore.\nI wanted to make a name for myself here, but now look at me. I'm pathetic.

Hey, can you take over my life for me?
We look so alike, it shouldn't be hard to impersonate me.
I bet you could do more with yourself than just mugging.
Oh, the Knights have arrived. Just pretend you're me.

You Knights thought he was me and brought him in, eh?\nWell, I have a bad habit of smashing the heads of women I see on the street at night.\nBut thanks to that dumbass, the dream of the ancient city continues...

[Young Man]
A senior student in the dorms shoved an obscene magazine in my face.
I smiled as I took it, but threw it in the trash once I got back to my room.
Everyone has been tempted by the devil, but I won't let it corrupt me!

[Young Man]
I was astonished at the notice I received from the School of Knights.
It said they would be accepting girls from this year!
There were already girls in the classroom, their sweet scent lingering in the air...
This communion of flesh is an abomination! We're being corrupted!

[Young Man]
One of the girls called me away from the crowd and handed me a letter with chocolates.
Then, she squeezed my hand gently.
Nooo... This exchange of flesh is an abomination!

[Doctor]
"This one's also ineligible." The doctor sighed and turned off the power to the culture pod, where electrodes floated in the brain.
In order to complete our project of artificial birth of the next generation of gods, an elemental body with a soul to withstand temptation is required.
So far none have passed the test of "The Fallen Soul".
Now then, how will our plans go?
Oh! Nice to meet you.\nDid you know? This place used to be a scenic town, until one day a hot crystal burst from the ground.\nIt exploited every last resident.

What do I mean by exploit?\nThe crystal connects us through a collective consciousness, forcing us to share our memories and senses.\nOn the bright side, it means we won't starve or grow old. We don't feel lonely either.

We share a common dream. A dream where every one of our secrets are openly and randomly revealed.\nOur hobbies, habits, sexual activity, all the things you can't tell others.\nThat's what "exploitation" is.

Huh? You want me to hand over a man who escaped to this town right before the crystal burst?
No way. We're all connected to each other.
That includes "you".
See? The crystal is embedded in your leg as well.
Now it's your turn to be exploited...

I heard the old man who moved in next door has a physical disability.\nI want to be friends with him, but he ignores me whenever I say hello and he's not entirely easy to get along with.\nWhat I don't get though is why he would move out to this snowy countryside? It's not like he has any relatives here.

Haha, of course! I'd be happy to help you find your lost dog.
And if you'd like, I'll join you around the neighborhood next time, too.
I'm always getting into arguments with my brother over splitting our inheritance.
I wish we could stop bickering and get along. But I want to get along with you too, sir!

H-hey... What are you doing robbing my house?!
Does it look like I have any money?! Oh, I get it. My brother paid you crooks, huh?
Well, if you're here to murder me, get on with it then.
Kill me and claim your lousy money selling our ancestors' mountain!

—I shouldn't be alive right now.
The bullets that flew through the window that day were a direct hit to each of the crooks' heads.
It wasn't long after that the old man moved away.
Maybe it was him who saved me. And in reality, he was a sniper faking his disability.
I don't wanna expose him or anything, I just wish to know if he's okay.

I may not be all up there, but I try think before I act.
I was looking up at the night sky when I realized something.
All those stars up there are gonna fall down one of these days.
And if that happens, it'll be the end to our village!

I tried to tell the villagers, but they just yelled at me sayin' "If you got time to think about nonsense, get back 'teh workin' the fields!"
They left me no choice but to seek a sage in the forest.
He spoke of some sorta "gravity" thing, but it was all gibberish to me.
Now what?

So I went to the capital to deepen my insight with books and to hear from scholars.\nRight now, I've got this hypothesis that this planet is part of something much bigger. And whatever that is, it keeps on expanding.\nI think this may just be the answer to my question that day.

Request upon request I got of people wishing to become my disciple. So I decided to open an academy to teach the younger generation.
Some people refer to me as a "sage," but they have it all wrong.
I'm just a man living out my misery.
My youth, give your days to learning.

You can open that book if you'd like, but you can't take a peek inside.
If you do, you'll meet a demon from the abyss and be turned into one just like it.
"Peek? And how do you peek at a book?"
Come here, I'll show you.
There's a small window on the cover you can look through.

"Ohh, so that's what you mean."
He took a peek and saw the demon.
"I think the eyes looking back at me are the demon's."
"But what's that?"
I think you underestimated that there demon. I never said it couldn't come out of the book.

See what you've down now? The demon comes closer because it saw you take a peek.\nIt could be today, tomorrow, or perhaps the day after. But it will come to get you.\n"Even if it does, there's no way it can escape from this tinny window."

"I knew it. The demon is just the picture on the book's cover."
I think you should look closer.
Was there really a demon behind that small window?
No... It was a small mirror reflecting your own image.
You've become one of them now.
That bird continues to live a lonely life.\nWith it's burning body, it could not be touched.\nIt has seen many deaths through its immortal years.

It was a quiet and gentle bird.\nIt slept next to those freezing in the cold, and offered to cook meat to those starving.\nThose saved by the bird were grateful, but none had the ability to heal its loneliness.

There was a child lost in the forest late at night, on the verge of being eaten by a beast.
The bird saved the child and led the way through the dark back to their home.
The child's parents were wealthy aristocrats, and as a token of their thanks, they made the bird a magnificent staff.
It had a stone statue of a bird and a crystal resembling a flame.
The moment the bird saw it, it chirped happily.

It was a chirp of courtship, only to be given to the one you share an eternal life with.
A beautiful voice that only the chosen mate would be allowed to hear.
However, the voice confused the aristocrats and they died in agony.
The bird then flew away with its staff, never to be seen again.

There was one soldier who would never smile. Adoring him for his honestly, the king made him the palace guard.\nThe king was a man of many tastes, especially his love for comedy, offering rewards to any comedians who could make him laugh.\nBut even the best out there failed to do so.

One evening, the soldier was approached by the king's mistress, she asked, "Would you like to spend the night?"\nThe soldier swung his club exclaiming, "How dare you disrespect our king!" and bruised her beautiful face.\nFurious, the king had him imprisoned.

The young castle jailer, aspiring to be a comedian, found it odd that he could not crack a chuckle from this soldier.\nUsing the soldier as a challenge, he practiced day after day on a performance to get the man laughing. Then at long last, he came up with a joke that made the man smile.

Having cooled his temper, the king appeared at the cell and was astonished.
"The man who does not smile smiles indeed. He is an imposter!" the king declared, and ordered his execution.
The jailer, who assisted in the soldier's escape was also ordered to be executed.
Since then, the king became a tyrant, bludgeoning to death those who made a poor joke without laughing.

As a priest, I've grown tired of consulting with the congregation daily.
You can't just talk to them, you've got to show respect and be considerate.
Fishing is how I refresh myself from the stress.
Humming a little tune, I threw my line out into the mountain's stream. Afterwards, I prepared the silver fish that I caught.
"Thank you Lord for this meal." But just as I was about to bite into the skewer, my teeth clamped onto thin air.

There before me was a thin middle-aged woman chomping on the skewer she had snatch from me. Her emotionless eyes stared at me.\n"What's wrong? Are you one of our parishioners?"\nShe took another bite into the skewer and said, "I am. Don't you recognize the faces of those believing in your jurisdiction?"

"Oh! Yes, I remember you. You often come in for confession!"
Shouting my excuse, I took a step back feeling something eerie about the situation.
As I did, I bumped into something. Turning around, it was a boy with dark eyes.
"I was bullied into handing over money. I came to you about it..."
Footsteps echoed in the distance. One after another, I was surrounded with people, eyes filled with rage.

"My mother could have been saved if she were to have seen a doctor."
"I needed your help from the bully."
Funds, arbitration...
That's when I realized.
I had dismissed all their concerns and now they were in a realm they could not return from.
I was then thrown into the mountain stream and devoured by silver fins.

When I got drafted, I faked an illness so I'd get reassigned to the rear support unit.\nThere I was introduced to an old man by my captain.\nHe said, "Listen up. If I catch you being rude to this man here, you'll regret it."
It was obvious why my captain and the rest of the squad cared so much about this man.\nThe self-proclaimed "wizard" could make a heavenly tasting drink gridding beans with his machine.

The old man told me how much I looked like his grandson, and then offered to show me how to use his machine.\nAfter that, I took a pillow to his mouth and suffocated him, making it look like he died of illness.\nNow I'm the only one able to make the drink...

But the drink I grounded didn't taste as good.
Was it the beans? Did it have to be a specific kind...?
But the dead can't speak, so I could never ask.
And then I was sent to the front lines and feel under fire...

Those who profit from war are arms dealers.
They're the real winners, gaining profits without needing to throw themselves into battle.
Behind the scenes, however, are the ones who work day in and day out producing these weapons.
Those makers are orphans. Feeling sorry for these orphans the merchant offered them jobs.

Morning until night they slaved away.
They'd gather iron from the junk pile and haul it away.
There was no end to the children's exhaustion.
If things continued this way, what could they hope for their future? Feeling this impending danger creeping up on them, the children decided to take action.

It happened some time ago. The war had begun to grow and the merchant feared that his country too would be caught up in the bloodshed.
But in order to take his family somewhere safe, he needed more money.
In a panic, he ordered double the production of weapons.
He didn't wish this, but it was the only choice he had.

The children pierced the merchant with the weapons they made.
His final words being, "If only I'd saved my family."
Hearing that, the children then set out to kill the rest of his bloodline.
As a result, a children-only arms dealer was born, but were crushed in the Great War.
Although they were great at producing weapons, they lacked the skills to protect themselves.
It is said that these dresses were first made of linen, but over time the usage of silk also became of fashion.
Silk is a common material nowadays, but I'm intrigued who would try to collect the threads of insects to make clothes.
Not only that, but the first person to eat a wild mushroom without fear of death is another marvel. Curiosity can be a scary thing.
But I should be thanking my predecessors, for if it weren't for their challenging attempts I wouldn't be able to wear such smooth clothing.
